title: Logistics & Maintenance Technician - Repost
description:
Requisition Details

  • Job Title:
    Logistics & Maintenance Technician - Repost
  • Requisition #:
    21-653
  • Campus:
    Doon
  • Department:
    Facilities & Maintenance
  • Payband:
    E
  • Payband Range:
    $26.21 - $30.39
  • Hours/Week:
    40
  • Starting Rate:
    $26.21
  • Posting Date:
    Monday, April 18, 2022
  • Closing Date:
    Posted until position is filled
  • Vacancy Type:
    Support Staff - Full-time Temporary Appendix D Contract

Support Staff Temporary Full-time Appendix D Contract Replacement Position (approximately 8 month contract with the possibility of extension)

As the COVID-19 pandemic evolves around the world and in our local community, Conestoga College continues to adjust plans based on the guidance provided by our local Public Health authority. Considering these unprecedented circumstances, all final hiring decisions remain contingent upon confirmed enrolment numbers and the evolving work environment. Conestoga College will take appropriate measures to protect the safety and well-being of our College community and prospective candidates throughout the recruitment and selection process, including the scheduling of remote interviews.

Conestoga College’s Facilities & Maintenance department requires a qualified Logistics & Maintenance Technician. Following all Health & Safety Policies and Procedures, the incumbent performs semi-skilled work in the area of installations, maintenance, repair and general upkeep of buildings, equipment and facilities, including seasonal exterior work at the Guelph campus and supports the Logistics and Facilities support services functions at the Doon campus.

Hours of work for this position are at Doon campus, Wednesday – Friday, 8:30am – 4:30pm and Saturday – Sunday, 5:30 am – 2:00 pm.

Responsibilities:

  • Performs shipping, receiving, and courier functions including:
    • receiving incoming shipments
    • arranging cost effective shipping
    • preparing packages for shipping and completing documents
    • unloading and handling internal delivery of items; completing documents as required by standard College procedures
    • interacting with Purchasing, Accounts Payable, College staff, and vendors to solve discrepancies and maintain a high level of customer service and satisfaction
    • interacting with Customs to ensure international received shipments have required documents
    • interacting with Canada Post for regular incoming mail
    • collecting and distributing mail or shipments to other College buildings and campuses
  • Performs repairs to buildings and contents including:
    • maintaining work areas to ensure maximum use of resources available
    • assembling and/or building cupboards, bookcases, shelving and installation
    • installing and repairing locks on doors, cupboards, filing cabinets and desks
    • installing notice boards, whiteboards and signage as directed
    • performing minor painting, adjusting and maintaining door hardware
    • completing minor plumbing repairs as directed
    • responding to various maintenance call and work requests
    • completing repairs to drywall, masonry walls and ceilings
    • completing preventative maintenance tasks as directed
  • Maintains grounds & fleet by:
    • operating & maintaining grass cutting and snow removal equipment
    • clear snow and salt walkways in preparation for campus traffic
    • inspecting and documenting inspections and repairs to equipment including fire extinguishers as required
    • supporting weed control programs within guidelines; prunes trees and shrubs
    • litter pick up and outdoor cleaning
    • repairing minor asphalt and concrete cracks and holes
    • Cleaning interior and exterior of fleet vehicles, as well as ensuring vehicles are fuelled and ready to be used by team members
  • Moves furniture and event materials, up to and including complete assembly of modular furniture and event set ups
  • Moves equipment and supplies throughout the campus and preforms repairs to the same
    • completes required academic space set up to ensure delivery of programs in all common academic areas following appropriate codes and legislation
    • completes set up and tears down functions for special events
    • repairs various furniture equipment in common academic areas
    • completes repairs as per work request processes to program specific equipment as required
  • Provide temporary back-up or assistance and support to various Facilities functions including but not limited to;
    • convocation
    • shipping and receiving
    • snow removal
    • grounds maintenance
    • equipment repairs
    • exterior and interior signs
    • assist with emergencies (within Facility Management)
    • assist trades/contractors, etc


Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Two years of practical experience in the maintenance and repair of building contents and equipment
  • Proficient reading, writing and arithmetic
  • Specialized technical skills would be an asset in some areas. i.e. locksmithing
  • Good organizational skills
  • Good interpersonal skills and ability to deal effectively and respectfully with people especially clients
  • Overtime hours required, including before/after regular workday (including weekends), based on weather conditions and/or special events
  • Valid Ontario driver’s license and continuation of clean driving record to be eligible for Conestoga Insured Driver status

title: HVAC Solutions Specialist
description:
Build Your Career at Aecon
Aecon is proud to build some of the most impactful infrastructure projects of this generation. From the roads and transit systems that connect our communities, to the communication networks that link us from coast-to-coast, and the water infrastructure that supplies our businesses and homes. Our integral work includes constructing the pipelines that join provinces with the energy that fuels the nation, and the airports and ports that connect us all. Aecon is there, safely and sustainably building the future.

We lead the infrastructure industry with purpose, and our people are at the heart of everything we do. Our business success relies on strong execution and continuous improvement – driven by the diversity, expertise and teamwork of our employees. We are always searching the globe for exceptional candidates to join the Aecon family and be a part of our forward-thinking, innovative, best-in-class organization!

What is the Opportunity?
Faster.Smarter.Safer. This is how Aecon Utilities is committed to delivering projects. Aecon Utilities is ready to become Canada’s #1 utility construction provider and we’re looking for an HVAC Solutions Specialist t to help us get there!

The Green Energy Services team at Aecon is bringing energy solutions for residential customers in Canada. This includes solar rooftop systems, energy storage, EV charging solutions and integration of these devices in the overall residential energy management. In addition, we are building solutions towards electrification of residential heating and cooling loads to reduce dependence on fossil fuels. For heating and cooling needs, our solutions include the use of Air Source Heat Pumps, Ground Source Heat Pumps (including geothermal loops) and hybrid solutions (where feasible) for both New Build and Retrofit homes.
We’re looking for a HVAC Solutions Specialist – Heat Pump/ HVAC Technology, reporting to the Director, Green Energy Services to build the business in residential heating and cooling technologies by providing their technical expertise.

What You'll Do Here:
  • Be familiar with various provincial Building Codes and relevant provisions for designing a modern energy efficient building.
  • Engage with builders, architects, contractors and other stake holders to understand their specific heating & cooling preferences, articulating the benefit of various technical solutions available.
  • Have hands on experience of conducting heat loss and heat gain calculations using compatible software meeting CSA F280-12 standard.
  • Choose appropriately sized air source and ground source heat pump in various configurations of internal units (wall/floor/ceiling) and air flow delivery (single /Multi Zone, ductless or ducted or a combination) and associated pipe/duct work and electrical load design. As part of the overall solution, co-ordination and interface with ground-loop Geothermal team will also be needed.
  • Develop detailed design and equipment specification for the overall solution will need co-ordination with builder architect and general contractors so that for new builds, all refrigerant piping, duct work, electrical conduiting, wiring, space for indoor and outdoor units is catered for upfront during construction stage itself.
  • Be familiar with available commercial HVAC equipment, especially heat pump technology and various OEM products.
  • Build installation team for installation of HVAC equipment with industry best practices to continuously improve the processes on sourcing, delivery, installation, commissioning, project timelines and training of the personnel involved to deliver a successful overall system.
  • Develop proposals for potential customers for the complete residential heating and cooling solution during various stages in the decision-making process and participate in discussions with various stake holders.

What You Bring to the Team:
  • Three or more years of direct industry experience in the field of mechanical building services.
  • Diploma/Degree from a mechanical building services/engineering program.
  • Working knowledge with various mechanical systems such as heating, air conditioning, plumbing systems, etc.
  • Experience designing and implementing residential heating cooling technologies
  • A C.E.T. with equivalent experience and abilities will be considered.
  • Knowledge and experience working with various load calculation tools like TECA Quality First, HOT2000, Wrightsoft, Elite, LoopCad Pro
  • Familiar with structural, architectural, and electrical models to appreciate space limitations and interferences.
  • Familiar with municipal and provincial codes and authorities.
  • Able to work independently, as well as contribute to the team
  • Knowledge of all Microsoft Office suites, specifically Word and Excel.
What Makes us Aecon Proud:
  • Engaging and agile workplace culture, collaborative and inclusive teams
  • Commitment to sustainability and to becoming a net-zero company by 2050
  • Investing in our people through a variety of learning and development programs such as Aecon University, BluePrint leadership program, and Project Management Academy
  • Variety of wellness benefits, access to virtual health care, 100% employer-paid health and dental premiums, Employee Assistance Program, Best Doctors Program, and more.
  • Tuition reimbursement opportunities
  • Recognition and rewards through Aecon Accolades, Aecon Achievement Awards and more
  • Employee Stock Options, Short Term Incentive Program, Retirement Savings and Pension Plan

Aecon fosters diversity, inclusion and belonging within and across our organization. We welcome all to apply including, women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity. If you require accommodation during any step of the application process, please click here.

title: Plumber
description:
Plumber Job Responsibilities:

  • Install, repair, and maintain pipes, valves, fittings, drainage systems, and fixtures in commercial and residential structures.
  • Collaborate with general contractors, electricians, and other construction professionals.
  • Follow building plans and blueprints.
  • Respond to, diagnose, and resolve plumbing emergencies.
  • Perform routine inspections of plumbing and drainage systems.
  • Light construction, carpentry, painting, plastering, flooring, ceiling, and electrical work as required.
  • Prepare bids, budgets, and cost estimates.
  • Keep accurate records of time spent working, description of work performed, and materials used.

Plumber Qualifications / Skills:

  • Skilled in the use of hand and power tools used in the plumbing trade
  • Knowledge of building codes, safety regulations, and safety practices
  • Ability to read and follow blueprints and rough drawings
  • Familiarity with PVC, CPVC, PEX, cast iron, and copper
  • Effective oral communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to complete projects unsupervised and unassisted
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Attention to detail and ability to perform multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Proficiency in basic mathematics and conversion of measurements

Education and Experience Requirements:

  • High school diploma
  • Plumbing license
  • 1-3 years experience as a plumber
  • Valid driver’s license

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 12 months

Salary: $42,890.00-$100,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • GTA, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • plumbing: 2 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • plumbing license (preferred)

title: Virtual Design Specialist (TSC
description:
At Flynn, It's not just a job, it's a career
TSC, a Division of Flynn Group of Companies is seeking New Graduates for their Virtual Design Specialist position. The successful individual will inspect, scan, and design components, while working closely with architects, engineering firms, general contractors and builders using the most advanced 3D Inspection Technology.

A Day in the Life

  • Designing building components (Architectural panels, Glass and Glazing components) using as-built point cloud data
  • Creating reports comparing the as-built conditions to nominal conditions
  • Manage the collection of on-site data using conventional survey methods combined with 3D Scanning Technologies
  • Documenting the as-built conditions of large construction sites
  • Use various measuring equipment (Trackers, Scanners, Multi-Stations) effectively after being trained
  • Ensure jobs meet the quality control process
  • Demonstrate understanding of engineering needs onsite and knowledge of project documents

What We Are Seeking

  • New Graduates with Bachelor’s degree in Civil, Mechanical, Building Sciences
  • Previous experience with 3D scanning technology, applications, and industry processes is considered an asset
  • Excellent technical computer skills – AutoCAD, Rhino is an asset
  • Solid knowledge of mechanical, math, and measurements skills
  • Must be motivated to take initiative, respond to issues, constraints, and opportunities
  • Detail-orientation without losing sight of the big picture

What We Offer

  • Beautiful work environment with high ceilings and tons of natural sunlight!
  • In-house cafeteria and gym
  • Free parking
  • Competitive wages and benefits
  • RRSP matching
  • Extensive on-the-job training and on-going career development programs
#LI-RS1

TSC Inc., a division of the Flynn Group of Companies, is the leading provider of 3D measuring, scanning and consulting services, primarily serving the construction industry, with a smaller focus on other industries: aerospace, automotive, hydro electric and space.

With the use of industry-leading technology, TSC Inc. is able to work collaboratively on high-profile projects across North America with Flynn Group of Companies' branches.

For more information about TSC Inc., visit our website at www.tsconsult.com

We are also highly active and committed to creating an environment which is accessible to all of our customers, employees and applicants. Reasonable accommodations in the hiring process will be provided to people with disabilities upon request.

title: Apply Here
description:
Job Posting - Foreman
THE ROLE

RWC is looking or a competent Site Foreman to coordinate operations and oversee workers on RWC project sites. As the point of reference of both workers and supervisors, you will be a key person for the completion of a project.

As an RWC foreman you will have strong leadership skills and extensive experience in the construction industry. RWC strives for excellence so you must be well-organized, be able to make decisions quickly and favour safety above everything else.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Attend pre-project handover meetings
  • Perform, oversee, and delegate site layout
  • Attend daily or weekly site meetings
  • Perform onsite material & quantity take-off’s if required
  • Ability to manage all jobs on the work site (Including but not limited to, steel stud framing, drywall, and suspended drywall systems, T-bar & shafts)
  • Enforce all General Contractor guidelines and regulations as well as compliance with all RWC safety requirements
  • Ability to effectively assign tasks to crews
  • Schedule project workforce needs with Project Manager and report to General Contractor
  • Remain up to date with all RWC developments and ensure information is communicated to all crew members
  • Able to recognize, address and resolve issues that arise on site and or between crew members
  • Perform regular quality checks of work that is performed by crews and provide constructive feedback, QAQC.
SKILLS / ATTRIBUTES

Sound command of the English language, strong communication skills both in written and verbal format, ability to solve problems, be resourceful, ability to run multiple crews simultaneously, knowledge of all aspects of trade, able to read blueprints, proficient in using technology (iPad), and hold a strong aptitude in engineering.

EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING

Technical Qualifications: 10 years of trade experience, holding or pursuing a Red Seal certification, or be competent in all aspects of the trade, Level 1 First Aide, Boom and Scissor lift certification, Fall protection, Supervisors Responsibility Training; experience using software such as Procore, PlanGrid, Field Wire are a strong asset.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Working conditions can vary greatly depending upon the projects assigned to. Majority of work will be outside or non-enclosed areas, often resulting in prolonged standing, walking, lifting, kneeling, and bending with may be a strenuous physical activity.

Interested applicants are encouraged to apply with an updated resume that highlights your skills and relevant experience as a Foreman.



APPLY NOW

1

Your contact information

2

Your application information
First Name

Last Name

Email

Contact #

Next

title: newTesting and Balancing (TAB) Technician
description:
Job Title: Testing, Adjusting and Balancing (TAB) Technician

Main Purpose of the Job: This position is open to someone with experience in Testing, Adjusting and Balancing or an entry level technician responsible for learning proficiency in this field.

Reports to: Management or Lead Technician (for trainee)

Benefits Offered:

  • Phone allowance starting at $60.00 per month
  • Car allowance starting at $150.00 per month and paid gas expenses
  • Training program and support towards obtaining certification as a NEBB TAB technician
  • Safety gear, hand tools and testing instruments to use on site
  • Safety training

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Take a proactive approach in participating in the company’s NEBB TAB Technician Training Program
  • Interpret mechanical drawings and specifications for ventilation systems requiring air and hydronic testing, adjusting and balancing
  • Test systems using specialized and calibrated instruments to measure system’s performance following NEBB Procedural Standards. Collect actual values for pressure, temperature, rotation speed, velocity, and flows for an air or hydronic audit and to improve the system’s performance.
  • Discuss system operations with end users to verify that malfunctions have been corrected.
  • Communicate with design engineers to clarify changes in design, and provide a technical explanation on the causes impeding a system to reach performance.
  • Make system adjustments using balancing dampers, circuit balancing valves, VFD’s (variable frequency drives), etc. to ensure performance.
  • Prepare the report which summarizes the testing and balancing notes, any deficiencies found during the TAB work.
  • Maintain proper documentation of daily activities using project specific reporting procedures
  • Coordinate site visits and work schedule with the mechanical firm installer, the General Contractor, the Building Operation firm or the owner.
  • The use of ladders is required to complete the task of Testing, Adjusting and Balancing of air and hydronic systems. All employees must possess the ability to safely exercise ladder usage.
  • The use of aerial platforms is required for some HVAC systems. All employees must possess the ability to safely exercise aerial platforms usage. Safety training will be provided.
  • Perform work in a safely manner and in accordance with the company’s safety policy
  • Ability to travel regularly with the occasional overnight stays for some projects

Qualifications:

  • Post-secondary diploma in HVAC systems or equivalent work experience
  • Mathematical proficiency is a necessity for completing basic and advanced equations associated with Air and Hydronic balancing
  • Comfortable using Excel and cloud file sharing applications
  • Ability to review and understand mechanical drawings and specifications
  • Learn and understand the design intent of each system associated with a project
  • Very good mechanical aptitude in using hand tools
  • Ability to use specialize instruments such as Pitot Tube, Manometer, Anemometer, Velometer, Tachometer, Psychrometer, and Thermometer
  • Ability to understand and analyze mechanical HVAC systems for determining issues and determining basic recommendations for issue resolution(s)
  • NEBB certification is required to advance beyond Entry Level

Restrictive Access Requirements:

  • Clean background check as most facilities require a police clearance letter

Working Conditions:

  • Work environment: various commercial, industrial and residential buildings, new construction sites or retrofit buildings, mechanical rooms, confined spaces, hospitals, etc.
  • Working conditions may vary and based on the scope of each project, you may be required to work outside and be exposed to rain, snow, and extreme heat or cold.
  • Work hours may vary based on the scope of work for each project and at times you will be required to work weekends, overnight shift work or early morning shift work.
  • A variety of physical demands are required to completed the work on site: climbing ladders, climbing stairs, access building roofs, open ceiling tiles, use aerial platforms to access ventilation equipment, stand for long hours, work in confined spaces
  • Maintain a valid Driver’s Licence as project locations vary throughout the Greater Toronto Area or within the Province of Ontario.
  • Must be able to lift, move, and carry equipment (up to 50 pounds)

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $22.00-$35.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's license (preferred)

Willingness to travel:

  • 100% (preferred)

title: Construction Labourer (NOC 7611)
description:
Construction Labourer (NOC 7611)
Philcan Contractor Ltd
Whitehorse, YT
Full Time
Compensation: $25 to $30 Hourly
Depend on work experience

    Trades & Labour

Duration
Permanent
Job Level
N/A

Job Summary

Responsible for cleaning and preparing construction sites for the erection of structures and buildings. Unloads and loads materials, reads plans and specifications, tends machines, assists carpenters, and other construction site workers.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in building structures for residential, business, and construction sites.
  • Participate in demolitions.
  • Remove trees and debris.
  • Operate machines, including pumps, compressors, generators, and trailers.
  • Assist concreting job
  • Pump concrete, grout, cement, sand, or plaster.
  • Use spray guns for application of material to ceilings or walls.
  • Assist construction managers.
  • Install traffic control devices.
  • Clear and prepare highway work zones.
  • Operate air, electric, and pneumatic drills.
  • Operate pavement breakers; jackhammers; earth tampers; concrete, mortar, and plaster mixers.
  • Ready the construction site each day for the current project by preparing materials, tools, and equipment
  • Apply new project instructions for each job and make adjustments as direction by the construction manager or supervisor
  • Wear clean safety equipment, such as ear plugs, safety glasses, gloves, helmets, and boots that are in good repair
  • Comply with health and safety regulations when operating equipment or walking on the job site even when not on active duty
  • Leave construction equipment and tools clean, organized, and stored in an orderly fashion after each use
  • Provide assistance to other team members on various tasks if your duties are completed ahead of schedule

Qualifications

  • Familiarity with hand tools such as power drills, hammers, and saws
  • Ability to perform repetitive actions using your hands, arms, wrists, fingers, legs, or other body parts
  • Commitment to wearing protective safety gear for heat, noise, and prevention of injury on the job site
  • Desire to work long shifts, usually up to 8 hours, during the day
  • Good English oral comprehension skills to follow verbal instructions and respond to questions about job tasks
  • Steady hands and ability to balance well even on high beams or scaffolding
  • General knowledge of construction operations and procedures
  • Ability to work well with a team of subcontractors and a supervisor
  • High school diploma or General Equivalency Diploma (G.E.D.) preferred, but not required
  • 1 Year experience in Construction

title: Relocate to Canmore, AB -Glazier
description:
Are you looking for a change? Want to work to live not live to work? Want to work in one of the most popular destinations in Canada and Made the top 100 places to visit in the world in 2021!!! Your life could be someone’s vacation!

We are looking for an experienced Glazier to join our team. CanGlass is a thriving abs growing company that treats our employees like family. We care about you as a person and that means benefits, growth opportunity, safety gear, and clear expectations. The correct candidate must be well experienced with installing, measuring, and servicing heavy and light shower enclosures and railing systems. Experience with general residential and commercial glass service is also required. We are offering a full time permanent position to the correct candidate. We are a great growing company with room for future promotion within our company. Work is based mostly in Banff

Job duties

This position will perform some or all of the following duties:

  • Read and interpret blueprints and specifications to determine type and thickness of glass, frame, installation procedure and materials required
  • Measure and mark glass and plastics and cut glass using glass cutters and edging machines
  • Assemble, erect and dismantle scaffolds, rigging and hoisting equipment
  • Position glass panes into frames and secure glass using clips, points or mouldings
  • Assemble and install prefabricated glass, mirrors or glass products on walls, ceilings or exteriors of buildings
  • Install, fit, fabricate and attach architectural metals or related substitute products in commercial and residential buildings
  • Install pre-cut mirrors and opaque and transparent glass panels in frames, walls, and exteriors
  • Replace glass in furniture and other products
  • Prepare and install skylights, showcases and aquariums and stained or other special glass in churches, museums, sports and other establishments
  • Repair, replace, and service residential windows, commercial aluminum doors and other glass supporting structures, and replace damaged glass or faulty sealant
  • Install bi-pass shower door systems, neo-angle showers, frameless showers
  • Install railings using various techniques including standoffs and shoe systems
  • May prepare cost estimates for customers or clients.

Experience required

  • Pay is based on experience and skill sets. If you are a general labourer looking to pick a career we will support you through an apprenticeship program.
  • Must have valid class 5 Canadian driver license
  • Must be able to legally work and reside in Canada
  • Must be able to pass a vulnerable sector background check
  • Must be willing to relocate to Canmore or commute from Cochrane/Calgary
  • Must be able to read and write in English
  • Canglass is an equal opportunity employer

Other traits we are looking for

  • Stamina: Since being a glazier can be a physically-demanding job, those who take on this role must have a high level of stamina. Not only should they be able to stand, kneel and sit for long periods, they must also be able to hold heavy pieces of glass until they have been fully installed.
  • Safety: we take it seriously and expect the people we hire to make safety of themselves and others a priority.
  • Teamwork: we are a team and that means having open and honest conversations when conflict arises, no gossip, and working together.
  • Reading comprehension: You must have good reading comprehension to read material such as regulations and contracts and installation notes
  • Critical thinking: To be able to figure out the best plan of action for each client, you must possess critical thinking to problem solve on the site and ask for help when needed.
  • Written, verbal and interpersonal communication: Given the vast array of clients you come into contact with, contractors, coworkers, management and many others you should have excellent communication skills.
  • Dependable: Considering the urgent nature of the issues that may arise in this field, and the high expectations of our clients, you must be very dependable and punctual.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $25.00-$42.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company car
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

COVID-19 considerations:
We provide PPE for Covid and abide by the Alberta Covid Restrictions

Experience:

  • glazing: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • class 5 drivers licence (required)

title: Carpenter
description:
BCIT’s Facilities and Campus Development Department is currently seeking a regular part-time Carpenter.
This position carries out planned and emergency maintenance, repair and installation of architectural, structural building systems, installation, and repair services for filing cabinets, furniture locks, and furniture.

Duties & Responsibilities
Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Responding to trouble calls, and taking corrective action; this includes troubleshooting problems on a wide variety of systems. The problems are sometimes difficult to identify, solutions are not standard, and many are emergency calls. Priorities are established by assessing the impact on property and public safety.
  • Establishing priorities and requirements for the Preventative Maintenance (PM) Plan, including items that need to be inspected and maintained for regulatory reasons.
  • Conducting preventative maintenance on multiple systems which are interconnected, as per the PM Plan; duties include printing off daily schedule, inspecting, identifying deficiencies and taking corrective action.
  • Estimating labour and materials for renovations, upgrades and projects, including reviewing project drawings, sketches, and specifications and making recommendations for improvements.
  • Communicating with individuals from a variety of departments within BCIT, and external contractors brought in to work on systems, including working with difficult or upset clients, describing problems and explaining the interrelation of complex systems.
  • Continually learning about advances in system and equipment design, advancing technology through communicating with local suppliers, on-the-job training, adapting older systems to work with new components and parts.
  • Staying current on new technology and regulatory requirements including changes to standards and codes related to the profession.
  • Adhering to and promoting safety standards required by regulatory bodies consistent with the assigned work.
  • Upgrading existing systems to more modern and efficient options.
  • Preparing drawing, sketches, layout diagrams, and estimates for internal projects and work required.
  • Maintaining an inventory of carpentry supplies.
  • Coordinating and monitoring the work of contractors to ensure adherence to established standards.
  • Preparing work orders and purchase requisitions; maintaining records of work performed and completing work control forms.
  • Estimating labour and materials for renovations, upgrades and projects, including pricing out materials from various vendors.
  • Making recommendations and suggestions for improvement to Program Coordinators on various building projects on campus
  • Setting-up and maintaining woodworking machinery.
  • Installing ceiling tiles, suspended ceilings, wall coverings, resilient flooring, baseboards, doors, door hardware, cabinets, counters, blackboards, corkboards, whiteboards, and a variety of other fixtures and fittings.
  • Repairing filing cabinets, furniture locks, which includes key duplicating, identification of lock types, picking
  • Providing preventative maintenance and repairs to floors, doors, windows, ceilings, walls, steps, handrails, furniture in the Facilities Management shop, classrooms, labs, theatres, etc., furniture, millwork, windows, sashes, door fittings and hardware, theatre seats, gym bleachers, and other structures
  • Constructing, removing, and relocating walls and doors, including drywall and paneling. This includes dismantling existing structure and salvaging materials. Constructing millwork, cabinets and counters, and fabricating security arrangements for workrooms and equipment, disposing of furniture that is beyond repair
  • Undertaking duties as assigned consistent with the job grade of this position.

Qualifications
Qualifications:
  • A valid Trades Qualification or an Interprovincial Trades Ticket (Journey person status) plus technical education and/or certifications in the relevant building trades industry; plus two (2) years general trades experience plus up to four (4) years current relevant experience in the building trades industry.
  • Ability to assess blueprints and make recommendations for specific trade requirements is an asset. Must be able to work independently.
  • Proven ability to trouble shoot and resolve related issues in conjunction with the assigned level of skill, ability and education.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills are required to maintain top quality customer service standards.
  • Willingness to maintain currency in the field and learn on the job is essential. Basic computer training and experience is required.

Please note: These are the minimum required qualifications. The schedule for the successful incumbent will be on either Saturdays or Sundays (incumbent’s choice) from 7:00 – 14:30

Additional Information
Benefits – Why you’d love working with us
  • Competitive pay
  • Minimum of fifteen days of vacation
  • Competitive employer-paid extended health and dental plan – take a look at our benefit plans!
  • Defined contribution pension plan with employer contributions
  • Eligibility for partial remote work upon Institute approval
  • Professional Development funds and resources
  • Access to most BCIT PTS courses free of charge
  • Wellness and Employee Assistance programs

title: MAINTENANCE STAFF
description:
We are currently seeking Maintenance candidates for our Hamilton area apartment buildings and town homes. If you are experienced in general maintenance duties and would like to become part of our team, this position is for you! The schedule is 8:00am to 4:00pm Monday to Friday. Flextime is an option. Standby is a requirement after hours and weekend about once every five to eight weeks. May be required to work outside Hamilton.

Responsibilities may include but not limited to:

General Carpentry Duties: Change countertops, door locks, doors, closets, cabinets, shelves, door closures, kick plates, towel bars, hinges, drawer slides, safety bars, cracks/holes in drywall etc. Repair and install flooring. Good understanding of general carpentry.

General Electrical Duties: Change smoke/CO detectors, light switches, fluorescent tubes, receptacles, fuses, fixtures, ceiling fans, stove elements, oven elements etc. Heating and Air Conditioner test a generator and understand the function of the generator, use power tools, good understanding of general electrical.

General Plumbing Duties: Change faucets, cartridges, taps, toilets, valves, shower heads, taps, washers, plunge toilets, use a snake, change a P-trap, flex line, leaks etc. Water softener, good understanding of general plumbing.

Fire Systems: Reset fire alarms, understanding how fire alarm system works, inspect fire system and complete daily, weekly, and monthly, recording in fire logbook. Understand how sprinkler system works, both dry and wet.

Hallways & Stairwells: Repairs and report all common area deficiencies including faulty door closures, plaster blisters, graffiti and vandalism, tile repairs, carpet repairs, etc.

Cleaning Duties: All cleaning duties as required to assist staff when shorthanded.

Groundskeeper Duties: Some groundskeeper duties will be required during winter months, front entrance, and all emergency exits. Keep Logs and track outside contractor on snow and salting requirements.

Preventative Maintenance Program: Complete monthly preventative maintenance program.

Occasional travel to Head office in Stoney Creek.

Job Type: Full-time

Health spending account, three weeks’ vacation, and five personal/sick days.

Salary: $23.00 /hour

Experience: Maintenance - 1 year (Preferred)

Language: English (Preferred)

Must possess valid driver’s license in Province of Ontario.

Employment conditional on criminal records check.

Must have own hand tools.

CLOSING DATE: 6 MAY 2022

Application deadline: 6 MAY 2022

Expected start date: 15 MAY 2022

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $23.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
Staff mask and physical distance from each other and tenants.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $23.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Staff mask and physical distance from each other and tenants.

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's license (required)

Application deadline: 2022-05-06
Expected start date: 2022-05-16

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Who We Are:

Like our country, ATCO Frontec is built on a Frontier Spirit of being agile, robust, ready to go to the most challenging places and push the boundaries. Do YOU have the Frontier Spirit? If the answer is yes, you should probably work with us.

COVID-19 Information

ATCO is committed to providing and maintaining a safe environment for our employees, contractors, partners, and customers. As part of this unwavering commitment to safety, all ATCO employees and contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 or provide proof of exemption.

Description:

ATCO Frontec is seeking a Maintenance Technician to join our RP North department in Whitehorse, YT. The Maintenance Technician is responsible for performing various skilled and semi-skilled tasks to maintain a 24/7 facilities operation. Responsibilities include maintaining the mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems.

Responsibilities

  • Troubleshoot and perform minor repairs on plumbing systems (leaking faucet, plodded toilets, etc.)
  • Performs building repairs including drywall, paint, flooring, carpentry, ceiling tile and grid
  • Responsible for the completion of all maintenance services requests as assigned
  • Performs daily site inspections of the facilities and mechanical equipment to ensure proper operations.
  • Provide a report to the Maintenance Coordinator noting any problems found
  • Performs other manual duties to clean and maintain landscaped environments
  • Respond quickly and thoroughly to changes in client requirements and amendments in scope
  • Ensure all operations meet and comply Customer regulations, federal and provincial health and safety legislations, regulations and corporate policies
  • Completion of work orders in the CMMS system
  • Perform routine maintenance jobs and repairs
  • Follow Health and Safety Policies and Safe Work practices
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • The successful candidate should have 4 or more years of experience in a facility maintenance position
  • Strong knowledge of safe work practices and procedure typical form maintenance operations
  • Highly experienced with vendor management in a 24/7 operation with a strong customer focus
  • Abilities to work safely with a wide variety of hand and power tools and materials
  • Ability to obtain Government Security Clearance – Reliability level
  • Basic PC skills including working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel) and Outlook.
  • Valid Driver’s License
  • Professional communication skills, oral, and written
  • Ability to prioritize and multitask
  • Work well under pressure
  • Effectively solve problems

We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

Final candidates will be required to undergo a Security Clearance Check.

This position has been identified as safety sensitive and will require completion of a pre-employment alcohol & drug test, fit to work medical test, criminal record check, and provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination.

Collection, use and retention of personal information will be in accordance with ATCO Group privacy policies and practices.

By submitting your resume and personal information to the ATCO Group of Companies, and/or participating in a personal interview, you acknowledge and consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the ATCO Group of Companies to determine your suitability for employment opportunities within the ATCO Group of Companies.

title: Carpenter
description:
Company Overview:

Banff Constructors Ltd. is an experienced workforce contractor of skilled labour to the commercial, industrial, civil, and infrastructure construction industry in Saskatchewan and Manitoba. We supply trade crafts people, such as labourers, apprentice and journeyman carpenters, equipment operators, surveyors, mechanics, lead hands/foremen, and superintendents on an open-shop basis. Since 1983 Banff Constructors has had a proven track record of business success, growth and providing steady work for our employees. Our aim is to provide expert construction services with a focus on teamwork, performance, safety and success.

Position Summary:

Possess the full range of knowledge of materials, methods and tools required to construct, install, renovate and repair commercial or industrial structures constructed of wood, steel, concrete and other materials using carpenter’s hand tools and power tools and equipment. Studies blueprints, sketches or building plans to determine specifications and calculate requirements.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Erect wood framework; walls, partitions, joints, drywalls and rafters
  • Installs doors and windows, floor coverings, ceilings, trims
  • Builds stairs
  • Build forms for concrete
  • Lays flooring
  • Installs cabinetry
  • Working from blueprints instructions from supervisors does layout-measuring, marking and arranging of various construction materials
  • Cut, shape and join
  • Checks accuracy of works and makes adjustments as required
  • Studies blueprints for work planning
  • Constructs and forms chutes for pouring concrete
  • Erects scaffolding and ladders for assembling structures above ground level
  • Acts as a work leader and mentors to apprentice carpenters
  • Informs immediate supervisor of abnormalities or defects and/or takes appropriate measures

Qualifications

Education/Experience:

Active apprenticeship or Journeyperson status OR minimum 2 years of related work experience

*Or an equivalent combination of experience, training and education

Knowledge & Skills:

Knowledge: (trade specific knowledge – technical competencies)

  • Knowledge of trade mathematics and imperial and metric measurements
  • Knowledge of the characteristics of construction materials and their proper use
  • Knowledge of installation equipment, techniques, wiring or programs to meet specifications

Skills: (behavioral competencies)

  • Ability to work at heights, good balance
  • Ability to bend, stretch, lift push, pull and carry
  • Ability to coach, mentor and train apprentices
  • Ability to describe and point out safety compliance and regulatory issues
  • Demonstrates good communication and interpersonal skills both upward and downward
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to problem solve
  • Ability to do precision work without close supervision

This job description in not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities, rather it is an account of the major responsibilities of the position.

Thank you for your interest in Banff Constructors Ltd! As one of the largest construction labour providers in the Canadian Prairies, we are proud to offer steady work, good compensation, great benefits, and the chance to grow and progress in building an interesting and fulfilling career with the company.

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal

Salary: $20.50-$34.20 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

title: Camp Attendant
description:
Who We Are:

Like our country, ATCO Frontec is built on a Frontier Spirit of being agile, robust, ready to go to the most challenging places and push the boundaries. Do YOU have the Frontier Spirit? If the answer is yes, you should probably work with us.

COVID-19 Information

ATCO is committed to providing and maintaining a safe environment for our employees, contractors, partners, and customers. As part of this unwavering commitment to safety, all ATCO employees and contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 or provide proof of exemption.

Description:

ATCO Frontec is seeking a Camp Attendant to join our Two Rivers Lodge in Fort St John, BC. The Camp Attendant will be responsible for general housekeeping at the Lodge.

Where We Work and Live:

The Two Rivers Lodge is located 7 kilometers southwest of Fort St. John, BC. Candidates local to Fort St John are preferred. This position is based on an 8 day on, 6 day off rotation.

Responsibilities:

  • Maintain clean and hygienic conditions of the bedrooms, bathrooms, and kitchen units.
  • Make beds, changes sheets, distributes clean towels and toiletries
  • Wash, dry, and fold linens and towels.
  • Assist in laundry as needed
  • Dust and vacuum all furniture and draperies.
  • Sweep, mop, wash, wax and polish floors.
  • Pick up debris and empty trash containers
  • Wash windows, walls, and ceilings.
  • Ensure adherence to all government regulations as well as ATCO Frontec Health and Safety, policies and procedures.
  • Ability to lift 25+ lbs.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Experience in a remote camp environment is an asset
  • 1 or more years of housekeeping experience in the camp or hotel industry is considered an asset
  • Good organizational skills
  • Ability to multitask
  • Excellent people skills
  • Clear and effective oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to prioritize and manage time in a fast-paced environment

We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

Final candidates will be required to undergo a Security Clearance Check.

This position has been identified as safety sensitive and will require completion of a pre-employment alcohol & drug test, fit to work medical test, criminal record check, and providing proof of COVID-19 vaccination.

title: newDrywall Finisher - Independent Contractor - Residential / Li...
description:
To meet the demands of our rapidly growing base of satisfied customers, Handyman Connection of Kitchener, Waterloo, Cambridge and Guelph is seeking an experienced Drywall Finisher. This skilled craftsman would ideally have a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business. Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work. Our customers love us! We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!

What You Will Receive
  • Earn $30-35/hour, depending on your skills and availability
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking, billing
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers
  • Branded signage
Responsibilities

The Drywall Finisher performs and coordinates the cutting, taping, sanding and installation of drywall during the construction, remodeling or repair in a residential and light commercial setting. The candidate must be proficient working with all drywall hand tools, mechanical tools required to complete their work. You must have experience as a Drywall Finisher, and you must have a positive attitude.
  • Ability to texture and refinish plaster services
  • Ability and willing to work on new walls and ceilings, and repair existing walls.
  • Ability to determine and clearly identify proper materials and material quantities for new and existing projects.
  • Evaluate customer requests, price projects, troubleshoot customer issues, and present a description of a work order to a customer.
Requirements
  • Must have current Driver's License and submit to a background check
  • Must have tools, vehicle and good references
  • Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades
  • Independent Contractors must carry liability insurance and workers comp (preferred but not required)
  • Must pass screening process
  • Must have a smart phone and access to the internet
Please, no Project Managers or those that specialize primarily in New Construction.

Ready to Learn More?

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.

What our customers say:

Watch More

Why Handyman Connection?

title: Insurance Sales Representative
description:
Looking for a new Career in Insurance? Or just looking for a change from your current role?
- Partial Work Remote/ Work from Home Available.- Are you a self-driven, energetic and passionate individual that is looking for a challenge?
- We are looking for a high energy, self motivated individual to join our team. Want to run your own business one day? Let us help you lay the groundwork to one day open your own office.Grant Leslie Insurance Agency is seeking a qualified professional to join their winning team for the role of Insurance Account Representative - Desjardins Agent Team Member. We seek an energetic professional interested in helping our business grow through value-based conversations and remarkable customer experience. If you are a motivated self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment, then this is your opportunity for a rewarding career with excellent income and growth potential. Responsibilities: • Develop leads, schedule appointments, identify customer needs, and market appropriate products and services. • Provide prompt, accurate, and friendly customer service. Service can include responding to inquiries regarding insurance availability, eligibility, coverages, policy changes, transfers, claim submissions, and billing clarification. • Work with the agent to establish and meet marketing goals. Requirements: • Sales experience (outside sales or inside sales representative, retail sales associate, or telemarketing) preferred • Successful track record of meeting sales goals/quotas preferred • Excellent interpersonal skills • Excellent communication skills - written, verbal and listening • Proactive in problem solving • Dedicated to customer service • Ability to multi-task • Ability to make presentations to potential customers • Property & Casualty license (preferred/must be able to obtain • OTL & LLQP (preferred/must be able to obtain) Total Compensation Range (Salary, Commission & Bonus):$55,000.00 annually is based on average sales results. There is no ceiling or maximum commissions you can receive in this sales position. (on target $60K-$70K) This is a Full-time position within a Desjardins Insurance Agency in Oakville, Ontario.

These positions are with an independent contractor agent that is part of the Desjardins exclusive agent network, not with Desjardins Group or its subsidiaries. This agents’ employees are not employees of Desjardins. Independent contractor agents are responsible for and make all employment decisions regarding their employees.

title: MAINTENANCE HANDYPERSON (6-Month Contract)
description:
Job Description:
Exciting things are happening at the City of Brampton. Take a look at what employees are working on related to our Term of Council Priorities moving us forward towards The Brampton 2040 Vision.

MAINTENANCE HANDYPERSON (6-Month Contract)

PRIMARY FUNCTION:


Reporting to the Foreperson/Supervisor, Operations, perform maintenance work to indoor and outdoor assets as assigned.

  • Perform general maintenance, minor repairs, and installations, in a large number of trades including: Painter, Arborist, Roofing, Drywall Application, Woodworking
  • Perform general maintenance with respect to indoor and outdoor assets involving basic carpentry/cabinet assembly, brick and interlock repairs, concrete forming and concrete work, asphalt pathway repairs, graffiti removal, playground asset repairs, etc.
  • Estimates, calculates and uses construction layout techniques
  • Install minor millwork and joinery steel and wood framing, interior and exterior finishing, etc.
  • Install doors, windows, hardware components, flooring, suspended ceilings, etc.
  • Build counters, cupboards, sheds, concrete formwork, etc.
  • Assemble and install pre-fabricated cabinetry. Maintain and repair of existing cabinetry
  • Other basic carpentry functions as assigned such as cabinet assembly
  • Monitor maintenance or renovation work performed by outside contractors when required
  • Act as a resource to support and assist with various departmental and Corporate special events
  • Complete work order requests that involve related trades, including indoor and outdoor asset related work
  • Assist with renovation work on indoor and outdoor asset projects
  • Review and assess problematic area on indoor and outdoor assets and provide recommendations to correct deficiencies
  • Perform installation of safety related equipment as required
SELECTION CRITERIA:
  • Completion of Grade 12 or equivalent.
  • Over four (4) years up to an including eight (8) years experience in general handyperson maintenance.
  • Valid non-probationary MTO Class G drivers licence, D class licence with Z endorsement is preferred.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on customer service.
  • Ability to work independently or as part of a team.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.

** Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the selection criteria.

Job status: Contract
Job Type: Union

Hourly rate: $ 30.56
Applications must be received by July 1, 2022
Alternate formats will be provided upon request.

If this opportunity matches your interest and experience, please apply online by clicking the button above, by July 1, 2022 and complete the attached questionnaire. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The successful candidate(s) will be required, as a condition of employment, to execute a written employment agreement. A Criminal Record Search will be required of the successful candidate at their own expense to verify the absence of a criminal record for which a pardon has not been granted.

Preference will be given to students that have a permanent residency in Brampton.

As part of the application process, applicants will be invited to complete a self identification survey. The survey is voluntary. Participation in the survey will have no impact on hiring decisions. All information collected is confidential and will not be shared with the hiring manager. The surveys will be anonymized and will be kept separate from applicant or employee files, such that the individuals who completed the surveys will not be identifiable. The results of the survey will assist in the analysis of disaggregated metrics for organizational planning purposes and our commitment to advance and foster diversity, equity, and inclusion. The City may use anonymized data to produce aggregate reports for internal or external use.

Please be advised, the City of Brampton uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the Job Competition and your application will be removed from the Competition.


The City is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If you require any accommodations at any point during the application and hiring process, please contact TalentAcquisition@brampton.ca or 905-874-2150 with your accommodation needs, quoting the job opening ID#, job title. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

title: Maintenance, Hourly
description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.

Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Are you ready to help us make the future?


All related duties of trade, and associated troubleshooting, are handled independently. Any procedure requiring overtime or outside contractors, difficulty in meeting scheduled workload, major malfunctions, difficult situations, etc would be handled in consultation with the supervisor. Building Code manuals, WHMIS and safety manuals are referred to accordingly.

Key Responsibilities:

  • The Carpenter Generalist constructs, repairs and maintains structures throughout the hospital in accordance with the established standards of the trade as well as covers general duties as assigned
  • Repairs/installs locks, door closer and all related hardware associated with doors/windows.
  • Responding to demand calls and scheduled PMs with the use of the CMMS data base which includes the use of PDA’s (iPad)
  • Assist other (licensed) trades with ANY work not requiring specific license as required for example: Plunge toilets, Minor plumbing repairs (change toilet seats, etc.), Filter replacement
  • Small wall fixture removal, Drywall repairs, Flooring repairs, Baseboards, Minor millwork e.g., counters, cabinets, door replacements, change light bulbs, install signage/pictures/white boards bulletin boards, repair office furniture/chairs, change ceiling tiles, Fire extinguisher checks, Clean roof drains, Clean/replace diffusers
  • Calculates and gives estimates, choosing materials and estimating time required to complete the job.
  • Cleaning mechanical/electrical rooms and other space “owned” by building services
  • Adheres to all safety regulations and ensures tools and work areas are maintained to standard.
  • Maintains confidentiality and release of information in accordance with hospital and Honeywell policies at all times.
  • Obligation to review and commit to applicable departmental, hospital and Honeywell policies and procedures at all times.
  • Assist contractors as required
  • Other duties as assigned

Must Haves:

  • Grade 12 education with an Ontario Certificate of Qualification as a Carpenter
  • Verbal ability is necessary to communicate with workers, superiors, and members of hospital staff.
  • Ability to work from verbal instructions, drawings and/or blueprints with minimal supervision.
  • Immunization (including COVID-19 vaccination) as required by the customer and in accordance with the Public Health Act

Nice to have:

  • Demonstrated commitment to the values of Service, Responsible Stewardship, Community Responsiveness and Respect
  • Numerical ability is needed to estimate materials
Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities under the Ontario Human Rights Code

Additional Information

  • JOB ID: HRD158509
  • Category: Facilities
  • Location: 100 West 5th St,Hamilton,Ontario,L8N 3K7,Canada
  • Nonexempt

title: Plumber
description:
EllisDon is committed to being the safest general contractor. As part of our vaccine directive, we require employees to be fully vaccinated, or in the process of receiving the vaccine against COVID-19. Should you have any additional questions related to our vaccine directive as you move forward in the hiring process, please discuss this with our People & Culture team.

Connect with us LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter

Thinking about a change?

We recognize that the construction industry is changing at a rapid pace and we continually strive to be at the forefront. Our core values empower people to deliver great careers to one another and develop creative solutions for complex problems on some of the most exciting projects. It doesn’t matter what your expertise and craft is – there are no boundaries. We are a group of professionals with a variety of expertise within pre-construction, construction, and post-construction. To learn more, check out our Cradle to Grave services and hear from our team directly about what a career at EllisDon could look like for you. As you can see, we are a diverse bunch.

Above all, we are a group of individuals with unique experiences and at EllisDon, we choose to celebrate the strength in our differences, every day. EllisDon’s commitment to Inclusive Diversity is to work together to create an environment where every employee feels safe to be their true and authentic self. Ultimately, EllisDon’s purpose is to provide people with similar values the opportunity to achieve to their full potential; to deliver that opportunity for great careers to one another; and to contribute meaningfully to the community we share with others.

You as a Plumber will:

  • Install, maintains and repairs sinks, showers, toilets, water coolers, ice machines and other plumbing fixtures.
  • Install, maintains and repairs chilled water, hot water and glycol coils in. AHUs, hot water heating equipment such as radiant heating panels, unit heaters and fan coils, lawn sprinklers and water treatment piping system for RO water, soft water and de-ionized water.
  • Install, maintains and repairs kitchen equipment, coffee machine, wending machine, grease trap, plaster trap, etc.
  • Install, maintains and repairs patient care related plumbing equipment / fixtures such as sterilizers, water cooled machineries, bed pan flasher and macerators.
  • Install, maintains and repairs minor steam/condensate devices such as steam traps, humidifiers, safety valves, pressure gauges, thermometers, sight glasses, etc.
  • Unplug sink, toilet, roof drain, floor drain and clear any drainage piping such as glass pipe, PVC pipe or cast iron pipe. He also repairs or replaces fixtures and fittings in drainage systems.
  • Cuts, bends, threads pipes, fit threaded pipes with adjoining pipe assemblies.
  • Replace washers, faucets, and broken pipes.
  • Welds, brazes and solders piping and fitting as is necessary.
  • Perform preventive maintenance to medical gas outlets, fire suppression sprinkler systems, lawn sprinklers, plumbing fixtures, etc.
  • Install and repair medical gas line in patient rooms and operating rooms.
  • Install and repair fire suppression and lawn sprinkler lines and fixtures.
  • Closing access holes in the ceiling by replacing ceiling tiles or closing access doors.
  • Sources parts and accessories as may be required from time to time to complete repairs.
  • Keeping work area orderly, clean and safe.
  • Ensure proper care in the use of equipment and supplies

Is this the right role for you?

  • Valid Ontario Plumbing Certificate or equivalent
  • 3 - 5 years of maintenance plumbing experience
  • Ability to read, write and speak English fluently
  • Ability to work at height, using step ladder, scissor lift, telescopic boom, etc
  • Ability to lift up to 20Kg
  • Ability to read and interpret schematics, plumbing drawing, instruction and Operation & Maintenance Manual
  • Knowledge and ability to work with plumbing tools and devices safely
  • Must successfully meet the medical clearance requirements of the Acute Care Facility

EllisDon is proud to provide this unique career opportunity that provides continuous learning, opportunity for growth, and a competitive compensation package within an environment that is committed to inclusion and respects diversity.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status. The EllisDon core values of Integrity and Mutual Respect welcomes everyone, at work and in the community, and our value of Mutual Accountability, means that we all have a role to play. As an EllisDon employee, this will ultimately be your commitment to Inclusive Diversity.

​Accommodation for Applicants with disabilities will be made during the recruitment process when requested.

We are committed to providing a positive candidate experience and ensuring timely updates are provided to all candidates. If you haven’t already, be sure to create a profile on our Careers page here to remain up to date on the status of your application and learn about new career opportunities as they arise.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $0.01-$1.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Greater Toronto Area, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • plumbing: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • plumbing license (required)

title: newGeneral Handyman (FT)
description:
Wanted: General Maintenance Worker for Building Maintenance/Renovations.
We are a busy renovations and maintenance company looking for a reliable, hard-working, and devoted handyman. You will be responsible for general renovations and maintenance duties, such as drywall, plaster, paint, ceramic tiles, small plumbing and electrical, countertops, etc. in Hi-Rise rental apartments.
This is a full-time position (not for general contractors). Serious applicants only.
Salary based on experience and will be fair and negotiable.
A successful candidate requires:
  • A set of their own tools.
  • 2-3 years of experience.
  • Their own vehicle.
  • An ability to work independently as well as part of a team.



About Mirage Renovations:

Mirage renovations Inc. is an interior renovations company that specializes in residential apartment building rental units. We pride ourselves on a quick job, done well and at a reasonable price. Years of experience in the rental apartment sector has allowed us to build a highly dedicated and efficient team that is able to tackle jobs of any size. Capital Projects: - Drop Ceiling installation - Corridor painting - Metal door and frame replacements - Finish work after large scale building updates - Garage Painting - Balcony Repairs - Fences Suite turnovers: We can handle all the components of a complete turnover: - Demolition - Plaster & paint - Electrical - Plumbing - Cabinetry - Tub Surrounds - Flooring - Baseboards - Tiles - Tub surrounds - Doors & Frames - Cleaning In-suite/ Odd jobs: We are well- equipped to provide solutions to all your maintenance needs. - Repairing flood damage - Plaster repairs - Door replacement - Painting - Finish work after plumbing repairs - Leaky faucets - Hardware replacement - Boiler room repairs - Fire- rating updates

description:

Work Setting

title: newApprentice Carpenter
description:
Description:

The role of a Carpenter Apprentice is assisting in constructing, erecting, installing, and repairing structures and fixtures of wood, plywood, and wallboard, conforming to local building codes. This position reports to the Lead Hand.

You will:

  • Build house framework, walls, roof, exterior and interior finishes
  • Install doors, windows, flooring, cabinets, stairs, handrails, paneling, molding, and ceiling tiles
  • Repair and remodel existing structures of all kinds
  • Read and interpret drawings.
  • Select materials, plan sequences and methods of work and measure and mark materials to avoid costly mistakes or omissions.
  • Cut and shape materials and join them with nails, screws, bolts, or glue.
  • Check completed units to ensure they are level, square, plumb and in the right size, shape, and location.
  • Work accurately and economically and follow national and local building codes

You will need:

  • To be enrolled in a carpentry program and meet the qualifications as a second, third- or fourth-year Carpenters Apprentice
  • Computer literate with the aptitude to solve arithmetic problems quickly and accurately

Physical requirements:

  • Capability to stand, crouch and kneel for long periods of time
  • Capacity to lift heavy equipment and materials when required and demonstrate proper lifting techniques

COVID-19 Information

ATCO is committed to providing and maintaining a safe environment for our employees, contractors, partners, and customers. As part of this unwavering commitment to safety, all ATCO employees and contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 or provide proof of exemption.

ATCO Structures Overview
ATCO Structures is part of ATCO Ltd. We're a worldwide leader in modular design, manufacturing, and construction. From our very beginnings in workforce housing, we've been at the forefront of this industry, pioneering design and delivery processes and developing innovative products to meet the essential need for shelter around the globe. Through our solutions to workforce accommodation, office and commercial buildings, classrooms, hospitals, and hotels, we've re-imagined how permanent and temporary modular facilities can help communities of all kinds.

ATCO Structures values diversity. We're committed to having an inclusive, fair, and respectful company that represents the diverse talents available in the workforce. With guidance from our Employment Equity Advisory Committee, we strive to ensure that our work environment allows for each employee to reach their full potential; this is only possible when differences are respected and valued.

Visit our website https://structures.atco.com for more information.

This position has been identified as risk/safety-sensitive and will require completion of pre-employment medical, alcohol and drug testing. In addition, will be required to undergo a Criminal Record Check.

By submitting your resume and personal information to the ATCO Group of Companies, and/or participating in a personal interview, you acknowledge and consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the ATCO Group of Companies to determine your suitability for employment opportunities within the ATCO Group of Companies.

title: Construction Estimator
description:
QSI Interiors Ltd. is seeking an Estimator for the Edmonton Branch. Our trade involves drywalling, steel framing, drywall finishing plus acoustical and specialty ceilings. We are a busy, well structured, safety conscious trade contractor and have the privilege of working for the best general contractors in Western Canada.

Key responsibilities include:

- Successfully bid a sufficient volume of work to satisfy our volume requirements

- Bid all projects assigned by the Manager

- Provide organized project information to the Manager

- Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external customers

- Provide bid reporting to the Manager

Requirements:

- Able to keep track of a busy calendar schedule

- Strong analytical and mathematical skills

- Strong computer skills (project estimating software preferred)

- Read plans, specifications and do quantity takeoffs

- Experience in the commercial drywall industry

- Good time management skills

- Good communication skills, both written and oral

- Well organized

A competitive salary is offered based on education and experience.

Please send resume with cover letter to the attention of Edmonton Branch Manager.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • construction estimating: 1 year (preferred)
