title: newInterior Designer
description:
Junior Designer

General:
Responsible for taking 6-10 projects at one time ranging from major renovations, custom homes, and offices. Designer will be responsible for coming with creative space plans, creating all technical drawings, concepts and sourcing finishes, fixtures, furniture, and lighting for all projects they are assigned. Each project will have a project coordinator that designer will be responsible for working with to ensure that clients are taken through the process effectively and in line with SCD systems.

Drawing Related Tasks

  • Lead multiple projects from beginning to end.
  • Creative solutions to solve clients’ spatial issues/wishes.
  • Responsible for elevating plans and creating unique space plans.
  • Prepare all technical drawings, including floor plans, finishes plans, reflected ceiling plans, power and communication plans, interior elevations, millwork sections and details, schedules, general notes and information, all which must comply with Building Code.

On-Site Responsibilities

  • Documenting and photographing existing conditions of space (includes ceiling heights, door heights, electrical locations etc.).
  • Perform weekly site visits and documentation analysis during construction process.
  • Meet with contractors and trades throughout construction process and that integrity and commitment in production of quality works upheld.
  • Review drawings and specifications for accuracy, omissions, errors, and legibility.

Sourcing Related Tasks

  • Ability to source furniture, finishes, fixtures, lighting, and artwork to be consistent with project within Stacey Cohen Design brand and within client budget.
  • Ability to provide digital design drawings in Photoshop to convey art/elevation concepts to clients.

Client/Trade Communication + Presentations

  • Responsible for preparing and presenting during client presentations.
  • Develop strong report with clients to ensure that they have confidence in the relationship and your ability to manage the project.
  • Follow up on client requests and lease between clients and vendors.
  • Ability to problem solve and come up with solutions when dealing with issues with vendors and clients.
  • Responsible for taking detailed meeting minutes during client presentations.
  • Review shop drawings to ensure accuracy.
  • Responsible for creating client digital folders and ensuring they are up to date after each meeting.

Internal Communication

  • Ability to communicate effectively with your team members.
  • Successfully use the SCD tools and planning systems to stay organized throughout a project.
  • Attend weekly team meetings.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with project manager to keep up to date on progress of each project.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with lead designer at SCD.

Coordination Responsibilities

  • Coordinate with outside consultants and trades to obtain technical details (e.g. architects, mechanical engineers, millworkers, contractors etc.), optimize designs, and resolve issues.
  • Ability to manage construction schedules and meet deadlines.
  • Communicate effectively with other team members on projects to ensure project details and information is shared appropriately.

Education

  • Post-secondary diploma or degree in Interior Design.

Skill Set

  • Proficient in AutoCAD for Mac.
  • Fluent in Google Sketch Up (or 3D modelling equivalent, Auto Kitchen, Revit, etc.)Comfortable with Microsoft Office + Dropbox.
  • Strong presentation skills/speaks with confidence.
  • Fluent in Photoshop/Illustrator.
  • Highly organized.
  • Independent work and ability to take initiative without instruction.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, fluent in English.
  • Trustworthy and honest and aligned with company principles and values.
  • Strong space planning skills and ability to maximize use of space.
  • Strong work ethic, excellent time management skills and ability to manage several projects at once.
  • Ability to work on multiple projects at once in a very fast paced environment with strong commitment to deadlines.
  • Highly detail-oriented and able to review drawings in detail.
  • Exceptional problem-solving skills and ability to come up with suitable solutions in a timely manner.
  • Ability to think creatively with an ingrained curiosity for how things work.

Additional Information

  • Please note that candidates may be required to do an AutoCAD and Photoshop assignment to assess proficiency during the interview process.
  • Ability to communicate to clients, liaise with trades, vendors, and other team members.
  • Experience with interior design drawing package production and industry standards, including all relevant plans, elevations, details, schedules and information.
  • Attention to detail and commitment to producing accurate, complete, and legible drawings.
  • Familiarity with local building codes.
  • Understanding of interior design principles and theory.
  • Experience in programming, planning principles, materials and furnishings.
  • NCIDQ considered an asset.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $40,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
All employees are triple-vaccinated. Visitors to the office are required to wear masks. Office is professionally cleaned regularly.

Experience:

  • interior design: 1 year (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-31

title: Delivery Helper
description:
Patene Building Supplies Ltd. is a distributor of drywall, steel framing components, insulation, acoustic ceilings, shingles and other building materials for the residential and commercial construction industries. We have fourteen (14) branch locations throughout Ontario & Manitoba to serve our contractor, builder and retail customers.

We are currently seeking a Delivery Helper that will load, unload, and move materials in the warehouse, yard and work sites for our London branch.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure all required PPE and equipment on trucks is checked and ready for delivery
  • Participate in loading and unloading materials on outgoing trucks by repetitive lifting or using a boom truck- heavy lifting and working at heights necessary
  • Assist driver with verifying and strapping of loads; ensure safe and timely delivery and pick up of material to and from locations
  • Assist driver on site as required (backing, set up) – ‘flagman responsibilities’
  • Maintain inventory in appropriate/designated storage areas in yard and warehouse
  • Ability to work indoor, outdoor and at various heights (rooftop deliveries)
  • Adhere and follow company’s Health & Safety policies and regulations
  • Perform other duties as assigned by management

Job Requirements:

  • High School diploma
  • Must be dependable and a team player
  • Ability to communicate with co-workers, vendors and customers (verbal and written)

This position offers competitive wages, health, dental, life insurance and an RRSP plan upon completion of the applicable waiting periods.

We invite qualified candidates to apply online.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Traffic Manager
description:
Patene Building Supplies Limited is a distributor of drywall, steel framing components, insulation, acoustic ceilings, shingles and other building materials for the residential and commercial construction industries. We have thirteen (13) branch locations throughout Ontario & Manitoba to serve our customer base of contractors, builders and retail customers.

We are currently seeking an energetic individual for the position of Traffic Manager for our St. Catharines Branch.

Responsibilities:

  • Instruct and supervise all aspects of shipping and receiving
  • Monitor and ensure completion of daily truck reports, timely maintenance of forklifts and trucks
  • Oversee the securement and accuracy of loading and unloading of deliveries
  • Perform quality audits of the shipped goods for both incoming and outgoing items prior to signing off, as well as site audits to ensure quality of service
  • Problem solve for any cases of missing documents, shipments and deliveries
  • Ensure proper training and supervision of drivers, forklift operators and yard personnel
  • Maintain a safe and clean work environment, organizing products in warehouse and yard for efficient movement
  • Ensure all incident and accidents WSIB required paperwork and reports are completed and forwarded to Health & Safety
  • Conduct monthly safety meetings with the staff
  • Adhere to and enforce all company’s Health & Safety policies & Government regulations
  • Perform weekly inventory counts, as required
  • Professional and courteous interaction with employees, customers, suppliers

Qualifications:

  • Completion of high school
  • 2-5 years working experience in shipping and receiving role, preferably in the building materials industry
  • Attention to detail in all areas of work
  • Good organizational, time management and prioritizing skills
  • Excellent communication, customer service and computer skills
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude

We invite qualified candidates to apply online with a resume and cover letter.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Cabinet Installer
description:
Sub-Contract Cabinet Installer
Mirage Renovations Inc. is a well established renovation firm with over 15 years of experience in the rental unit renovation industry. We pride ourselves on consistently delivering excellent service and always welcome new and talented individuals to our team

We are looking for:
Cabinet Installation sub contractors to partner with us in order to complete cabinet installation projects for our many different turn over projects. Experience working in the fast- paced environment of rental unit renovations is an asset.
Types of work include but are not limited to:
  • Kitchen Cabinet Installation
  • Countertop installation (laminate)
  • Sink, faucet and plumbing installation

A successful candidate must have:
  • 2-5 years experience in cabinet installation
  • A reliable vehicle
  • Their own tools kept in optimal condition
  • WSIB coverage

***Experience in minor plumbing is a definite asset***


About Mirage Renovations:

Mirage renovations Inc. is an interior renovations company that specializes in residential apartment building rental units. We pride ourselves on a quick job, done well and at a reasonable price. Years of experience in the rental apartment sector has allowed us to build a highly dedicated and efficient team that is able to tackle jobs of any size. Capital Projects: - Drop Ceiling installation - Corridor painting - Metal door and frame replacements - Finish work after large scale building updates - Garage Painting - Balcony Repairs - Fences Suite turnovers: We can handle all the components of a complete turnover: - Demolition - Plaster & paint - Electrical - Plumbing - Cabinetry - Tub Surrounds - Flooring - Baseboards - Tiles - Tub surrounds - Doors & Frames - Cleaning In-suite/ Odd jobs: We are well- equipped to provide solutions to all your maintenance needs. - Repairing flood damage - Plaster repairs - Door replacement - Painting - Finish work after plumbing repairs - Leaky faucets - Hardware replacement - Boiler room repairs - Fire- rating updates

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Are you outgoing and customer-focused? Are you excited to help customers reach their insurance needs? If you answered yes to these questions, working for an Insurance agent may be the career for you!

Successful Desjardins Agent - Pam Pabla Insurance and Financial Services Inc, is looking for a motivated, sales-oriented individual who has a passion for the insurance industry to join their winning team for the role of Customer Service Representative - Desjardins Agent Team Member.

Our goal is to build up strong relationships and increase our professional reputation. If you are looking for a full-time job that provides meaningful work and competitive compensation? Consider a position in our office.

We offer a starting competitive base salary plus generous commission Schedule, yearly bonus, paid vacation, Life balance days, Benefits within the first year, Training & support.

There is no ceiling or maximum commission one can receive in this sales position.

Responsibilities
  • Develop leads, Schedule appointments, identify Customer needs, and market appropriate products and services.
  • Establishes personalized telephone contact with the client. Creates a climate of trust conducive to the sale of a home or auto insurance policy. Educates and advises our clients on our products, while adhering to the company's underwriting policies.
  • Seizes all sales opportunities, solicitation and product offers.
  • Work with the agent to establish and meet marketing goals.
  • Use a customer-focused, needs-based review process to educate customers about insurance options.
Benefits of working with our office:
  • Salary
  • Paid Vacation - 2 weeks
  • Health and Dental Benefits (after 3 months)
  • Technology (laptop)
  • Annual Bonus and Annual Travel bonus (subject to office qualification)
Qualifications and Experience
  • Sales experience (preferred).
  • Successful track record of meeting sales goals.
  • Self-motivated.
  • Ability to relate to customers.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong work ethic with a total commitment to success each and every day.
  • Organized, with the ability to problem solve.
  • Ability to work as a team.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Strong understanding of social media/ technology.
  • Ability to motivate and leadership skills.
  • Property and Casualty license Preferred.
  • Life and Health license Preferred.
  • Strong understanding of social media/ technology.
  • Product/ sales experience (required).
  • College diploma/University Degree in a related field.
  • 2 years of relevant experience.
  • Previous insurance experience in various property and casualty disciplines, such as underwriting, claims, sales or service would be an asset.
Desjardins is a leading provider of Auto, Home and Life Insurance as well as Financial services in Canada, with the passion to become the customer's first and best choice in the products and services we provide. Training provided for the licensed candidates.

This is a Full-time position within a Desjardins Insurance Agency- Pam Pabla Insurance and Financial Services Inc. in Mississauga

We thank you all applicants for their interest. Please be advised that only those selected for interview will be contacted by our office.

Pam Pabla Insurance and Financial Services Inc.

Note: This position is with an independent contractor agent that is part of the Desjardins exclusive agent network, not with Desjardins Group or its subsidiaries. This Agent's employees are not employees of Desjardins Group. Please be advised that Independent contractor Agents are responsible for and make all employment decisions regarding their employees.

This agents’ employees are not employees of Desjardins. Independent contractor agents are responsible for and make all employment decisions regarding their employees.

title: Restoration Estimator
description:
Responsibilities

Overview

Estimators at Icon Buildera are managers who scope, estimate, sell, invoice, collect payments and oversee the completion of work on insurance claims. They are responsible for ensuring jobs are being completed on time, properly and are of good quality. Estimators are the main point of contact for customers and adjusters through the whole restoration process. Job performance will be evaluated on achieving target profit numbers each year.

Tasks

Set appointments on the weekly schedule within business hours. Location, type of loss and time necessary to scope should be recorded.

Document all hours spent on claims on the time sheet provided by Icon Builder to account for time spent on jobs. Must be submitted Monday of the following week by 10am.

Write estimates in logical order, from ceilings to floors, and send to senior management for approval using estimating software provided.

Emergency scope to be written within 3 days of emergency completion and all costs are in. Ensure you follow each insurance companies protocols.

Restoration scope to be written within 3-7 days of completion of emergencies and all subtrade quotes are in. Ensure you follow each insurance companies protocols.

Get PO number for all subtrades that are going to be used on a job.

Within 24 hours of completing scope, with senior managements approval, upload/send to adjuster with note asking for approval to start work.

Write estimates for all private work and create a payment schedule before private work is started.

Follow up on unsold claims once a week by calling and emailing the adjuster and the customer.

Collect deductibles and obtain work authorization at time of sale. Scopes must be signed at this time before work proceeds.

Organize all subtrades, special order items and tools/equipment necessary for contractors to complete the job before starting work on the claim.

Schedule contractors and labourers to do work as per time in components list on Xactimate.

Provide proper scope to contractor with no prices and a serparate material list before work begins.

Ensure all necessary health & safety policies, procedures and laws are being followed on by contractors and labourers.

Monitor progress on job by contacting contractors to receive progress reports with pictures of work completed. Assess quality and pace of work for feedback on performance reviews.

Check & signoff on invoices to ensure that all purchases are necessary for the job.

Review cost control throughout job and prior to invoicing any claims.

Inspect finished job, get sign-off from customer and resolve any complaints of deficiencies.

Schedule deficiences to be repaired within one week of job completion.

Bill emergencies within 3 business days of completion, all costs are in and approval from senior management.

Bill restorations within 5 business days of completion, signoffs being received, all costs are in and approval from senior management.

Solve any issues on files that may hinder payment. Call adjuster if payment has not been received within 30 days and provide further documentation needed.

Get co-payable cheques signed.

Collect payments for privatework prior to job completion.

Document any deficiencies on jobs with the name of the person or people responsible. To be provided to the human resource department and Owners.

Provide feedback, within one week of invoicing being completed, to contractors and labourers to let them know how they did.

An Estimators responsibility on a claim ends when the customer has signed off and is happy with the work, the adjuster is satisfied with the work and has received all estimates, invoices and documentation they need and we have received all payments in full.

Requirements

3-5 years estimating experience Xactimate experience required!

Degree or Diploma in Construction Management preferred


Time management

Critical thinking and problem solving

Planning and organizing

Decision-making

Excellent communication (both written and verbal)

Team work

Conflict management

Stress tolerance

Leadership

Excellent computer skills (MS word, excel, outlook)

Proficient in using estimating software (Xactimate preffered)

Construction and Building code knowledge

Conditions

  • Work location – GTA
  • Drivers License G
  • Full-time employment.
  • Competitive package of salary, benefits and annual bonus scheme.
Contact Us Online
Send a CV
Igli Selamaj
RECRUITMENT SPECIALIST
Contact Details

647-346-4265
info@iconbuilder.ca

Start Your Career Icon
Can not find what you need?
See All job opportunities!

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Posted
01-Feb-2022
Service line
GWS Segment
Role type
Full-time
Areas of Interest
Engineering/Maintenance
Location(s)
London - Ontario - Canada

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires basic analytical skills.
  • Inspects new installation for compliance with building codes and safety regulations.
  • Performs assigned day-to-day repairs, emergency, and preventive maintenance. completes maintenance and repair records as required.
  • Reviews assigned work orders. Estimates time and materials needed to complete repair orders, necessary materials and supplies to complete all tasks.
  • Maintains lighting systems throughout the facility, cleaning fixtures and replacing bulbs and lamps.
  • Maintains grounds of facility performing such tasks as raking, sweeping, leaf blowing or snow removal.
  • Performs carpentry, furniture assembly and locksmith tasks as needed.
  • Responds quickly to emergency situations, summoning additional assistance as needed.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
  • Perform routine maintenance and repairs on Doors, walls and floor areas
  • Perform routine preventive maintenance to ensure that building systems operate efficiently
  • Maintain a clean shop floor and work area
  • Perform maintenance tasks including floor repairs, ceiling tiles replacement, painting, and drywall repairs to ensure that the building is properly maintained
  • Indoor and outdoor patrol of the facility to determine if any hazards are present and any issues that are discovered should be resolved immediately


QUALIFICATIONS

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
  • Strong communication skills, able to communicate effectively with all levels of staff and management in a professional manner as well as interact directly with outside contractors associated with the facility
  • Ability to multitask and be flexible in daily work tasks
  • Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
  • EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
  • Minimum of 2 to 3 years of related experience and/or training.
  • Certified BES 1 & 2
  • Certified License HVAC Mechanic.
  • OTHER SKILLS and/or ABILITIES
  • Uses computer and / or PDA for work order system, email, ESS and training. Basic skills with Microsoft Office Outlook.
  • Physical requirements include stooping, standing, walking, climbing stairs / ladders and ability to lift / carry heavy loads of 50 lbs. or more.
  • SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY
  • Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.
  • SAFETY
  • Responsible for personal safety and the safety of those who are affected by your work. This includes but is not limited to:
  • Complete all required and assigned HSE training at a satisfactory level,
  • Follow all activity policies and procedures, including all HSE-related requirements at all times,
  • Participate in all HSE-related programs & activities as required, including incident investigations, interviews, auditing and assessment, etc.
  • Report any conditions which you feel could result in an accident or injury and / or stop work if required follow all established safety procedures.
  • Strong experience in using common hand tools and power tools
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs and bend

Training is provided as required. You are required to bring your own tools.


Full COVID 19 Vaccination and/or approved COVID 19 testing (where accepted as an alternative) is a requirement for the role

title: Installation Sprinkler Fitter
description:
Company description

IT STARTED WITH A COMMON MISSION – TO PROTECT PEOPLE

This mission is the reason why two organizations joined forces in 2021 to create Classic Fire & Life Safety – comprising the strength of all partners, united in one, clear mission.

In June 2021, Classic Fire Protection and FCFP began a journey to come together to create a new, stronger partnership with the intention of continuing to grow with and through new partners if and when the decision to do so would be beneficial to stakeholders – partners, employees and, most critically, customers.

Supported by our values and leadership team, forged by our shared history, we’ve become the contractor of choice for high quality, professionally installed, inspected and serviced fire and life safety systems and equipment – solutions that play an essential role to ensure the safety of both our clients’ facilities and the people inside.

What is the job?

A Sprinkler Fitter is responsible for the installation, service, and repair of fire protection systems, including: wet, dry, pre-action, and suppression systems; as well as fire pumps and backflow devices.

What makes you valuable?

  • Completion of the 4 year sprinkler fitter apprenticeship program
  • A member of local 853 in good standing
  • Follow verbal and written instructions.
  • Capable of performing physical labour to include carrying and moving equipment and tools weighing up to 50 lbs.
  • Majority of work all above head
  • Able to work in unusual and sometimes difficult positions such as climbing ladders, scaffolding and high lift equipment, working within ducts, crawl spaces, above ceilings, etc.
  • Read and understand construction blueprints, diagrams, and specifications used in installation activities
  • Ability to work flexible hours.
  • Ability to adhere to, implement, and follow safety guidelines and procedures at all times.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills, positive attitude, and an ability to learn quickly.
  • Possess a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record

Why Choose Classic Fire + Life Safety?

We focus on delivering world class service by:

  • Providing a safe environment for our clients’ businesses to grow
  • Investing in state-of-the-art field technology and inspection tools
  • Distributing industry leading fire protection and security systems

We value each and every team member by:

  • Providing a positive and friendly work environment
  • Ensuring that there are opportunities for growth and development within their career
  • Company-paid health and wellness benefits with company-matched retirement savings

Other family perks include:

  • Competitive wages reviewed annually
  • Company social events
  • Home & Auto Insurance Discount Programs
  • Employee Assistance Programs
  • Social impact committee dedicated to make a difference in our community and communities around the world

If you pride yourself on being a team player and forging trust with your colleagues and customers, we are eager to hear from you!

To learn more please reach out to our HR team through Indeed or toll free at 1-800-755-0962.

We thank all applicants who apply, but only those candidates who meet the above qualifications will be contacted for an interview.

Classic Fire + Life Safety Inc. (Former FCFP & Classic Fire Protection) is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds. We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format of job posting) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Employee assistance program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • How did you hear about this role?

Licence/Certification:

  • Sprinkler Fitter license from UA Local 853 (preferred)

We welcome and encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds. We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format of job posting) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.', 'Completion of the 4 year sprinkler fitter apprenticeship program', 'Capable of performing physical labour to include carrying and moving equipment and tools weighing up to 50 lbs.', 'Excellent communication skills', 'Possess a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record', 'Investing in state-of-the-art field technology and inspection tools', 'Ensuring that there are opportunities for growth and development within their career', 'To learn more please reach out to our HR team through Indeed or toll free at 1-800-755-0962.', 'Competitive wages reviewed annually', 'Providing a safe environment for our clients’ businesses to grow', 'Follow verbal and written instructions.', 'Social impact committee dedicated to make a difference in our community and communities around the world', 'Company social events', 'Distributing industry leading fire protection and security systems', 'Able to work in unusual and sometimes difficult positions such as climbing ladders, scaffolding and high lift equipment, working within ducts, crawl spaces, above ceilings, etc.', 'Supported by our values and leadership team, forged by our shared history, we’ve become the contractor of choice for high quality, professionally installed, inspected and serviced fire and life safety systems and equipment – solutions that play an essential role to ensure the safety of both our clients’ facilities and the people inside.', 'Company-paid health and wellness benefits with company-matched retirement savings', 'Read and understand construction blueprints, diagrams, and specifications used in installation activities', 'Strong organizational skills, positive attitude, and an ability to learn quickly.', 'Other family perks include:']

title: Carpenter
description:
TIL-KA Construction Inc. – DKI is a General Contractor and Restoration Company with over 27 years of experience and can handle all of our customers’ building, renovation and disaster clean-up needs. Our company focuses on residential and light commercial projects including window & door installations, new home construction, and interior/exterior home and commercial renovations projects.

We offer a competitive wage (based on experience) and benefit package. “Safety First” is the backbone of our company and we continually strive to give our employees a safe, fun and team-oriented workplace.

We are looking for experienced Carpenters to join our team!

Reporting to the Management Team and Foreman, this position’s responsibilities include, but aren’t limited to:

  • Home and commercial renovation projects i.e. frame floors, walls, ceilings and roofs, finishes interiors and exteriors
  • New house construction
  • Communication with crew members, management team and customers to ensure goals are met.
  • Setting up/taking down project sites including equipment, scaffolding, materials, etc.
  • Identify risks, safety issues and ensure entire team is following company policy/procedures and OSHA safety standards

Qualifications:

  • Experience in residential and/or commercial renovations
  • Carpentry license - preferred
  • Working at Heights Certificate – preferred
  • Driver’s License – preferred
  • Ability to follow company safety policies, practices and procedures in order to complete job tasks.
  • Ability to follow instructions.
  • Good communication skills
  • Ability to work as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
  • Physical Ability to lift and maneuver heavy weighted objects including materials and equipment in a variety of settings, i.e. inside, outdoors, etc.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Seasonal

Salary: From $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • On call
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • Carpentry: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Working at Heights (preferred)
  • Drivers Licence and clean abstract (preferred)

title: Tile Setter
description:
Sub-Contract Tile Setter
Mirage Renovations Inc. is a well established renovation firm with over 15 years of experience in the rental unit renovation industry. We pride ourselves on consistently delivering excellent service and always welcome new and talented individuals to our team

We are looking for:
Tile-setting sub contractors to partner with us in order to complete tile installation projects for our many different turn over projects. Experience working in the fast- paced environment of rental unit renovations is an asset.

Types of work include but are not limited to:
  • Tub Surrounds
  • Shower Surrounds
  • Kitchen Backsplashes
  • Floor Tiles

A successful candidate must have:
  • 2-5 years experience in tile setting
  • A reliable vehicle
  • Their own tools kept in optimal condition
  • WSIB coverage

***Experience in plumbing and tub installation is a definite asset***
***All work is in the GTA***

About Mirage Renovations:

Mirage renovations Inc. is an interior renovations company that specializes in residential apartment building rental units. We pride ourselves on a quick job, done well and at a reasonable price. Years of experience in the rental apartment sector has allowed us to build a highly dedicated and efficient team that is able to tackle jobs of any size. Capital Projects: - Drop Ceiling installation - Corridor painting - Metal door and frame replacements - Finish work after large scale building updates - Garage Painting - Balcony Repairs - Fences Suite turnovers: We can handle all the components of a complete turnover: - Demolition - Plaster & paint - Electrical - Plumbing - Cabinetry - Tub Surrounds - Flooring - Baseboards - Tiles - Tub surrounds - Doors & Frames - Cleaning In-suite/ Odd jobs: We are well- equipped to provide solutions to all your maintenance needs. - Repairing flood damage - Plaster repairs - Door replacement - Painting - Finish work after plumbing repairs - Leaky faucets - Hardware replacement - Boiler room repairs - Fire- rating updates
skills: ['2-5 years experience in tile setting']

title: newFacilities Maintenance Worker
company: The Corporation of The City of Victoria
description:
Job Description:

Competition #22/32A
Internal/External Posting
Closing date: May 12, 2022

Facilities Maintenance Worker (Continuous)
Parks, Recreation and Facilities Department

POSITION FUNCTION
Perform building maintenance and repair functions at City owned and leased buildings and grounds.

KEY DUTIES
Perform routine maintenance and troubleshoot repairs during component failures for HVAC systems, including boilers, chillers, cooling towers, ventilation and air conditioning systems, by checking and adjusting pressures, replacing pumps, motors, belts, filters and gaskets, as required; check boiler temperatures; test and adjust chemical balance in heating system water. Perform minor electrical work to boilers, such as: three phase motors or controllers integral to the boiler equipment, low voltage controls or 24 volt thermostats, and branch wiring to the boiler equipment as per BC Safety Authority Regulations.

Perform minor repairs and adjustments to building fabric and related systems, such as: interior walls, ceilings, flooring, furniture, roofing, windows and overhead, interior and exterior doors.

Perform repairs and adjustments to building plumbing and electrical systems, such as: washroom fixtures, pumps, domestic water systems, fountains, lighting repairs (ballasts), replace switches and thermostats. Perform routine inspections on emergency generators; service and test life safety equipment such as emergency lighting and fire extinguishers.

Assess requirements and provide routine services to building occupants; perform routine building inspections and document repair requirements; provide technical assistance in capital project work, as required.

Purchase applicable supplies; obtain quotes and approvals for contractor services; monitor, review and report on the work of contractors and city staff providing maintenance and repair services at assigned sites.

Operate computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) by entering preventative maintenance data from facility inventories; determine work required; open, process and close work orders; review monthly maintenance work; recommend work schedule to supervisor; independently, monitor and adjust (as required) daily automated building control systems (DDC), perform routine diagnostics for DDC issues and determine and apply the best solution, non-traditional methods of analysis may be required to determine best solution (anticipate and forecast equipment failures through use of trend logs, analyse DDC programming to troubleshoot system irregularities); create and print building access activity reports; reconcile credit card statements.

Operate a vehicle to transport materials and equipment. Operate equipment such as power tools, pressure washers and man lift; maintain and operate mobile fuel tank cleaning systems; maintain tools and equipment as required.

Perform related duties where qualified.

INDEPENDENCE
Work is performed according to established maintenance procedures and schedules, requests for service or is assigned by supervisor.
Work is reviewed through meetings with, or reports to supervisor.
Issues such as major expenditure or deviations from established procedures practices are referred to supervisor.

WORKING CONDITIONS
Physical Effort:
Lift and move heavy materials and equipment. (often)
Work in awkward positions. (often)
Work in confined spaces. (often)
Mental Effort:
Short periods of intense concentration while working on complex maintenance systems. (occasional) Visual/Auditory Effort:
Focus on a variety of source data and computer for short periods. (occasional)
Work Environment:
Work from heights. (often)
Work in an environment where protective measures must be taken to avoid exposure to equipment noise, heat, dust and fumes. (often)
Exposure to potentially harmful materials. (occasional)
Exposure to raw sewage. (Premium item)
Work irregular hours. (Premium item)

KEY SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Organize and prioritize work.
Understand and apply the techniques of building maintenance and repair and applicable safety standards and acts.
Basic level operation of a personal computer; working knowledge of building control systems (DDC), maintenance management systems (CMMS) and energy management systems.
Use hand tools and power equipment.
Read and understand building drawings and specifications.
Maintain accurate records.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Deal effectively with the public and outside agencies.
Work safely on job sites.

QUALIFICATIONS
Formal Education, Training and Occupational Certification:
High school graduation.
Fourth Class Power Engineering Trades Certification. (2 years) – or approved equivalent
Basic Building Operator's, or two Building System or Building Fabric courses such as Basic Refrigeration, Carpentry, Heating, or Plumbing. (60 hours)
Manlift Operator Certificate. (8 hours)
Required to obtain criminal record clearance.
Current and valid Class 5 B.C. Driver's Licence.
Experience:
2 years of related experience.
or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
OTHER:
May be requested to substitute in a more senior position.

Work schedule: Monday - Friday, 35 hour work week
$33.79 per hour, Pay Grade 9
Job Code #4030
This is a CUPE Local 50 Position

To apply for this opportunity you will need to create an online profile or log back in to our career portal at www.victoria.ca/jobs - only online submission will be considered. All applications must be submitted online by 4:30 pm on the closing date noted on the posting. Please be prepared to provide proof of qualifications and supporting materials as outlined in your resume.

COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
Applicants who are not current City of Victoria employees will be asked to provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19 during the recruitment process. External applicants who cannot be fully vaccinated based on a protected legal ground as defined in the BC Human Rights Code may request an accommodation.

At the City of Victoria, we are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce that represents the community we serve. Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, LGBT2Q+ and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations will be provided upon request during the selection process.

If you require assistance, please email us at recruitment@victoria.ca .

title: Facilities Technician - Day Shift
description:
WHO WE ARE

Our Brands: The Estée Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world’s leading manufacturers and marketers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance and hair care products. The company’s products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: Estée Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Prescriptives, Lab Series, Origins, Tommy Hilfiger, MAC, Kiton, La Mer, Bobbi Brown, Donna Karan New York, DKNY, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Michael Kors, Darphin, Tom Ford, Smashbox, Ermenegildo Zegna, AERIN, RODIN olio lusso, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums Frédéric Malle, GLAMGLOW, By Kilian, BECCA, Too Faced and Dr. Jart+.

Our Heritage: Since Estée Lauder founded our Company in 1946 with four cosmetics products and unlimited dreams, we have grown virtually every year on the key principles she established: creativity, innovation and entrepreneurship. The Estée Lauder Companies are committed to building world-class brands by developing talented people. We champion a professional organization that emphasizes excellences at every level. Our people are our greatest asset and the success of our company is the result of the talent, passion, and vision of our creative and highly dedicated employees, who set a global standard for innovation, service and quality. The Canadian Supply Chain and Canadian Innovation Centre is at the core of that innovative spirit. (http://www.elcompanies.com/who-we-are/the-lauder-family)

Our Culture & Values: Our culture is often described as a rare mix of family values with a high-performing public company with a mission of “Bringing the best to everyone we touch and being the best in everything we do. This unique mix translates into a caring, collaborative and compassionate workplace that is also demanding – with a competitive spirit that is a powerful source of motivation. Above all else, there is a focus on long-term, sustainable growth which engenders loyalty and commitment from internal and external stakeholders. We are a values-driven organization. Our actions are rooted in the Lauder Family values of respect for the individual, uncompromising ethics and integrity, generosity of spirit and fearless persistence. Building on these core values we also abide by the following principles: http://www.elcompanies.com/who-we-are/culture-and-values.

To learn more about our unique corporate culture in Canada, please visit LinkedIn.

POSITION SUMMARY

This job exists to maintain the general up-keep of the facility, maintain a preventative maintenance program and a safe work environment ensuring operational readiness and efficiency. In addition, to address all occupants and customers’ needs in a flexible, cordial, cost effective and timely manner.

PRINCIPLE ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • General Up-Keep (30%)
    • Complete or coordinate damage and cleanliness repairs/improvements.
    • Repair drywalls, ceilings, doors and door hardware, plumping fixtures, office furniture, painting, etc.
    • On emergency standby when contract cleaner is not available.
    • Clean snow from entrances if not cleaned by contractor on time.
    • Support Compounding Facility (Agincourt) on a scheduled as need basis.
  • Preventive Maintenance (30%)
    • Follow preventive maintenance program for facility process equipment, utilities and building envelope to ensure Operational Readiness upholding GMP and Environmental, Health and Safety (EH&S) policies.
    • Maintain, troubleshoot downtime/breakdowns and repair or coordinate repairs.
    • Service doors and door hardware, plumping fixtures, wall painting, etc
    • Assist in daily visual and Building Automation System (BAS) process system checks and daily/weekly/monthly preventative maintenance tasks (purified water system, air compressors, boiler, chiller, hot water tanks, wastewater treatment system, fire protection system and equipment, waste/recycling and hazardous material disposal, etc.) Report deficiencies to Facilities Manager and respond to alarms in a timely manner.
    • Assist in review of contractor preventative maintenance program agreements and offers improvements on system maintenance and cost effectiveness.
    • Reviews service reports and ensure deficiencies are competed utilizing Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) Maximo fore pest control, feminine hygiene, janitorial, etc. Assists Facilities Manager with trend analysis of process uptime and effectiveness.
    • Execute ISO9001 policies and inspections on ladder inspections, harness inspection, aerial lifts, etc.
    • Maintain and store up-to-date documentation of all performed preventative maintenance, change controls and deviations.
  • Special Projects as Assigned (20%)
    • Assist Management on capital construction projects at the building.
    • Execute construction and demolition of areas including walls, ceilings.
    • Execute installation of windows, doors, door hardware, and trim.
    • Execute office furniture moves (desks, filing cabinets, etc.).
    • Identify special projects to provide a cost-effective way to meet the growing demands of the business.
    • Provide flexible service and meet deadlines for the projects while maintaining a tight schedule.
    • Train colleagues and new hires as assigned.
  • Customer Work Requests (10%)
    • Provide exceptional customer service to stakeholder’s frequent communication and assistance as required.
    • CCMS(Maximo) – job order completion, monitoring, trending, inventory control, scheduling.
    • Type (1)
      • Customer requests, i.e. corkboards, whiteboards, computer, trays coat hooks, an all other general-purpose requests. All to be addressed within 5 working days.
    • Type (2)
      • Health and safety requests, including operational readiness i.e. system down response, fire extinguishers, eye wash stations, visual safety aids, and safety barriers. All to be addressed within 2 working days
      • arrange contractor service call and ensure EH&S and Security protocols are followed.
  • Other Activities (10%)
    • Order material with coordination with Maintenance Coordinator on Purchase Order creation and reporting Goods Receipt (GR).
    • Understand department budget and control of GR on materials and services rendered.
    • Maintain inventory of consumables and stored items in Remstar vertical storage units and by Janitorial contractor.
    • Pick-up material, if urgently required.
    • Data entry for environmental KPIs.
    • Complete internal and external visuals inspection of buildings.
    • Travel between building, i.e. from 351 Hillmount to 161 Commander
    • Assist colleagues with their projects. Practice horizontal colleagueship with all employees especially Maintenance and Reliability department.
  • Health and Safety (100% – At all times)
    • Proactively identify and resolve safety concerns.
    • Observe and conform to all corporate EH&S guidelines and procedures.
    • Confirm ISN contractor safety program is up to date for all contractors working on-site.
    • Adhere to established Lockout/Tag out, Work Permits, Lone-worker, Fire System Impairment protocols.
    • Actively participate and evaluate Pre-start Reviews for new equipment.
    • Participate in the establishment and execution of annual Operations and EH&S objectives.
    • Understanding of Occupational Health and Safety Regulations and follow all ISO9001 Environmental Safety Management System (ESMS) policies and environmental compliance.
  • Housekeeping (100% – At all times)
    • Work in a neat and safe manner. Maintain clean work environment throughout the site and within the facilities/maintenance shop.
    • Complete all SumTotal training of GMP and EH&S Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) with full understanding of expectations, tasks and policies.
    • Conform to all ergonomic assessment requirements.
    • Actively participate and support the Canadian Operations 5S Program.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Ability to multi-task and juggle multiple priorities by allocating one’s time effectively to manage tight deadlines while making critical decisions based on work assignments.
  • May be required to attend to or provide direction during afterhours emergency situations
  • Mature and self-motivated team player who is committed to personal growth and ethical integrity.
  • Practice a detailed approach to problem solving as it pertains to critical equipment, utilities or systems daily.
  • Assist management in evaluating new installation and equipment.
  • Train colleagues and new employees on ELC practices and procedures.
  • Proficient in the safe use of hand and power tools
  • Strong knowledge of state and local building codes
  • Ability to work at heights and on ladders
  • Ability to safely lift up to 50 pounds
  • Strong construction/carpentry aptitude
  • Maintain good attendance record.
  • Good interpersonal skills.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Demonstrate attention to detail.
  • Maintain a safe and clean working environment.
  • Demonstrate ability and willingness to take on responsibility and leadership roles
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Ability to work independently as well as part of a team
  • Proficient with computers, tablets, phones, and other office equipment


Qualifications


Education:

Secondary school or equivalent.

Recommended Certificates:

  • Renovation and Construction Technician Certificate
  • Trades courses: Drywall, Mudding and Sanding; Framing and Rough carpentry; Painter and Decorator

Experience:

Minimum of 4 years manufacturing/fabrication/construction related work experience with general mechanical knowledge of pumps, motors, piping, valves, etc.

Competencies:

Proficient knowledge in carpentry/drywalling/painting. Strong knowledge using tools and equipment including a wide variety of drills, power actuated tools, sky jacks and scaffolds. Must be proficient with computer software including Building Management Systems (BMS), CMMS, Microsoft Office (email, documents, spreadsheets, presentations). Must hold an ON Driver’s License.



Job: Manufacturing - Supply Chain
Primary Location: Americas-CA-ON-Markham
Job Type: Standard
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: 1st (Day) Shift
Job Number: 219504

We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.

title: newMaintenance Worker (Casual)
description:
Job Summary

Reporting to the Manager of Maintenance, the maintenance worker is responsible for operation of mechanical, electrical, plumbing and HVAC. He/she repairs and maintains machinery and mechanical equipment in accordance with blueprints, operating manuals of manufacturer’s specifications.

Typical duties:

1. Verifies proper function and maintenance of all building equipment as designed.

2. Monitors security and fire alarm systems.

3. Performs maintenance of safety controls indicators such as emergency lights and smoke detector fire testing. Updates maintenance logs.

4. Implement schedule changes and monitor HVAC control system.

5. Painting and minor prep for wall and ceilings (repairs requiring new plasterboard would be performed by an outside contractor).

6. Basic repairs to plumbing and electrical fixtures, locks, doors, and other minor repairs.

7. Provide assistance for room set-ups and take downs for events.

8. Removal of trash and garbage.

9. Cleaning sidewalks of trash, leaves, snow.

10. Covers duties and responsibilities in the absence of the manager.

11. General lavatory repairs (sinks, flush meters, toilets, etc.)

12. Participates in emergency response teams.

13. Work a flexible schedule and be on-call on weekends/evenings/stats

14. Respond to emergencies when needed.

Required Education, Skills and Qualifications

  • Grade 10 plus, at least THREE years of recent building maintenance experience in hospitals or care home or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Valid BC Drivers License.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
  • Ability to organize work.

Company Profile

The New Vista Society operate 236 senior care beds and 540 residential units for seniors and low to moderate income families. The Society takes pride in providing professional care and support services for residents in a home-like environment, including the provision of programming and activities to combat helplessness, loneliness and boredom and support strong health outcomes.

Job Type: Casual

Salary: $22.00-$24.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • maintenance: 1 year (preferred)

title: newMaintenance Worker
description:
THE OPPORTUNITY:

MAINTENANCE WORKER

REPORTS TO GENERAL MANAGER

THE COMPANY:

Passion Drives Performance. InnVest succeeds because our people love what we do. Our entire team shares a deep-rooted passion for the world of hospitality & travel that extends far beyond the walls of our offices and hotels.

Our company culture is built on collaboration. A nimble team where everyone has a voice at the table and an opportunity to pursue their passions. Our skill sets are as diverse as our portfolio, but we all have a singular focus: a belief that partnerships deliver the best results, an entrepreneurial approach to decision making, respect for others, a strong sense of integrity and a curiosity to challenge the status quo.

With over 75 hotels in our portfolio, representing 18 internationally recognized hotel brands, InnVest is the largest independent owner of hotels in Canada. In addition, our management team oversees the day-to-day activities of almost 70 hotels also making InnVest the largest independent operator of hotels in Canada. InnVest’s portfolio is geographically diverse with hotels from Vancouver, BC to Corner Brook, NL but also experientially diverse from roadside inns to luxury urban properties.

At InnVest, our mission is simple – to deliver outstanding guest experiences and superior returns on quality hospitality investment. A career at InnVest will provide you with unrivaled opportunities and invaluable exposure to Canada’s largest independently-owned and operated hotel portfolio.

THE ROLE:

The Maintenance Worker is responsible for performing repairs and preventative maintenance work to ensure all facilities and amenities are in working order and meet Hotel standards.

ACTIVITIES:

The duties of the Maintenance Worker include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Assists with preventative maintenance including completing Guestroom Preventative Maintenance Checklist, minor repair orders such as replacing ceiling tiles, light bulbs and patching vinyl to maintain Hotel and keep property quality to standard.
  • Applies preparatory materials, paints, and stains to surfaces of walls, ceilings, equipment, and furniture. Prepares and applies appropriate materials to signage and irregular surfaces such as parking lots.
  • Applies protective and decorative coats of paint, varnish, lacquer, and/or other related materials to interior and exterior surfaces of buildings, furniture, equipment, and other structures.
  • Maintain the exterior of the hotel including but not limited to snow removal and landscaping.
  • Checks electrical systems such as air conditioning controls, television sets, lighting systems and makes minor repairs and/or replacements as needed.
  • Performs maintenance to electronic locks, telephone systems and fixtures such as pipelines, toilets and sinks.
  • Monitor and perform system tests as necessary to the hotel’s fire alarm/life safety system
  • Refurbishes furniture and fixtures within guestrooms such as cabinets, tables, chairs, doors, windows, and counters.
  • Maintains all tools and equipment in the hotel.
  • Handles guest requests, compliments and suggestions in a professional manner.
  • Follows all company and job-specific safety policies, and reports any accident and/or hazard immediately.
  • Maintains an up-to-date emergency plan. Inspect fire protection systems in accordance with hotel engineering procedures and manufacturers’ recommendations. Complete and keep current evacuation plans for guests and employees.
  • Maintains written emergency procedures for fire, power failure, water and gas line ruptures, and severe weather conditions.
  • Accompanies inspectors, insurance representatives, the local fire marshal, or other officials on inspections of the property. Maintain copies of all fire inspection reports, both from insurers and fire marshals.
  • Maintains a list of primary contractors used in all phases of original hotel construction (plumber, electrician, etc.), as well as those used for any subsequent renovations or repairs. Coordinate and control the activities of contractors and enforce safe work practices.
  • Keep accurate completion and task records in the project files.
  • Undertakes special projects and other duties as assigned by Management.

COMPETENCIES WE ARE SEEKING:

  • High school diploma
  • 1-3 years building maintenance experience required, hotel environment preferred
  • Painting and plastering experience necessary
  • Previous trade (electrical and/or plumbing) experience an asset
  • Have and maintain a valid Driver’s License
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills with excellent customer service skills
  • Able to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, safety awareness information, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Able to write routine reports, keep logs, and correspondence
  • Ability to work independently and as a team
  • Long periods of time spent standing, with frequent bending
  • Must be able to lift a minimum of 50lbs

InnVest Hotels is an inclusive employer. As such, we welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We appreciate all applications, however only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Type: Part-time

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Moncton, NB E1A 6P9: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Application question(s):

  • Have you been employed by InnVest Hotels before? If yes, when was that and at what location?

Experience:

  • Building Maintenance: 1 year (preferred)

title: Building Operator- Day Shift
description:
WHO WE ARE

Our Brands: The Estée Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world’s leading manufacturers and marketers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance and hair care products. The company’s products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: Estée Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Prescriptives, Lab Series, Origins, Tommy Hilfiger, MAC, Kiton, La Mer, Bobbi Brown, Donna Karan New York, DKNY, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Michael Kors, Darphin, Tom Ford, Smashbox, Ermenegildo Zegna, AERIN, RODIN olio lusso, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums Frédéric Malle, GLAMGLOW, By Kilian, BECCA, Too Faced and Dr. Jart+.

Our Heritage: Since Estée Lauder founded our Company in 1946 with four cosmetics products and unlimited dreams, we have grown virtually every year on the key principles she established: creativity, innovation and entrepreneurship. The Estée Lauder Companies are committed to building world-class brands by developing talented people. We champion a professional organization that emphasizes excellences at every level. Our people are our greatest asset and the success of our company is the result of the talent, passion, and vision of our creative and highly dedicated employees, who set a global standard for innovation, service and quality. The Canadian Supply Chain and Canadian Innovation Centre is at the core of that innovative spirit. (http://www.elcompanies.com/who-we-are/the-lauder-family)

Our Culture & Values: Our culture is often described as a rare mix of family values with a high-performing public company with a mission of “Bringing the best to everyone we touch and being the best in everything we do. This unique mix translates into a caring, collaborative and compassionate workplace that is also demanding – with a competitive spirit that is a powerful source of motivation. Above all else, there is a focus on long-term, sustainable growth which engenders loyalty and commitment from internal and external stakeholders. We are a values-driven organization. Our actions are rooted in the Lauder Family values of respect for the individual, uncompromising ethics and integrity, generosity of spirit and fearless persistence. Building on these core values we also abide by the following principles: http://www.elcompanies.com/who-we-are/culture-and-values.

To learn more about our unique corporate culture in Canada, please visit LinkedIn.

POSITION SUMMARY

Building Operator is a trained professional in Building Environmental Systems responsible for operating and maintaining Building Systems. Building systems are included but not limited to Heating, Cooling, Ventilation, Controls, Automations, Water, Drainage and Building Envelope (roofs, walls, doors and windows). Optimal and efficient operation will lead to reduction in energy consumption and GHG emissions. Maintaining a safe work environment with comprehensive preventive maintenance will extend the life expectancy of equipment’s leading to operational readiness and efficiency. Ensuring occupant comfort by addressing customers’ needs in a flexible, cordial, and timely manner.

PRINCIPLE ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • General Up-Keep (30%)
  • Complete or coordinate damage and cleanliness repairs/improvements.
  • Ensure sound curtain wall, structural, roof and asphalt maintenance is coordinated.
  • Liaise with building owner/landlord, contracted maintenance vendors, regulatory or civic authorities having jurisdiction.
  • On emergency standby when contract cleaner is not available.
  • Clean snow from entrances if not cleaned by contractor on time.
  • Support Compounding Facility (Agincourt) on a scheduled as need basis.

  • Preventive Maintenance (30%)
  • Execute preventive maintenance program for facility process equipment, utilities and building envelope to ensure Operational Readiness upholding GMP and Environmental, Health and Safety (EH&S) policies.
  • Maintain, troubleshoot downtime/breakdowns and repair or coordinate repairs.
  • Service doors and door hardware, plumping fixtures, wall painting, etc.
  • Execute daily visual and Building Automation System (BAS) process system checks and daily/weekly/monthly preventative maintenance tasks (purified water system, air compressors, boiler, chiller, hot water tanks, wastewater treatment system, fire protection system and equipment, waste/recycling and hazardous material disposal, cafeteria appliances, elevators, power generators, solar array, etc.) and respond to alarms in a timely manner.
  • Maintain and store up-to-date documentation of all preventative maintenance, Engineers Logbooks, change controls, deviations from GMP and ISO processes.
  • Review of contractor preventative maintenance program agreements and offers improvements on system maintenance and cost effectiveness.
  • Coordinate and oversee contracted performed preventative maintenance and unscheduled repairs. Reviews service reports and ensure deficiencies are competed utilizing Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) Maximo. Assists Facilities Manager with trend analysis of process uptime and effectiveness.
  • Assist with ISO9001 policies and inspections on ladder inspections, harness inspection, aerial lifts, etc.
  • Maintain and store up-to-date documentation of all preventative maintenance, change controls, deviations from GMP and ISO processes.

  • Special Projects as Assigned (20%)
    • Assist Management on capital construction projects at the building.
    • Assist with Construction and demolition of areas including walls, ceilings.
    • Coordinate installation of windows, doors, door hardware, and trim.
    • Assist with move of office furniture (desks, filing cabinets, etc.).
    • Identify special projects to provide a cost-effective way to meet the growing demands of the business.
    • Provide flexible service and meet deadlines for the projects while maintaining a tight schedule.
  • Customer Work Requests (10%)
    • Provide exceptional customer service to stakeholder’s frequent communication and assistance as required.
    • CCMS(Maximo) – job order completion, monitoring, trending.
    • Type (1)
    • Customer requests, i.e. corkboards, whiteboards, computer, trays coat hooks, an all other general-purpose requests. All to be addressed within 5 working days.
    • Type (2)
    • Health and safety requests, including operational readiness i.e. system down response, fire extinguishers, eye wash stations, visual safety aids, and safety barriers. All to be addressed within 2 working days
    • arrange contractor service call and ensure EH&S and Security protocols are followed.
  • Other Activities (10%)
    • Order material with coordination with Maintenance Coordinator on Purchase Order creation and reporting Goods Receipt (GR).
    • Understand department budget and control of GR on materials and services rendered.
    • Maintain inventory of consumables and stored items in Remstar vertical storage units and by Janitorial contractor.
    • Pick-up material, if urgently required.
    • Data entry for environmental KPIs.
    • Complete internal and external visuals inspection of buildings.
    • Travel between building, i.e. from 351 Hillmount to 161 Commander
    • Assist colleagues with their projects. Practice horizontal colleagueship with all employees especially Maintenance and Reliability department.
  • Health and Safety (100% – At all times)
    • Proactively identify and resolve safety concerns.
    • Observe and conform to all corporate EH&S guidelines and procedures.
    • Confirm ISN contractor safety program is up to date for all contractors working on-site.
    • Adhere to established Lockout/Tag out, Work Permits, Lone-worker, Fire System Impairment protocols.
    • Actively participate and evaluate Pre-start Reviews for new equipment.
    • Participate in the establishment and execution of annual Operations and EH&S objectives.
    • Solid understating of Occupational Health and Safety Regulations and follow all Environmental and code compliance including ISO9001 Environmental Safety Management System (ESMS) policies

  • Housekeeping (100% – At all times)
    • Work in a neat and safe manner. Maintain clean work environment throughout the site and within the facilities/maintenance shop.
    • Complete all SumTotal training of GMP and EH&S Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) with full understanding of expectations, tasks and policies.
    • Conform to all ergonomic assessment requirements.
    • Actively participate and support the Canadian Operations 5S Program.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

    • Ability to multi-task and juggle multiple priorities by allocating one’s time effectively to manage tight deadlines while making critical decisions based on work assignments.
    • Attend to or provide direction during afterhours emergency situations
    • Mature and self-motivated team player who is committed to personal growth and ethical integrity.
    • Practice a detailed approach to problem solving as it pertains to critical equipment, utilities or systems daily.
    • Assist management in evaluating new installation and equipment.
    • Train colleagues and new employees on ELC practices and procedures.
    • Experience with environmental control systems (DDC, pneumatic, or analog/electric)
    • Strong understanding of energy conservation principles and techniques
    • Proficient in the safe use of hand and power tools
    • Ability to interpret diagrams, drawings and equipment manuals
    • Strong knowledge of state and local building codes
    • Ability to work at heights and on ladders
    • Ability to safely lift up to 50 pounds
    • Strong mechanical/technical aptitude
    • Maintain good attendance record.
    • Good interpersonal skills.
    • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
    • Demonstrate attention to detail.
    • Maintain a safe and clean working environment.
    • Demonstrate ability and willingness to take on responsibility and leadership roles
    • Strong organizational skills
    • Ability to work independently as well as part of a team
    • Proficient with computers, tablets, phones, and other office equipment

Qualifications


Education:

Two-year or four-year post-secondary degree in building automation systems (BAS) or related field


Recommended Certifications:

  • BES - Building Environmental Systems Operator Class II and/or I
  • BOC - Building Operator Certification
  • Systems Maintenance Designation from BOMI
  • HVAC Excellence, NATE HVACR Certification and Universal CFC/ESCO Institute Certification for HVAC, ASSE 6040 Certification, OSHA-10 or OSHA-3

Experience:

Minimum of 4 years manufacturing/building maintenance related work experience with mechanical knowledge of pumps, motors, piping, valves, etc.


Competencies:

Must be proficient with computer software including Building Management Systems (BMS), CMMS, Microsoft Office (email, documents, spreadsheets, presentations). Must hold an ON Driver’s License



Job: Manufacturing - Supply Chain
Primary Location: Americas-CA-ON-Markham
Job Type: Standard
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: 3rd (Night) Shift
Job Number: 219350

We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.

title: Temporary Full Time - Maintenance Employee
company: Holiday Inn Express - Sault Ste. Marie
description:
TEMPORARY FULL TIME MAINTENANCE EMPLOYEE

This position will require the employee to work from 24 - 40 hours per week, holiday’s and weekends inclusive. The shifts to be worked are mainly 3pm-11pm, 7am-3pm and 10am-6pm. Some overnight and on call shifts may be required.

Applicants must be completely vaccinated against the COVID 19 virus

The wage for this position is $17.57/hour, with a premium of $1.00/hour for any hours on the night shift (11pm-7am) as per schedule “B” of the Union Agreement.

The starting date for this position will be effective immediately.

MAINTENANCE EMPLOYEE POSITION SUMMARY:
POSITION SUMMARY:
You will report directly to the Facilities Manager for the day to day operations and any other maintenance related issues. Your main responsibility will be to perform a variety of routine to semi-skilled construction, maintenance, and repair duties to maintain the Holiday Inn Express Sault Ste. Marie facilities, grounds, and specific equipment. You will ensure that all maintenance related issues are handled on a daily basis with guest problems taking priority. You will also perform any other tasks requested from time to time by management.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES - MORNING SHIFT: Regular Daily Tasks

  • Sign out keys from front desk
  • Patrol property first thing in the morning and collect all garbage lying about
  • Sweep around buildings, and in front of all doorways in order to collect cigarette butts, etc.
  • Performs and assists in preventative maintenance to the hotel’s facilities, grounds, and specific equipment
  • Troubleshoot any plumbing problems and determine the best means of fixing it
  • Remove, replace, and repair plumbing fixtures, faucets, valves, and washers as necessary.
  • Maintenance of HVAC units, ensuring equipment runs properly, replace/clean filters and belts as necessary
  • Perform a variety of minor electrical duties including installation and repairs to electrical outlets, switches, receptacles, and light bulb changes
  • Perform a wide variety of general building maintenance and repair duties; maintenance and repairs to doors and door closures, patches and repairs to ceilings and walls, cleaning of parking lot and restaurant windows, plastering, repair/replace of drywall, apply caulking and grout where needed (bathtubs, toilets, etc.)
  • Assembly and repairs to furniture, installs shelving, bulletin boards, and install floor and ceiling tiles
  • Patch and prepare surfaces for painting, painting various surfaces including walls, cabinets, doors, parking lot stripes
  • Assist in unloading of furniture, supplies, etc.
  • Assist in vehicle parking in parking lot when hotel is full and functions going on. This is usually directed by the Front Desk.
  • Assist outside contractors as needed in emergency situations
  • Keep work area and storage areas clean and orderly. Keep tools clean, appropriately stored and in safe and proper working condition.
  • Report unusual situations to management
  • Sign in keys to front desk at end of shift

Pool Area Tasks
· Check pool chemical levels every 2 hours during the day

· Shut down pumps and check chlorinator. Add chlorine pails if necessary (keep 2/3 full)

· Vacuum the pool if required

· Backwash pool filter if required (if gauge is at 22 or higher)

· Check baskets in pumps and skimmers and empty

· Clean any tables and chairs that are dirty
Winter Tasks
· Keep all doorways and stairways clear of snow

· Keep main entrance driveway clear of snow

· Apply salt in icy areas as required
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES - EVENING SHIFT: Regular Daily Tasks
· Upon arrival, sign out keys from front desk and check in with the morning shift person to see what is planned for the day

· Throughout shift, perform functions as noted above

· If it is dark prior to the end of your shift, do a tour of the property to see if any lights are burned out and ensure that everything is as it should be

· Close and lock all doors leading into kitchen/maintenance shop area

· Inform front desk that you are leaving and sign in keys to front desk
Pool Tasks
· Check the pool chemical levels at 3:00 p.m. and every hour after that until the end of your shift

· At the end of your shift, ensure pool area is closed and locked
Winter Tasks
· Keep all doorways and stairways clear of snow

· Keep main entrance driveway clear of snow

· Apply salt in icy areas as required

At the end of EACH shift, clean all tools and items that you have used throughout the shift and put them back in their proper places and throw out any garbage you have created

QUALIFICATIONS & JOB SPECIFICATIONS:

· Must have previous Maintenance experience

· Basic plumbing and electrical knowledge

· Handyman skills and experience using of power tools

· Flexibility to work days, evenings, weekends, holidays as required

· Strong interpersonal skills

· Excellent organizational and time management skills

· Ability to meet the physical demands of the position, such as heavy lifting, working on ladders, bending, and standing or walking for extended periods of time.

- Must demonstrate proof of full vaccination or provide documented medical reason, by a physician, for not being vaccinated

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

· Ability to perform duties while standing and/ or walking for the majority of the shift.

· Ability to lift weights up to 50 lbs, push and pull heavy equipment such as cleaning carts and equipment.

· Ability to stoop, bend, stretch, and lift while performing duties.

· Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and distance vision.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential function of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing this job, the employee is exposed to weather conditions prevalent at the time. The noise level in the work environment is moderate.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $17.57 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
All hotel employees will be completely vaccinated by January 1, 2022

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $17.57 per hour

Job Types: Temporary Full-time, Permanent Part Time

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $17.57 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Weekend availability
