title: Carpenter
description:
Posting Period

Open: April 14, 2022

Closes: May 14, 2022

UNIFOR

This position is covered by a collective agreement. Applications from outside the bargaining unit are welcome but can only be considered if the position is not filled from within this bargaining unit.

Department Description

Carpenter

Reporting to the Coordinator of Engineering Services, the Carpenter is accountable for the structural and architectural buildings systems, including millwork, hardware, glazing, floor surfaces, steel and wood framing, interior and exterior finishes, installs doors, windows, builds stairs, lay flooring, erects scaffolding, installs suspended ceilings, constructs concrete, and builds framework. Duties will include providing estimates of labour and materials content for minor projects and renovation. The incumbent will work collaboratively with other trade groups and disciplines in completing work requests.

Rate of Pay: $29.78/hour - $30.34/hour

Hours of Work: 37.5 hours per week

Qualifications

Qualifications:

  • Current Provincial Certificate of Qualification as a Carpenter
  • Minimum of five (5) years recent, related experience as a licensed Carpenter, preferably within and institutional environment
  • Demonstrated strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to interact positively and effectively with patients, public and staff
  • Demonstrated ability to interact effectively with coordinators, contractors and agency representatives to achieve departmental objectives
  • Demonstrated ability to function in a team environment as well as independently with minimal direct supervision
  • Self-starter, conscientious, motivated with a willingness to learn, and take on additional responsibilities
  • Customer focused with service-oriented attitude
  • Demonstrated record of excellent work performance and technical competence
  • Valid Ontario driver’s license preferred
  • Demonstrated practice and commitment to the principles of patient and family centered care
  • Demonstrated practice and commitment to patient and staff safety at LHSC
  • Demonstrated practice and commitment to LHSC’s Mission, Vision and Values
  • Demonstrated ability to attend work on a regular basis


Immunizations Requirements:

Successful candidates will be required to complete a health review which includes providing vaccination records or proof of immunity against Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella(Chicken Pox). In addition candidates will need to provide documentation of Tuberculosis Skin testing and a completed COVID vaccine series (two vaccines).

We are committed to providing a safe, healthy and inclusive work environment that inspires respect. LHSC is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and LGBTQ2+ persons. We are committed to providing persons with disabilities equal opportunities and standards of goods and services, and are also fully compliant with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (2005), as applicable.

Your interest in this opportunity is appreciated. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Successful candidates, as a condition of job offer, would be required to provide a satisfactory Police Information Check (original document) completed in the last 3 months.

Together we care, we learn, we discover.

title: Licensed Plumber
description:
Subcontractor position – Training provided.

We are searching for highly motivated individual sub-contractors who take pride in their work and enjoy new challenges to consider submitting applications for this position. As Neptune continues to grow its business, highly skilled sub-contractors will continue to be an integral part of our growth strategy.

We are currently filling positions for Licensed Plumber. There are also opportunities for future positions across Atlantic Canada at the conclusion of the project. The sub-contractor should possess a valid plumbing license, excellent communication and customer service skills, time management skills, have basic computer skills, and able to work independently.

Duties:

· Installation of water meters

· Service work related to water meters

· Installation of transmitters and associated equipment

· Digital data entry through an Electronic Work Order System

· Self management of assigned accounts to completion

· Participation in safe and environmentally sound work behaviours and objectives at all times in support of Health and Safety Policy/Programs and best practices.

· No selling required

Requirements:

· Must have a Valid Plumbing License

· Mechanical aptitude

· Strong Customer Service Skills

· Good troubleshooting skills

· Valid driver’s license

· Reliable vehicle and valid insurance

· Familiarity with hand tools and power tools

· Familiarity with operation of a smart phone

· WHMIS Certificate

· First Aid Certificate is an asset

· Criminal background check

· Relevant past experience in construction/trades

Remuneration:

· Pay based on performance (piece-work), no ceiling, with flexible hours.

Neptune Technology Group is a pioneer in the development of automatic meter reading (AMR) and advanced metering infrastructure (AMI) technologies for more than 50 years. Since 1892 Neptune has continually focused on the evolving needs of utilities – revenue optimization, operational efficiencies, and improved customer service. The company offers a fully integrated migration path for its utility customers to meet their needs now and in the future. For additional information, please visit the company website at www.neptunetg.com.

We thank all applicants for their interest in this position however, only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Freelance

Work remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Contract length: 4 months

Salary: $25.00-$100.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

COVID-19 considerations:
Neptune will provide installers with Masks, disposable gloves, hand sanitizer, boot covers, necessary for Covid-19 precaustions

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • New Glasgow, NS: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Drivers License (required)
  • Plumbing Certificate (required)

title: Building Manager
description:
As a building manager at Williams & McDaniel Property Management (W&M), he/she must ensure the assigned residential property(s) is operated and maintained in a cost-effective, safe and efficient manner as per the operating parameters and standards of the company.

This individual is responsible for maintaining the cleanliness of interior and exterior of the assigned building(s) which includes sweeping, mopping and waxing hallways, stairs, floors and elevator; washing building windows, interior walls and ceilings.

During the summer months, he/she should tend to the building(s)' plants and it includes activities such as mowing the lawn, watering and tending to plants as necessary. During the winter months, he/she is responsible for shoveling the snow on the sidewalk and parking areas.

In addition to maintaining the curb appeal of the assigned building(s), the incumbent is required to act as the primary representative of W&M with strong customer orientation to attend to tenants' property related issues. It may include minor repairs to heating, cooling, ventilating, plumbing and electrical systems. For all other problems that the building manager has no expertise, he/she should coordinate with the sub-contractors to do the repairing.

When there are vacancies in the assigned building(s), he/she should advertise the vacancies, coordinate and show apartments to prospective tenants.

Moreover, this individual is accountable for the financial and operational performance of his/her assigned building(s). Every month, this individual should collect rents from tenants, follow up with any missed payment and deposit the rents to the company's bank account.

Finally, the Building Manager position is responsible for maintaining and fostering positive relationships with tenants to strive for service excellence. Besides the above activities, the candidate is also responsible for any tasks requested by W&M's management.

Major Activities Include:

  • Perform routine cleaning throughout the interior and exterior of the assigned building(s).
  • Attend to tenants' property related problems and give them immediate attention if the situation allows.
  • Co-ordinate the implementation of repairs, maintenance and renovations carried out on building(s) and monitor progress and cost of work for property owners.
  • Collect rents from tenants, follow up with any missed payment and deposit the collected rents to the company's bank account.
  • Compile and maintain a record on operating expenses and income.
  • May advertise vacancies, show apartments to prospective tenants.
  • May occasionally move heavy furniture, equipment, and supplies as required.
  • Perform day-to-day activities with the emphasis on customer orientation

Requirements:

Education Level: Completion of grade 12 or equivalent required

Experience: Previous experience in property management is an asset

Knowledge:

  • Knowledge of operating industrial vacuum cleaners and snow blowers
  • Basic knowledge of computer is required
  • Basic knowledge of carpentry, plumbing and electrical is an asset
  • Knowledge of first aid/CPR and Senior's health needs is an asset

Skills:

  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Strong oral communications skills
  • Organizational skills
  • Problem-solving skills

Abilities:

  • Function independently
  • Plan, organize and execute work under own initiative
  • Coordinate, schedule and instruct work to be performed by sub-contractors
  • Perform physical tasks related to building maintenance

Others:

  • Strong customer orientation
  • Strong willingness to learn while receiving coaching
  • High level of empathy and desire to assist others
  • Self-motivated
  • Flexible and adaptable to changing priorities
  • Supervisory Responsibility:
  • Occasionally supervise sub-contractors and building staff

Reporting Relationship:

Report directly to Director of Operations (Residential Division)

Special Conditions:

The incumbent's home is his/her work office, therefore he/she may have to accommodate tenants' request outside of office hours

Salary Package and Benefits:

At Williams and McDaniel Property Management we have a very attractive salary package for our Building Managers. The salary package is broken into the following categories:

Base Salary:

The competitive base salary depends on the size of the building and the number of units.

On top of this salary, the building manager is entitled to $21.90 per hour spent on extra work done around the building. A list of approved tasks and maximum allowable hours is available from the HR department.

Accommodation and Communication:

As this is a live-in position, the accommodation is provided by Williams and McDaniel Property Management. In addition to the apartment benefit, the Building Manager is also provided with Hi-Speed internet connection, basic cable and a cell phone for communication.

Medical Benefits:

Every building manager has a $900 health spending account that they can use for any medical expenses.

Bonus:

On top of the base salary, a bonus is also available. Building managers can earn up to $7 per unit more than their base salary. The bonus pay is performance based.

Pension Plan:

In addition to the incentive-based compensation, 55% of the bonus earned will be deposited in a deferred pension plan, the building manager has to be with the company for at least 2 years before they have access to these funds.

Training:

Complete training is provided, but previous experience in a similar role is an asset.

title: Temporary Maintenance Operator
description:
Job Description

Operating 11 facilities including seniors’ lodges, apartment buildings, and an affordable family housing complex, Heartland Housing Foundation is known as a strong, collaborative organization and a leader in the social fabric of the region. At Heartland Housing Foundation we are committed to our culture of service and excellence as we continue to serve the people of our communities.

Position Summary

The Maintenance Operator is responsible for performing primarily complex building and suite repairs analyzing, troubleshooting issues and strategizing possible solutions. This position requires knowledge of building operating systems including electrical, plumbing and mechanical/boiler components as well as performing carpentry and aesthetic repairs. As part of the Maintenance Team, the Maintenance Technician will assist in ensuring that HHF facilities and systems are in good condition and compliant with applicable codes, regulations, policies, procedures and standards.

Responsibilities

Maintenance and Repairs Perform maintenance and repairs in accordance to the set guidelines and specifications independently or as a team including but not limited to:
1. Building Maintenance

  • Respond to both routine and emergency facility service requests and complete necessary repairs ·
  • Plumbing/carpentry/electrical/mechanical related activities associated with facility aesthetics and general building functioning
  • Interior and exterior repairs to walls, floors, ceilings, windows, doors, lighting, electrical, plumbing, etc
  • Provide assistance to the maintenance team and contractors in the completion of assigned work orders
  • Monitor contractors and trades people working within the assigned building and ensuring the subcontractor policy is adhered to and followed
  • Conduct testing and reviews of building equipment, machinery and systems to ensure facilities are compliant with applicable codes, regulations, policies, procedures and standards
  • Provide contractors with access to facilities, suites and systems in order to complete their work

2. Grounds Maintenance

  • Assist when required with snow/ice removal (utilizing tools such as snow blowers, shovels, blowers, etc.); applying de-icer/ice melt materials; sweeping walkways; spreading traction sand; etc.
  • Assist with rodent, pest and bird control, etc.

3. General/Custodial Related ·

  • Assist with the set-up and movement of furniture (desks, chairs, tables, etc.) when necessary
  • Assist with special event set-up, tear down and clean-up activities

Equipment Operation and Maintenance

  • Maintain and repair a variety of tools, motorized equipment and machinery that may be both straightforward and complex
  • Perform preventative maintenance and ensure servicing of equipment is completed regularly and/or in accordance with manufacture guidelines
  • Contact equipment suppliers/dealers for maintenance/repair information

Administration

  • Using the YARDI system review assigned work orders, updating required information and closing them out once work has been completed to the specifications

Health, Safety and Environmental Stewardship

  • Participate and contribute to the success of the overall safety program
  • Support, follow and abide by all safety management systems and promote a safety culture throughout the organization
  • Maintain a clean, sanitary and tidy work area at all times
  • Respond to emergency situations as they arise providing appropriate follow-up and documentation as required
  • Adhere to all manufacturer guidelines and safe work practices when using equipment
  • Use Personal Protective Equipment and follow universal precautions
  • Participate in worksite inspections, health & safety meetings and committees as required
  • Contribute to the organization’s commitment to improving its impact on the environment through day-to-day operations and seeking innovative ways to be a greener organization

Undertake the performance of other assigned duties as required

Requirements

  • High School Diploma or equivalent is preferred
  • Three (3) years of previous building maintenance, repair and/or construction/trades related experience is required
  • A valid Class 5 Driver’s License is required
  • Completion of a current and acceptable criminal records check for the vulnerable sector as required by the Protection for Persons in Care Act and the Accommodation Standards and Licensing Act is mandatory
  • Basic working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Outlook is required ·
  • Experience working with the YARDI system or other property management software is an asset First Aid and CPR certification is preferred or must be attained soon after hire

Working Conditions

  • Frequent and ongoing contact with staff, residents, contractors, etc.
  • The requirement to be able to lift and carry up to 50 lbs. and perform heavy manual work at times
  • Travel between HHF sites is required and the position may be required to work alone
  • Work both indoors and outdoors in varying temperature and weather conditions is required
  • Must utilize Personal Protective Equipment and follow universal safety precautions
  • Operation of hand and power tools & equipment is required ·
  • Occasional overtime and participation on an on-call rotation is required

Hours

  • 8:00am - 4:30pm
  • Monday to Friday
  • 40 hours per week

Application Process

Interested applicants, please forward your resume including what position and appropriate hours you are applying for. This position will remain open until filled. We thank all applicants for their interest in this position, however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Heartland Housing Foundation offers competitive salary and benefits packages, training opportunities and an incredible work environment. The successful candidate will be required to provide an acceptable Criminal Records Check, 30 days current.

Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 6 months

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Maintenance: 1 year (preferred)

title: newService Sprinkler Fitter
description:
Company description

IT STARTED WITH A COMMON MISSION – TO PROTECT PEOPLE

This mission is the reason why two organizations joined forces in 2021 to create Classic Fire & Life Safety – comprising the strength of all partners, united in one, clear mission.

In June 2021, Classic Fire Protection and FCFP began a journey to come together to create a new, stronger partnership with the intention of continuing to grow with and through new partners if and when the decision to do so would be beneficial to stakeholders – partners, employees and, most critically, customers.

Supported by our values and leadership team, forged by our shared history, we’ve become the contractor of choice for high quality, professionally installed, inspected and serviced fire and life safety systems and equipment – solutions that play an essential role to ensure the safety of both our clients’ facilities and the people inside.

What is the job?

A Service Fitter is responsible for the inspections, service, repair, and preventative maintenance of installed fire protection systems, including: wet, dry, pre-action, and suppression systems; as well as fire pumps and backflow devices.

What makes you valuable?

  • Have 2 years of service van experience
  • Completion of the 4 year sprinkler fitter apprenticeship program
  • A member of local 853 in good standing
  • Follow verbal and written instructions.
  • Capable of performing physical labour to include carrying and moving equipment and tools weighing up to 50 lbs.
  • Majority of work all above head
  • Able to get Security Clearance
  • Able to work in unusual and sometimes difficult positions such as climbing ladders, scaffolding and high lift equipment, working within ducts, crawl spaces, above ceilings, etc.
  • Read and understand construction blueprints, diagrams, and specifications used in installation activities
  • Ability to work flexible hours.
  • Ability to adhere to, implement, and follow safety guidelines and procedures at all times.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills, positive attitude, and an ability to learn quickly.
  • Possess a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record

Classic Fire + Life Safety Inc. (Former FCFP & Classic Fire Protection) is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds. We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format of job posting) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Have you completed the 4 year sprinkler fitter apprenticeship program and are a member with UA Local 853, in good standing?

Experience:

  • Service van: 2 years (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Driver's License (required)

title: Electrician
description:
Details

Positions Available
1
Job Type
Full Time

Description

Shift: Midnights 10:30pm – 7:00am

Position Summary
Perform the full scope of electrician duties regarding installation, maintenance, and repair work for manufacturing, utilities and building equipment in a manufacturing facility with injection molding and assembly processes.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Install, maintain, upgrade and repair electrical equipment including:
  • Power and control cabinets and their components for injection molding machines, conveyors, vacuum conveying equipment, pumps and compressors.
  • Power distribution equipment like transformers, load centers, bus bars, wiring, switch gear, etc.
  • Facility and building electrical systems, such as ceiling fans, inside and outside lighting, electrical outlets, electric vehicle charging stations, emergency lights, etc.
  • Complete installations, repairs and modifications according to diagram specifications and code requirements.
  • Work with industrial systems and installations up to 600 Volts.
  • Select and recommend replacement electrical components and systems.
  • Calibrate equipment and instruments to provided specifications
  • Conduct basic mechanical repairs and PMs (pumps, conveyors, hydraulic and pneumatic systems)
  • Work with the Development team to implement new systems and production equipment.
  • Prepare working sketches, plans and PM schedules.
  • Estimate labor, material, and equipment costs.
  • Work with specialized contractors to install, repair and maintain industrial electrical equipment.
  • Provide technical guidance to apprentices and junior electricians and millwrights.
  • Train personnel in the safe operation of installed equipment.
  • Effectively work on multiple and diverse projects and repairs simultaneously.
  • Submit of required documentation, including time sheets, PM records, Work Order records, etc.
  • Complete additional responsibilities as assigned

Additional Details

Benefits
Eligible on your first day of employment. Includes but not limited to 90% medical prescriptions, 80% dental, $350 Vision every other year
Community Involvement
50/50 Draws every pay week with proceeds going to charity, dress down days the day before a statutory holiday for a donation; proceeds going to charity, annual christmas family to provide christmas gifts to those in need, annual food drive
Employee Allowances
$100 annual uniform allowance, $100 annual safety boot allowance, $100 prescription safety glasses allowance every two years
Employee Events/Appreciations
Team member appreciation lunches, holiday lunches, kid's christmas party, montly attendance bonus of $50 for perfect attendance, $5 Tim Hortons gift card for your birthday, sweets and coffee provided on overtime weekends

Location

City
Stratford

Qualifications

  • Journeyman Electrician license required.
  • 3-5 years of relevant experience.
  • Capable of working with and without blueprints, schematics, and written instructions.
  • Must be able to generate schematic diagrams, panel layouts, and bill of material.
  • Perform all work in a manner that meets and follows electrical codes, blueprints, and standards
  • Adhere to proper safety procedures
  • Adherence to the Company’s policies and procedures
  • Maintain professionalism when communicating with coworkers

Physical Requirements:

  • Ability to lift, carry, push, and pull up to 50 pounds.
  • Ability to bend, climb, squat, reach, and kneel.
  • Willing to work overtime.

How To Apply

Please apply to opportunites@toyodagosei.com with your resume.

Thank you

title: Intermediate Interior Designer
description:
Intermediate Interior Designer

Are you looking to be part of a skilled, creative, and award-winning firm?

Moncur Design Associates Inc. has been recognized by numerous publications and organizations for our stylistically versatile and beautiful interiors. Since 1992 Moncur Design Associates Inc. has been committed to designing dynamic and distinguished hospitality spaces in North America.

As an Intermediate Designer, you will be working hands on in our office with located in the heart of Toronto at Designer’s Walk, adjacent to the vibrant Annex and Yorkville neighbourhoods where there is no short of inspiration. Specializing in AutoCAD, you will provide technical guidance to our team to develop documentation for various Hotel Brands, boutique restaurants, and beyond. At Moncur Design Associates Inc, we are a tight knit team of hard-working individuals that that are dedicated to producing the highest quality of documentation.

Qualifications:

- Interior Design Degree (or related field of study) from a recognized institution

- Minimum 5 years working in a recognized Interior Design firm (Residential or Hospitality)

- Passion for Hospitality Interior Design and detailed documentation

- Comprehensive Knowledge of AutoCAD Software (XREF’s, blocks, layers, commands, etc...)

- In-Depth Knowledge of Construction Documentation and Drawing Conventions (Furniture Plans, Construction Plans, Reflected Ceiling Plans, Elevations, Details, etc…)

- Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word)

- Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop/InDesign)

- Creative, innovative, driven

- Strong communication, problem solving, and critical thinking skills

- Strong leadership skills and ability to guide and mentor junior staff members

- Clear understanding of Building Code Regulations and Accessibility Standards

Responsibilities:

AutoCAD/Design

- Develop high quality drawings packages in AutoCAD from concept to final design (Furniture Plans, Construction Plans, Reflected Ceiling Plans, Elevations, and Architectural and Millwork Details, Tender Packages, etc…)

- Provide guidance to Junior Team Members for Project Documentation including Building Code, Accessibility and CAD Standards, as well as take direction from Senior Interior Design Team

- Ability to mark-up and correct drawing files

- Develop presentation material (Conceptual Packages, Rendered Elevations, etc…) using AutoCAD, InDesign, and Photoshop

- Coordination with Team to develop conceptual directions for projects as well as material and FF&E selection

- Develop FF&E and Base Building Specifications

- Review and approve shop drawings and finish samples as required

Project Management

- Work as a team by consulting, coordinating, and meeting with Brand, Client, Contractors, Team Consultants, and Purchasing Agents throughout the design and construction process.

- Prioritize multiple projects at various stages of development

- Work in a Team setting as well as independently

- Strong organizational and interpersonal skills

- Meet tight schedules and deadlines

- Utilize various third-party file hosting software’s such as Procore, Lobo, Hightail, Dropbox, etc.

- Participate in conference calls, producing and issuing meeting minutes

- Execute site measures and verifications as required (travel required)

Must:

*Be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or legally entitled to work in Canada, living the in Greater Toronto Area.
*Travel to the USA is required and the selected applicant must have appropriate working Visa or Passport documentation.

Schedule:

Monday to Friday: 37.5 hours a week (in office)

If this sounds like you, please submit a sample of your portfolio along with a sample of your technical drawings.

All applications will be reviewed; however, we will only be contacting selected candidates for an interview.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Regular sanitization and hand washing required by all employees. All surfaces are wiped down regularly.

Application question(s):

  • How many years of AutoCAD experience do you have?

Experience:

  • Interior Design: 5 years (preferred)

title: newDrywall Finisher - Residential / Light Commercial
company: Handyman Connection of Metro Vancouver, BC
description:
To meet the demands of our rapidly growing base of satisfied customers, Handyman Connection of Metro Vancouver, BC is seeking an experienced Drywall Finisher. This skilled craftsman would ideally have a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business. Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work. Our customers love us! We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!

What You Will Receive
  • Receiving comparative wage based on the work experience
  • Flexibility in job locations; craftsman can select where to work
  • Continues jobs as long as the craftsman provides satisfactory work quality
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking, billing
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers
  • Branded apparel and signage
Responsibilities

The Drywall Finisher performs and coordinates the cutting, taping, sanding and installation of drywall during the construction, remodeling or repair in a residential and light commercial setting. The candidate must be proficient working with all drywall hand tools, mechanical tools required to complete their work. You must have experience as a Drywall Finisher, and you must have a positive attitude.
  • Ability to texture and refinish plaster services
  • Ability and willing to work on new walls and ceilings, and repair existing walls.
  • Ability to determine and clearly identify proper materials and material quantities for new and existing projects.
  • Evaluate customer requests, price projects, troubleshoot customer issues, and present a description of a work order to a customer.
Requirements
  • Must have current Driver's License and submit to a background check
  • Must have tools, vehicle and good references
  • Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades
  • Independent Contractors must carry liability insurance and workers comp
  • Must pass screening process
  • Must have a smart phone and access to the internet
HOW TO APPLY:
Please send your application including your resume to pbehpouri@handymanconnection.com

Thank you

title: General Renovation Handyman
description:
Wanted: General Maintenance Worker for Building Maintenance/Renovations.

We are a busy renovations and maintenance company looking for a reliable, hard-working, and devoted handyman. You will be responsible for general renovations and maintenance duties, such as:
  • Drywall
  • Plaster
  • Paint
  • Ceramic tiles
  • Minor plumbing
  • Minor electrical
  • Countertops
  • Kitchen Cabinets

***All work is in Hi-Rise rental apartments.***
This is a full-time position (not for general contractors). Serious applicants only.
Salary based on experience and will be fair and negotiable.
  • $25-$30/hr
  • Mon-Friday
  • 8-10 hour shifts

A successful candidate requires:
  • A set of their own tools.
  • 2-3 years of experience.
  • Their own vehicle.
  • An ability to work independently as well as part of a team.


About Mirage Renovations:

Mirage renovations Inc. is an interior renovations company that specializes in residential apartment building rental units. We pride ourselves on a quick job, done well and at a reasonable price. Years of experience in the rental apartment sector has allowed us to build a highly dedicated and efficient team that is able to tackle jobs of any size. Capital Projects: - Drop Ceiling installation - Corridor painting - Metal door and frame replacements - Finish work after large scale building updates - Garage Painting - Balcony Repairs - Fences Suite turnovers: We can handle all the components of a complete turnover: - Demolition - Plaster & paint - Electrical - Plumbing - Cabinetry - Tub Surrounds - Flooring - Baseboards - Tiles - Tub surrounds - Doors & Frames - Cleaning In-suite/ Odd jobs: We are well- equipped to provide solutions to all your maintenance needs. - Repairing flood damage - Plaster repairs - Door replacement - Painting - Finish work after plumbing repairs - Leaky faucets - Hardware replacement - Boiler room repairs - Fire- rating updates

title: Maintenance Worker (Permanent, Full Time)
description:
Job Summary
Under the direction of the Manager or designate, the Maintenance Worker performs a variety of cleaning, landscaping and interior & exterior maintenance duties at various Coast properties.

Hours of Work:
Monday - Friday 07:00 - 15:00.
+ rotation for on-call emergencies

Typical Functions & Responsibilities

  • Performs typical maintenance and repair work such as unplugging sinks and toilets, minor drywall repairs, touching up paint, changing locks, door handles and replacing light bulbs and fluorescent tubes. Notifies supervisor of major repair and maintenance requirements, and contacts external contractors and tradespeople to obtain quotes as required.
  • Performs additional duties such as repairing furniture, constructing shelves, installing switches, dimmers, replacing plugs, fuses and other minor electrical repairs, applying paint and other finishes, repairs to equipment, replacing sinks, toilets and plumbing fixtures.
  • Cleans, washes, and disinfects building areas such as walls, windows, ceilings, floors, carpets, air vents, furniture, mattresses, blinds, and washrooms by methods such as dusting, polishing, vacuuming, sweeping, wet mopping, shampooing, waxing, and buffing, using various manual and power cleaning equipment.
  • Cleans external areas such as entrance ways, sidewalks, and parking lots using manual and power brooms, rakes, shovels, and other equipment to remove dirt, leaves, snow, and other refuse.
  • Monitors maintenance and housekeeping supplies. Places purchase orders with external suppliers, receives supplies, checks invoices against orders and goods received, stores and distributes supplies, and contacts suppliers to obtain and provide general information.
  • Collects and removes garbage and recyclable materials, and ensures the safe disposal of hazardous waste.
  • Monitors work performed by contractors, contacts external contractors and tradespeople to obtain quotes, and arranges for minor repairs and maintenance work.
  • Solicits quotes from service providers, vendors and suppliers such as equipment and parts suppliers, trades and general contractors.
  • The Maintenance Worker will be required to go on an on-call rotation during evenings and weekends for one week every 6 weeks and respond to building emergencies.
  • Additional duties as assigned

Typical Education, Training and Experience

  • Grade 12 education or equivalent, a Certificate in Building Service/Cleaning from a recognized college or equivalent combination of education, training and two years of experience are required.
  • Proficient using small power tools and equipment such as hammer drills, augers and skill-saws.
  • Ability to work unsupervised and use of sound judgement
  • A WHMIS Certificate,
  • A valid B.C Class 5 Driver’s license
  • A First Aid Certificate
  • Proof of Covid-19 Immunization
  • Able to work on-call during evenings and weekends and at locations across the Lower Mainland


About Coast
Coast Mental Health (Coast) is one of the largest mental health non-profit societies in Canada, and operates a large array of innovative housing and community based rehabilitation services for people with a mental illness living in and around Vancouver. Coast operates in the Lower Mainland of British Columbia providing approximately 1000 people with supportive housing and 4000 clients living in the community with a wide variety of programs and services.
Coast fosters a client-driven, recovery-oriented environment that promotes restoring health, personal growth and a return to society for individuals with a mental illness through advocacy and providing direct programs and services.

Why Coast

  • We believe in the person, not the disease
  • We operate client-centered care under the principles of psychosocial rehabilitation
  • There is a variety of work within a particular position and within the organization
  • We strive to be the best that we can be
  • We hold Exemplary Status accreditation through Accreditation Canada
  • We have won numerous awards for our innovative programming
  • We care about our employees, and believe in living our values and culture throughout the organization


***Employees of Coast must apply within seven days of the posting date with their internal account (Coast email address registered) to be considered as an internal applicant. Current Coast employees who apply to this posting using external accounts or after the 7 day deadline will be considered as external candidates. Seniority will not apply.***

Coast Mental Health is committed to creating a culture of diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion or disability.

Licenses & Certifications

Required
  • COVID: Fully Vaccinated
Preferred
  • Workplace Haz Mat Info Sy
  • First Aid
  • Criminal Records Check

title: DZ Delivery Driver - Boom or Moffett Experience
description:
JOIN OUR FAMILY!

Patene Building Supplies Ltd. is a distributor of drywall, steel framing components, insulation, acoustic ceilings, shingles, masonry and other building materials for the residential and commercial construction industries. We have fourteen (14) branch locations throughout Ontario & Manitoba to serve our contractor, builder and retail customers.

We are currently seeking a Delivery Truck Driver (DZ - Boom or Moffett Operator) that will make deliveries to customer job sites for our Hamilton branch.

Responsibilities:

  • Daily circle check reports and upkeep of company vehicle, including general maintenance (greasing of Boom/ Moffett) and cleanliness of cabs
  • Verifying loads and paperwork (proper loading of materials, tarping, strapping etc.)
  • Completion of all daily (MTO) paperwork requirements
  • Safe and timely deliveries and pick ups of material to locations
  • Participate in loading and unloading materials on outgoing trucks by repetitive lifting or using a boom truck
  • Responsible for directives on site to helper
  • Provide professional and courteous service to customers and sub trades
  • Reporting damaged or missing materials or equipment
  • Adhere and follow company’s Health & Safety policies and regulations
  • Abide by all rules and laws of the road
  • Perform other duties as assigned by management

Job Requirements:

  • High School diploma
  • Driver's Licence (Class D), Air Brake (Z) Endorsement or AZ
  • Standard Transmission experience a must
  • Boom experience preferred
  • Driver’s abstract and good CVOR
  • 1-2 years related experience, preferably in the construction industry
  • Must be dependable and a team player
  • Ability to communicate with co-workers, vendors and customers (verbal and written)

This position offers competitive wages, health, dental, life insurance and an RRSP plan upon completion of the applicable waiting periods.

We invite qualified candidates to apply online.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: newCarpenter-Carseland
description:
JCL Industrial Constructors Inc. is a workforce contractor focused on servicing the industrial and civil construction market in Saskatchewan. JCL supplies skilled workers to our project sites, including apprentices, certified journeyman carpenters, equipment operators, and site supervision. We ensure that our workforce is well trained and highly qualified to provide timely, professional service to our clients. The success of our projects is a direct result of our communication and collaboration with our people.

Possess the full range of knowledge of materials, methods and tools required to construct, install, renovate and repair commercial or industrial structures constructed of wood, steel, concrete and other materials using carpenter’s hand tools and power tools and equipment. Studies blueprints, sketches or building plans to determine specifications and calculate requirements.


Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Erect wood framework; walls, partitions, joints, drywalls and rafters
  • Installs doors and windows, floor coverings, ceilings, trims
  • Builds stairs
  • Build forms for concrete
  • Lays flooring
  • Installs cabinetry
  • Working from blueprints instructions from supervisors does layout-measuring, marking and arranging of various construction materials
  • Cut, shape and join
  • Checks accuracy of works and makes adjustments as required
  • Studies blueprints for work planning
  • Constructs and forms chutes for pouring concrete
  • Erects scaffolding and ladders for assembling structures above ground level
  • Acts as a work leader and mentors to apprentice carpenters
  • Informs immediate supervisor of abnormalities or defects and/or takes appropriate measures


Qualifications

Education/Experience:

Active apprenticeship or Journeyperson status OR minimum 2 years of related work experience

  • Or an equivalent combination of experience, training and education


Knowledge & Skills:

Knowledge: (trade specific knowledge – technical competencies)

  • Knowledge of trade mathematics and imperial and metric measurements
  • Knowledge of the characteristics of construction materials and their proper use
  • Knowledge of installation equipment, techniques, wiring or programs to meet specifications

Skills: (behavioral competencies)

  • Ability to work at heights, good balance
  • Ability to bend, stretch, lift push, pull and carry
  • Ability to coach, mentor and train apprentices
  • Ability to describe and point out safety compliance and regulatory issues
  • Demonstrates good communication and interpersonal skills both upward and downward
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to problem solve
  • Ability to do precision work without close supervision


This job description in not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities, rather it is an account of the major responsibilities of the position.


Thank you for your interest in JCL Industrial Constructors Inc. We look forward to having you join our team.

Please be advised, local candidates will be given preference.

description:
With over fifty years serving the Waterloo Region and beyond, Woodhouse Group is one of the largest and most experienced General Contractors, Disaster Restoration, and Real Estate management companies in Southwestern Ontario. Our team is recognized through the Growth 500 ranking for the last two years as one of Canada’s fastest growing companies, and we are currently seeking a Professional Cleaner for our Disaster Restoration division. title: Carpenter
description:
Position Overview
This position is responsible to provide operational support in reconstruction efforts for clients. Must have carpentry experience and capability of working with little supervision. You must be able to assist with scope development with WINMAR Estimators and run projects autonomously. An Intermediate Carpenter will participate in the development of basic level carpenters. Intermediate Development objectives include; 1) expanding capability from residential to commercial and multi-family projects; (2) competence leaded and self-performing emergency services (3) increased material knowledge and proficiency with various carpentry subsets of framing, cabinetry, trim, etc. This position is 3rd level to journeyman in the Alberta apprenticeship program.

Job Duties

  • Supervision of unskilled labor, Basic Level WINMAR employees, and the occasional

sub-contractor in any residential setting

  • Answer simple questions about the project and when to defer questions to more

qualified personnel

  • Maintaining equipment used in daily tasks
  • Perform emergency services as needed - - IE Board Ups, securing building against

further damage

  • Additional other duties as required
  • Recognize potential problems with the project and timely request additional guidance

and assistance

  • Answer most questions regarding the project and direct more specific or complicated

questions to the appropriate resource

  • Move and protect contents without damage
  • Construct appropriate containment for construction dust, dirt and airborne contaminant in working area
  • Using appropriate tools and accepted WINMAR methods, perform tasks related to

floodcutting, salvaging and labeling baseboards, cabinets, doors, etc.

  • Perform duties but not limited to Trim, Doors, Cabinetry, Insulation, Rough Framing,

acoustical Ceilings, Roofing materials, and Exterior Siding to daily tasks.
Qualifications

  • 3rd level - Journeyman Certificate in Carpentry
  • Perform Daily vehicle safety and maintenance inspections and maintain in clean serviceable condition
  • Must maintain attention to detail
  • Will be required to meet WINMAR Standards in safeguarding other people's property
  • Must have a comprehensive understanding of customer service, principles and practices
  • Work under time constraints to meet specific timelines
  • Will be required to work nights and weekends as requested and travel periodically
  • Report time worked and equipment and consumables used timely and accurately
  • Attend WINMAR sponsored operations and safety training courses as required

Disclaimer
The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being
performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

Application deadline: 2021-05-31

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Apprenticeship

Salary: $21.00-$35.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

Experience:

  • Carpentry: 1 year (required)

Language:

  • English (required)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Customer Service - Insurance Sales Agent
description:
Position Overview:

Looking for a new CAREER in Insurance? Or just looking for a change from your current role?

Are you a self-driven, energetic and passionate individual that is looking for a challenge? We are looking for a high energy, self motivated individual to join our team. Want to run your own business one day? Let us help you lay the groundwork to one day open your own office.

Stephen J Dunn Insurance Agency is seeking a qualified professional to join their winning team for the role of Insurance Account Representative - Desjardins Agent Team Member. We seek an dedicated professional interested in helping our business grow through value-based conversations, relationship building and remarkable customer experience. If you are a motivated self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment, then this is your opportunity for a rewarding career with excellent income and growth potential in an professional office TEAM environment.

Total Compensation Range (Salary, Commission & Bonus): $55,000.00- $60,000.00 annually is based on average sales results including a base salary and commissions. There is no ceiling or maximum commissions you can receive in this sales position.

Responsibilities:
  • Develop leads, schedule appointments, identify customer needs, and market appropriate products and services, ensuring client peace of mind.
  • Provide prompt, accurate, and friendly customer service. Service can include responding to inquiries regarding insurance availability, eligibility, coverages, policy changes, transfers, claim submissions, and billing clarification.
  • Work with the agent and team to meet sales goals.
Requirements:
  • Sales experience (outside sales or inside sales representative, retail sales associate, or telemarketing) preferred
  • Successful track record of meeting sales goals/quotas preferred
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and good sense of humour
  • Excellent communication skills - written, verbal and listening
  • Proactive in problem solving
  • Honest, empathetic, trustworthy, dedicated team player
  • Ability to multi-task
  • Ability to make presentations to potential customers
  • General License - OTL/RIBO (preferred/must be able to obtain prior to starting)
This is a full-time position within a Desjardins Insurance Agency in Ancaster, Ontario with some ability to work from home 1 day per week.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $43,000.00-$60,000.00 per year

These positions are with an independent contractor agent that is part of the Desjardins exclusive agent network, not with Desjardins Group or its subsidiaries. This agents’ employees are not employees of Desjardins. Independent contractor agents are responsible for and make all employment decisions regarding their employees.

title: Territory Manager-GTA
description:
The Territory Manager (TM) for CertainTeed will be responsible for building sales with new and existing customers. The Territory Manager will primarily work directly with contractors and dealer/ distribution customers to generate sales growth of CertainTeed’s (CT) portfolio of building products for interior and exterior applications. They will be responsible for account planning, developing and coordinating activities to expand CT sales and be the preferred choice within the Ontario region. In addition, the TM will work in collaboration with their regional colleagues to deliver cross-functional customer planning sessions to unlock and maximize the sales opportunities across the full product portfolio. Territory Location: Eastern GTA & Northern Ontario What will you do? • Develop and implement territory strategy consistent with the overall business direction to grow sales with year over year growth in multiple product categories within the Interior Products Group (IPG) and the Exterior Products Group (EPG). • Identify customer solutions that span across multiple product categories and cross-functional stakeholders, and collaborate effectively with our customers to help them grow their business • Establish and effectively manage a high sales call cycle for a diverse customer base such as contractors, builders and create “pull-through” demand, subsequently working with distribution customers to close related sales • Work collaboratively with Architectural Solutions colleagues to deliver sales growth by working towards securing specifications and tracking construction projects on our CRM platform from planning through bidding phases to maximize closing rates • Support the achievement specifications for Value Added Products (VAP) • Conducts and participates in sales promotions and educational meeting with contractors, builders and builder sales representative, applicators, distributors and other trade factors. • Monitor competitive activity and industry trends to create competitive solutions • Provides product knowledge to customer inquiries and develop account growth • Monitors market pricing, and where applicable, presents documented price approval requests to manager in strict accordance with company guidelines. • Communicate promptly and regularly with the regional team on trends, opportunities, and issues • Promptly investigates customer complaints, informs necessary functions within the company and enters case into CRM platform. Follows up and closes complaint with the customer ensuring an acceptable customer experience • Monitor the quality of our products to ensure customers are satisfied and issues are resolved internally • Participates in formalized training programs to continually improve professional selling and develop a thorough working knowledge of products and programs. • Process all administrative tasks accurately and on time (Salesforce, expense accounts, new customer setups etc.) Ensures alignment to our Healt Location: Remote position ; managing GTA territory Travel: up to 25% overnight post Covid

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

• Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business or similar discipline, or five (5) years of equivalent training and related experience in the building, construction industry. • Five to ten (5-10) years of applied professional selling experience which includes managing customer relationships, sales presentations and closings of sales. • Experience managing distribution channels and contractor sales is strongly preferred • Experience creating and executing sales • Territory management experience with a focus on developing long-term relationships. • Experience successfully meeting or exceeding sales target by being results driven, • Communicating Effectively-written and orally, including presentation skills • Decision Making & strong problem solving skills • Exceptional at working in a collaborative team environment • Focusing on Customers • Planning & Organizing • Self-Confident • Thinking Systematically • Initiating Action & Agility • Negotiating • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and other technology (Sales Force)

Who are we ?

Here’s what we do… CertainTeed is a subsidiary of Saint-Gobain - the world’s largest building materials company with over a 350-year legacy of innovation and growth. The Saint Gobain group is a leader in sustainable product development and environmental stewardship. We are proud to that Saint Gobain North America was recognized by the Top Employers institute as one of the best workplaces in North America & Canada. For 113 years, CertainTeed has been synonymous with quality, trust, innovation, and service. Our team designs, manufactures and distributes materials and solutions in the construction and building materials market. CertainTeed’s broad product offering includes insulation, ceilings, roofing, siding, fence, railing, deck, exterior trim and gypsum board products. We provide comfort, performance and safety while addressing the challenges of sustainable construction, resource efficiency and climate change. Our offerings incorporate and promote the wellbeing for each of us and we are building a future where we collectively work together towards our core purpose to Make the World a Better Home. You’ll join a dynamic sales team who have strong customer relationships and solid knowledge of service delivery within our CertainTeed Canada business.

Legal Statement

Saint-Gobain is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process to applicants upon their request. This commitment is in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

title: Building Services Technician
description:
Location

Royal Bank Building - 335 - 8th Avenue SW

Business

Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations — bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. It’s why the world’s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.

If you’re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.

Job Description

DESCRIPTION:
This entry level position involves constant daily interaction with contractors and tenants, which requires an individual who consistently demonstrates empathy and courtesy to customers’ needs. This position will require some physical activity such as lifting of boxes, moving common area furniture and minor construction. Flexible hours are required in this role with occasional weekends or evening.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responding to 310-SERV requests, completion of minor repairs and tenant requests
Handyman type duties such as hanging pictures, door repairs, moving common area furniture and fire stopping.
Delivery of construction materials to contractors upon request
Occasional evening and weekend work to accommodate event set-ups and completion of building related projects.
Reporting daily to the Coordinator, Building Services on projects and tasks.
Responsible for the set-up and take down of events within the interior and exterior of Bankers Hall and Bankers Court
Perform building inspections
Maintaining ceiling tiles and building supplies inventory.
Ensure base building storage rooms are organized and tidy.
Liaising with contractors to arrange minor building repairs for complex
Assist with fire alarms/drills
Embody and support Brookfield Properties’ Safety, Health and Environment Policy.
Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate hazards to reduce risk to the workplace.
Engage in training and continuing education to develop the knowledge, skills, and competencies required to work safely.
Take action to stop work if it cannot be executed safely or if conditions or behaviours are unsafe.
Immediately report SH&E incidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and/or at-risk behaviours to their supervisor; then diligently work to correct the problem.
Promote safe work practices and safe working conditions in accordance with all Brookfield Properties Safe Work Procedures.
Wear Personal Protective Equipment when required
Other duties as assigned

SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS:
This energetic position, located in Bankers Hall Complex, requires an individual with superior customer service and good organizational skills. The ideal candidate will also have the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.

EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:
Previous experience in customer service is required
Experience with basic tools such as hammer, level, and power tools for minor repairs
Work independently and is self-motivated
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Efficient communicator and the ability to multi-task
Ambitious, energetic and enthusiastic
Experience with Microsoft Office, specifically Outlook, Word and Excel

EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES:
High school diploma or equivalent.
Customer service courses are desired

We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are grateful for your interest in this position, however, only candidates selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

title: newTechnicien de maintenance / Maintenance Technician Bilingual
description:
About GWL Realty Advisors:

GWLRA is a leader in both the commercial and multi-residential real estate industries. Driven by our values of Integrity, Ambition, Creativity, and Empathy, our vision is to be a sustainable company known for exceptional real estate management, trusted advice, and outstanding service by consistently fulfilling our mission to deliver strong, long-term results for our clients.

RESPONSABILITÉS:

Services à la clientèle
  • Correspondance professionnelle, rapide et courtoise avec les résidents et avec les fournisseurs sous contrat qui fournissent des services supplémentaires, lors de services d'entretien.

PLOMBERIE
  • Comprend la réparation, le remplacement ou l'installation de robinets, de tuyaux, de réservoirs d'eau chaude, de toilettes, de broyeurs à déchets, de lave-vaisselle et de machines à laver. Enquêter et diagnostiquer les fuites et les problèmes de plomberie dans l'immeuble et/ou les appartements.

ÉLECTRIQUE
  • Comprend la réparation, le remplacement ou l'installation d'interrupteurs d'alimentation, de fusibles, de prises murales, de plafonniers, de ventilateurs de plafond, de systèmes de climatisation et d'ouvre-portes de garage.

LA PEINTURE
  • Comprend les retouches mineures par suite d’un réparation ou des dommages, l'entretien des aires communes au besoin.

RÉPARATION D'APPAREILS
  • Comprend les réparations mineures, le remplacement ou l'installation de gros appareils électroménagers, comme les réfrigérateurs, lave-vaisselle, les cuisinières, les laveuses et les sécheuses, les micro-ondes, etc.

ENTRETIEN DU BÂTIMENT
  • Comprend l'hivernage des terrasses et des aires communes extérieur, l'arrosage des plantes dans les pots, le remplacement des ampoules dans les aires communes, l'éclairage extérieur et les aires de stationnement, le lavage à haute pression des terrasses et de l'entrée, et toute autre tâche si demandée. Étendre du sel sur des surfaces glacées.
  • Comprend le maintien d'une apparence soignée dans l'entrepôt d'entretien, le penthouse mécanique, le garage, les bureaux, les espaces réservés, le gym et tous les espaces communs. Comprend également un nettoyage léger dans les unités libérées avant que les nouveaux résidents n'y prennent place, au besoin.

GESTION DES ENTREPRENEURS
  • Comprend l'escorte des entrepreneurs dans les logements des résidents pour leur permettre d'effectuer des réparations, en s'assurant que les entrepreneurs utilisent l'équipement et les pratiques de sécurité appropriés pour le travail qu'ils effectuent et en signalant les travaux terminés par les entrepreneurs dans notre système de bons de travail Yardi.

SÉCURITÉ + MAINTENANCE DES SYSTÈMES
  • Comprend la tenue des registres pour les composants mécaniques du bâtiment, les systèmes de sécurité incendie (extincteurs et détecteurs de fumée), la protection contre les chutes, l'entretien de l'équipement de protection individuelle et le signalement de tout problème potentiel de sécurité des personnes à votre responsable de l'entretien ou de la propriété, en effectuant des inspections annuelles


GESTION DU TEMPS
  • Inclut le maintien d'un système de planification et de suivi organisé à l'aide de la technologie fournie, la réalisation efficace de toutes les demandes de maintenance en temps opportun et dans l'ordre dans lequel elles ont été reçues ou par niveau d'urgence.


In this role you will have the opportunity to:
We’re looking for a maintenance technician for a multi-residential apartment building. With as many as 4-10 service requests per day, maintenance technicians must be prepared to respond to any of a variety of maintenance needs, often with very little advance notice and a variable degree of urgency expressed residents and management. The role includes bi-weekly on call responsibilities for building emergencies.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

PLUMBING
  • Includes the repair, replacement or installation of faucets, pipes, hot water tanks, toilets, garbage disposals, dishwashers, water-dispensing refrigerators, and washing machines. Investigation of leaks and plumbing issues within the building and/or suites.

ELECTRICAL
  • Includes the repair, replacement or installation of power switches, fuses, wall sockets, ceiling lights, ceiling fans, climate control systems, and garage doors openers

DRYWALL REPAIR
  • Includes filling in small holes caused by nails and minor dings from normal wear and tear; most commonly performed between the time a tenant vacates a unit and a new renter assumes occupancy

PAINTING
  • Includes minor touch-ups following damage repair, upkeep of the common areas and new painting walls, as needed

APPLIANCE REPAIR
  • Includes the minor repair, replacement or installation of major household appliances, such as refrigerators, dishwashers, range ovens, washers and dryers, microwaves, etc.

GROUNDS KEEPING
  • Includes winterization of terraces and common area, watering plants in office and pots, replacing light bulbs in common areas, exterior lighting and parking areas, power-washing terraces and entry, and any other duty if asked.

CLEANING + HOUSEKEEPING
  • Includes maintaining a tidy appearance in maintenance storage, mechanical penthouse, parking garage, offices, reserved amenity spaces, fitness center and all common areas and also includes cleaning fixtures, floors and other surfaces in vacated units before new renters assume occupancy, as needed.

CONTRACTOR MANAGEMENT
  • Includes escorting contractors into resident suites to allow them to perform repairs, ensuring that contractors are using proper gear and safety practices for the work they are performing, and reporting work completed by contractors in our Yardi work order system.

LIFE SAFETY + SYSTEMS MAINTENANCE
  • Includes maintaining all logs for mechanical components of the building, fire safety systems (extinguishers and smoke detectors), fall protection, Personal Protective Equipment maintenance and reporting any potential life safety issues to your Maintenance or Property Manager, completing annual inspections

SNOW REMOVAL
  • Includes shoveling, blowing or plowing snow away from walkways, common areas and driveways, and laying down rock salt atop icy surfaces to prevent slipping, maintaining snow log

CUSTOMER SERVICE
  • Includes professional, prompt and courteous correspondence with residents when scheduling and providing maintenance services, and with contracted vendors that provide additional facility services

TIME MANAGEMENT
  • Includes maintaining an organized scheduling and tracking system, usually by paper, to effectively complete all maintenance requests in a timely manner and in the order by which they were received or by level of urgency



QUALIFICATIONS:
  • 2+ years of experience in a maintenance role
  • Property Management experience an asset
  • Must be Bilingual (French/English)
  • Must possess exceptional communication and interpersonal relationship skills
  • Strong attention to detail, problem-solving, and follow-up is required
  • Must be a self-starter with high degree of initiative, flexibility, and professionalism
  • Ability to work with a diverse group of people and interests while being culturally aware
  • Possess knowledge of health and safety practices
  • Ability to follow oral and written instructions and be able to maintain effective and cooperative working relationships
  • Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions
  • High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED)

What we Offer:
  • 3 Weeks of Vacation per year
  • 3 Paid Personal Days per year
  • Up to $2,000 annual Education Allowance
  • Up to $5,000 annual Mental Health Coverage, plus other comprehensive benefits and savings programs
  • Up to $400 to use towards wellness annually to help support your financial, physical, and mental wellness

Our Business :
Learn more about our commercial and residential businesses, our values, and careers at GWLRA.

Our Commitment to Diversity :
GWL Realty Advisors is an equal opportunity employer. It prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

title: 1 Permanent Full Time Capital Projects Coordinator
description:
Position Information:
The position entails assisting the Capital Projects department at the hospital in managing the P3 facility management contract and with the management of hospital capital projects. This includes direct oversight of day to day operations of the service provider and assisting in the contract management of the P3 agreement. The coordinator will manage small to medium size projects from planning to design and construction. In addition, the Capital Projects Coordinator is responsible for the property management of the Medical Professional Building owned by Woodstock General Hospital. This responsibility includes handling contractor maintenance agreements and resolving building/equipment emergencies on an ongoing 24/7 basis and will act as a liaison between Woodstock Hospital, suite occupants and outside contractors called in to complete repairs. Also, the Capital Project Coordinate will complete weekly visual inspections of the on-site CHP unit.

Qualifications and Skills Required

  • Possess a Diploma or Degree (preferred) from a recognized Facilities Management,

Architectural Technologist, or Engineering program or have applicable work experience.

  • Minimum 1 to 3-year experience in Facility Management
  • Strong knowledge on building maintenance, mechanical systems and troubleshooting.
  • Superior Interpersonal skills and communication skills in both verbal and written reporting
  • Solid understanding of complex drawings, specification and other technical data are essential
  • Self-motivated, able to work independently and collaboratively as a team member
  • Experience managing sub trades
  • Solid organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent time management skills and the ability to handle a complex workload
  • Knowledge of applicable Building Codes, regulations and industry best practices.
  • Able to use computer programs such as AutoCAD, Revit, Microsoft Excel, and Word
  • Building automated systems or computerized maintenance management system experience would be an asset.
  • Commitment to Patient Care & Safety and Service Excellence

Physical Demands
Responding to tenant calls which includes inspecting problems outdoors (in all-weather/seasons), on top of roofs, and mechanical and electrical rooms. Complete small tasks: light bulb changes, faucet cartridges, replacing ceiling tiles, moving materials as needed, ability to lift up to 50lbs, climb a ladder.

Hours of Work

37.5 hours per week

Please note that a cover letter is required to be submitted with your application.

Company Biography:
Located in the heart of Oxford County and serving more than 110,000 people, Woodstock Hospital is committed to promoting compassionate and respectful patient care. Join the team at our new state-of-the-art 178 bed hospital. We are a smoke-free and fragrance-free facility. Woodstock Hospital is also dedicated to sustaining a supportive environment and providing employment equity by meeting the accessibility needs of people with disabilities. Woodstock Hospital and its employees are committed to participating and complying with the by-laws and guidelines of the standards developed under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA).

Job Type: Full-time

title: newData Center, Operations Facilities Technician
description:
For more than 20 years Global Relay has set the standard and trends in compliant communications with our multi-award winning unified communications, data capture, and data analysis platform. We securely capture and manage the world's communications data and give its owners greater control and visibility to drive value and ensure compliance with the regulatory requirements of a large variety of industries and authorities.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other typical things you expect, but we are not your typical company. Global Relay is a career-making company. It is a place for big ideas, new challenges, and cutting-edge innovation. It is a place where you can make an impact.

Your Role:

This position provides facilities support of Global Relay's mission critical data center facilities, server environments and related infrastructure. This includes specification, installation, maintenance and testing of mechanical equipment, electrical equipment, server and storage systems within established standards, as well as development and maintenance of data center support systems such as automated system provisioning, asset tracking, space planning, cable management, equipment monitoring and maintenance. The primary focus of this position will be around facilities support, including electrical, HVAC, and building maintenance and repairs. Activities require timely troubleshooting of hardware including servers, mechanical systems, electrical systems and use of monitoring application software and operating systems to monitor, diagnose and resolve unique, non-recurring problems. These responsibilities require independent and team-based analyses, initiative and good judgment, communication and problem solving while working with little supervision. This role will be primarily facilities related.

Your Job:

  • Ensure facility is maintained to highest standards possible to ensure 100% uptime is achieved
  • HVAC systems maintenance, filter replacements, motor swaps, cleaning and inspections
  • Daily, weekly and monthly inspections of facility, logging of results, and planning of repairs and maintenance
  • Electrical system inspections, testing and documenting
  • Receiving, unpacking, assembling, racking and cabling of servers, storage systems and related components
  • Ability to lift and move large and awkward equipment safely
  • Light fabrication, metalwork and construction as part of facility expansion and changes
  • Building maintenance including; pressure washing, painting, basic repairs of doors and hardware
  • Assist operations staff with the installation, configuration and ongoing usability of servers, storage systems, peripheral equipment and software
  • Maintain a well-organized list of inventories of all equipment and parts
  • Perform rotating shift coverage to meet all support needs as needed
  • Willing to do shift work, including night shifts and emergency coverage as needed
  • Liaise with contractors to ensure system availability and highest standards of work are upheld
  • Assist in ongoing facilities improvements
  • Assist in 3rd party technical audits as needed
  • Management of storage spaces and hardware and equipment storage
  • Waste Management of packing materials and refuse produced as part of facility operations
  • Destruction of decommissioned IT equipment prior to disposal
  • Basic janitorial tasks as required, loading recycling bins, wiping down of surfaces, etc.

About You:

The successful candidate will have a High School diploma or higher education. Experience in supporting facilities and data center needs within a mission critical environment, or have an equivalent combination of education, training and experience that is relevant to the role.

Essential qualifications include:

  • Familiarity with mechanical equipment systems (CRAC, CRAH, evaporative cooling) required
  • Knowledge of electrical power distribution systems and how they are used in a data center
  • Metalworking, Fabrication and construction skills to conduct repairs and installations of equipment
  • Experience with complex building and mechanical system controls
  • Excellent judgement skills in making critical decisions
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in both verbal and written English
  • Strong organization skill and initiatives
  • Strong documentation skills
  • Comfortable working under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  • Computer skills in Word, Excel, Outlook
  • Basic CAD\CAM skills an asset
  • Resourcefulness in problem solving abilities
  • Excellent cable management skills required. Pictures of previous cabling jobs would be an asset
  • Experience working in a mission critical data center facility an asset
  • Demonstrated ability to work both collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently in an effective and organized manner in a complex and challenging environment
  • Previous experience working in an environment with formally structured change management process would be considered an asset
  • Ability to work in a team environment as well as independently as needed
  • Ability to learn on the go and take on additional roles and responsibilities
  • Proper use of PPE as needed for the various duties being preformed

Working conditions

Working conditions entail working in the following environments:

  • Extended periods of work in Data Center spaces, which can be noisy and have temperature extremes (10*c to 40*c)
  • Working outside on building repairs and maintenance (pressure washing, painting)
  • Working at a desk to complete documentation
  • Extended periods of standing or working on one's feet

Physical requirements

This position requires the following abilities;

  • Lift and carry 50Lbs, and has prolonged periods of standing
  • Climb ladders and work from them
  • Work with power tools such as drills, saws, pressure washers
  • Work with hand tools such wrenches, sockets, screwdrivers, pliers

About Us:

At Global Relay there is no ceiling. This is the land of opportunity for the energetic, intelligent, and driven people that make this company great. The combination of the right people in the right positions and a rapidly growing company means unlimited career potential.

You will receive the mentoring, coaching, and support that you need to reach your personal and career goals. You'll be part of a culture that promotes and rewards hard work and creativity and will grow into the new opportunities that are available to you.

We understand flexible work arrangements are important and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it's flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.
