title: newBuilding Operator
description:
Job Title

Building Operator

Job Description Summary

POSITION:BUILDING OPERATOR
LOCATION:Cornwall Centre
REPORTS TO:Operations Manager/Operations Supervisor
WORKING HOURS: 40 hrs. Per week, Mon. – Sun. (shift rotations incl. morning & afternoon shifts, evenings, and weekends)

RESPONSIBILITY: Operates and assists in the repair and maintenance of the Shopping Centre’s HVAC equipment and building systems towards the objective of peak efficiency resulting in maximum retailer and shopper comfort.

Job Description

Operation and daily inspection of all HVAC, mechanical, electrical, telecommunication, life safety and lifting device equipment to ensure efficient performance. Performs minor repairs and adjustments as needed.
Seasonal start up and shutdowns of cooling and heating systems.
Boiler maintenance, chemical testing and running to a maximized level.
Daily tests and maintains records for chemical treatment of chilled water and condenser water.
Monitoring of cooling tower operation, checking pressure and temperature gauges, and changing filters as required.
Monitoring, preventative maintenance and system checks on the boiler system.
Monitor the Energy Management System and adjust as necessary.
Assist with the maintenance and control of wet and dry sprinkler systems. Work with the Security Department, monitoring company and contractors in draining and refilling sprinkler systems as required.
Test run and maintain emergency generator as per schedule.
Assist with the monitoring and control of all life safety equipment including the fire alarm and sprinkler systems, fire hydrants, standpipe connections, fire doors, etc. as required.
Respond to tenant calls regarding heating, cooling problems & building emergencies (i.e., water leaks); co-ordinate same with the tenant to ensure proper repair is being completed on a timely basis.
Assist in the seasonal shutdown of heaters, boilers, and cooling towers.
Assist in the winterizing of all common area air-handling units including draining and anti-freeze treatment, where applicable.
Property maintenance including but not limited to general building repair, sign repair, light changes, ceiling tile changes, fire inspections and logs, etc.

SPECIFIC SECONDARY DUTIES:
Record makeup water meter readings & utility consumption for those with check meters
Works with contractors on scheduled diagnostic and periodic legislative tests/inspections of building systems and related equipment to ensure reliability.
Organize and maintain operations storage and workshop area.
Assist in coordinating and supervising all contracts and contractors as outlined by Operations Manager/Maintenance Supervisor.
Maintain the plant in a first-class manner as it relates to safety, appearance and efficiency.
Perform and supervise all minor tasks as requested by the Operations Manager/Maintenance Supervisor, which directly or indirectly affects the operations of the shopping centre.

In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendments Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a position at Cushman & Wakefield, email HRServices@cushwake.com or HRServices@cwservices.com. All inquiries not related to accommodations will go unanswered.

Cushman & Wakefield is committed to equity in employment and our goal is to have a diverse, inclusive, and barrier-free workplace. If you are a person with a disability and need the job posting in an alternative format or any other accessible accommodations during the hiring process, please email your request to canadarecruitment@cushwake.com. Please refer to the job title and job location when you contact us.Cushman & Wakefield s’engage à respecter l’équité en matière d’emploi. Notre objectif est d’offrir un milieu de travail diversifié, inclusif et exempt d’obstacles. Si vous êtes une personne handicapée et que vous avez besoin de recevoir l’offre d’emploi dans un autre format ou d’accéder à toute autre mesure d’adaptation au cours du processus d’embauche, veuillez soumettre votre demande par courriel à canadarecruitment@cushwake.com. Veuillez mentionner le titre de poste et le lieu de travail au moment de communiquer avec nous.

title: newJourneyman Carpenter
description:
Description:

The Journeyman Carpenter is responsible for constructing, renovating, erecting and repairing of buildings made of wood, wood substitutes and other materials within a manufacturing setting.

You will:

  • Build house framework, walls, roof, exterior and interior finishes
  • Install doors, windows, flooring, cabinets, stairs, handrails, paneling, molding and ceiling tiles
  • Repair and remodel existing structures of all kinds
  • Read and interpret drawings.
  • Select materials, plan sequences and methods of work and measure and mark materials to avoid costly mistakes or omissions.
  • Cut and shape materials and join them with nails, screws, bolts or glue.
  • Check completed units to ensure they are level, square, plumb and in the right size, shape and location.
  • Work accurately and economically and follow national and local building codes.

You will need:

  • Certified Journeyman Carpenter Certification
  • Computer literate with the aptitude to solve arithmetic problems quickly and accurately

Physical requirements:

  • Capability to stand, crouch and kneel for long periods of time
  • Capacity to lift heavy equipment and materials when required and demonstrate proper lifting techniques

COVID-19 Information

ATCO is committed to providing and maintaining a safe environment for our employees, contractors, partners, and customers. As part of this unwavering commitment to safety, all ATCO employees and contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 or provide proof of exemption.

ATCO Structures Overview

ATCO Structures is part of ATCO Ltd. We're a worldwide leader in modular design, manufacturing, and construction. From our very beginnings in workforce housing, we've been at the forefront of this industry, pioneering design and delivery processes and developing innovative products to meet the essential need for shelter around the globe. Through our solutions to workforce accommodation, office and commercial buildings, classrooms, hospitals, and hotels, we've re-imagined how permanent and temporary modular facilities can help communities of all kinds.

ATCO Structures values diversity. We're committed to having an inclusive, fair, and respectful company that represents the diverse talents available in the workforce. With guidance from our Employment Equity Advisory Committee, we strive to ensure that our work environment allows for each employee to reach their full potential; this is only possible when differences are respected and valued.

Visit our website https://structures.atco.com for more information.

This position has been identified as risk/safety-sensitive and will require completion of pre-employment medical, alcohol and drug testing. In addition, will be required to undergo a Criminal Record Check.

By submitting your resume and personal information to the ATCO Group of Companies, and/or participating in a personal interview, you acknowledge and consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the ATCO Group of Companies to determine your suitability for employment opportunities within the ATCO Group of Companies.

title: newCorporate Law Clerk Summer Student
description:
At Flynn, it's not just a job, it's a career

Do you enjoy corporate law or want to find out if corporate law is for you?
Reporting to the Senior Law Clerk, the Corporate Law Clerk Summer Student will experience an in-depth overview of minute books and corporate governance relating to CBCA and OBCA corporations. This role will provide the successful candidate with hands-on experience in all components of minute books, preparing annual proceedings and various resolutions, extra-provincial filings, sorting and compiling e-minute books, filing documents in minute books as well as updating and preparing registers and ledgers.
This is an hourly, fulltime contract position for the summer months with potential for part-time work continuing into the fall. The Corporate Law Clerk Summer Student will be required to work in-office.

A Day in the Life

  • Reviewing minute books
  • Preparing minute book review summaries
  • Drafting directors and shareholders resolutions
  • Preparing various extra-provincial annual returns across Canada
  • Scanning signed resolutions and filed annual returns and uploading to corporate directories and placing in minute books
  • Preparing and/or updating directors, officers and shareholders ledgers and registers
  • Preparing share certificates
  • Organizing electronic documents within corporate directories
  • Updating various tracking charts
  • Other projects as required

What We Are Seeking

  • Current enrollment in a Post-Secondary Law Clerk program
  • Detail-oriented, responsible, independent, and self-motivated
  • Strong oral and written communication

What We Offer

  • Beautiful work environment with high ceilings and tons of natural sunlight!
  • In-house cafeteria and gym
  • Free parking
#LI-RS1

Flynn Group of Companies is the leading trade contractor in North America that works on virtually every aspect of a building’s outer layer, including Roofing, Glazing, Waterproofing, and Architectural Metals. The foundation of our award winning success is having the right people on our team.

We are also highly active and committed to creating an environment which is accessible to all of our customers, employees and applicants. Reasonable accommodations in the hiring process will be provided to people with disabilities upon request.

title: Mine Supervisor
description:
CertainTeed Canada has an exciting career opportunity for a seasoned Mine Supervisor.

This is a great chance to join a Top Employer and contribute to our growth and success by demonstrating your passion and expertise for achieving Company objectives and being solution driven.


Here’s what we do…

CertainTeed is a subsidiary of Saint-Gobain - the world’s largest building materials company with a 350-year legacy of innovation and growth. Saint-Gobain group is leader in sustainable product development and environmental stewardship. We’re proud to that Saint-Gobain North America was recognized by Top Employers institute as on the best workplaces in North America & Canada.

For 113 years, CertainTeed has been synonymous with quality, trust, innovation, and service. Our team designs, manufactures and distributes materials and solutions in the construction and building materials market. CertainTeed’s broad product offering includes insulation, ceilings, roofing, siding, fence, railing, deck, exterior trim and gypsum board products. We provide comfort, performance and safety while addressing the challenges of sustainable construction, resource efficiency and climate change. Our offerings incorporate and promote the wellbeing for each of us and we are building a future where we collectively work together towards our core purpose to Make the World a Better Home.


What’s the job?

As a key member of the operational team and reporting directly to the Mine Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the rock handling plant (RHP), shipment process, maintenance of stationary machinery and mobile equipment and providing overall supervision and support to mining and RHP plant operations. You will also:

  • Act as a role model for all safety standards/processes and on the-job-behavior through living core principles and creating a positive and inclusive work environment
  • Work through influence, act as a principal change agent for the site and coordinate initiatives including ensuring environmental compliances and regulations are adhered to in conjunction with the onsite Environmental Coordinator
  • Monitor the production processes and product quality and direct efforts to make adjustments to the process and/or equipment to maintain quality and production standards
  • Ensure the mine contractors are working in compliance with the Scope of Work.
  • Ensure the production planning vs rock demand
  • Supervises the RHP to produce crushed rock for board plant, cement and agriculture market
  • Supervise – the loading process. Customer trucks and rail shipment, including rail cars move
  • Supervise - the maintenance crew and help plan AM and PM to ensure that all buildings, equipment and machinery are maintained efficiently, in good and safe operating condition
  • Report performance results in accordance with company standards using assigned tools
  • Train, schedule and assign hourly employees and contractors to work activities.
  • Coach and develop team capability to deliver and sustain improvements
  • Openly and honestly communicate with employees and contractors to build trust and effective teamwork
  • Oversee quality control, with focus on customer specs compliance
  • Maintains of strategic rock stock levels at budgeted level
  • Supports the business identifying losses and cost reduction opportunities

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • High school diploma or equivalent and 5 years of supervisory experience with emphasis on people, equipment, and process priorities.
  • Must possess an Open Pit Boss Certification.
  • 1 to 3 years of experience in mineral exploitation or preparation.
  • Quarry safety and regulations.
  • Customer oriented.
  • Must be capable of learning supervisory, safety and production reporting activities.
  • The ability to provide leadership and innovation within this area of expertise.
  • Good interpersonal, communication, organization, and problem-solving skills.
  • Familiar with Microsoft Office and Excel and have adequate typing skills.

Who are we ?

We provide unique options to fit your unique lives! Our Total Rewards Program is customizable to accommodate your needs. Our menu of flexible options includes, but is not limited to:

  • Hybrid work environment.
  • Excellent healthcare benefits package.
  • Family Focus & Balance: Parental leave, paid time-off and Employee Assistance Program.
  • Financial Security: Competitive RRSP, Company-funded DPSP (Deferred Profit-Sharing Plan) and Employee Stock Purchase Program (PEG).
  • Volunteer Day off: Give back to the community – each employee has one paid day a year that they can use towards volunteering their time and effort with a registered charity.
  • LiveWell Program: Rewarding you for living a healthy lifestyle.
  • And more!

Why work with us?

At Saint-Gobain, our employees have pride in belonging to an organization whose culture is made up of these core values: Trust, Empowerment, & Collaboration. Our company encourages diversity and inclusion in all its forms while our products make the world a more beautiful, safer, and sustainable home.

To learn more about us visit www.certainteed.ca

We look forward to hearing from everyone but please note that due to the volume of resumes submitted, only those selected for next steps will be contacted. To stay in touch with CertainTeed, follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram.

title: Interior Finisher
description:
About Us

Today, West Coast Building Restoration is one of B.C.’s leading building envelope restoration companies emerging as a trusted general contractor. Safety, sustainability, teamwork, and integrity are core company values that encourage innovation and make a lasting difference in meeting the objectives of our clients and the communities in which we operate.

West Coast Building Restoration Inc. is committed to a continuous improvement approach as a means to meeting and exceeding customer expectations.

We expect our employees to bring their best to work every day and in return, management recognizes and rewards employees for their valued contribution through competitive compensation and learning development opportunities.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete the work safely, on time, and to an acceptable standard of quality
  • Reporting to Site Superintendents on site progresses, possible delays, and other issues
  • Troubleshooting common issues that may arise on site
  • Maintaining a good working relationship with the team, subcontractors, and regulatory authorities
  • Performs carpentry, painting, plastering/drywall resilient and tile flooring, and a variety of general maintenance, repair, overhaul, and construction duties throughout in accordance with company procedures.
  • Constructs new interior work, repairs and modifies existing partitions, ceilings, floors, doors, millwork, casework.
  • Prepares substrates and applies final finishes to surfaces including painted finishes, clear and stained finishes, wallcovering, resilient, and tile floors.
  • Assists in maintaining required records, reports, work orders, and miscellaneous information as to document work assignments, as required, in accordance with company procedures.
  • Maintains a clean, safe and orderly work environment in accordance with safe work practices.
  • Assures proper care in using tools, equipment, and supplies.

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience as an Interior Finisher
  • Class 5 Driver's License and personal vehicle (required)
  • Clear Criminal Record Check
  • Good written and oral English communication skills
  • Must be handy with tools and must know how to work independently and in a team environment
  • Experience in Building Envelop Maintenance Projects is a definite advantage
  • Proven trade experience (carpentry, drywall, painting, etc.)
  • Ability to interpret construction documents, including drawings, plans, and schedules
  • Commitment to the job site safety and project quality
  • Understanding of construction procedures, equipment, and Safety Guidelines
  • Excellent organizational and execution skills
  • Are hardworking and detailed orientated
  • The desire to advance within your trade and the company

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Group Insurance Plan
  • Salary increase based on performance
  • Recognition programs
  • Advanced technology tools
  • Stable work-life balance
  • A positive and fun corporate culture, while maintaining accountability
  • Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
  • Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
  • On the job training, mentoring, and coaching
  • Career Development Programs
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

Who We Are

We have proudly served the construction industry for over 27 years. Our rich history demonstrates our ability and diversity as an integrated, full-service organization serving the building restoration and subsidiary service markets. We deliver confidence through a client-centered approach that ensures the highest quality of service, reduces risk, and delivers results.

West Coast Building Restoration Inc. is committed to do business in a way that is mutually beneficial for both people and environment. We train our employees regarding sustainable practices in the construction industry and promote LEED accreditation in an effort of minimizing our carbon footprint.

To apply, please send your resume. We thank all candidates in advance but only those qualified will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $28.00-$35.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • interior finishing: 5 years (Required)

Work remotely:

  • No

COVID-19 precaution(s):

  • Personal protective equipment provided or required
  • Social distancing guidelines in place
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

title: newPlumber
description:
EllisDon is committed to being the safest general contractor. As part of our vaccine directive, we require employees to be fully vaccinated, or in the process of receiving the vaccine against COVID-19. Should you have any additional questions related to our vaccine directive as you move forward in the hiring process, please discuss this with our People & Culture team.

Connect with us LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter

Thinking about a change?

We recognize that the construction industry is changing at a rapid pace and we continually strive to be at the forefront. Our core values empower people to deliver great careers to one another and develop creative solutions for complex problems on some of the most exciting projects. It doesn’t matter what your expertise and craft is – there are no boundaries. We are a group of professionals with a variety of expertise within pre-construction, construction, and post-construction. To learn more, check out our Cradle to Grave services and hear from our team directly about what a career at EllisDon could look like for you. As you can see, we are a diverse bunch.

Above all, we are a group of individuals with unique experiences and at EllisDon, we choose to celebrate the strength in our differences, every day. EllisDon’s commitment to Inclusive Diversity is to work together to create an environment where every employee feels safe to be their true and authentic self. Ultimately, EllisDon’s purpose is to provide people with similar values the opportunity to achieve to their full potential; to deliver that opportunity for great careers to one another; and to contribute meaningfully to the community we share with others.

You as a Plumber will:
Install, maintains and repairs sinks, showers, toilets, water coolers, ice machines and other plumbing fixtures.
Install, maintains and repairs chilled water, hot water and glycol coils in. AHUs, hot water heating equipment such as radiant heating panels, unit heaters and fan coils, lawn sprinklers and water treatment piping system for RO water, soft water and de-ionized water.
Install, maintains and repairs kitchen equipment, coffee machine, wending machine, grease trap, plaster trap, etc.
Install, maintains and repairs patient care related plumbing equipment / fixtures such as sterilizers, water cooled machineries, bed pan flasher and macerators.
Install, maintains and repairs minor steam/condensate devices such as steam traps, humidifiers, safety valves, pressure gauges, thermometers, sight glasses, etc.
Unplug sink, toilet, roof drain, floor drain and clear any drainage piping such as glass pipe, PVC pipe or cast iron pipe. He also repairs or replaces fixtures and fittings in drainage systems.
Cuts, bends, threads pipes, fit threaded pipes with adjoining pipe assemblies.
Replace washers, faucets, and broken pipes.
Welds, brazes and solders piping and fitting as is necessary.
Perform preventive maintenance to medical gas outlets, fire suppression sprinkler systems, lawn sprinklers, plumbing fixtures, etc.
Install and repair medical gas line in patient rooms and operating rooms.
Install and repair fire suppression and lawn sprinkler lines and fixtures.
Closing access holes in the ceiling by replacing ceiling tiles or closing access doors.
Sources parts and accessories as may be required from time to time to complete repairs.
Keeping work area orderly, clean and safe.
Ensure proper care in the use of equipment and supplies

Is this the right role for you?

Valid Ontario Plumbing Certificate or equivalent
3 - 5 years of maintenance plumbing experience
Ability to read, write and speak English fluently
Ability to work at height, using step ladder, scissor lift, telescopic boom, etc
Ability to lift up to 20Kg
Ability to read and interpret schematics, plumbing drawing, instruction and Operation & Maintenance Manual
Knowledge and ability to work with plumbing tools and devices safely
Must successfully meet the medical clearance requirements of the Acute Care Facility

EllisDon is proud to provide this unique career opportunity that provides continuous learning, opportunity for growth, and a competitive compensation package within an environment that is committed to inclusion and respects diversity.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status. The EllisDon core values of Integrity and Mutual Respect welcomes everyone, at work and in the community, and our value of Mutual Accountability, means that we all have a role to play. As an EllisDon employee, this will ultimately be your commitment to Inclusive Diversity.

Accommodation for Applicants with disabilities will be made during the recruitment process when requested.

We are committed to providing a positive candidate experience and ensuring timely updates are provided to all candidates. If you haven’t already, be sure to create a profile on our Careers page here to remain up to date on the status of your application and learn about new career opportunities as they arise.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
General Job Description

Perform the full scope of electrician duties regarding installation, maintenance, and repair work for manufacturing, utilities and building equipment in a highly automated and robotized manufacturing facility with injection molding, spray paint and assembly processes.


Job Description

Install, maintain, upgrade and repair electrical equipment including:

  • Power and control cabinets and their components for injection molding machines, conveyors, paint systems, vacuum conveying equipment, pumps, air handling units, robots, compressors, furnaces and ovens.
  • Power distribution equipment like transformers, load centers, bus bars, wiring, switch gear, etc.
  • Facility and building electrical systems, such as ceiling fans, inside and outside lighting, electrical outlets, electric vehicle charging stations, emergency lights, etc.
  • Control, instrumentation and automation components like PLCs, HMIs, industrial robots and sensors (level, temperature, pressure, humidity, etc.)
  • Data processing and communication systems that support industrial automation and robots (data networks, servers, industrial process controllers)

Complete installations, repairs and modifications according to diagram specifications and code requirements.

Work with industrial systems and installations up to 600 Volts.

Select and recommend replacement electrical components and systems.

Calibrate equipment and instruments to provided specifications

Conduct basic mechanical repairs and PMs (pumps, conveyors, hydraulic and pneumatic systems)

Work with the Development team to implement new systems and production equipment.

Prepare working sketches, plans and PM schedules.

Estimate labor, material, and equipment costs.

Work with specialized contractors to install, repair and maintain industrial electrical equipment.

Provide technical guidance to apprentices and junior electricians and millwrights.

Train personnel in the safe operation of installed equipment.

Effectively work on multiple and diverse projects and repairs simultaneously.

Submit of required documentation, including time sheets, PM records, Work Order records, etc.

Complete additional responsibilities as assigned.


Qualifications and Requirements

Journeyman Electrician license required.

3-5 years of relevant experience.

Knowledge and experience in the Control Systems field.

Capable of working with and without blueprints, schematics, and written instructions.

Must be able to generate schematic diagrams, panel layouts, and bill of material.

Ability to lift, carry, push, and pull up to 50 pounds.

Ability to bend, climb, squat, reach, and kneel.

Willing to work overtime.

Perform all work in a manner that meets and follows electrical codes, blueprints, and standards.

Adhere to proper safety procedures.

Attendance and participation in regular meetings with the team.

Adherence to the Company’s policies and procedures.

Maintain professionalism when dealing with fellow employees.

title: Mobile Technology Support Analyst
description:
At Flynn, it's not just a job, it's a career

**This position is a contract role, working out of our Mississauga head office

A Day in the Life

  • Providing Tier 1 & 2 support to end users of mobile devices
  • Perform setups of mobile devices
  • Coordinate device replacements of mobile devices for field users
  • Manage inventory and ordering of consumable mobile device accessories
  • Assisting with the management of select SaaS applications (box.com, Halogen, etc.)
  • Providing Tier 1 & 2 support to end users of Flynn’s mobile and web applications
  • Triage support incidents and escalate to developers as needed
  • Analyze trends in incoming support requests
  • Use information gathered from interaction with application users to help the development team define new features
  • Document standard problem-solving techniques on the support wiki
  • Take part in pre-release application testing
  • Other duties as assigned by management

What We Are Seeking

  • Degree or diploma in related field or equivalent work experience
  • 3+ years related work experience
  • Microsoft or other industry certifications considered an asset
  • A self-starter, a passion for IT, with exceptional customer service skills
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Exceptional written and oral skills
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills
  • Willing to speak up and share ideas with the team
  • Willing to question the status quo
  • Be able to give and take criticism
  • Ability to work in a dynamic team environment and independently
  • Knowledge of: Android mobile devices; Apple mobile devices; Mobile Device Management tools like Microsoft Intune or AirWatch; Zendesk ticketing system is an asset; Atlassian Jira for issue/bug management is an asset

What We Offer

  • Beautiful work environment with high ceilings and tons of natural sunlight!
  • In-house cafeteria and gym
  • Free parking
  • Competitive wages
  • Great environment where our motto is “Flynn Family Winning Together”!
  • On-going career development programs through our in-house Flynn University and eLearning courses
#LI-VS1

Flynn Group of Companies is the leading trade contractor in North America that works on virtually every aspect of a building’s outer layer, including Roofing, Glazing, Waterproofing, and Architectural Metals. The foundation of our award winning success is having the right people on our team.

We are also highly active and committed to creating an environment which is accessible to all of our customers, employees and applicants. Reasonable accommodations in the hiring process will be provided to people with disabilities upon request.

title: newMaintenance Technician
description:
GENERAL PURPOSE:

Performs variety of skilled duties in one or more of the building trades, such as painting, carpentry, minor electrical, cement masonry, dry wall or other recognized crafts for the purpose of maintaining, repairing or remodeling within a LTC facility, including H.V.A.C., fire safety and other mechanical systems.

DUTIES:

  • Constructs and repairs existing structural woodwork and equipment where required or as directed and approved by supervisors; works from blueprints, drawings, or oral instructions.
  • Builds, repairs, and installs counters, cabinets, benches, partitions, floors, doors, associated hardware, building framework, and trim; uses carpenter's hand tools and power tools.
  • Repairs or installs glass in windows, doors, and partitions; Replaces mirrors; replaces damaged ceiling tile, floor tile, and sheet plastic wall coverings.
  • Landscaping and outdoor work
  • Prepares and paints walls and woodwork or performs other types of refinish; installs or repairs carpet; performs custodial duties as required or instructed by supervisors.
  • Assists as directed in the operation and maintenance of mechanical systems, such as: plumbing, heating, ventilating, air conditioning, automatic temperature control, electrical, ozone system, operates snow plow or blower or other similar equipment as needed.
  • May be responsible for maintaining equipment warranties and maintenance agreements for machinery and equipment within the facility.
  • Performs daily and weekly safety checks throughout the facility to ensure a safe and clean environment for the patrons of the facility and to eliminate all hazards.
  • Performs duties associated with life safety equipment for preventative maintenance
  • Performs related duties as required or assigned by supervisors.

REQUIREMENTS or QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Graduation from High School plus four (4) years of related employment in the building trades, or any equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
  • Considerable knowledge of construction practices and procedures; considerable knowledge of maintenance and repair work; considerable knowledge of rough and finished carpentry techniques; considerable knowledge of carpentry supplies, equipment and their use; considerable knowledge of material grades and types and their adaptability to various uses; considerable knowledge of modern methods and techniques of building construction and construction materials; considerable knowledge of preparing walls and woodwork for various types of refinishing; thorough knowledge of proper safety techniques and procedures.
  • Competent knowledge basic electrical work and understanding of regulatory regulations limiting work where not authorized to do so.
  • Skill in the operation of a variety of hand tools and equipment common to the building trades and/or H.V.A.C., filtration systems, etc.
  • Ability to follow written and verbal instructions; ability to communicate, both verbally and in writing; ability to work in a Long Term Care environment with co-workers and the public.
  • Must be able to maintain a good attendance record.
  • Must be available and flexible for call ins and available for weekend scheduled shifts.
  • Must maintain a professional and courteous manner with all residents, vendors, contractors and fellow employees.
  • Must assure that safety standards are used which comply with all company, local, provincial and federal guidelines.
  • The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to forward reach, overreach, carry and lift with hands and arms, sitting, standing, walking, climbing, bending, twisting, kneeling, crawling, use hands to finger, handle, feel or operate objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to use vision, hearing, speech and writing. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move materials and or equipment weighing up to 100 pounds.

title: Carpenter
description:
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

ACML is actively seeking a Carpenter to work at Vancouver Community College in Vancouver, BC whose main responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Follows direction from the Manager, Facilities Management Services (FMS);
  • Coordinates with other FMS resources for the purpose of completing projects and work orders efficiently;
  • Understands and complies with Health & Safety policies to assure that health, safety, and the environment are the first priority of business;
  • Ensures safe work practices and the safety of others in all areas of his/her work;
  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings and sketches to prepare project layout and determine dimensions and materials;
  • Measures, cuts, shapes, assembles, and joins materials made of wood, wood substitutes, lightweight steel and other materials;
  • Door hardware repair, such as panic hardware, latching hardware, door strikes, hinge adjustments, washroom cubicle partitions and minor metal door skin repairs;
  • Repair walls, floors, ceilings, and using materials such as: wood, steel, metal, concrete, plastics, and composites of multiple materials;
  • Maintains a well-organized shop, keeping a clean work environment and ensures that tools are kept in good working order,
  • Safely and effectively works with a table saw, chop saw, skill saw, drill press, and various other power tools
  • Builds or repairs cabinets, doors, frameworks, floors, or other wooden fixtures used in buildings, using woodworking machines, hand tools, or power tools;
  • Modifies furniture with shelving or cable trays, repairs broken chairs;
  • Seismically restrains cabinets and other items;
  • Shapes or cuts materials to specified measurements, using hand tools, machines, or power saws;
  • Executes preventative maintenance program including door alignments, lubrications and closer adjustments;
  • Repairs and patches drywall;
  • Performs maintenance painting, which includes filling, sanding, priming, and calking;
  • Repairs or replaces broken window blinds;
  • Hangs whiteboards, notice boards, pamphlet boards, and artwork;
  • Hangs signs, eyewash stations, paper towel dispensers and other items as required;
  • Collaborates and provides guidance to sub-contractors and construction workers for projects where specialist equipment or in-house knowledge is required;
  • Assists with scheduling and supervising of subcontractors;
  • Monitors the CMMS for approved work orders for Carpentry tasks;
  • Utilizes the CMMS to manage and accurately and record work effort;
  • Gathers customer requirements to ensure fit for purpose solutions;
  • Makes recommendations on replacement of end of life or failed items;
  • Makes recommendations on enhancing existing systems where cost or environmental impacts may be improved;
  • Assists with generating estimates and quotes on work;
  • Prepares material lists and assists in purchase of parts, materials, and supplies;
  • Schedules work to least impact facility’s operations;
  • Assists other trades with occasional lifting and moving of equipment;
  • Assists with seasonal snow and ice removal to priority areas of the facilities;
  • Attends After Hours carpentry related emergencies;
  • Prioritizes emergency repairs and provides work-around solutions when necessary;
  • Participates in meetings as required;
  • Travels and works at other sites; and
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

WHAT WILL YOU BRING?

  • At least 3 years experience as a carpenter in either commercial or residential construction services and/or directly related to operations and maintenance of facilities
  • Travels between sites. Shall have a valid BC driver’s license.
  • Proven ability to manage a project on your own
  • Ability to work in a team

WHO ARE WE?

With over 50 years of experience throughout North America, Angus Consulting Management Limited (“ACML”) is one of Canada’s most trusted facility operations management companies. We have extensive knowledge managing critical environments including data centers, healthcare facilities, commercial facilities, central utility plants and Public Private Partnership projects.

WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY?

We work hard to find the right people and provide opportunities for them to flourish.

We offer a collaborative environment with experienced leaders and room to grow. We are a company that values integrity, continuous improvement and operations excellence. .

If you’re as excited about the future of our company as we are, we would love to hear from you! We welcome and encourage all qualified candidates to submit a detailed resume.

We are an accessible workplace. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $35.00-$45.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Vancouver, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Application question(s):

  • What are your salary expectations?

Experience:

  • carpentry: 3 years (preferred)

title: Maintenance Worker (Temporary, Full Time)
description:
Job Summary
Under the direction of the Manager or designate, the Maintenance Worker performs a variety of cleaning, landscaping and interior & exterior maintenance duties at various Coast properties.

Hours of Work:
Monday to Friday: 07:00 - 15:00

Typical Functions & Responsibilities

  • Performs typical maintenance and repair work such as unplugging sinks and toilets, minor drywall repairs, touching up paint, changing locks, door handles and replacing light bulbs and fluorescent tubes. Notifies supervisor of major repair and maintenance requirements, and contacts external contractors and tradespeople to obtain quotes as required.
  • Performs additional duties such as repairing furniture, constructing shelves, installing switches, dimmers, replacing plugs, fuses and other minor electrical repairs, applying paint and other finishes, repairs to equipment, replacing sinks, toilets and plumbing fixtures.
  • Cleans, washes, and disinfects building areas such as walls, windows, ceilings, floors, carpets, air vents, furniture, mattresses, blinds, and washrooms by methods such as dusting, polishing, vacuuming, sweeping, wet mopping, shampooing, waxing, and buffing, using various manual and power cleaning equipment.
  • Cleans external areas such as entrance ways, sidewalks, and parking lots using manual and power brooms, rakes, shovels, and other equipment to remove dirt, leaves, snow, and other refuse.
  • Monitors maintenance and housekeeping supplies. Places purchase orders with external suppliers, receives supplies, checks invoices against orders and goods received, stores and distributes supplies, and contacts suppliers to obtain and provide general information.
  • Collects and removes garbage and recyclable materials, and ensures the safe disposal of hazardous waste.
  • Monitors work performed by contractors, contacts external contractors and tradespeople to obtain quotes, and arranges for minor repairs and maintenance work.
  • Solicits quotes from service providers, vendors and suppliers such as equipment and parts suppliers, trades and general contractors.
  • The Maintenance Worker will be required to go on an on-call rotation during evenings and weekends for one week every 6 weeks and respond to building emergencies.
  • Additional duties as assigned

Typical Education, Training and Experience

  • Grade 12 education or equivalent, a Certificate in Building Service/Cleaning from a recognized college or equivalent combination of education, training and two years of experience are required.
  • Proficient using small power tools and equipment such as hammer drills, augers and skill-saws.
  • Ability to work unsupervised and use of sound judgement
  • A WHMIS Certificate,
  • A valid B.C Class 5 Driver’s license
  • A First Aid Certificate
  • Proof of Covid-19 Immunization
  • Able to work on-call during evenings and weekends and at locations across the Lower Mainland

About Coast
Coast Mental Health (Coast) is one of the largest mental health non-profit societies in Canada, and operates a large array of innovative housing and community based rehabilitation services for people with a mental illness living in and around Vancouver. Coast operates in the Lower Mainland of British Columbia providing approximately 1000 people with supportive housing and 4000 clients living in the community with a wide variety of programs and services.
Coast fosters a client-driven, recovery-oriented environment that promotes restoring health, personal growth and a return to society for individuals with a mental illness through advocacy and providing direct programs and services.

Why Coast

  • We believe in the person, not the disease
  • We operate client-centered care under the principles of psychosocial rehabilitation
  • There is a variety of work within a particular position and within the organization
  • We strive to be the best that we can be
  • We hold Exemplary Status accreditation through Accreditation Canada
  • We have won numerous awards for our innovative programming
  • We care about our employees, and believe in living our values and culture throughout the organization


***Employees of Coast must apply within seven days of the posting date with their internal account (Coast email address registered) to be considered as an internal applicant. Current Coast employees who apply to this posting using external accounts or after the 7 day deadline will be considered as external candidates. Seniority will not apply.***

Coast Mental Health is committed to creating a culture of diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion or disability.

Licenses & Certifications

Required
  • COVID: Fully Vaccinated
Preferred
  • Workplace Haz Mat Info Sy
  • First Aid
  • Criminal Records Check

title: Painter/Drywall Installer-Renovations
description:
The Byng Group is a leading interior renovation general contractor with more than 50 years' experience and a team of over 500, specializing in high-rise rental properties.

We are currently hiring Painter/drywaller installers in the Windsor area to join our growing team!

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Paint walls, ceilings, doors, hallways, shelving in Apartment Units
  • Prepares surfaces to be plastered
  • Fills in nicks and cuts in ceilings, walls, and partitions using plaster
  • Repair walls with drywall
  • Sand areas after each coat making drywall paint-ready
  • Drywall Repairs, Taping and Plastering
  • Drywall Installation is considered an asset
  • Framing with Metal Studs considered an asset

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • At least 3 years’ experience as a painter and drywaller
  • Valid Ontario Driver's License with a clean Driver’s Abstract
  • Able to problem solve on-site and off-site
  • Ability to follow and complete a daily, weekly & monthly task schedule
  • Own Tools Required. They are not supplied.

WHY CHOOSE US!

  • Annual Bonus

title: Maintenance Supervisor
description:
We are looking for a Maintenance Supervisor with a passion for positive business impact. This is a great chance to join a Top Employer and contribute to our growth and success!

Here’s what we do…

CertainTeed is a subsidiary of Saint-Gobain -- the world’s largest building materials company with a 350-year legacy of innovation and growth. Saint-Gobain group is leader in sustainable product development and environmental stewardship. We’re proud to that Saint-Gobain North America was recognized by Top Employers institute as on the best workplaces in North America & Canada.

For 113 years, CertainTeed has been synonymous with quality, trust, innovation, and service. Our team designs, manufactures and distributes materials and solutions in the construction and building materials market. CertainTeed’s broad product offering includes insulation, ceilings, roofing, siding, fence, railing, deck, exterior trim and gypsum board products. We provide comfort, performance and safety while addressing the challenges of sustainable construction, resource efficiency and climate change. Our offerings incorporate and promote the wellbeing for each of us and we are building a future where we collectively work together towards our core purpose to Make the World a Better Home.

WHAT’S THE JOB?

As a highly effective leader and subject matter expert within manufacturing, you will be responsible for directing and engaging the daily operational requirements of the unionized facility maintenance team. You will utilize your experience in process improvements to drive corporate initiatives and support Saint-Gobain’s World Class Manufacturing (WCM) model of operational excellence and continuous improvement in “Making the World a Better Home”.

  • Role model for all safety standards/processes and on the-job-behavior through living core principles and creating a positive and inclusive work environment.
  • Identify and develop individual team skills and manage performance with the highest priority placed on safe behaviors and decisions.
  • Leads team meetings & trainings, identifies safety, environmental, quality & production issues, coordinates activities with the production team to maximize productivity, minimize cost, reduce waste and as well as plant downtime.
  • Work with Maintenance Lead and Maintenance Planner personnel to ensure correct prioritization and timely completion of daily/weekly work orders.
  • Develop and implement maintenance strategies and improvement initiatives, ensuring timely completion of ‘root cause analyses and countermeasure implementation (EWO).
  • Progressively improve the professional maintenance status of all equipment on a prioritized basis using Saint-Gobain’s WCM model and practices.
  • Work with internal stakeholders to ensure spares holding is optimized and coherent with the equipment Professional Maintenance requirement.
  • Work with area performance teams on complex maintenance and/or process improvements ensuring sustainability for maintenance team.
  • Manage all external contractor requirements.
  • Maintain, use and train CMMS system.

WHAT DO YOU BRING?

Required

  • Post-Secondary education in Mechanical, Electrical or Industrial Engineering or equivalent technical diploma or red seal millwright or electrician and/or 5+ years of equivalent experience within similar type role.
  • 2+ years of experience within a supervisory role.
  • Demonstrated experience in safely leading manufacturing processes, predictive and preventative maintenance, productivity, and/or cost process improvements.
  • Experience working with CMMS systems, along with strong computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.
  • Excellent communication (written, verbal, and listening) skills.
  • Agility and willingness to effectively facilitate and encourage change management.
  • Strong independent problem-solving and organizational skills.
  • Willingness to support a 24/7 unionized, operating environment, which may include weekend and holiday support as conditions require.

Preferred

  • Prior experience in Lean Six Sigma / 5S / Kaizen / Lean Manufacturing

WHAT WE OFFER

Besides a great work culture where we work hard, while trying to have fun with various events, regular companywide activities geared towards our employees and a strong safety culture we also offer the following:

  • Excellent healthcare benefits package.
  • Family Focus & Balance: Parental leave, paid time-off and Employee Assistance Program.
  • Financial Security: Competitive RRSP, Company-funded DPSP (Deferred Profit Sharing Plan) and Employee Stock Purchase Program (PEG).
  • Volunteer Day off: Give back to the community – each employee has one paid day a year that they can use towards volunteering their time and effort with a registered charity.
  • And more!

To learn more about us visit www.certainteed.ca

We look forward to hearing from everyone but please note that due to the volume of resumes submitted, only those selected for next steps will be contacted. To stay in touch with CertainTeed, follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram.

Saint-Gobain is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process to applicants upon their request. This commitment is in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Saint-Gobain is committed to following provincially regulated guidelines.

title: General Civil-MEP Superintendent
description:
Summary

The General (Civil-MEP) Superintendent is responsible for the overall Civil and MEP (Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing) field works on a project, ensuring contract compliance in reference to all works, and ensure all works are completed with respect to safety, scheduling, budget, quality and customer satisfaction. Directing the day-to-day coordination of civil, mechanical, electrical, and plumbing trade contractors and their sub-contractors (and/or self-performed works) to ensure work meets or exceeds the contract requirements.

Responsibilities

  • Assist the Project Manager and Project Scheduler to develop project construction schedules detailing the timing of material delivery, subcontractor work schedules and overall project plans. Advise Project Manager of circumstances and issues that will have a significant impact on the project schedule.
  • Prepare and maintain reports in accordance with company policies, procedures and contract requirements that accurately describe project status. Document issues and problems that have developed and provide reasonable remedies for their resolution.
  • Verify accuracy of drawing plan measurements of floors, walls, ceilings, etc. Identify discrepancies and take corrective action with Estimating or Project Manager.
  • Schedule the routing and delivery of materials and take appropriate precautions to ensure job-site security.
  • Co-chair weekly project construction meetings with subcontractors, architects, engineers, other vendors, and owner to discuss project status. Document issues that impact the project schedule or will impact project budget and assign resolution to appropriate individuals in attendance.
  • Make active attempts to resolve labor disputes and personnel problems. Elevate unresolved issues to Project Manager when needed.
  • Establish effective working relationships with client, architects, building manager, building engineer and others. Actively enforce all building regulations regarding noise, use of elevators, security, etc.
  • Maintain adequate and competent subcontractor labor crews as approved to complete timely and quality work. Schedule and coordinate work crews consistent with project demands and schedule. Supervise work of crews to ensure work is completed as contracted with a minimal punch list. Meet daily with subcontractors to ensure daily schedules and task lists are understood.
  • Take necessary steps to maintain general conditions costs are within the budgeted amounts.
  • Review invoices from subcontractors and vendors and recommend approval or modification to Project Manager.
  • Document all field changes and “as-built conditions” on a weekly basis.
  • Assist Project Manager and/or Estimators by reviewing bid documents and estimates from a logistics, scope of items and general field perspective.
  • Review design documents, specifications, equipment submittals and shop drawings for functional capabilities, performance and monitoring capabilities and the ability of the systems to meet the design requirements.
  • Interact with installing trade contractors and witness daily construction, start-ups, contractor testing, performance testing, document/track field inspections/observations & deficiencies and related reporting.
  • Prepare and/or assist the Project Manager in the preparation of plans, schedules, and documents.
  • Preparing and executing equipment/system protocols, pre-functional and functional checklists.
  • Develop, document, and communicate the Civil and MEP work plans regarding changes made in the field, particularly regarding long-lead equipment and systems procurement and delivery.
  • Maintain a thorough understanding of contract documents to be able to plan ahead and anticipate potential problems before they arise.
  • Obtain or verify that the Contractors/subcontractors obtain all necessary permits for construction purposes.
  • Ensure the work is performed in a safe and quality manner.
  • Establish credibility among owners, trade contractors, unions etc. by maintaining a fair and trustworthy environment.
  • Lead Civil and MEP works progress/coordination meetings on a regular basis.
  • Maintain daily reports and documentation and update the project schedule, create, and implement contingency plans when necessary.
  • Communicate schedule status, updates and changes to project team and procurement/contracting plan, coordinate and manage jobsite logistics.
  • Manage the final project commissioning and ensure contract compliance of project close-out procedures.

Qualifications

  • High School Diploma or GED equivalent
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Civil, Mechanical, or other technical engineering degree) preferred.
  • 10+ years experience required.
  • International experience with USACE and/or US State Dept (OBO) required.
  • Secret Clearance

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Ability to obtain and maintain a Secret Security Clearance required
  • Strong technical and communication skills, with excellent organizational skills
  • Excellent problem solving skills and ability to adapt to changing requirements
  • Ability to work in a team environment, and collaborate on a daily basis with the project team.
  • Proficient in construction documentation and drawing literate, with knowledge of all phases of construction, divisions of work, methods, materials, scheduling, and cost control
  • Strong knowledge and appreciation of USACE EM385 construction safety processes and ability to enforce the project safety plan.
  • Experience in Civil, Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing, and Building Automation systems, as well as the Commissioning of these systems on similar/relevant projects.
  • Ability to interact with installing contractors and manage/perform field execution of commissioning documents, generate field reports, punch lists, summary reports, O&M Manuals, O&M training, etc and manage and/or prepare project closeout as per contract requirements.
  • Required to adhere to Chenega Corporation mandate that all employees must be fully vaccinated to COVID-19 by December 8, 2021.

Chenega Corporation and family of companies is an EOE.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Native preference under PL 93-638.

We participate in the E-Verify Employment Verification Program

title: Summer Student, Building Services
description:
Location

Royal Bank Building - 335 - 8th Avenue SW

Business

Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations — bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. It’s why the world’s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.

If you’re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.

Job Description

DESCRIPTION:
The successful candidate will perform maintenance duties as well learn the fundamentals of building operations and basic building services duties for the property requiring daily interaction with customers and service providers, which demands an individual that consistently demonstrates empathy and courtesy to the customers’ needs. This position at times will require some physical activity, such as lifting of boxes and completing inspections throughout the complex for various projects. Flexible hours are required in this role with occasional weekends or evenings.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Assist maintenance staff with basic maintenance (i.e. lighting, plumbing)

Maintaining and tidying mechanical and storage rooms

Assisting Building Service staff with handyman type duties such as hanging pictures, ceiling tile replacements, door repairs and fire stopping.

Moving and setting up décor, stages and other equipment.

Provide support and coverage with preventative maintenance and tenant requests.

Assist the Project Coordinator with the daily inspection of exterior building projects for safe work practices and procedures such as rooftops, swing stages and general work areas.

Assist with the daily monitoring and documentation of capital and operational projects during the summer months

Assist with the scheduling of the annual swing stage and fall protection certification.

Performing fall protection checks for proper use of fall protections of harnesses and lanyards

Accompanying the Project Coordinator on walkthroughs of completed work packages with consultants and contractors

Assisting with fire alarms.

Assisting with painting.

Embody and support Brookfield Properties’ Safety, Health and Environment Policy.

Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate hazards to reduce risk to the workplace.

Engage in training and continuing education to develop the knowledge, skills, and competencies required to work safely.

Take action to stop work if it cannot be executed safely or if conditions or behaviours are unsafe.

Immediately report SH&E incidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and/or at-risk behaviours to their supervisor; then diligently work to correct the problem.

Promote safe work practices and safe working conditions in accordance with all Brookfield Properties Safe Work Procedures.

Wear Personal Protective Equipment when required

Completion of other tasks as assigned

SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS:
This position requires an individual with superior customer service and organizational skills. The ideal candidate will also have the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.

EXPERIENCE & TECHINCAL SKILLS:
Previous experience in customer services

Experience with basic tools and equipment

Loading dock experience is an asset

Working knowledge of lighting systems and re-lamping procedures

Previous experience cleaning and maintaining equipment

General cleaning duties

Previous painting skills is an asset

Familiar with computers/Samsung

EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES:
Enrolled in the 5th or 4th Class Power Engineering Technology program or a relevant program such as Carpenter, Electrician, Millwright, Plumbing, Welder

Strong written and verbal communications skills

We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are grateful for your interest in this position, however, only candidates selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

title: Caretaker/Maintenance
description:
Caretaker for Medium Rise Residential Building

Burnaby, BC

Job Type: Private Contractor, Full-time, Permanent (with 3 months of probation)

General Overview:

Caretaker will clean and maintain the interior and exterior of our residential building and the surrounding grounds. Minor onsite repairs as needed.

Responsibilities:

  • Daily physical inspections of the property and undertake basic maintenance repair duties
  • Reporting any unusual extraordinary circumstances regarding the residents or the property.
  • Operate vacuum cleaners to remove scraps, dirt, debris and other refuse
  • Clean main floor windows, interior walls and ceilings.
  • Empty trash bins, cans and other waste containers
  • Sweep, mop, scrub hallways, floors and stairs interior and exterior
  • Clean snow and ice from walkways and parking areas
  • Clean and disinfect washrooms and fixtures
  • Make adjustments and minor repairs to heating, cooling, ventilating, plumbing and electrical systems
  • Perform other routine maintenance jobs such as painting and drywall repair
  • Dealing with any contractors/trades people onsite including ensuring that all contractors abide by the rules set out for the contractor and trades people when working in the building.
  • Maintaining an adequate supply and inventory of any lighting requirements, cleaning/pool products, etc.
  • Daily recycling, garbage, cardboard tidy up/disposal.
  • Janitorial duties.
  • To ensure that all residents have safe and clean buildings to reside in.

Certificate in one or more of the trades may be required: Pool maintenance and care

Requirements

  • 3+ years’ experience as Building Caretaker of a multi-family community is preferred
  • High school diploma
  • Written and oral communication skills in English.
  • Building Maintenance experience is preferred.
  • Own tools are preferred.

Please send your resume. Qualified individuals will be contacted.

Thank you for your interest.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: to be negotiated as a contractor. Pay commensurate with experience.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

COVID-19 considerations:
Interviews conducted with health and safety precautions as advised

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Burnaby, BC V5H 3Y8: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Residential Caretaking: 3 years (required)

Language:

  • English (preferred)

title: Housekeeper / Cleaner (88550011)
description:
Company Description


Looking for a change, an opportunity to grow your skills, a chance to work with a team that is passionate about providing a great patient experience? Grow your career with us at Sodexo!

Do you enjoy cleaning? Get in to Health Care NOW!

Our Healthcare Division has an exciting opportunity to join the Sodexo team at Ridge Meadows Hospital as a Housekeeper! We are looking for 3 individuals to work Full time, Part-time, or as a Casual. Full time and part time will be eligible for benefits. We have shifts in the morning, afternoon, and overnight (graveyard).

All employees are members of the United Steelworkers Union. We have a wide array of hours and days of the week available, including graveyard shifts. We are a 24/7 operation. Hourly rate is $17.15 per hour.

Contributing to The Well-Being and Quality of Our Consumers

The well-being of our consumers is at the heart of Sodexo's approach, customer engagement is integral in the services provided by Sodexo employees in various locations across Canada. We work closely with our consumers and clients to create an interactive and personalized environment for the well-being of everyone we serve.

Sodexo is proud to announce these nominations: 2021 Canada’s Best Diversity Employer; 2021 Canada’s Greenest Employers; 2020 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index featured company; 2020 Parity Certification - Platinum level and Progressive Aboriginal Relations (PAR) Program company – Gold Level.

What We Can Offer You

Sodexo offers you a flexible and dynamic work environment, competitive compensation, access to ongoing training and development programs, and countless opportunities to grow within the company.


Job Description


How You will Make an Impact:
As a member of our housekeeping team, you will always provide the highest quality of customer service, while maintaining the premises in a clean and orderly manner, including:

  • Daily & discharge cleaning patient rooms, offices, common areas, washrooms, halls, food service areas, and any other areas that may require attention
  • Stripping and cleaning beds, collecting linen
  • Cleaning desks, ceilings and vents, walls, blinds, kitchenettes, microwaves, washrooms, furniture, windows, floors and carpets
  • Dusting, mopping, vacuuming, sweeping, polishing floors and replenishing supplies
  • Emptying trash and waste containers

Qualifications


What You'll Need to Succeed:

  • Strong attendance
  • Ability to use tools and equipment and to perform the physical aspects of the job including:
  • Lift and handling up to 40lbs
  • Prolonged walking and standing and bending
  • Demonstrated exceptional customer service skills; willingness to go beyond.
  • Ability to work under supervision and follow procedures, and compliance with all health and safety standards
  • Personal and professional integrity, appearance, and demeanor
  • Applicants will be required to complete Criminal Record Check and specified immunizations as a condition of employment.
  • Sodexo is committed to providing a safe and healthy working environment for our team members, customers, clients, contractors, business partners, guests and members of the public with whom we regularly interact. As a provider of services in many client locations, including hospitals, long term care facilities, and senior homes, we require that all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

What's Next?

If you're looking for a role where you can truly impact the lives of others, click "I'm interested" for a quick 5-minute online application.


Additional Information


Sodexo is committed to Employment Equity and Diversity. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of national origin, race, religion, ethnicity, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other federal, provincial, or local protected class.

We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates who participate in all aspects of the selection process. We use the masculine gender to lighten the text.

Thank you for your interest in Sodexo.

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.

Follow us on social media to see first-hand what we are all about!

Instagram: @SodexoCanadaCareers

Twitter: @SodexoJobsCA

LinkedIn: Sodexo Canada Careers

Facebook: Sodexo CA Jobs

title: Operations Supervisor - Pine Centre Mall
description:
WHO YOU ARE

Pine Centre is looking for a personable, driven and detail-oriented individual to fill the Operations Supervisor role. The ideal candidate will come with skills in building maintenance, have a desire to learn, grow and excel in a dynamic fast paced team environment. This role will evolve with the individual to support the Operations Manager and Maintenance team of the centre. The Pine Centre team offers a unique blend of passion, determination and drives change all while creating a fun team positive environment.

PURPOSE

The Supervisor, Operations is accountable to Manager, Operations or Building Manager for supervision and coordination of all daily activities related to timely and cost-efficient maintenance of the building equipment and ground keeping of the site. The Supervisor, Operations plays a key role in ensuring that high-standard and timely tenant repairs and service requests are carried out to assist in maintaining effective long-term relationships with the tenants and contribute to tenant retention at the property.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Building Operations
Supervises, inspects and performs, where required, maintenance programs of all building and site equipment (incl. fire, life, safety and emergency systems, HVAC, electrical, security and video surveillance systems and ground-keeping equipment) and programs to ensure the property adheres to the existing company policies & procedures.

2. General Maintenance

Oversees and performs minor repairs and installations pertaining to non-structural and non-vital systems of the property (incl. plumbing, light fixture replacement, touch up painting, asphalt patching, installation and repair of ceramic tiles, replacement of ceiling tiles and carpeting, interior and exterior plastering, dry-walling, minor carpentry, common area door repairs, installation and maintenance of directional signage); Inspects all maintenance repair logs for the property to ensure uninterrupted operation of non-vital building systems.

3. Tenant Services
Supervises and performs, where required, tenant repairs and service requests to ensure that effective long-term tenant relationships are built and a consistent high-level of service is provided to the tenants at all times.

4. Environmental, Health and Safety
Oversees adherence to the company’s environmental and Health & Safety policies, coordinates and participates in investigation of Environmental and Health and Safety incidents, supervises implementation of effective energy management programs, coordinates parking access control systems and operations of security contractor.

5. Tenant Coordination
Supports property management in all project-related activities including coordination of Tenant Improvement works (in consultation with tenant coordination department) and preparation of tenant/building statistics and reporting.

6. Contract Tendering and Payables
Initiates and supports property management in Requests for Proposal for third-party service contracts, processes Purchase Orders and payments against third-party invoices pertaining to building maintenance.

7. Budgeting and Reforecasting
Participates and provides input into periodic budgeting for recoverable operating expenses as well as forecasting activities, where required.

Any other job related duties and/or projects that may be assigned.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Skills, Knowledge, Experience and Education

  • Minimum 2 years of relevant work experience
  • Solid understanding of Business Automation Systems and other operating systems of a property
  • Working knowledge of MS Office, iOS and operations specific software

Core Competencies

  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Strong communication skills
  • Strong team building skills

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Trade Certificate or a Certification in one of the core building operations systems (e.g. HVAC, Boiler etc.) an asset
  • Solid knowledge of WHMIS requirements is an asset
  • Experience with HVAC systems is an asset
  • Previous experience instructing/training staff is an asset
  • Valid Driver’s License is an asset


Morguard is a fully integrated real estate company. We own, manage and invest in high-quality, well-located, geographically diversified assets across North America. We have built our business with strong leadership and a proven management platform that have generated substantial, risk-adjusted returns – and significant long-term growth. With more than 40 years of experience and a dynamic team of 1,500 professionals, our commitment is to realize the potential of real estate through value creation and operational excellence.

We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources at hrassist@morguard.com or 905 281-5967.

***Subject to legally permissible exceptions or accommodation requests, Morguard requires that all new hires be fully vaccinated, as defined by Public Health, for COVID-19 on their first day of the assignment. Unless a valid Human Rights exemption applies, the vaccine requirement will be a condition of employment with Morguard and you will be required to submit your documented proof of vaccination. Should you require an accommodation as set out by the Human Rights Code , please notify our Human Resources Department at HRAssist@morguard.com , 905-281-5967.***

title: Forklift Operator
description:
Patene Building Supplies Limited is a distributor of drywall, steel framing components, insulation, acoustic ceilings, shingles and other building materials for the residential and commercial construction industries. We have fourteen (14) branch locations throughout Ontario & Manitoba to serve our customer base of contractors, builders and retail customers.

We are currently seeking a Forklift Operator for our London branch.

Responsibilities:

  • Daily circle check reports and upkeep of company equipment, including general maintenance
  • Load/unload trucks for deliveries and outside carriers/transfer trucks
  • Receive materials, assist on deliveries when required
  • Report damaged or missing materials or equipment
  • Assist with inventory counts and general housekeeping of yard and warehouse
  • Adhere and follow company’s Health & Safety policies and regulations
  • Provide professional and courteous service to customers and sub trades
  • Work in adverse weather conditions both indoors and outdoors with the ability to lift 70 lbs. plus
  • Perform other duties as assigned by management

Job Requirements:

  • High School diploma
  • General forklift certification
  • Driver's License G/G2
  • 1-3 years related experience, preferably in the construction industry
  • Must be dependable and a team player
  • Ability to communicate with co-workers, vendors and customers (verbal and written)

This position offers competitive wages, health, dental, life insurance and an RRSP plan upon completion of the applicable waiting periods.

We invite qualified candidates to apply online.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Forklift: 1 year (preferred)
