title: Intermediate Interior Designer (FT)
description:
Role Description:
We are seeking an Intermediate Interior Designer with a minimum of 3 – 5 years’ experience in applying their creative talents in an interior design studio, with a focus on custom private residences, large-scale condominium developments, boutique retail and hospitality.

Key Accountabilities:
  • Comprehensive knowledge in project delivery from programming & schematic design, conceptual developments & producing detailed working drawings.
  • Ability to manage & coordinate with clients and other professional consultants, but not limited to contractors, architects, engineers, suppliers & trades to ensure project success.
  • Solid understanding of the Ontario Building Code.
  • Able to interpret & prioritize project scheduling, deadlines & responsibilities.
  • Take responsibility for the development of the design & the project with input from the Principal Designer & Senior Designer.
  • Prepare & develop with the team, the required drawings, models, images, material & concept boards & other documents relating to the design.
  • Aptitude for anticipating, identifying & arriving at creative solutions.
  • Able to work well under pressure & meet deadlines efficiently.
  • Able to take initiative in response to direction or instruction.
Candidate Requirements & Skills:
  • Must be located within the GTA, or be able to reliably commute to the studio.
  • Advanced AutoCAD and SketchUp Skills.
  • Familiarity with Adobe Suites (InDesign, Illustrator & Photoshop).
  • Advanced MS Office Application Skills.
  • Experience working with millwork / shop drawings, lighting & ceiling plans, electrical plans, product & material specifications.
  • Use of Harvest, an asset.
  • Analytical Skills.
  • Organizational Skills.
  • Capability to manage & meet deadlines.
  • Advanced written & verbal communication skills.
  • Motivated & self-directed.
  • Confident & comfortable working independently & with others.
Experience Requirements:
  • 3 – 5 years in custom private residential design, condo development design, retail & hospitality design.
Education & Training Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Interior Design.
Please attach a portfolio of your previous work along with your application.


About Create Design & CO.:

Create Design & CO. was incorporated in 2015 with every intention to leave a fingerprint in the design industry. We are proud of our hands-on, imaginative, and collaborative approach to transform our client’s dream into a reality. Our designers are committed to forming meaningful, functional spaces that are designed to create an experience and evoke an emotion. Our visual edge in concept, floorplan, brand development as well as technical skills in working drawings and planning our projects through to construction - makes us a complete full-service boutique design studio. Our ever-growing minds, constantly developing style and enthusiasm to provide professional quality service has earned acclaim for developers, residential, commercial, retail and boutique projects.

title: Instructor - Renovations and Construction Program
description:
CIMT College is looking for a dynamic instructor for its Renovation and Construction Technician program that can provide theoretical as well practical learning to the students.

Duties and Responsibilities :

  • Demonstrate a thorough and accurate knowledge of the field
  • Instruct curriculum using only pre-authorized and provided materials
  • Teach students using a diverse and systematic plan of lectures, presentations, demonstrations, discussion groups, laboratory work, case studies, independent or group projects
  • Employ appropriate adult teaching and learning strategies to communicate the subject matter to diverse students
  • Administer and marks quizzes, assignments, exams and/or other assessments to monitor and evaluate students’ progress according to guidelines and procedures
  • Evaluate student performance fairly and consistently and return student marks promptly
  • Provide feedback on student performance
  • Arrange feedback from students on the instructor, content, and facility at the end of each course
  • Demonstrate sensitivity to student needs and individual circumstances in a multi-cultural environment
  • Resolve student complaints and concerns with a positive and professional attitude
  • Maintain attendance records accurately
  • Assure that classrooms are left in a clean and orderly fashion at end of class without loss of or damage to equipment or other resources
  • Provide support to the admissions team with potential students who have questions about the program or future career
  • Participate in scheduled meetings and annual events like graduation
  • Maintain confidentiality of student privacy and information
  • Stay current in the subject matter through professional development
  • Display an attitude of teamwork and problem solving
  • Perform other related duties as required

Skills Required:

  • Knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and database systems
  • Excellent oral and written communication to present information in a way that students will understand as well as adapt to the different learning styles
  • Professional business attire and interpersonal skills to act as a mentor and role model
  • Online teaching (training provided, but computer skills are essential)

Qualifications:

  • Have 48 months of work experience in the vocation/field OR
  • Have 36 months of teaching experience in the vocation and 24 months of work experience in the vocation OR
  • Have 24 months of work experience in the vocation AND

o Hold a Bachelor degree from a Canadian university or an equivalent degree
o Graduate of a College of Applied Arts and Technology or equivalent
o Graduate of a registered PCC or equivalent

  • AEC/DEP or Skilled Trades Certificate (Preferred)

Industry Experience:

Suitable candidate must possess 3-5 years on industry experience. Should have working knowledge of some or all of the following courses that comprise the Renovation and Construction program-

  • Foundations - Choosing the correct foundation, either concrete or wood, and in the concepts and process of building a foundation. Students are introduced to the required tools for foundation construction. They learn about minor repairs and upgrades to foundations, as well as how to replace a shallow foundation. Students also learn about damp basement solutions.
  • Blueprints and Building Codes – Architectural and blueprint reading from the perspective of someone who will need rudimentary skills for construction and renovation in order to find and understand critical information on blueprints. Students learn about sheet sizes, tile blocks and borders, as well as the importance of lettering, abbreviations, and symbols on architectural drawings. Students also learn about architectural scales and notations, as well as the proper techniques for folding and storing blueprints.
  • AutoCAD Level 1 – The basics of AutoCAD so that students can use it in a productive manner as it pertains to renovation and construction. Students learn to switch between Classic and Drafting and Annotation workspaces, and well as modelspace and paperspace. Students will learn to work with basic draw commands, add layers, text and text styles, colours, linetypes, and lineweights. Students will learn to set up a basic layout with a properly scaled viewpoint, and plot the layout accordingly.
  • Tools and Shop Equipment – Learn how to use and maintain hand tools like handsaws, hammers, abrading tools (sandpaper, rasps), dismantling tools (nail pullers, wrecking bars), and chisels. Students next learn about portable power tools, like screw and nail guns, abrading tools (grinders and sanders), planning tools, and routers. Students learn about stationary power tools like table saws, chop saws, miter saws, drilling and boring tools. Students also learn about explosive actuated tools, as well as how to choose, clean, and maintain, all of the tools in the course.
  • Project Management for Construction - Introduction to project management specifically as it pertains to construction and renovation. Students learn about building a project plan and the project management process. They learn about budgeting and estimating to keep within the project’s triple constraints. Students learn about various stakeholders for a project, about leadership, and meeting effectiveness.
  • Framing and Rough Carpentry– Learn the difference between wood and metal frames and their characteristics, pros and cons. They learn to select proper framing lumber or materials, and how to use framing tools like nail guns, with safety. Students learn the Framing Square, and how to calculate and cut angles for wood frames and metal frames. Students also learn how to design, lay out, and build stairs and rafters.
  • Finished Carpentry- Learn about measuring and layout, in addition to cutting, shaping, sanding, nailing and drilling. Students explore the materials required and learn the basic skills to do finished carpentry on the job. They additionally learn about door and window casings, as well as baseboard and crown molding.
  • Drywall and Painting – Drywalling, various tools and types, and the materials required. Students learn how to drywall over plaster, how to tape, and how to properly do three coats with sanding. Students learn about soundproofing, choosing paint, and all of the supplies and tools required to properly paint.
  • Ceiling Systems – Introduces students to various types of ceilings which are used for renovation and construction. Students learn about leveling and using a laser level, and how to install ceiling boxes and fixtures. Students also learn about issues with ceiling systems, including weight concerns for building codes and safety, dealing with rot, and insect infestations. Students also learn how to cut holes for fixtures, and how to prepare, paint, and finish a ceiling for a professional look.
  • Flooring – Learn various types of flooring, including hardwood, laminate, ceramic, and carpeting. Students learn to choose the proper tools and prepare the floor surface. They next learn the skills of laying out a floor, including design options, horizontal, vertical, diagonal, and even custom designs. They explore cutting techniques as well as installation and fastening methods. For tiling, they also learn how to lay a heated floor, wall tiles, and grouting and sealing methods.
  • Introduction to Electrical – Introduction to Canadian Electrical codes and municipal codes, and students learn what they can and cannot do without a licensed electrician. They learn the theory of electricity, voltage and AC/DC Currents, power factors, and the dangers involved with electricity. Students learn to install a receptacle, install a switch, calculate, measure, and run a line of electrical wire. They also learn about fuses and breakers. Students do not become "electricians."
  • Introduction to Plumbing – Introduction to Ontario Plumbing Codes, and students learn what they can and cannot do without a licensed plumber. They learn the theory of plumbing, water factors, and the dangers involved with water. Students learn to install a copper pipe, work with ABS, test drains, and install, repair, and maintain domestic, commercial, and industrial fixtures. Students also learn to measure, cut, bend, and thread pipes, and well as join pipes using clamps, cement, and soldering. Students do not become "licensed plumbers."
  • Introduction to HVAC – Introduction to Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning, commonly referred to as HVAC. Students learn what they can and cannot do without an HVAC Contractor. HVAC must be considered as part of any construction plan, so students learn the basics about HVAC systems which control the ambient environment, including temperature, humidity, air flow, and air filtering. Students are taught about the necessary tools, materials, testing instruments, and service equipment for HVAC basics. Students do not become "HVAC Technicians."
  • Build a House – This course gives students the hands-on-learning experience of building the interior structure of a multi-room home. Depending on the number of students in the class, students will build a 2, 3, or 4 room house interior. All of the theoretical training from the first four months of the program is implemented at every stage as students build a house using input from their own blueprint design, from conception to costing, to material purchasing, to layout, to construction, to flooring and ceiling systems, to trim, painting and finishing. Students also learn about demolition and how to salvage old materials to reduce costs on projects.Job Duties

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

title: Drywall Finisher/painter
company: Handyman Connection of Metro Vancouver, BC
description:
To meet the demands of our rapidly growing base of satisfied customers, Handyman Connection of Metro Vancouver, BC is seeking an experienced Drywall Finisher. This skilled craftsman would ideally have a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business. Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work. Our customers love us! We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!


What You Will Receive
  • Receiving constant leads that can be scheduled based on your availability
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers

Responsibilities


The Drywall Finisher performs and coordinates the cutting, taping, sanding and installation of drywall during the construction, remodeling or repair in a residential and light commercial setting. The candidate must be proficient working with all drywall hand tools, mechanical tools required to complete their work. You must have experience as a Drywall Finisher, and you must have a positive attitude.


  • Ability to texture and refinish plaster services

  • Ability and willing to work on new walls and ceilings, and repair existing walls.

  • Ability to determine and clearly identify proper materials and material quantities for new and existing projects.

  • Evaluate customer requests, price projects, troubleshoot customer issues, and present a description of a work order to a customer.


Requirements


  • Must have current Driver's License and submit to a background check

  • Must have tools, vehicle and good references

  • Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades

  • Independent Contractors must carry liability insurance and workers comp

  • Must pass screening process

  • Must have a smart phone and access to the internet


Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.

Check out our website at: www.handymanconnection.com

title: Custodian
description:
Our Mission

The North Shore Neighbourhood House mission is to work together to enhance the lives of our neighbours, especially the most vulnerable.

Our Vision

North Shore Neighbourhood House strives to build a safe, healthy and strong community, welcoming all ages, abilities and cultures – one where everyone has access to support, everyone is included, and where everyone matters.

Nature and Scope of Work

This is manual work of limited complexity in performing recurrent and defined janitorial and custodial duties at the various North Shore Neighbourhood House Centres. The work may include the minor maintenance of heating and ventilation equipment; simple repairs, the securing of the building and activating of the alarm system. Duties are performed to an established schedule and latitude of judgment is used to alter the schedule as required, to ensure that priority areas are cleaned. The work is regularly reviewed to ensure conformity with the established standard of cleanliness.

Illustrative Examples of Work

Performs a variety of cleaning duties such as:

Sweeping, mopping, washing, waxing, stripping and polishing floors, hallways and stairs; washing walls, counters and windows, washing hand basins, sinks and toilets, replenishing supplies; vacuuming and shampooing rugs; garbage disposal.

Performs a variety of building maintenance tasks such as;

Replacing locks, door closures and windows; plumbing disorders; replacing lights and fixtures; painting; minor repairs to furniture, equipment, shelving and cupboards; minor repairs to walls, ceilings and flooring; general maintenance to equipment.

Secures the building and activates the alarm system.

Sets up tables and chairs for scheduled events; moves or provides furniture or equipment; locks and unlocks doors as well as providing assistance to members of the public.

Resets fire alarms and pull stations.

Checks, cleans and maintains grounds and yard.

Performs minor, routine servicing to heating and ventilation systems as directed.

Maintains written cleaning schedule.

In consultations with supervisor, provides on-site assistance to contractors or City employees doing work with the North Shore Neighbourhood House.

Performs related work as required.

Required Knowledge, Abilities & Skills

Sound knowledge of methods, materials and equipment used in providing janitorial services.

Ability to understand and carry out written and oral instructions.

Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with patrons, staff and members of the public.

Sufficient strength and stamina to perform the duties.

Desirable Training and Experience

Completion of Grade 10, ability to read, write, understand and follow instructions; completion of a B.S.W. course plus experience in janitorial and custodial work, or related work; or, a suitable combination of training and experience.

Required Licenses, Certificates and Registrations

Valid B.C. Driver’s License

Emergency First Aid Certificate

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.20 per hour

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
All staff are required to be vacinated for COVID-19.

title: plasterer
description:
Additional Skills

  • Work at heights, on scaffolding or swing stages
  • Read and interpret blueprints, maps, drawings and specifications

Work Setting

  • Residential
  • Commercial

Own Tools/Equipment

  • Steel-toed safety boots
  • Hard hat

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities

  • Repetitive tasks
  • Handling heavy loads
  • Physically demanding
  • Manual dexterity
  • Standing for extended periods
  • Bending, crouching, kneeling

Work Location Information

  • Various locations

Personal Suitability

  • Flexibility

  • Dependability

Plasterer Specific Skills

title: Maintenance Manager
description:
We are looking for a Maintenance Manager with a passion for positive business impact to join our Redcliff, AB Fiberglass Insulation Manufacturing Plant!

This is a great chance to join a Top Employer and contribute to our growth and success!

Here’s what we do…

CertainTeed is a subsidiary of Saint-Gobain -- the world’s largest building materials company with a 350-year legacy of innovation and growth. Saint-Gobain group is leader in sustainable product development and environmental stewardship. We’re proud to that Saint-Gobain North America was recognized by Top Employers institute as on the best workplaces in North America & Canada.

For 113 years, CertainTeed has been synonymous with quality, trust, innovation, and service. Our team designs, manufactures and distributes materials and solutions in the construction and building materials market. CertainTeed’s broad product offering includes insulation, ceilings, roofing, siding, fence, railing, deck, exterior trim and gypsum board products. We provide comfort, performance and safety while addressing the challenges of sustainable construction, resource efficiency and climate change. Our offerings incorporate and promote the wellbeing for each of us and we are building a future where we collectively work together towards our core purpose to Make the World a Better Home.

What’s the job?

As a highly effective leader and subject matter expert within manufacturing, you will be responsible for directing and engaging the daily operational requirements of the unionized facility maintenance team. You will utilize your experience in process improvements to drive corporate initiatives and support Saint-Gobain’s World Class Manufacturing (WCM) model of operational excellence and continuous improvement in “Making the World a Better Home”. You will also:

  • Role model for all safety standards/processes and on the-job-behavior through living core principles and creating a positive and inclusive work environment.
  • Identify and develop individual team skills and manage performance with the highest priority placed on safe behaviors and decisions.
  • Lead team meetings & trainings, identify safety, environmental, quality & production issues, and coordinate activities with the production team to maximize productivity, minimize cost, reduce waste and plant downtime.
  • Oversees the Lead Hand, Maintenance Planner, MRO, and Electrical Department to ensure correct prioritization and timely completion of daily/weekly work orders.
  • Develop and implement maintenance strategies and improvement initiatives, ensuring timely completion of ‘root cause’ analyses and countermeasure implementation (EWO).
  • Progressively improve the professional maintenance status of all equipment on a prioritized basis using Saint-Gobain’s WCM model and practices.
  • Work with area performance teams on complex maintenance and/or process improvements ensuring sustainability for maintenance team.
  • Manage all external contractor requirements.
  • Maintain, use and train SAP system.

What do you bring?

Required

  • Post-Secondary education in Mechanical, or Industrial Engineering and/or 5+ years of equivalent experience within similar type role.
  • 2+ years of experience within a supervisory role.
  • Demonstrated experience in safely leading manufacturing processes, predictive and preventative maintenance, productivity, and/or cost process improvements.
  • Experience working with CMMS systems and MS Office.
  • Excellent communication skills (written, verbal, and active listening).
  • Agility and willingness to effectively facilitate and encourage change management.
  • Strong independent problem-solving and organizational skills.
  • Willingness to support a 24/7 unionized, operating environment, which will include weekend, holiday and on-call support as conditions require.

Preferred

  • Prior experience in Lean Six Sigma / 5S / Kaizen / Lean Manufacturing

What we offer…

We provide unique options to fit your unique lives! Our Total Rewards Program is customizable to accommodate your needs. Our menu of flexible options includes, but is not limited to:

  • Hybrid work environment.
  • Excellent healthcare benefits package.
  • Family Focus & Balance: Parental leave, paid time-off and Employee Assistance Program.
  • Financial Security: Competitive RRSP, Company-funded DPSP (Deferred Profit-Sharing Plan) and Employee Stock Purchase Program (PEG).
  • Volunteer Day off: Give back to the community – each employee has one paid day a year that they can use towards volunteering their time and effort with a registered charity.
  • LiveWell Program: Rewarding you for living a healthy lifestyle.
  • And more!

Why work with us?

At Saint-Gobain, our employees have pride in belonging to an organization whose culture is made up of these core values: Trust, Empowerment, & Collaboration. Our company encourages diversity and inclusion in all its forms while our products make the world a more beautiful, safer, and sustainable home.

To learn more about us visit www.certainteed.ca

We look forward to hearing from everyone but please note that due to the volume of resumes submitted, only those selected for next steps will be contacted. To stay in touch with CertainTeed, follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

COVID-19 considerations:
The Company is committed to following all Provincial and Local Health Unit recommendations.

title: Intermediate Network Administrator
description:
Excellence. Integrity. Passion.

BURNCO is looking to immediately hire a talented Intermediate Network Administrator to join our Information Technology team. Located in our Calgary Head Office*, as the successful candidate you will report directly to the Infrastructure Operations Lead. As our Network Administrator you will assist in the organization and management of the overall network, ensuring the stable operations of BURNCO’s network and telecom environment. The BURNCO Network Administrator shares responsibility for the operational support of our network and telecommunications infrastructure – LANs and WANs, including both wired and wireless. This work covers any changes to the network including equipment installation, software upgrades and patching in a manner that minimizes the disruption of business operations. In an unplanned outage, it will be crucial that you respond rapidly to diagnose, execute repairs and shorten downtime. In addition to these overall responsibilities, here’s:

What You Will Be Doing

Strategy & Planning

  • Assist leadership in the design and implementation surrounding short- and long-term strategic plans to ensure infrastructure capacity meets existing and future requirements (including disaster recovery and back up strategies)
  • Maintain policies, procedures, and associated training plans for network/telecom architecture and IT operations

Administration & Deployment

  • Prepare work reports and other documentation for operational and project related efforts Work with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors to secure IT operational products and services
  • Install, configure, maintain, and troubleshoot networking hardware, software, and communication peripherals

Operational Management

  • Assist in day-to-day operations of the network infrastructure
  • Participate in troubleshooting network outages or performance issues
  • Determine cause of high priority incidents to ensure they are prevented from happening in the future
  • Resolve incidents and trouble tickets as per established service levels
  • Install and configure network equipment and maintain network connectivity
  • Practice network, UPS and communications asset management, including maintenance of component inventory and related documentation and technical specifications information
  • Execute network security measures as directed by security and senior staff and monitor for threats
  • Perform technical administration of the Cisco Unified Communications environment
  • Works closely with Senior Network Team members to propose improvements to the network infrastructure and executes various projects to improve network service availability
  • Establish and maintain regular written and in-person communications with the BURNCO IT team, decision-makers, and end users regarding pertinent technology activities
  • Track, analyze and report on trends in network/telecom requests
  • Assist in the development and dissemination of usage guides, and FAQ lists for end users
  • Participate in change management reviews and advisory

Reality of the Job

  • On-call availability required
  • Frequent travel to multiple BURNCO sites required (vehicle provided)
  • Routine inspection of devices, systems and cables in floors and ceilings
  • Excellent hands/fingers dexterity to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, power tools, and handling other computer components
  • Lifting and transporting of moderately heavy objects, such as switches, UPS and peripherals

You Are Someone Who Is/Has

  • Highly self-motivated, with a sharp attention to detail and a dedication to organization
  • Willingly accepts direction to adapt role to organization or team changes
  • Strong understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on and adept at listening and questioning skills
  • Ability to absorb and retain information quickly
  • Strong documentation skills, including exceptional written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
  • Exceptional customer service orientation
  • Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language to non-technical staff and end users
  • Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities

Requirements

What We Would Like From You

Knowledge & Experience

  • Network operations, and network performance analysis skills
  • Hands-on technical troubleshooting capabilities
  • Ability to work independently under minimal supervision
  • Critical thinking and problem-solving mind set
  • Ability and authorization to travel within Canada & US may be required at times
  • After hours/on call/change activity required at times
  • Proven success in contributing to a team-oriented environment
  • Knowledge of IT access controls and change management processes
  • Some experience with IoT equipment would be an asset

Qualifications

  • Technical Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Prior experience in a network administration role is preferred
  • Familiarity with network management and monitoring tools
  • Previous experience with Cisco routers and switches preferred
  • Previous experience with Cisco Meraki Wireless preferred
  • Previous experience with Palo Alto Firewalls preferred
  • Cisco/Palo Alto Networks certification(s) a plus
  • ITIL certification a plus
  • Must have and maintain a valid class 5 Driver's License
  • Must provide a Driver's Abstract for review if required
  • Must provide a valid Canadian passport if required (10% travel to US)

IMPORTANT: Applicant selected for hire will be required to complete a background check (which includes references & credential verifications). Candidate hired will also be subject to BURNCO's Canadian COVID vaccination policy that may be in effect at the time.

Posting Open Until Filled

  • The BURNCO Calgary Head Office will be moving to its new more convenient location at the corner of 50th Avenue and 11th Street NE in April 2022.

Since 1912, BURNCO has been supplying aggregate construction materials as a successful, family-run business based in Calgary. Over the last 110 years we have embraced innovative technology and new marketplaces while always maintaining the vision and values that were first introduced by our founder, James F. Burns.


Benefits

COMPETITIVE SALARIES

At BURNCO, we believe in paying people what they’re worth. To ensure our pay levels are competitive, we participate in comparative salary surveys and analysis.

PERFORMANCE-BASED INCENTIVE PROGRAM

BURNCO has a performance-based culture where compensation increases are linked to performance from an individual contribution and overall company measure.

KEEPING YOU AND YOUR FAMILY HEALTHY – BURNCO HAS GREAT HEALTH BENEFITS

BURNCO offers and extensive employee benefits package including: Health and Dental Care, Vision, Life Insurance and a Retirement Savings Plan.

BURNCO Retirement Plan

BURNCO wants to assist employees in preparing for life after work through our excellent group retirement plans - either an RRSP Plan in Canada or our 401k Plan in the US - employee’s may contribute an approved amount to their Plan and BURNCO provides a matching contribution.

title: Housekeeper (88550015)
description:
Company Description


Looking for a change, an opportunity to show your exceptional skills, a chance to help lead and build a team? Grow your career with a company that shares your passion!

Do you enjoy cleaning? Get in to Health Care NOW!

Grow your career with a company that shares your passion! Our Healthcare Division has an exciting opportunity to join the Sodexo team at Delta Hospital as a Housekeeper! We are looking for 2 individuals to work as a Part-time float. Guaranteed at least 20 hours per week and benefits-eligible.

All employees are members of the Hospital Employees Union. We have a wide array of hours and days of the week available, including graveyard shifts. Must be available for 7AM - 3 PM shifts, and 3 PM - 11 PM shifts, including on weekends. We are a 24/7 operation. Hourly rate is $17.15 per hour.

Contributing to The Well-Being and Quality of Our Consumers

The well-being of our consumers is at the heart of Sodexo's approach, customer engagement is integral in the services provided by Sodexo employees in various locations across Canada. We work closely with our consumers and clients to create an interactive and personalized environment for the well-being of everyone we serve.

Sodexo is proud to announce these nominations: 2021 Canada’s Best Diversity Employer; 2021 Canada’s Greenest Employers; 2020 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index featured company; 2020 Parity Certification - Platinum level and Progressive Aboriginal Relations (PAR) Program company – Gold Level.

What We Can Offer You

Sodexo offers you a flexible and dynamic work environment, competitive compensation, access to ongoing training and development programs, and countless opportunities to grow within the company.


Job Description


How You will Make an Impact:
As a member of our housekeeping team, you will always provide the highest quality of customer service, while maintaining the premises in a clean and orderly manner, including:

  • Daily & discharge cleaning patient rooms, offices, common areas, washrooms, halls, food service areas, and any other areas that may require attention
  • Stripping and cleaning beds, collecting linen
  • Cleaning desks, ceilings and vents, walls, blinds, kitchenettes, microwaves, washrooms, furniture, windows, floors and carpets
  • Dusting, mopping, vacuuming, sweeping, polishing floors and replenishing supplies
  • Emptying trash and waste containers

Qualifications


What You'll Need to Succeed:

  • Strong attendance
  • Ability to use tools and equipment and to perform the physical aspects of the job including:
  • Lift and handling up to 40lbs
  • Prolonged walking and standing and bending
  • Demonstrated exceptional customer service skills; willingness to go beyond.
  • Ability to work under supervision and follow procedures, and compliance with all health and safety standards
  • Personal and professional integrity, appearance, and demeanor
  • Applicants will be required to complete Criminal Record Check and specified immunizations as a condition of employment.
  • Sodexo is committed to providing a safe and healthy working environment for our team members, customers, clients, contractors, business partners, guests and members of the public with whom we regularly interact. As a provider of services in many client locations, including hospitals, long term care facilities, and senior homes, we require that all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

What's Next?

  • If you're looking for a role where you can truly impact the lives of others, click "I'm interested" for a quick 5-minute online application.


Additional Information


Sodexo is committed to Employment Equity and Diversity. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of national origin, race, religion, ethnicity, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other federal, provincial, or local protected class.

We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates who participate in all aspects of the selection process. We use the masculine gender to lighten the text.

Thank you for your interest in Sodexo.

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Housekeeper_BC Healthcare
description:
Company Description


Sodexo is committed to providing a safe and healthy working environment for our team members, customers, clients, contractors, business partners, guests and members of the public with whom we regularly interact. As a provider of services in many client locations, including hospitals, long term care facilities, and senior homes, we require that all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Recognized as a strategic partner, Sodexo is the global leader in services that improve Quality of Life, an essential factor in individual and organizational performance. Operating in 80 countries, Sodexo serves 75 million consumers each day through its unique combination of On-site Services, Benefits and Rewards Services and Personal and Home Services. Through its more than 100 services, Sodexo provides clients an integrated offering developed through over 50 years of experience. Sodexo’s success and performance are founded on its independence, its sustainable business model and its ability to continuously develop and engage its more than 425,000 employees throughout the world.


Job Description


Hourly wage $15.90 - 20.97/hr

  • All employees at this site are members of the applicable Union. Employees are hired on a casual basis, but once employed they are able to apply to any job postings onsite. Employees must work more than 20 hours per week to be eligible for benefits after the probation period.
  • As a member of our housekeeping and/or custodial teams, you will provide high-quality customer service, while maintaining the premises in a clean and orderly manner, including:
    • Cleaning and disinfecting patient rooms, including those with infection / isolation protocols.
    • Cleaning and disinfecting offices, common areas, washrooms, halls, food service areas, and any other areas that may require attention
    • Cleaning desks, ceilings and vents, walls, blinds, kitchenettes, microwaves, washrooms, furniture, windows, floors and carpets
    • Dusting, mopping, vacuuming, sweeping, polishing floors and replenishing supplies
    • Emptying trash and garbage containers

Qualifications
  • One year of experience preferred
  • Ability to use tools and equipment and to perform the physical aspects of the job including:
  • Lift and handling up to 40lbs
  • Work activities involve body postures other than, or in addition to, Standing and/or walking such as bending, stooping, kneeling and crouching
  • Work activities involve handling loads between 10 kg and 20 kg.
  • Prolonged walking and standing
  • Excellent customer service skills, willing to go beyond the basics
  • Ability to work under supervision and follow standard procedures, and compliance with all health and safety standards
  • Personal and professional integrity, appearance, and demeanor
  • Applicants will be required to complete Criminal Record Check via Ministry of Justice, and specified immunizations as a condition of employment.

title: Building Operator (Mobile)
description:
Posted In: Commercial Property Management

About The Job

The Building Operator will perform general preventive maintenance and corrective repairs on industrial and retail properties within a given geographic territory. In this capacity the role will travel to the various properties on a regular basis and conduct hands-on repair work on lighting, electrical, plumbing, doors and gates, mechanical systems, building envelope, grounds and parking lots, building interior as well as general housekeeping duties and other maintenance tasks associated with the operation of the properties in the portfolio.

Responsibilities

  • Perform property inspections and maintenance, start-up/shutdown of building equipment as required or directed by management.
  • Assist with supervision of construction projects and inspection of work completed by various trades, assist with tenant move-in and move-out inspections and meet with contractors onsite to obtain quotes.
  • Perform minor plumbing and electrical repairs as required, such as but not limited to: cleaning up after minor floods, replacing fittings and faucets, clearing sinks, toilets and drains, including roof drains, resetting breakers, cleaning electrical fixtures, and replacing bulbs and lamps.
  • Complete various preventive maintenance tasks, such as but not limited to: filter changes, belt replacements, lubrications, cleaning of utility rooms, ceiling tiles replacements, minor drywall repairs and painting.
  • Able to independently plan work assignments, perform duties with minimum supervision and to assist as a helper in the general maintenance and operation of assigned buildings and grounds.
  • Able to prioritize and track completion of building repairs, emergency and preventive maintenance tasks.
  • Comply with all applicable codes, regulations, governmental agencies, and company directives related to building operations and work safety.
  • Complete maintenance and repair records as required.
  • Provide operations reports and order for necessary tools, supplies and materials as requested by Operations Manager.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in Building Operations and/or Facilities Maintenance
  • Completion of post-secondary education
  • A valid driver’s license with a clean driving record
  • Solid working knowledge of the OHSA
  • Completion of WHMIS, Lock-Out/Tag-Out; Working at Heights
  • Completion of First Aid with CPR
  • Flexible to respond to after-hours calls and oversee planned work
  • Experience working with hand tools
  • Strong focus on customer service with the ability to communicate clearly both in writing and verbally
  • A self-starter, capable of working with minimum supervision on a daily basis

Apply

We offer a competitive compensation package and the opportunity to work with an industry leader!

To apply, please forward your resume to employment@menkes.com and in the subject line please include the name of the position and quote Ref #2022-516.

We thank all applicants for considering Menkes Developments Ltd. as an Employer of Choice, however only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: DZ or AZ Delivery Truck Driver (Boom or Moffett experience a...
description:
AN OPPORTUNITY TO JOIN OUR FAMILY IN HERE!

Patene Building Supplies Ltd. is a distributor of drywall, steel framing components, insulation, acoustic ceilings, shingles, masonry and other building materials for the residential and commercial construction industries. We have fourteen (14) branch locations throughout Ontario & Manitoba to serve our contractor, builder and retail customers.

We are currently seeking a Delivery Truck Driver (DZ or AZ - Boom/Moffat Operator Experience is an Asset) that will make deliveries to customer job sites for our Windsor branch.

Responsibilities:

  • Daily circle check reports and upkeep of company vehicle, including general maintenance (greasing of Boom/ Moffett) and cleanliness of cabs
  • Verifying loads and paperwork (proper loading of materials, tarping, strapping etc.)
  • Completion of all daily (MTO) paperwork requirements
  • Safe and timely deliveries and pick ups of material to locations
  • Participate in loading and unloading materials on outgoing trucks by repetitive lifting or using a boom truck
  • Responsible for directives on site to helper
  • Provide professional and courteous service to customers and sub trades
  • Reporting damaged or missing materials or equipment
  • Adhere and follow company’s Health & Safety policies and regulations
  • Abide by all rules and laws of the road
  • Perform other duties as assigned by management

Job Requirements:

  • High School diploma
  • Driver's Licence (Class D), Air Brake (Z) Endorsement or AZ
  • Standard Transmission experience a must
  • Boom/Moffat experience preferred but not required
  • Driver’s abstract and good CVOR
  • 1-2 years related experience, preferably in the construction industry
  • Must be dependable and a team player
  • Ability to communicate with co-workers, vendors and customers (verbal and written)

This position offers competitive wages, health, dental, life insurance and an RRSP plan upon completion of the applicable waiting periods.

We invite qualified candidates to apply online.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: newEnvironmental Service Attendant- Weekend Night Shift
description:
Company Description


Looking for a change, an opportunity to show your exceptional skills, a chance to help lead and build a team? Grow your career with a company that shares your passion!

Sodexo is committed to providing a safe and healthy working environment for our team members, customers, clients, contractors, business partners, guests and members of the public with whom we regularly interact. As a provider of services in many client locations, including hospitals, long term care facilities, and senior homes, we require that all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Contributing to The Well-Being and Quality of Our Consumers

The well-being of our consumers is at the heart of Sodexo's approach, customer engagement is integral in the services provided by Sodexo employees in various locations across Canada. We work closely with our consumers and clients to create an interactive and personalized environment for the well-being of everyone we serve.

Sodexo is proud to announce these nominations: 2021 Canada’s Best Diversity Employer; 2021 Canada’s Greenest Employers; 2020 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index featured company; 2020 Parity Certification - Platinum level and Progressive Aboriginal Relations (PAR) Program company – Gold Level.

What We Can Offer You

Sodexo offers you a flexible and dynamic work environment, competitive compensation, access to ongoing training and development programs, and countless opportunities to grow within the company.


Job Description


Sodexo is growing! We are looking for an Environmental Service Attendant, to join our dynamic team. This position is part time- Friday 11pm- 7am and Saturday 11pm- 7am. You will be offered a great team environment, work/life balance and the ability to ensure customer satisfaction.


Qualifications


You are a dynamic and reliable person; you have good communication and interpersonal skills. Your schedule is flexible, and you have good analytical and decision-making skills. You are committed to quality assurance and safety.

During your mandate, you will be asked to clean offices, patient/resident rooms, dormitories, classrooms, schools, common areas, restrooms, lobbies, food service areas, and any other areas that may require special attention. You will be required to sweep, mop, buff floors and vacuum hallways, stairways and offices. You will also be asked to clean ceilings, air vents, walls, furniture, windows and window coverings. You will be responsible for emptying garbage cans and containers, restocking supplies, linen and changing sheets as needed. You may also be asked to clean carpets or polish floors using the appropriate mechanical equipment. You will be requested to move furniture and set up tables and chairs.

You will need to properly and safely use cleaning chemicals according to manufacturer and Sodexo standards. Specialized cleaning equipment and techniques may be required. You may be asked to drive a golf cart or other types of vehicles.

It will be your responsibility to perform routine maintenance on equipment and make minor repairs. You will be requested to communicate to your supervisor the need for major repairs or the addition of lighting, heating and ventilation equipment.

You will be attending training programs (classroom and virtual), requested to comply with company safety and risk management policies and procedures, perform all work in accordance with established safety procedures, participate in regular safety meetings, safety training and hazard assessments. Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

High school diploma, DEC or equivalent experience is required. 1 year of experience is preferred. May require prior GxP (Good x Practices) cleaning experience depending on facility requirements (e.g. education, healthcare, lab practices, etc.).

What's Next?

If you're looking for a role where you can truly impact the lives of others, click "I'm interested" for a quick 5-minute online application.

I further understand that I will need to provide proof before starting work.


Additional Information

Patene Building Supplies Limited is a distributor of drywall, steel framing components, insulation, acoustic ceilings, shingles and other building materials for the residential and commercial construction industries. title: Sales Specialist, Millwork
description:
At Lowe’s Canada, over 26,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.

We operate or service more than 450 corporate and affiliated dealer stores. With a distinctive product and service offering and complementary store formats ranging from neighbourhood hardware stores to big box stores, our Lowe’s, RONA, Reno-Depot, and Dick’s Lumber banners are always looking for dedicated associates to help meet the needs of all DIYers and contractors.

You’ve got the talent? We’ve got the tools! Here, your work and ideas will contribute to building a flourishing organization. Your voice will always be heard and valued. You’ll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills.

So if you’re looking to do what you love, and to grow and evolve within our family—one of the best employers in Canada according to a recent Forbes survey—we could be perfect for each other.


Our expectations:

The primary function of the Sales Specialist, Millwork is to serve as the store expert on millwork (including interior/exterior fixings such as windows, doors, trim, ceiling tiles, and skylights) by providing detailed product information to both customers and other Lowe's Canada associates.


Your role:

  • Generate leads, conduct sales activities, and build relationships with customers including promoting and recommending products, plans, or installation services that match customer needs
  • Inform customers on pricing, options, or status on pending orders
  • Keep shelves stocked and correctly displayed
  • Coordinate successful completion of projects and orders including performing order management duties such as entering new orders for customers, reaching out to vendors on special orders, tracking and fulfilling orders, and resolving issues
  • Provide excellent customer service through the daily execution of Lowe’s Canada customer service programs, following up on completed orders to ensure customer satisfaction, and assisting customers as needed in locating, selecting, carrying, and loading merchandise
  • Maintain a safe and secure work environment by complying with company policies and procedures for merchandising, housekeeping, safety, and monitoring for potential theft or security risks
  • Operate store equipment
  • Support other departments as needed

The qualifications we are looking for:

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • At least 1 year of experience in a trade directly related to this department (Millwork)
  • At least 1 year experience entering and submitting customer sales orders, including special orders
  • At least 2 years of experience following up on outstanding or incomplete customer orders, sales, or installs
  • At least 1 year of experience promoting product-related services and plans such as installations, deliveries, credit financing, or extended protection plans
  • At least 2 years of experience in a sales environment with required sales goals or metrics
  • Ability to lift up to 40 pounds daily without assistance

Your benefits of working for Lowe’s Canada:

  • An inclusive and safe working environment
  • Promotion of work-life balance
  • Exclusive employee discounts
  • Benefits: insurance (certain conditions apply), annual salary review, etc.
  • Opportunities for advancement within the company
  • An employer that’s involved in the community
  • Teamwork and ongoing training
  • A comprehensive training program for all new hires
  • A company discount on store merchandise
  • A student incentive program
  • And much more!

The masculine generic is used without discrimination and only in order to simplify the text. Lowe’s Canada is committed to encouraging diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, or any other status protected by law.

title: Environmental Service Attendant- 7am - 3pm
description:
Company Description


Looking for a change, an opportunity to show your exceptional skills, a chance to help lead and build a team? Grow your career with a company that shares your passion!

Sodexo is committed to providing a safe and healthy working environment for our team members, customers, clients, contractors, business partners, guests and members of the public with whom we regularly interact. As a provider of services in many client locations, including hospitals, long term care facilities, and senior homes, we require that all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Contributing to The Well-Being and Quality of Our Consumers

The well-being of our consumers is at the heart of Sodexo's approach, customer engagement is integral in the services provided by Sodexo employees in various locations across Canada. We work closely with our consumers and clients to create an interactive and personalized environment for the well-being of everyone we serve.

Sodexo is proud to announce these nominations: 2021 Canada’s Best Diversity Employer; 2021 Canada’s Greenest Employers; 2020 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index featured company; 2020 Parity Certification - Platinum level and Progressive Aboriginal Relations (PAR) Program company – Gold Level.

What We Can Offer You

Sodexo offers you a flexible and dynamic work environment, competitive compensation, access to ongoing training and development programs, and countless opportunities to grow within the company.


Job Description


Sodexo is growing! We are looking for an Environmental Service Attendant, to join our dynamic team. This position is part time. You will be offered a great team environment, work/life balance and the ability to ensure customer satisfaction.


Qualifications


You are a dynamic and reliable person; you have good communication and interpersonal skills. Your schedule is flexible, and you have good analytical and decision-making skills. You are committed to quality assurance and safety.

During your mandate, you will be asked to clean offices, patient/resident rooms, dormitories, classrooms, schools, common areas, restrooms, lobbies, food service areas, and any other areas that may require special attention. You will be required to sweep, mop, buff floors and vacuum hallways, stairways and offices. You will also be asked to clean ceilings, air vents, walls, furniture, windows and window coverings. You will be responsible for emptying garbage cans and containers, restocking supplies, linen and changing sheets as needed. You may also be asked to clean carpets or polish floors using the appropriate mechanical equipment. You will be requested to move furniture and set up tables and chairs.

You will need to properly and safely use cleaning chemicals according to manufacturer and Sodexo standards. Specialized cleaning equipment and techniques may be required. You may be asked to drive a golf cart or other types of vehicles.

It will be your responsibility to perform routine maintenance on equipment and make minor repairs. You will be requested to communicate to your supervisor the need for major repairs or the addition of lighting, heating and ventilation equipment.

You will be attending training programs (classroom and virtual), requested to comply with company safety and risk management policies and procedures, perform all work in accordance with established safety procedures, participate in regular safety meetings, safety training and hazard assessments. Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

High school diploma, DEC or equivalent experience is required. 1 year of experience is preferred. May require prior GxP (Good x Practices) cleaning experience depending on facility requirements (e.g. education, healthcare, lab practices, etc.).

What's Next?

If you're looking for a role where you can truly impact the lives of others, click "I'm interested" for a quick 5-minute online application.

I understand that as a condition of my employment, I must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. By applying, I hereby certify that I have received two doses of government approved vaccines and that at least 14 days have past since the date of my last vaccination. I further understand that I will need to provide proof before starting work.


Additional Information


Sodexo is committed to Employment Equity and Diversity. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of national origin, race, religion, ethnicity, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other federal, provincial, or local protected class.

We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates who participate in all aspects of the selection process.

Thank you for your interest in Sodexo.

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.

Follow us on social media to see first-hand what we are all about!

Instagram: @SodexoCanadaCareers

Twitter: @SodexoJobsCA

LinkedIn: Sodexo Canada Careers

Facebook: Sodexo CA Jobs

title: Relocate to Canmore -Glazier
description:
Are you looking for a change? Want to work to live not live to work? Want to work in one of the most popular destinations in Canada and Made the top 100 places to visit in the world in 2021!!! Your life could be someone’s vacation!

We are looking for an experienced Glazier to join our team. CanGlass is a thriving abs growing company that treats our employees like family. We care about you as a person and that means benefits, growth opportunity, safety gear, and clear expectations. The correct candidate must be well experienced with installing, measuring, and servicing heavy and light shower enclosures and railing systems. Experience with general residential and commercial glass service is also required. We are offering a full time permanent position to the correct candidate. We are a great growing company with room for future promotion within our company. Work is based mostly in Banff

Job duties

This position will perform some or all of the following duties:

  • Read and interpret blueprints and specifications to determine type and thickness of glass, frame, installation procedure and materials required
  • Measure and mark glass and plastics and cut glass using glass cutters and edging machines
  • Assemble, erect and dismantle scaffolds, rigging and hoisting equipment
  • Position glass panes into frames and secure glass using clips, points or mouldings
  • Assemble and install prefabricated glass, mirrors or glass products on walls, ceilings or exteriors of buildings
  • Install, fit, fabricate and attach architectural metals or related substitute products in commercial and residential buildings
  • Install pre-cut mirrors and opaque and transparent glass panels in frames, walls, and exteriors
  • Replace glass in furniture and other products
  • Prepare and install skylights, showcases and aquariums and stained or other special glass in churches, museums, sports and other establishments
  • Repair, replace, and service residential windows, commercial aluminum doors and other glass supporting structures, and replace damaged glass or faulty sealant
  • Install bi-pass shower door systems, neo-angle showers, frameless showers
  • Install railings using various techniques including standoffs and shoe systems
  • May prepare cost estimates for customers or clients.

Experience required

  • Pay is based on experience and skill sets. If you are a general labourer looking to pick a career we will support you through an apprenticeship program.
  • Must have valid class 5 Canadian driver license
  • Must be able to legally work and reside in Canada
  • Must be able to pass a vulnerable sector background check
  • Must be willing to relocate to Canmore or commute from Cochrane/Calgary
  • Must be able to read and write in English
  • Canglass is an equal opportunity employer

Other traits we are looking for

  • Stamina: Since being a glazier can be a physically-demanding job, those who take on this role must have a high level of stamina. Not only should they be able to stand, kneel and sit for long periods, they must also be able to hold heavy pieces of glass until they have been fully installed.
  • Safety: we take it seriously and expect the people we hire to make safety of themselves and others a priority.
  • Teamwork: we are a team and that means having open and honest conversations when conflict arises, no gossip, and working together.
  • Reading comprehension: You must have good reading comprehension to read material such as regulations and contracts and installation notes
  • Critical thinking: To be able to figure out the best plan of action for each client, you must possess critical thinking to problem solve on the site and ask for help when needed.
  • Written, verbal and interpersonal communication: Given the vast array of clients you come into contact with, contractors, coworkers, management and many others you should have excellent communication skills.
  • Dependable: Considering the urgent nature of the issues that may arise in this field, and the high expectations of our clients, you must be very dependable and punctual.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $25.00-$42.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company car
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

COVID-19 considerations:
We provide PPE for Covid and abide by the Alberta Covid Restrictions

Experience:

  • glazing: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • class 5 drivers licence (required)

title: newSite Foreman
description:
New City Contracting is looking for a Site Foreman to join our team! The Site Foreman's responsibility includes providing on-site supervision and coordination between different subcontractors, to ensure that required quality standards are met for the building envelope projects and to ensure work is executed towards the on-schedule completion of the project and the project's conditions are safe.
Location: 60 Westridge Dr, Williams Lake, BC V2G 4L6
Responsibilities:
  • Monitor the work progress on site by efficiently managing the Coordination of different trades.
  • Motivating sub-trades, to complete the work safely, on time, and to an acceptable standard of quality.
  • Reporting to Site Superintendents on site progresses, possible delays, and other issues.
  • Installation of interior flooring with new resilient flooring.
  • Responsible for demolition of drywall ceiling and interior.
  • Interior repair works affected by mechanical/electrical works.
  • Troubleshooting common issues that may arise on site.
  • Maintaining a good working relationship with the team, subcontractors, and regulatory authorities.
  • Other duties that may be assigned.
Requirements:
  • Must have 5+ years of experience as a Site Foreman.
  • Must have experience in doing interior projects.
  • First aid level 1 or 2 is preferred but not a requirement.
  • Must be handy with tools and must know how to run a crew.
  • Experience in Building Envelop Maintenance Projects is a definite advantage.
  • Managing new construction projects is an added asset.
  • Proven trade experience (carpentry, drywall, painting, etc.).
  • Supervisory experience and ability to manage a construction site crew.
  • Ability to interpret construction documents, including drawings, plans, and schedules.
  • Commitment to the job site safety and project quality.
  • Understanding of construction procedures, equipment, and Safety Guidelines.
  • Excellent organizational and execution skills.
  • Experience using construction machinery is an asset.
Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, a stable work-life balance, a positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.


About New City Contracting Ltd.:

Over 20 years ago, Edward Buset — New City’s founder and president — saw that the Lower Mainland was missing something: a resource for property managers, homeowner associations (HOAs), engineers, and other professionals involved in the building renewal business. Edward envisioned this resource that will work on new builds or maintain existing buildings, one that will develop cost-effective plans for the renewal of all types of buildings in our area’s unique climate. From this vision rose today’s New City, one of Vancouver’s leading general contractors. With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently. Today, New City Contracting is a trusted leader in envelope renewal for commercial and residential projects. New City is an expert in the investigation, analysis, and repair of building envelopes — for all material types and vintages. Our extensive building renewal services include: Building Envelope RenewalExterior and Interior PaintingRoof Renewal and ReplacementTenant ImprovementWaterproofingExterior and Industrial CleaningEnvironmental AbatementConcrete Restoration

title: Building Operator
description:
ZML Holdings Group Corporation is a real estate investment and management company. We are hiring a full time contractor for maintain the properties in downtown Calgary, Alberta,.

The Building Operator will report to the Property Manager and will be assisting with the maintenance and tenant improvements for the properties

This position will conduct daily inspections, record instrument readings, operate, troubleshoot, and repair plumbing, electrical and HVAC systems.

Responsibilities

  • Oversee the contractors for HVAC preventive maintenance, energy management, environmental management, waste management, janitorial, property maintenance, pest control, and life safety systems, cleaning operations, tenant coordination and other pertinent aspects of physical operations
  • Operate office tower building automation system and security computer systems
  • Assist the Property Manager in coordination of all contracted maintenance, scheduled repairs, capital projects and conduct ongoing and final inspections to ensure deficiencies are addressed
  • Follow up on weekly operations checklists as provided by management
  • Maintain the filing system and records related to all commercial operations
  • Paint and complete minor touch-ups following damage, repair and apply new coats of paint to unit walls, fill in small holes caused by nails and minor dings from normal wear and tear, perform basic drywall, electrical and plumbing repairs, as required
  • Provide professional, prompt, and courteous correspondence with renters when scheduling and providing maintenance services, and with contracted vendors that provide additional facility services
  • Perform daily operations with a strong commitment to customer service while upholding the owner’s professional property management image
  • Maintain the cleanliness, safety, and appearance of the commercial portion of the project, including the office tower and retail frontages, common stairwells, corridors, garbage and recycling rooms and designated parking /loading areas
  • Respond to tenant and customer inquiries in a professional manner
  • Answer phone calls and direct maintenance calls
  • Help with the repair, replacement or installation of power switches, fuses, wall sockets, ceiling lights, ceiling fans, climate control systems, and garage doors openers
  • Oversee and monitor any work performed by third party contractors whether it is a portion of outsourced maintenance, major/minor repairs, or tenant improvements (when necessary)
  • Complete shoveling, blowing, or plowing snow away from covered walkways and driveways, and laying down rock salt atop icy surfaces to prevent slipping
  • Be available for ‘on-call’ duty to respond to emergency situations after hours and weekends on a rotating schedule
  • Various other duties and responsibilities as assigned

Skills & Qualifications

Certificates:

  • Has minimum class 4 certificate of power Engineer
  • BES Certification is an asset
  • BOMA (SMT, SMA,FMA) certifications would be an asset
  • Enrolled in or completion of Building Environmental systems diploma (or similar program) preferred

Experience:

3-5 years’ related working experience

Property/facilities management experience would be an asset

Experience with building mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and fire systems or related trade certification would be an asset

Experience with application of the Occupational Health and Safety Act, Regulations and Code, WHMIS legislation, Building Codes and Fire Codes would be an asset

Proactive approach in the maintenance of the building and in the best interests of the owner

Familiarity with the use and operation of a variety of hand tools and equipment common to building trades

Good working knowledge of carpentry, finishing, minor electrical, plumbing, HVAC and other associated systems and trades

Understanding of mechanical and electrical systems, including pumps, motors, boilers, chillers, cooling towers and air handling equipment

Ability to analyze and determine the cause of any problems/malfunctions and take corrective action as required

Strong communication with tenants, guests, contractors, and staffs and handle multiple tasks with minimal supervision

Familiarity with Johnson Controls system would be an asset

Must possess a valid Province of ALBERTA driver's license and have access to a vehicle in good working condition

Ability to lift to 50 pounds, stand or walk for prolonged periods, crouch, climb, and reach

Good working knowledge in the use Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook)

Criminal Back Ground Check will be required

Pay will be based on experience and qualification

Job Types: Part-time, Casual

Salary: $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • On call

Experience:

  • maintenance: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • class 4 certificate of Power Engineer (preferred)

title: Desjardins Insurance Account Representative
description:
Are you outgoing and customer-focused? Are you excited to help customers reach their insurance needs? If you answered yes to these questions, working for an Insurance agent may be the career for you!

Successful Desjardins Agent - Pam Pabla Insurance and Financial Services Inc, is looking for a motivated, sales-oriented individual who has a passion for the insurance industry to join their winning team for the role of Insurance Account Representative - Desjardins Agent Team Member.

Our goal is to build up strong relationships and increase our professional reputation. If you are looking for a full-time job that provides meaningful work and competitive compensation? Consider a position in our office.

We offer a starting competitive base salary plus generous commission Schedule, yearly bonus, paid vacation, Life balance days, Benefits within the first year, Training & support.

There is no ceiling or maximum commission one can receive in this sales position.

Responsibilities
  • Develop leads, Schedule appointments, identify Customer needs, and market appropriate products and services.
  • Establishes personalized telephone contact with the client. Creates a climate of trust conducive to the sale of a home or auto insurance policy. Educates and advises our clients on our products, while adhering to the company's underwriting policies.
  • Seizes all sales opportunities, solicitation and product offers.
  • Work with the agent to establish and meet marketing goals.
  • Use a customer-focused, needs-based review process to educate customers about insurance options.
Benefits of working with our office:
  • Salary
  • Uncapped Commission (Property and Casualty + LIFE - %of premium sold)
  • Paid Vacation - 2 weeks
  • Health and Dental Benefits (after 3 months)
  • Technology (laptop)
  • Annual Bonus and Annual Travel bonus (subject to office qualification)
Qualifications and Experience
  • Sales experience (preferred).
  • Successful track record of meeting sales goals.
  • Self-motivated.
  • Ability to relate to customers.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong work ethic with a total commitment to success each and every day.
  • Organized, with the ability to problem solve.
  • Ability to work as a team.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Strong understanding of social media/ technology.
  • Ability to motivate and leadership skills.
  • Property and Casualty license Preferred.
  • Life and Health license Preferred.
  • Strong understanding of social media/ technology.
  • Product/ sales experience (required).
  • College diploma/University Degree in a related field.
  • 2 years of relevant experience.
  • Previous insurance experience in various property and casualty disciplines, such as underwriting, claims, sales or service would be an asset.
Desjardins is a leading provider of Auto, Home and Life Insurance as well as Financial services in Canada, with the passion to become the customer's first and best choice in the products and services we provide. Training provided for the licensed candidates.

This is a Full-time position within a Desjardins Insurance Agency- Pam Pabla Insurance and Financial Services Inc. in Mississauga

We thank you all applicants for their interest. Please be advised that only those selected for interview will be contacted by our office.

Pam Pabla Insurance and Financial Services Inc.

Note: This position is with an independent contractor agent that is part of the Desjardins exclusive agent network, not with Desjardins Group or its subsidiaries. This Agent's employees are not employees of Desjardins Group. Please be advised that Independent contractor Agents are responsible for and make all employment decisions regarding their employees.


These positions are with an independent contractor agent that is part of the Desjardins exclusive agent network, not with Desjardins Group or its subsidiaries. This agents’ employees are not employees of Desjardins. Independent contractor agents are responsible for and make all employment decisions regarding their employees.

title: Senior Estimator
description:
Our Company,

Cambridge Drywall is a drywall contractor servicing both the residential and ici sectors. Our scope includes but is not limited to: steel stud framing, gypsum sheathing, drywall, taping, insulating, acoustic ceilings and panels.

The Opportunity
We are looking for a fulltime Estimator including but not limited to the following duties:

  • Prepare quantity take offs using computer software
  • Estimate and co-ordinate change orders and site instructions.
  • Prepare tender documents for potential jobs, review specifications and drawings to identify scope.
  • Review tender invitations
  • Provide value engineering insight
  • Consult with clients, contractors, architects, engineers and site super intendants
  • Comprehensive bid preparation, submittal, award and follow up
  • Responsible for clear communication to project managers and senior estimators.
  • Provide budgeting, scheduling and assist with project management including pre-construction administration and job costing.
  • Review contracts for accuracy

Requirements

  • Ability to read and understand construction drawings
  • Strong computer skills including but not limited to estimating software and Microsoft Office, Plexxis and Plan Swift.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Post-secondary education in a related field
  • Must have strong estimating skills

Salary

  • TBD

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (required)

Experience:

  • construction estimating: 2 years (required)

Expected start date: 2022-02-16
