title: Web Application Developer
description:
At Flynn, it's not just a job, it's a career

Flynn Group of Companies, North America’s leading building envelope contractor, is looking for a Web Application Developer to work from our Mississauga location.

Imagine a career where your creativity and technical skills can fuel BIG innovations. Where your work will have an impact on the productivity of your client’s day-to-day lives. Be recognized for your skills and take part in the full product design and development lifecycle. Work with leading edge technology to make a difference in the mobile-construction world.

Our Team
A small team of collaborative individuals working together to solve hard problems and deliver testable, high quality, secure code. Everyone wears many different hats and works on several projects.

Our Tech Stack
Our primary tech stack is C# and .NET delivered via Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure. We use MySQL and MongoDB as our primary databases. We use ASP.NET and JavaScript (Angular, KendoUI) for our web apps and Xamarin (C#) and Java for our mobile apps.

About You
Be passionate about delighting our customers
Have a passion for code quality validated by testing
See the value in modern development techniques like TDD, DevOps, CI/CD, Dependency Injection, etc.
Be curious and interested in improving yourself and the team
Willing to speak up and share ideas with the team
Willing to question the status quo
Be able to give and take criticism
Looking to see the results of your work quickly

A Day in the Life

  • Working on mobile and web app development projects
  • Design, build and maintain SQL (MySQL) and NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB) data layers
  • Design, build and maintain RESTful APIs
  • Build out pipelines to support continuous integration and continuous delivery
  • Build and maintain front end web applications to interact with our APIs
  • Everyone is responsible for quality, security and building testable software
Learning new techniques and reinforcing them with solid past experience is critical. Being able to write clear code, that is understandable by the team and is testable is a key factor in your success as a candidate.

What We Are Seeking

  • Post-secondary education in Computer Science/IT or related field
  • Ability to work as part of a team & independently
Knowledge of:
  • .NET Framework/ASP.NET
  • C#
  • Entity Framework
  • JavaScript front end frameworks (Angular)
  • MySQL
  • MongoDB and MongoDB Atlas
  • WebSockets
  • SignalR
  • Amazon AWS (Elastic Beanstalk, Lambda, Dynamo DB)
  • Microsoft Azure (App Service, AzureSQL, Blob storage)
  • Continuous Integration/Delivery/DevOps
  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to multitask
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and decision making abilities
Past Experience with the following tools and technology is an asset:
  • Atlassian Jira, GitHub, Azure DevOps, Aha!, NewRelic

What We Offer

  • Beautiful work enviroment with high ceilings and tons of natural sunlight!
  • In-house cafeteria and gym
  • Free parking
  • Competitive wages and benefits
  • RRSP matching
  • Great environment where our motto is “Flynn Family Winning Together”!
  • On-going career development programs through our in-house Flynn University and eLearning courses
  • Our employees are also afforded coveted technical perks such as state of the art technology, MSDN subscription as well as Azure and AWS credits.
#LI-VS1

Flynn Group of Companies is the leading trade contractor in North America that works on virtually every aspect of a building’s outer layer, including Roofing, Glazing, Waterproofing, and Architectural Metals. The foundation of our award winning success is having the right people on our team.

We are also highly active and committed to creating an environment which is accessible to all of our customers, employees and applicants. Reasonable accommodations in the hiring process will be provided to people with disabilities upon request.

title: newDelivery Driver (DZ or AZ Boom Operator)
description:
JOIN OUR FAMILY!

Patene Building Supplies Ltd. is a distributor of drywall, steel framing components, insulation, acoustic ceilings, shingles, masonry and other building materials for the residential and commercial construction industries. We have thirteen (13) branch locations throughout Ontario & Manitoba to serve our contractor, builder and retail customers.

We are currently seeking a Delivery Truck Driver (DZ - Boom Operator)that will make deliveries to customer job sites for our Barrie branch.

Responsibilities:

  • Daily circle check reports and upkeep of company vehicle, including general maintenance (greasing of Boom/ Moffett) and cleanliness of cabs
  • Verifying loads and paperwork (proper loading of materials, tarping, strapping etc.)
  • Completion of all daily (MTO) paperwork requirements
  • Safe and timely deliveries and pick ups of material to locations
  • Participate in loading and unloading materials on outgoing trucks by repetitive lifting or using a boom truck
  • Responsible for directives on site to helper
  • Provide professional and courteous service to customers and sub trades
  • Reporting damaged or missing materials or equipment
  • Adhere and follow company’s Health & Safety policies and regulations
  • Abide by all rules and laws of the road
  • Perform other duties as assigned by management

Job Requirements:

  • High School diploma
  • Driver's Licence (Class D), Air Brake (Z) Endorsement
  • Standard Transmission experience a must
  • Working at Heights Certificate a must
  • Boom experience preferred
  • Driver’s abstract and good CVOR
  • 1-2 years related experience, preferably in the construction industry
  • Must be dependable and a team player
  • Ability to communicate with co-workers, vendors and customers (verbal and written)

This position offers competitive wages, health, dental, life insurance and an RRSP plan upon completion of the applicable waiting periods. NO WEEKEND DELIVERIES & HOME EVENINGS = WORK-LIFE BALANCE

We invite qualified candidates to apply online.

Job Type: Full-time

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Custodian / Janitor
description:
About Apotex Inc.

Apotex Inc. is a proudly Canadian, global pharmaceutical company that produces high-quality, affordable medicines for patients around the world. Apotex employs almost 8,000 people worldwide in manufacturing, R&D, and commercial operations. Apotex Inc. exports to more than 100 countries and territories and operates in more than 45 countries, with a significant presence in Canada, the US, Mexico, and India. Through vertical integration, Apotex is comprised of multiple divisions and affiliates including Apotex Inc., focused on generics; Apobiologix, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on biosimilar development; Aveva, an affiliate of Apotex Inc. fully integrated global developer and manufacturer of complete transdermal solutions; Apotex Consumer Products, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on brand name products; and Global Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (GAPI), a division of Apotex Inc. focused on the manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) for Apotex and third parties. For more information visit: www.apotex.com.

Job Summary

Responsible for performing general cleaning duties inside and outside of Apotex facilities as assigned. Areas inside the building include offices, washrooms, Locker change rooms, Production area, Warehouse and Laboratories. At the Etobicoke site, the buildings include the Engineering Site Office.


Outside the buildings, in winter, operate the snow blower and ice melter spreader, in conjunction with manually keeping the walkways, exits and entrances clear of ice and snow.


Job Responsibilities
  • Offices

Clean offices which include dusting and polishing furniture, vacuuming, sweeping, mopping, washing walls and windows. Remove garbage and recycling from the centralized areas.


  • Washrooms

Clean washrooms and change rooms and replenish supplies. (soaps, paper towels, hand cream, etc.)


  • Warehouse

Clean warehouse floors, shelves, walls and where applicable, any marks on the floor from the forklift wheels.


  • GMP areas (Production, Packaging)

Clean the Good manufacturing Practices (GMP) areas, which include washing walls, stairs, ceilings and floors. Clean pails and drums and replenishing supplies.


  • Cafeteria

Clean the cafeteria, including the food preparation area, freezers, coolers and storage areas. Remove Garbage and recycling materials as needed. Maintain coffee brewers as required.


  • Clean the Laboratory and replenish supplies as required.

  • Clean the Controlled Substances/CT vault and walk in refrigerator.

  • Dispose of all garbage and recycling following proper procedures.

  • Operate various cleaning machines including floor polisher, vacuums and floor scrubbing machines.

  • Operate the compactors.

  • Utilize standardized cleaning agents as trained.

  • Ensure that all work is performed in accordance with Good Manufacturing Practices, (cGMP), Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s) and established safety standards (SWP).

  • Work as a member of a team to achieve all outcomes.

  • Perform all work in support of our Corporate Values of Pride, Accountability, Integrity and Diligence.

  • Perform all work in accordance with all established regulatory and compliance and safety requirement.

  • Perform all other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements
  • Grade 12 education;

  • The ability to lift 50 lbs;

  • Good command of the English language (ability to read, write and understand English);

  • Good oral communication skills;

  • Good interpersonal skills;

  • Previous cleaning experience preferred;

  • Physically fit

COVID-19 VACCINATION POLICY: In accordance with Apotex Inc. (“Apotex”) policy, as of November 15, 2021, all individuals entering a Canadian site (including but not limited to employees, visitors, contractors and agency workers) must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in accordance with the current government requirements. Further, all employees must maintain all future booster vaccines as approved and recommended by Health Canada. Accommodation from these requirements for reasons pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code, or any other applicable law (most commonly for medical and/or religious reasons) will be reviewed and considered by Apotex.


At Apotex, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported.

Apotex offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

title: HR/Benefits Administrator
description:
At Flynn, it's not just a job, it's a career

Are you interested in pursuing a career in Human Resources? Look no further, join one of Canada's Best Managed Companies!

A Day in the Life

  • A heavy focus on Benefits Administration including billing, enrolment, program termination, filing, inquiries and benefits accounts reconciliation
  • Retirement Savings Plan Administration

What We Are Seeking

title: newSales Specialist, Millwork (Full Time)
description:
At Lowe’s Canada, over 26,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.

We operate or service more than 450 corporate and affiliated dealer stores. With a distinctive product and service offering and complementary store formats ranging from neighbourhood hardware stores to big box stores, our Lowe’s, RONA, Reno-Depot, and Dick’s Lumber banners are always looking for dedicated associates to help meet the needs of all DIYers and contractors.

You’ve got the talent? We’ve got the tools! Here, your work and ideas will contribute to building a flourishing organization. Your voice will always be heard and valued. You’ll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills.

So if you’re looking to do what you love, and to grow and evolve within our family—one of the best employers in Canada according to a recent Forbes survey—we could be perfect for each other.


Our expectations:

The primary function of the Sales Specialist, Millwork is to serve as the store expert on millwork (including interior/exterior fixings such as windows, doors, trim, ceiling tiles, and skylights) by providing detailed product information to both customers and other Lowe's Canada associates.


Your role:

  • Generate leads, conduct sales activities, and build relationships with customers including promoting and recommending products, plans, or installation services that match customer needs
  • Inform customers on pricing, options, or status on pending orders
  • Keep shelves stocked and correctly displayed
  • Coordinate successful completion of projects and orders including performing order management duties such as entering new orders for customers, reaching out to vendors on special orders, tracking and fulfilling orders, and resolving issues
  • Provide excellent customer service through the daily execution of Lowe’s Canada customer service programs, following up on completed orders to ensure customer satisfaction, and assisting customers as needed in locating, selecting, carrying, and loading merchandise
  • Maintain a safe and secure work environment by complying with company policies and procedures for merchandising, housekeeping, safety, and monitoring for potential theft or security risks
  • Operate store equipment
  • Support other departments as needed

The qualifications we are looking for:

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • At least 1 year of experience in a trade directly related to this department (Millwork)
  • At least 1 year experience entering and submitting customer sales orders, including special orders
  • At least 2 years of experience following up on outstanding or incomplete customer orders, sales, or installs
  • At least 1 year of experience promoting product-related services and plans such as installations, deliveries, credit financing, or extended protection plans
  • At least 2 years of experience in a sales environment with required sales goals or metrics
  • Ability to lift up to 40 pounds daily without assistance

Your benefits of working for Lowe’s Canada:

  • An inclusive and safe working environment
  • Promotion of work-life balance
  • Exclusive employee discounts
  • Benefits: insurance (certain conditions apply), annual salary review, etc.
  • Opportunities for advancement within the company
  • An employer that’s involved in the community
  • Teamwork and ongoing training
  • A comprehensive training program for all new hires
  • A company discount on store merchandise
  • A student incentive program
  • And much more!

The masculine generic is used without discrimination and only in order to simplify the text. Lowe’s Canada is committed to encouraging diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, or any other status protected by law.

title: Customer Service Insurance Sales Representative
description:
Looking for a new Career in Insurance? Or just looking for a change from your current role?
- Partial Work Remote/ Work from Home Available.- Are you a self-driven, energetic and passionate individual that is looking for a challenge?
-We are looking for a high energy, self motivated individual to join our team. Want to run your own business one day? Let us help you lay the groundwork to one day open your own office. Grant Leslie Insurance Agency is seeking a qualified professional to join their winning team for the role of Insurance Account Representative - Desjardins Agent Team Member. We seek an energetic professional interested in helping our business grow through value-based conversations and remarkable customer experience. If you are a motivated self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment, then this is your opportunity for a rewarding career with excellent income and growth potential. Responsibilities: • Develop leads, schedule appointments, identify customer needs, and market appropriate products and services. • Provide prompt, accurate, and friendly customer service. Service can include responding to inquiries regarding insurance availability, eligibility, coverages, policy changes, transfers, claim submissions, and billing clarification. • Work with the agent to establish and meet marketing goals. Requirements: • Sales experience (outside sales or inside sales representative, retail sales associate, or telemarketing) preferred • Successful track record of meeting sales goals/quotas preferred • Excellent interpersonal skills • Excellent communication skills - written, verbal and listening • Proactive in problem solving • Dedicated to customer service • Ability to multi-task • Ability to make presentations to potential customers • Property & Casualty license (preferred/must be able to obtain • OTL & LLQP (preferred/must be able to obtain) Total Compensation Range (Salary, Commission & Bonus):$55,000.00 annually is based on average sales results. There is no ceiling or maximum commissions you can receive in this sales position. (on target $60K-$70K) This is a Full-time position within a Desjardins Insurance Agency in Oakville, Ontario.

These positions are with an independent contractor agent that is part of the Desjardins exclusive agent network, not with Desjardins Group or its subsidiaries. This agents’ employees are not employees of Desjardins. Independent contractor agents are responsible for and make all employment decisions regarding their employees.

title: Commercial Field Sales Manager
description:
CertainTeed Canada has an exciting career opportunity for a seasoned Commercial Field Sales Manager with a passion for people leadership.

This is a great chance to join a Top Employer and contribute to our growth and success by demonstrating your passion and expertise for achieving Company objectives and being solution driven.


Territory Location: British Columbia (Vancouver)


Here’s what we do…

CertainTeed is a subsidiary of Saint-Gobain - the world’s largest building materials company with a 350-year legacy of innovation and growth. Saint-Gobain group is leader in sustainable product development and environmental stewardship. We’re proud to that Saint-Gobain North America was recognized by Top Employers institute as on the best workplaces in North America & Canada.

For 113 years, CertainTeed has been synonymous with quality, trust, innovation, and service. Our team designs, manufactures and distributes materials and solutions in the construction and building materials market. CertainTeed’s broad product offering includes insulation, ceilings, roofing, siding, fence, railing, deck, exterior trim and gypsum board products. We provide comfort, performance and safety while addressing the challenges of sustainable construction, resource efficiency and climate change. Our offerings incorporate and promote the wellbeing for each of us and we are building a future where we collectively work together towards our core purpose to Make the World a Better Home.


What’s the job?

The successful sales lead for CertainTeed will be responsible for building sales within new and existing customers within the Interior Products Group (IPG). The BC IPG Sales team works primarily with builders, contractors and distribution customers to generate sales growth of CertainTeed’s (CT) portfolio.

They will be responsible for account planning, developing and coordinating activities to expand CT sales and be the preferred choice within the BC region. In addition, this role will work in collaboration with their regional colleagues to deliver cross-functional customer planning sessions to unlock and maximize the sales opportunities across the full product portfolio.

  • Implement and execute Regional distribution strategy with CT Key Strategic accounts
  • Develops and maintains business plans within the market.
  • Builds, maintains and adds value to relationships between customer’s and CT’s organization; customers include all audiences e.i. contractors, distributors, etc.
  • Works collaboratively with Territory Managers (TM), Sr Field Application Manager, Architectural Solutions Managers, EPG team in the territory to deliver sales growth and sustained demand
  • Key account manager for primary GSD and drywall-insulation contractors, (Owner/President level) in British Columbia
  • Actively works to increase sales in Insulation, Gypsum and Ceiling Tile sales within GSD Channel British Columbia to meets or exceeds Performance Objectives and Incentive Sales Goals
  • Provides effective leadership and regular performance coaching and mentorship to Territory Manager with GSD responsibility on site conversion calls and pull through techniques utilizing company coaching model. Manages employee programs for direct reports- annual review cycle, assessing training needs
  • Adheres to and manages expense budget.
  • Develop sales budgets in conjunction with Director of Sales Central & Western Canada Regional Sales Manager.
  • Coaching and mentoring Territory Managers

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in architecture, marketing, business or similar discipline, or five (5) years of equivalent training and experience that provides thorough knowledge of the laws, regulations and practices concerned with the field of construction.
  • Minimum 10 years’ of applied professional experience in managing Territory Manager, senior customer relationships, job site calls and closing of sales.
  • Excellent presentation skills with good written and oral communication.
  • Results driven, flexible, open-minded and ability to work in a team environment
  • Computer literate and proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, CRM .

Who are we ?


We provide unique options to fit your unique lives! Our Total Rewards Program is customizable to accommodate your needs. Our menu of flexible options includes, but is not limited to:

  • Excellent healthcare benefits package.
  • Family Focus & Balance: Parental leave, paid time-off and Employee Assistance Program.
  • Financial Security: Competitive RRSP, Company-funded DPSP (Deferred Profit-Sharing Plan) and Employee Stock Purchase Program (PEG).
  • Volunteer Day off: Give back to the community – each employee has one paid day a year that they can use towards volunteering their time and effort with a registered charity.
  • LiveWell Program: Rewarding you for living a healthy lifestyle.
  • And more!

Why work with us?

At Saint-Gobain, our employees have pride in belonging to an organization whose culture is made up of these core values: Trust, Empowerment, & Collaboration. Our company encourages diversity and inclusion in all its forms while our products make the world a more beautiful, safer, and sustainable home.

To learn more about us visit www.certainteed.ca

We look forward to hearing from everyone but please note that due to the volume of resumes submitted, only those selected for next steps will be contacted. To stay in touch with CertainTeed, follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram.

JOIN OUR TEAM!

Patene Building Supplies Ltd. is a distributor of masonry, drywall, steel framing components, insulation, acoustic ceilings, shingles and other building materials for the residential and commercial construction industries. We have fourteen (14) branch locations throughout Ontario & Manitoba to serve our customer base of contractors, builders and retail customers.

We are currently seeking a Delivery Truck Driver (DZ or AZ - Boom Operator) that will make deliveries to customer job sites for our Brantford branch.

Responsibilities:

  • Daily circle check reports and upkeep of company vehicle, including general maintenance (greasing of Boom/ Moffett) and cleanliness of cabs
  • Verifying loads and paperwork (proper loading of materials, tarping, strapping etc.)
  • Completion of all daily (MTO) paperwork requirements
  • Safe and timely deliveries and pick ups of material to locations
  • Participate in loading and unloading materials on outgoing trucks by repetitive lifting or using a boom truck
  • Responsible for directives on site to helper
  • Provide professional and courteous service to customers and sub trades
  • Reporting damaged or missing materials or equipment
  • Adhere and follow company’s Health & Safety policies and regulations
  • Abide by all rules and laws of the road
  • Perform other duties as assigned by management

Job Requirements:

  • High School diploma
  • Driver's Licence (Class D), Air Brake (Z) Endorsement or AZ
  • Standard Transmission experience a must
  • Boom experience preferred
  • Driver’s abstract and good CVOR
  • 1-2 years related experience, preferably in the construction industry
  • Must be dependable and a team player
  • Ability to communicate with co-workers, vendors and customers (verbal and written)

This position offers competitive wages and benefits upon completion of the applicable waiting periods.

We invite qualified candidates to respond with cover letter & resume ONLINE

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Skilled Labourer - Water Damage Technician
description:
Company Description:

Winmar Property Restoration Specialists is one of the largest independent disaster restoration company in Canada. We provide unsurpassed emergency response, restoration and reconstruction services to the insurance industry, residential, commercial and industrial customers. We offer a wide range of services that remediate conditions caused by fires, floods, wind, vehicle impact, mould, environmental hazards, accidents and much more!

Position Summary:

Reporting to our Estimator/Project Manager, the Water Technician supports emergency response and ensures the goals and needs of our customers are being met. The Water Technician must be capable of implementing water remediation procedures consistent with the IICRC S500 Standard.

Responsibilities:

Ensures that all health and safety policies and procedures are followed by other employees and sub-contractors.

Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.

Possess a good working knowledge of the capability and limitations of all equipment used in water damaged environments.

Performs contents handling procedures per company Standard Operating Procedures.

Manages onsite emergency response activities, including pumping water, clearing carpet, removing drywall, mitigation, etc.

Carries out specialty cleaning and degreasing of wall and ceiling surfaces.

Sets up deodorization, negative air, ozone, thermo fogging and related equipment while on site.

Ensures safe installation and operation of scaffolding and ladders while on site.

Assists with pack-out of wet documents, contents and electronics.

Performs pack-out and documentation of contents on site.

Identifies non-restorable contents and completes all required documentation.

· Loads van/trailer with contents on site.

· Correctly applies tags, numbering system and usage contents forms.

WE will train the right candidate! Just have a "can do attitude" and be willing to learn!

Job will require rotationary after hour on-call responsibilities.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$23.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • On call

Experience:

  • restoration: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • drivers license (required)

title: Building Maintenance Technician / Entretien des immeubles
description:
THE ROLE

Join Triovest as Building Maintenance for a downtown high-rise building in Montreal. Reporting to the Director, Property Management, the successful candidate will be responsible for assisting with the day-to-day operations of the property and will perform routine repairs and maintenance to the buildings including electrical/mechanical systems and including exterior parking lot and site repair and maintenance requirements.

LE POSTE

Joignez-vous à Triovest pour vous occuper de l’entretien d’un gratte-ciel situé au centre-ville de Montréal. Relevant du directeur, Gestion immobilière, le candidat retenu devra contribuer aux activités quotidiennes liées à la propriété et effectuer les réparations courantes nécessaires à l’entretien des bâtiments, y compris les systèmes électriques et mécaniques, le parc de stationnement et l’extérieur du bâtiment, conformément aux critères d’entretien.

WHY CHOOSE TRIOVEST?

At Triovest, we have clear guiding core values and principles, and we live by them every day in everything we do. When you join us, you will find that collaboration and trust go hand-in-hand, creating genuine relationships with colleagues, leaders, shareholders, and clients.

As we grow and evolve, you can too. There is ample opportunity to build your skills and grow in your career while working on exciting, industry-leading projects. Your potential is limitless.

Here is some of the great benefits that our employees enjoy:

  • A comprehensive health benefits package, including a health spending account and personal spending account, access to virtual health, and an employee and family assistance program (EFAP)
  • Personal & sick days
  • National and local social committees – fun events, webinars and team building activities held throughout the year for employees
  • Speaker Series to support diversity, equality, and inclusion
  • Corporate Charity Program – making a positive difference and supporting our communities through paid volunteering days and charity matching
  • Tuition for training & development
  • Employee Referral Program – our people are our greatest asset, we’re always looking to grow our teams, and we offer a substantial Employee Referral Program
  • Discounted membership fees with GoodLife
  • Cell phone plan discounts with Rogers


POURQUOI CHOISIR TRIOVEST?

Chez Triovest, nous avons des valeurs fondamentales et des principes directeurs clairs que nous respectons dans tout ce que nous faisons au quotidien. En rejoignant notre entreprise, vous constaterez que la collaboration et la confiance vont de pair et qu’elles favorisent la création de relations authentiques avec vos collègues, dirigeants, actionnaires et clients.

À mesure que l’entreprise grandit, vous aussi pouvez évoluer. Les possibilités de perfectionner vos compétences et d’avancer dans votre carrière, tout en travaillant sur des projets stimulants à la fine pointe de l’industrie, sont vastes. Votre potentiel est infini.

Voici quelques-uns des excellents avantages dont bénéficient nos employés :

  • Couverture médicale complète comprenant un compte Soins de santé et un compte de dépenses personnelles, un accès à un service de santé virtuel et un programme d’aide aux employés et à leur famille (PAEF)
  • Congés personnels et de maladie
  • Comités sociaux nationaux et locaux – activités ludiques, webinaires et activités favorisant l’esprit d’équipe organisés tout au long de l’année pour les employés
  • Série de conférences pour promouvoir la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion
  • Programme de bienfaisance de l’entreprise – pour faire bouger les choses et soutenir nos communautés grâce à des journées de bénévolat payées et à des dons jumelés
  • Frais de formation et de perfectionnement
  • Programme de recommandation par les employés – nos employés sont notre principal atout, nous cherchons toujours à améliorer nos équipes et nous offrons un important programme de recommandation par les employés
  • Frais d’adhésion réduits avec GoodLife
  • Rabais sur le forfait de téléphonie cellulaire avec Rogers


WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?

  • Respond to tenant requests in a timely and professional manner both through the Service Connect and Angus portals and in-person.
  • Monitor and ensure the cleanliness and appearance of all common area, interior and exterior of the building.
  • Complete basic property maintenance repairs, i.e. minor plumbing and electrical repairs, breaker panel reset, light and lock changes, etc.
  • Perform regular building inspections and complete required preventive maintenance (hvac, fire safety, etc.)
  • Perform maintenance tasks and oversee contracted property services to ensure an overall clean and safe property and grounds.
  • Perform daily inspections and maintenance of the interior/exterior property and the building systems.
  • Check and replace lighting and ceiling tiles in common areas and vacancies.
  • Assist with snow removal operations coordinating with the snow removal contractors and ensure entrances are clear of snow and safe for pedestrians. If necessary, remove snow and apply salt.
  • Assisting building contractors as required including monitoring of contractors onsite for safety practices and best practices.
  • Oversee contractor(s) to ensure third party work is performed correctly and as per contract or Purchase Order.
  • Assist and take daily direction from the Senior Building Operator on jobs and tasks to maintain a clean and orderly site
  • Regularly take meter readings.


LA MISSION

  • Répondre aux demandes des locataires de façon rapide et professionnelle par l’entremise des portails Service Connect et Angus ainsi qu’en personne.
  • Surveiller et assurer la propreté et l’apparence de toutes les aires communes, intérieures et extérieures du bâtiment.
  • Effectuer les réparations de base nécessaires à l’entretien de l’immeuble, c.-à-d. les réparations mineures de plomberie et d’électricité, la remise à zéro du panneau de disjoncteur, les changements d’éclairage et des verrous, etc.
  • Inspecter le bâtiment et effectuer les travaux d’entretien préventifs requis de manière régulière (CVCA, sécurité incendie, etc.)
  • Effectuer des tâches d’entretien et superviser les services immobiliers contractuels pour assurer la propreté et la sécurité des biens et des terrains.
  • Réaliser des inspections et des travaux d’entretien sur les parties intérieures et extérieures de l’immeuble ainsi que les systèmes du bâtiment.
  • Vérifier et remplacer l’éclairage et les carreaux de plafond des aires communes et des logements vacants.
  • Participer aux opérations de déneigement aux côtés des entrepreneurs en déneigement et s’assurer que les entrées sont déneigées et qu’elles ne présentent aucun danger pour les piétons. Au besoin, enlever la neige et appliquer du sel.
  • Aider les entrepreneurs en construction au besoin, y compris en assurant la surveillance des pratiques de sécurité et les pratiques exemplaires sur place.
  • Superviser les entrepreneurs pour s’assurer de la bonne exécution des travaux des tiers conformément au contrat ou au bon de commande.
  • Aider et suivre les directives quotidiennes du responsable principal du fonctionnement des immeubles dans le cadre des activités et des tâches requises au maintien de la propreté et de l’ordre du site.
  • Faire régulièrement des relevés de compteur.


WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

We believe success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills:

  • A dedication to providing exceptional service, every day.
  • The ability to adapt to change in a positive way and deliver successful results within a time frame.
  • Must possess a team-oriented approach to meeting goals and objectives.
  • A willingness to admit mistakes and easily digest constructive feedback, using it as a learning opportunity.
  • The ability to perform with exceptional integrity, always.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills.
  • Positive attitude and willingness to work overtime and respond to emergencies.

To fulfill this role successfully, you should demonstrate the following minimum qualifications:

  • Must be fluent in both English and French (written and verbal).
  • A High School or College and a BES designation or working towards designation.
  • One year of related maintenance/operations experience.
  • Knowledge of general maintenance procedures.
  • General knowledge of HVAC electrical/mechanical systems, and life safety systems.
  • Good mechanical and problem solving skills.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.
  • Ability to lift up to 40lbs.
  • Availability to respond to emergency calls outside of regular business hours.


CE QUE NOUS RECHERCHONS

Nous croyons que pour réussir, le titulaire du poste devra démontrer les qualités et les compétences suivantes :

  • Volonté d’offrir tous les jours un service exceptionnel.
  • Capacité à s’adapter, s’améliorer et obtenir d’excellents résultats dans un délai donné.
  • Esprit d’équipe pour atteindre les objectifs établis.
  • Disposition à admettre ses erreurs, à assimiler facilement la critique constructive et à en tirer un apprentissage.
  • Capacité continue à travailler avec une intégrité exceptionnelle.
  • Excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et en communication (à l’oral et à l’écrit).
  • Attitude positive et volonté de faire des heures supplémentaires et de répondre aux urgences.

Pour vous acquitter de ce rôle avec succès, vous devez en outre posséder les qualifications minimales suivantes :

  • Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais (à l’écrit et à l’oral).
  • Diplôme d’études secondaires ou collégiales et titre BES (systèmes environnementaux des bâtiments) (ou en voie d’obtention du titre).
  • Une année d’expérience connexe en entretien et en exploitation.
  • Connaissance des procédures générales d’entretien.
  • Connaissance générale des systèmes électriques et mécaniques de CVCA et des systèmes de sécurité des personnes.
  • Bonnes aptitudes en mécanique et en résolution de problèmes.
  • Maîtrise des applications de la suite Microsoft Office.
  • Capacité de soulever jusqu’à 40 livres (18 kg)
  • Disponibilité pour répondre aux appels urgents en dehors des heures normales de bureau.


ABOUT TRIOVEST

Triovest is a Canadian investment manager and developer of institutional-quality commercial and residential properties. The company offers a full suite of complementary real estate services, including asset management, leasing, property management, sustainability, and risk-mitigation services. Its portfolio of office, industrial, residential, retail, and mixed-use properties is valued at over $12 billion, with $2 billion currently under development. With more than 45 million square feet of real estate assets under management on behalf of individual and institutional investors, Triovest is one of the largest privately-owned commercial real estate companies in Canada.

We believe that the quality of our people directly impacts the quality of our work, therefore we place a high value on attracting and retaining exceptional individuals. Triovest fosters a hands-on approach to value creation for our clients through innovation and collaboration. Learn more about Triovest by visiting our website.


À PROPOS DE TRIOVEST

Triovest est une société canadienne de services de gestion d’investissements et de propriétés immobilières commerciales et résidentielles de qualité institutionnelle. L’entreprise offre une gamme complète de services immobiliers complémentaires, y compris des services de gestion d’actifs, de location, de gestion immobilière, de durabilité et d’atténuation des risques. Son portefeuille d’immeubles de bureaux, industriels, résidentiels, de commerce de détail et à usages multiples est évalué à plus de 12 milliards de dollars, dont deux milliards en projets de développement. Avec plus de 45 millions de pieds carrés d’actifs immobiliers sous sa gestion au nom d’investisseurs individuels et institutionnels, Triovest est l’une des plus importantes sociétés immobilières commerciales d’intérêt privé au Canada.

Comme nous croyons que la qualité de nos employés a une incidence directe sur celle de notre travail, nous attachons une grande importance à attirer et à retenir des candidats d’un niveau exceptionnel. Triovest favorise une approche pratique fondée sur l’innovation et la collaboration pour créer de la valeur pour ses clients. Pour en savoir plus sur Triovest, visitez notre site Web.


Triovest is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We believe in the power of diversity and we are dedicated to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment at Triovest. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request during the recruitment and selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process, please contact eboyack@triovest.com for assistance/support.

À titre d’employeur, Triovest souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi

Nous croyons en la force de la diversité et sommes résolus à créer un milieu de travail diversifié, équitable et inclusif. Des mesures d’adaptation sont offertes aux candidats handicapés sur demande pendant le processus de recrutement et de sélection. Les candidats internes et externes qui ont besoin de mesures d’adaptation dans le cadre du processus de recrutement et de sélection doivent écrire à eboyack@triovest.com pour obtenir de l’aide ou du soutien.

Vaccination Policy

Triovest requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. An exemption from this requirement is provided on an exceptional reason, such as medical, creed or religious reasons in accordance with the relevant Human Rights legislation in the province in which you work.

Politique de vaccination

Triovest exige que tous les employés soient complètement vaccinés contre la COVID-19. Une exemption à cette exigence est accordée pour des raisons exceptionnelles, comme des raisons médicales, religieuses ou fondées sur la croyance, conformément à la législation sur les droits de la personne dans la province où vous travaillez.

#LI-DNI

#INDHP

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Maintenance Technician
Posting #2022-17

At Labstat our strength is our people. For over 45 years we are the premier CRO’s in the Kitchener-Waterloo region. Today Labstat International, is a member of the Certified group of companies and we are recognized as an international “Center of Excellence”. We are the world’s largest independent testing laboratory specializing in analytical chemistry , in vitro toxicology and microbiology for the nicotine and cannabis industries. We are a certified GLP laboratory with both SCC and ISO accreditation.

The Maintenance Technician will work under the direction of the Facility Coordinator and will be responsible for facility maintenance (including preventative) for all buildings.

Primary activities of the job:

  • Facility Maintenance – Internal
    • Build, assemble, install racks, supports, storage units, exhausts, other facility equipment (i.e. Keyboard trays)
    • Painting, cleaning as instructed
    • Replace or repair tubing, ducts, ceiling tiles, bulbs
    • Waste and recycling disposal (non-chemical)
    • Water treatment systems (cartridge replacement, water softer, DI Tanks, Check Drinking water supplies and inform purchasing when low)
    • Collect broken glass throughout the stations in the lab
    • Clean palm readers
    • Assist with moving heavy equipment as requested
    • Assist in tasks required to close Safety Corrective Actions
    • Floor Tile Repairs
    • Organize door keys for facility
    • Replace and monitor air flow for Hepa System in Metals Lab
    • Variety of cleaning duties, throughout all buildings (including lab), as required
    • Refrigerator maintenance for Toxicology– Annually
    • Service Water Shut off monitors when required for facility

  • Facility Maintenance – Exterior
    • Parking Lot maintenance – cleaning, de-icing the parking lots/walkways
  • Small plumbing jobs to sinks and toilets
  • Storage Maintenance
    • Build or assemble shelving/storage units
    • Maintain an organized archive system
    • Discard obsolete items as approved by the Facility Coordinator or other senior individual (i.e. In keeping
      with ISO or other legislative requirements for archiving)
      • Shopping – weekly shopping of approved items (or as requested/required by Facility Manager or Facility Coordinator
      • Assists with Instrumentation tasks as requested or required by the Facility Coordinator
      • Greet Contractors to get them signed in and safety forms when required

  • Back up to Receiver:
  • Physically receive all orders
  • Complete receiving in NetSuite
  • Stock all inventory items, or arrange with end user for pick-up of non-inventory items
  • Perform weekly inventory of gas cylinder inventory and requisition as required
  • Requisition all items for inventory replenishment (via a report in NetSuite)
  • Liaison with Clean Harbors for chemical waste pick-up
  • Perform monthly inventory of specialty glassware cabinet and requisition as required
  • Physically receive all client samples, log them into LIMS and deliver to Product Prep
  • Provide transportation between Labstat buildings or as required, proof of Clean Driving Record (G License)
  • Other duties as assigned


Minimum Qualifications:

  • OSSD
  • Previous experience in a general labor, facility/maintenance position
  • Work cooperatively in a team environment
  • Effective communication skills
  • Work with limited supervision
  • Problem Solving
  • Attention to detail


Labstat offers competitive wages, benefits, training programs.

Labstat values a diverse workforce.


Labstat values Equal Opportunity and embraces diversity. Begin a dynamic and rewarding career by becoming a member of Labstat’s team of professionals!


Labstat is committed to meeting the accessibility requirements under the AODA and we invite applicants to contact us for specific requirements.

title: Custodian
description:
About Apotex Inc.

Apotex Inc. is a proudly Canadian, global pharmaceutical company that produces high-quality, affordable medicines for patients around the world. Apotex employs almost 8,000 people worldwide in manufacturing, R&D, and commercial operations. Apotex Inc. exports to more than 100 countries and territories and operates in more than 45 countries, with a significant presence in Canada, the US, Mexico, and India. Through vertical integration, Apotex is comprised of multiple divisions and affiliates including Apotex Inc., focused on generics; Apobiologix, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on biosimilar development; Aveva, an affiliate of Apotex Inc. fully integrated global developer and manufacturer of complete transdermal solutions; Apotex Consumer Products, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on brand name products; and Global Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (GAPI), a division of Apotex Inc. focused on the manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) for Apotex and third parties. For more information visit: www.apotex.com.

Job Summary

Responsible for performing general cleaning duties inside and outside of Apotex facilities as assigned. Areas inside the building include offices, washrooms, Locker change rooms, Production area, Warehouse and Laboratories. At the Etobicoke site, the buildings include the Engineering Site Office.

Outside the buildings, in winter, operate the snow blower and ice melter spreader, in conjunction with manually keeping the walkways, exits and entrances clear of ice and snow.

Job Responsibilities
  • Offices

Clean offices which include dusting and polishing furniture, vacuuming, sweeping, mopping, washing walls and windows. Remove garbage and recycling from the centralized areas.

  • Washrooms

    Clean washrooms and change rooms and replenish supplies. (soaps, paper towels, hand cream, etc.)

  • Warehouse

    Clean warehouse floors, shelves, walls and where applicable, any marks on the floor from the forklift wheels.

  • GMP areas (Production, Packaging)

    Clean the Good manufacturing Practices (GMP) areas, which include washing walls, stairs, ceilings and floors. Clean pails and drums and replenishing supplies.

  • Cafeteria

    Clean the cafeteria, including the food preparation area, freezers, coolers and storage areas. Remove Garbage and recycling materials as needed. Maintain coffee brewers as required.

  • Clean the Laboratory and replenish supplies as required.
  • Clean the Controlled Substances/CT vault and walk in refrigerator.
  • Dispose of all garbage and recycling following proper procedures.
  • Operate various cleaning machines including floor polisher, vacuums and floor scrubbing machines.
  • Operate the compactors.
  • Utilize standardized cleaning agents as trained.
  • Ensure that all work is performed in accordance with Good Manufacturing Practices, (cGMP), Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s) and established safety standards (SWP).
  • Work as a member of a team to achieve all outcomes.
  • Perform all work in support of our Corporate Values of Pride, Accountability, Integrity and Diligence.
  • Perform all work in accordance with all established regulatory and compliance and safety requirement.
  • Perform all other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements
  • Grade 12 education;
  • The ability to lift 50 lbs;
  • Good command of the English language (ability to read, write and understand English);
  • Good oral communication skills;
  • Good interpersonal skills;
  • Previous cleaning experience preferred;
  • Physically fit

COVID-19 VACCINATION POLICY: In accordance with Apotex Inc. (“Apotex”) policy, as of November 15, 2021, all individuals entering a Canadian site (including but not limited to employees, visitors, contractors and agency workers) must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in accordance with the current government requirements. Further, all employees must maintain all future booster vaccines as approved and recommended by Health Canada. Accommodation from these requirements for reasons pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code, or any other applicable law (most commonly for medical and/or religious reasons) will be reviewed and considered by Apotex.


At Apotex, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported.

Apotex offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

title: Painter/Drywall Installer
description:
The Byng Group is a leading interior renovation general contractor with more than 50 years' experience and a team of over 500, specializing in high-rise rental properties.


We are currently hiring Painter/drywaller installers throughout the Ottawa area to join our growing team!

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Paint walls, ceilings, doors, hallways, shelving in Apartment Units
  • Prepares surfaces to be plastered
  • Fills in nicks and cuts in ceilings, walls, and partitions using plaster
  • Repair walls with drywall
  • Sand areas after each coat making drywall paint-ready
  • Drywall Repairs, Taping and Plastering
  • Drywall Installation is considered an asset
  • Framing with Metal Studs considered an asset

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • At least 3 yearsâ€™ experience as a painter and drywaller
  • Valid Ontario Driver's License with a clean Driverâ€™s Abstract
  • Able to problem solve on-site and off-site
  • Ability to follow and complete a daily, weekly & monthly task schedule
  • Own Tools Required. They are not supplied.

WHY CHOOSE US!

  • Annual Bonus
  • Company Events
  • Supportive Team Atmosphere
  • #B

title: Drywall Installer for Residential and Light Commercial
description:
Handyman Connection is seeking an experienced home improvement contractor to do drywall installation and repairs.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work.  Our customers love us!  We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!

We take care of the things that you don't want to.  We find the jobs, we schedule appointments, we manage the customer, and we take care of the payments.  You can focus on doing the work.  You decide what you want to do, where you want to do it, and when you want to do it.  You can work as little or as much as you like.

What You Will Receive

  • Earn $42-48/hour, depending on your skills and experience
  • Work as an Independent Contractor
  • Flexibility - you choose the work you do, when you do it, and where you go
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking, billing
  • Free access to custom Mobile App for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaigns that brings us well qualified customers
  • Branded apparel and signage

Responsibilities

The handyman will need to have expertise in drywall installation and finishing. You must have basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate with others with a positive attitude.  We are looking for a craftsman or craftswoman who can bid work and produce it.  If you have experience in the following skill areas, you're the kind of person we need to add to our team:

  • Drywall Installation
  • Drywall Repair / Patching
  • Trims/Baseboards/Caulking
  • Handyman, General Home Repairs and Maintenance Work

Requirements

  • Must have 10 years experience in the remodeling or home repair trades
  • Must pass screening process which includes reference and background checks
  • Must have current Driver's License and Insurance
  • Must have tools and vehicle
  • Must have a smart phone and access to the internet

Ready to Learn More?

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.  Check us out on the web at: ottawa.handymanconnection.com

title: Skilled labourer
description:
Our client is growing and looking for a fourth member of full-time crew. Company philosophy is to train workers to ensure our timelines, quality of work and customer satisfaction is met.

The right candidate must be able to lead tasks with minimal supervision and must have a minimum of five years of renovation experience with relevant construction education. One of the key requirements of this role is leadership ability. The candidate must be able build and maintain strong site team morale.

The position is for a small-sized General Contracting company in the residential and commercial market that focuses on interior renovations for clients of various sizes across Toronto and the GTA. This is a strategic hire for the company as we are looking for an individual who is passionate about the industry and enjoys learning about construction techniques/methods, and who will be a future candidate for a foreman or site manager.

Requirements:
  • Must have a valid Ontario Driver's License, and your own vehicle; a truck is preferable.
  • Must have, at minimum, cordless drill, tool belt and hand tools.
  • Must be clean cut and presentable to clients – public perception is very important.
  • Must be hard working, flexible, reliable and take pride in your work.
  • Must have the ability to work within a team as well as alone.
  • Must provide a criminal record check.
  • Must provide a resume and professional references upon request.
  • Post-secondary education is preferred in a construction-related field of study.
Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Assist the Supervisor or General Contractor with basic work site project management.
  • Read and interpret plans, instructions, and specifications to determine daily work activities.
  • Provide assistance to sub trades, skilled trades, Supervisor and General Contractor on the job-site when required.
  • Build, install, and repair structural woodwork, flooring, ceilings and cabinetry.
  • Operate, maintain, and calibrate hand and power tools.
  • Read and comprehend plans and blueprints.
  • Clean and make minor repairs to equipment and tools when required.
  • Follow proper safety rules to maintain a safe working environment.
  • Operate all equipment in a safe and efficient way according to all relevant legislation,
  • policies and procedures.
  • Set up the accompanying tools, equipment, materials and supplies for trades, such as carpenters, drywallers, plumbers, electricians, etc., who are completing work on-site, when needed.
  • Load, unload and organize tools, equipment, materials and supplies to and from the work truck, work site, and designated tool boxes and bins.
  • Maintain a clean and organized work site to eliminate possible hazards.
  • Ensure daily time sheets and any other forms requested by Supervisor are consistently completed by team.
  • Maintain daily communication with General Contractor and record daily construction activity.
  • Assist with communication between sub trades, skilled trades, labourers and GC.
Knowledge -The employee must have proficient knowledge in the following areas:
  • Comprehensive knowledge of general construction and repair methods, and the proper utilization and care of tools, materials, and equipment used in building construction.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of traditional building materials, practices, and techniques
  • Strong knowledge of electrical, plumbing, tiling, drywalling, framing, flooring, painting and carpentry.
  • Minimum technical college education but college- or university-level education is preferred (post-secondary education such as George Brown College, Ryerson University, or equivalent is ideal).
Skills/Experience -The employee must demonstrate the following skills/experience:
  • Five (5) years or more of renovation experience.
  • Strong carpentry skills, and general trade and interior finishing experience.
  • Plumbing, electrical and HVAC experience is preferred.
  • Excellent project management, organizational and time management skills.
  • Strong verbal and listening communications skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to work as a team or unaccompanied on various tasks.
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English.
Personal Attributes:
  • The employee must demonstrate the following personal attributes:
  • Fast-thinking and good judgement (common sense).
  • Hardworking, detail-oriented and thorough.
  • Honest, trustworthy and flexible.
  • Respectful and conscientious of the people and environment around them.
  • Demonstrates sound work ethics and self-motivation to work with minimal supervision.
  • Interacts with supervisors, coworkers and clients in a positive, courteous and respectful manner.

title: General Laborer (Construction)
description:
Job Description: All-purpose Renovation Contractor
Go Industries is looking for an ambitiousAll-purpose Renovation Contractor. You will be responsible for all renovation work including layout, installation, and repairs for our client’s commercial, industrial, and residential customers. 

The Opportunity:
We are looking for an experienced full-time All-purpose Renovation Contractor to join our prestigious heating and cooling client’s team. This is a full-time opportunity with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow. 
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Must have expertise in multiple types of repairs, maintenance, and remodeling.
  • Must possess basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate.
  • General Carpentry - Rough and Finish.
  • Ability to Upgrades / Remodel / Refresh / Remodel all types of commercial, residential, and industrial spaces. 
  • Painting Interior and Exterior.
  • Drywall Repair/Patching / Caulking.
  • Electrical knowledge.
  • Minor Plumbing and Minor Electrical Knowledge.
  • Flooring Repair and Installation.
  • Ceramic Tile Installation.
  • Handyman, General Home Repairs and Maintenance Work.

Qualifications:
  • 2-5 years of renovation experience. 
  • Valid Driver’s license with clean abstract.
  • Able to work at multiple sites in Ontario Primarily in the Hamilton area.
  • Experience working in other trades is a bonus. (HVAC/Plumbing/Electrical)
  • Ceramic tile installation is a bonus.

Pay rate: 
  • Up to $40.00 per hour for the right candidate. 
 




    About Go Heating/Natural Direct Canada:

    GO Heating & Cooling has been proudly serving the communities Simcoe County, Bruce, Grey, Kawartha Lakes, Muskoka, Dufferin, Peel, York, Durham Region and surrounding areas since 1977. Our reputation has been built on Quality Service, Honesty and Integrity and this has made us the service provider of choice. Over the years, the GO company has grown but our commitment to our core values and to our community remains the same today as it did when we first opened our doors. Today we’re more than just furnaces and air conditioners – we’re home comfort experts. We know what it takes to keep your home healthy and comfortable, each and every day.

title: Nutrien Redwater: Scaffolder Journeyman and Apprentice (Redwater, AB)
description:
SCAFFOLDER - APPRENTICES AND JOURNEYPERSON: Local Drive-in position

Shift is 5x10


MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • Must have a previous Scaffolding experience.
  • Valid certification from an accredited apprenticeship board.
  • Must be able to work for 8 hours at a time in an environment where temperatures may reach from 0 to 60° C, both indoors and outdoors in the sun.
  • Work in an environment in which vibrations and noise are moderate to severe and noise level may require the wearing of hearing protection devices.
  • Must be able to work in confined spaces for 4-7 hours per day; stand or walk for long periods.
  • Able to wear a full-face respirator for extended periods.
  • Climb and maintain balance on ladders and scaffolding at extreme heights.
  • Stoop, kneel, crouch and crawl.
  • Lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 pounds often and occasionally up to 100 pounds.
  • Maintain footing on surfaces which are sometimes slippery.
  • See well (naturally or with correction) and distinguish colors.
  • Hear well (naturally or with hearing aid).
  • Must be able to effectively communicate with other employees and supervision.
  • Use arms and hands to reach for, handle, and feel objects; and coordinate well the use of hands or fingers and eyes.
  • Must have reliable transportation to and from the work location.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
  • Must comply with all safety regulations of Brock Canada.
  • Ensures that work is performed in accordance with Contractor Specifications and/or as directed by the Contractor’s Representative.
  • Ensures they are following the applicable Contractor’s Safety Procedures, OH&S, Provincial and/or Contractor’s safety requirements.
  • Assures that the proper materials, tools and equipment is being used for the specified tasks.
  • Reads specifications, such as blueprints and data, to determine requirements.
  • Able to install steel pipes, support braces and clamps to form bases for scaffolds.
  • Able to dismantle scaffold upon job completion.
  • Can identify the type of scaffolding material to be used for the job (frame, tube & clamp, system).
  • Able to thoroughly describe scaffolding materials.
  • Sort and organize material
  • Able to count and place orders for material
  • Required to complete safety paperwork such as FLRA’s, Start Cards, etc.
  • Other duties as assigned

Department: Operations
This is a non-management position
This is a contract position

title: Labourer (6 Month Contract)
description:
Location



Edmonton - 204, 4212 Gateway Blvd. NW



Our Company




At Brookfield Properties, the foundation of our success is firmly rooted in our people.


Our company is comprised of experts across a range of specialties who share a goal of ensuring our properties are continuously evolving to meet the needs of our communities and stakeholders. To meet this goal, we hire visionary, entrepreneurial talent who help us innovate and enhance our business. We build collaborative teams who value integrity, creativity and diversity.


Our teams operate an iconic portfolio of irreplaceable properties within the world’s most dynamic markets. As one of the largest real estate services companies, we provide management and development expertise exclusively for properties owned by Brookfield Asset Management.




Job Description




Your Team


Reporting directly to the Site Manager, the Labourer (6 Month Contract) performs comprehensive housekeeping duties on the interior and exterior of homes to ensure home is clean and presentable at all times, the construction site is tidy and safe, and clear of debris and hazards.




Your Key Deliverables


Construction:

+ Collect and dispose of debris at construction sites complying with waste recycling programs

+ Performs scheduled cleaning activities in units under construction

+ Set up heat and hoarding, as required

+ Assist team members in miscellaneous tasks, if needed






Quality Control:

+ Ensure any excess materials are moved to the next site for use and the Site Manager is notified of the material count

+ Ensure garbage collection bins are used efficiently






Reporting:

+ Inform and report on Site Management Team on site conditions

+ Report any onsite safety concerns to immediate supervisor

+ Participate in safety inspection programs and training






Relationships:

+ Develop and build working relationship with managers, construction team and trades






Must Haves

+ 1+ year of construction experience and/or vocational training

+ Ability to work in a fast pace and physically demanding environment

+ Knowledge of multiple trades functions and use of tools

+ Effective customer service and communication skills

+ Ability to perform physical duties, to take directions, and to work in a team environment

+ Ability to work at various locations

+ Valid drivers license and vehicle




The position will include the following physical requirements:

+ Walk uneven terrain

+ Climb stairs

+ Lift/push/pull up to 100 pounds

+ Ability to hear for safety reasons- hearing aids are acceptable

+ Vision- 20/20 and is acceptable if they are wearing glasses or contacts

+ Crawl- maneuver through difficult areas

+ Kneel down

+ Climb up and down a ladder











We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are grateful for your interest in this position, however, only candidates selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

title: General Labourer (1 Year Contract)
description:
#BeExtraordinary

At Andrew Peller Limited (APL), we deliver the perfect brand experience for every lifestyle, occasion, and generation. Through collaboration, open communication, honesty, drive to win, and accountability, we inspire teammates to be extraordinary every day.

Who We Are

We are one of Canada's largest and oldest wine companies with a rich heritage in quality winemaking.

We produce some of Canada's most recognized brands and offer our teammates a challenging and rewarding employment experience.

We are seeking twoGeneral Labourersto join our Operations Team!

Reporting into the Packaging Manager, The Bottling Line Operator will be responsible for providing support to the Lead Line Operator while working with the Bottle shop team to ensure the efficient production of finished goods which meets both Company and Government quality and work safe practices.

We are looking for a teammate with:

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Five years' work experience or training in a similar manufacturing operation.
  • Packaging quality experience
  • HACCP and ISO training
  • Forklift training
  • Oral and Written communication skills

This teammate will be accountable for:

  • Participates in training program and qualification process for a Line Operator Level 3.
  • Trouble shoots and make minor adjustments, fully change over All Lines
  • PS and Cold glue Labeler sets-up and adjustments to meet optimum efficiency
  • Maintains inputs on the PLC and mechanical adjustments on the filers, labelers, packers, and check-Scales.
  • Inspect and make machine set-up adjustments to ensure the product is free of defects and meets final product specifications i.e.; PS and Cold Glue labelers
  • Assists maintenance and lead operators during scheduled shut downs
  • Assist when required to perform hot water and chemical sanitization of fillers, filter housings, rinsers. Perform filter integrity Test.
  • Reprocessing as required i.e., re-labeling, dumping, inspection.
  • Ensures safe work practices are followed. Reports work related injuries and hazards immediately to the Production Supervisor.
  • Maintains quality standards by following Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP's). Reports any and all quality concerns to the Production Supervisor.
  • Participates in the Maintenance of all areas in the Bottle Shop through collaboration with all Team members.
  • Training of other team members upon request
  • Demonstrates continuous improvement in the competencies of a Level 1 and Level 2 line operator.
  • Follows safe work procedures and practices and reports all unsafe working conditions / hazards to their reporting Manager.
  • Will be required to work afternoon shifts and third shift occasionally

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest; only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. In addition, per our "Internal Job Posting Policy"; internal candidates should be in their current position for one (1) year and their performance must be in good standing.

Andrew Peller Limited is committed to meeting the needs of persons with temporary and/or permanent disabilities in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We are happy to discuss any need for accommodation in the workplace and will make an effort to meet those needs in a timely manner by preventing and removing barriers to accessibility in the areas of information, communications, and employment.

title: Labourers
description:
• An excellent opportunity to start your career in a cutting-edge organization!
  • Enjoy a competitive $22 hourly wage plus overtime and other attractive benefits! 
  • Travel to various locations throughout Northern Alberta and BC! 

About White Water Management Ltd.

Whitewater Management is a cutting-edge fluids management company, started by industry leaders with decades of expertise in the industry, a great reputation, and an excellent environmental and safety record. Experts in engineering, remediation chemicals, and regulatory compliance; we handle water and industrial fluid needs for our clients, offering them the best and most flexible water management programs. 

For more information about our organization, please visit our website by clicking here.

About the Opportunity

White Water Management is currently looking to employ multiple Labourers to join our Water Transport Technician team on a full-time, casual basis. Our projects are primarily based in Chilliwack, Grande Prairie, Fort St. John, Red Deer, Fort McMurray, Prince George, and other cities throughout Northern Alberta and BC. 

Reporting to the Site Superintendent, your responsibilities and duties will include:

  • Rigging in hose lines for water transfer
  • Operating equipment (loader, skidsteer)
  • Operating, maintaining, and troubleshooting water pumps
  • Tracking water flows and water pressure
  • Building and tearing down frac ponds
  • Testing, repairing and maintaining hoses
  • Changing out equipment as needed
  • Communicating regularly with site supervisors and team members
  • Completing other related duties as assigned

More About You 

In order to qualify for this role, you will need a valid Class 5 Drivers' License, with a minimum of 3 years of off-highway driving experience with a pick-up truck, hauling a trailer or other comparable vehicle. In addition, you will need to have completed H2S Alive and First Aid training. Previous experience in the oilfield or water management industries will be considered an asset, but are not required. 

As our ideal candidate, you are safety oriented and customer focused. You have a mechanical aptitude, basic math skills, and strong communication and teamwork skills. Candidates who are reliable, self-motivated, and eager to learn are strongly encouraged to apply.

This opportunity is Veteran friendly, and we also welcome seasonal workers from the Agricultural background during off-season. 

Please note: Pre-employment illicit drug testing will be required.

About the Benefits

In exchange for your hard work and dedication, you can expect a competitive starting wage of $22 per hour plus overtime, along with:

  • Transportation to/from project sites from our depot locations in Grande Prairie & Innisfail, Alberta
  • Paid travel time while en route to and from project sites
  • Accommodations provided
  • Meals provided (or a meal allowance when away from our camps)
  • $100 boot allowance
  • Extended health, vision and dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Wellness program
  • Growth opportunities
  • Company events such as our annual Christmas party
  • The opportunity to join a friendly tight-knit team environment

If you are a collaborative team-player and this opportunity excites you, then we want to hear from you - apply today!

In addition, you will need to have completed\xa0H2S Alive\xa0and\xa0First Aid training. title: Scaffolder - All Levels
description:
SUMMARY:
A Scaffolders’ duties may vary from site to site, however, the main responsibilities of a Scaffolder are to erect temporary work platforms using steel pipes, support braces and clamps with a high standard of workmanship using a variety of tools. Scaffolders work both indoors and outdoors, year-round in commercial and industrial settings.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • Apprenticeship level ticket or proof of hours. 
  • CSTS, Fall Protection, H2S Alive, Confined Space, Common Safety Orientation 
  • Must be local to Medicine Hat  Area
  • Must be able to work for 8 hours at a time in an environment where temperatures may reach from 0 to 60° C, both indoors and outdoors in the sun.
  • Work in an environment in which vibrations and noise are moderate to severe and noise level may require the wearing of hearing protection devices.
  • Climb and maintain balance on ladders and scaffolding at extreme heights.
  • Stoop, kneel, crouch, and crawl.
  • Lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 pounds often and occasionally up to 100 pounds.
  • Maintain footing on surfaces which are sometimes slippery.
  • Must be able to effectively communicate with other employees and supervisors.
  • Use arms and hands to reach for, handle, and feel objects; and coordinate well the use of hands or fingers and eyes.
  • Must be able to supply a negative Drug & Alcohol Pre-Access test.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
  • Must comply with all safety regulations of Soogadin Field Services
  • Ensures that work is performed in accordance with Contractor specifications and/or as directed by the Contractor’s representative.
  • Ensures they are following the applicable Site/Contractor’s Safety Procedures and safety requirements.
  • Assures that the proper materials, tools, and equipment is being used for the specified tasks.
  • Reads specifications, such as blueprints and data, to determine requirements.
  • Able to install steel pipes, support braces, and clamps to form bases for scaffolds.
  • Able to dismantle scaffold upon job completion.
  • Can identify the type of scaffolding material to be used for the job (frame, tube & clamp, system).
  • Able to thoroughly describe scaffolding materials.
  • Sort and organize material
  • Able to count and place orders for material
  • Required to complete safety paperwork such as FLRA’s, Start Cards, etc.
  • Other duties as assigned
