title: Skilled Ground Worker in Fort McMurray, Alberta | Careers at North American Construction Group
description:
Position Scope

NACG is looking for a labourer to work on a remote mining site in the Fort McMurray area. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Site: Fort Hills

Schedule: 14x7- 12 hours (paid for 11.5 hours) (Days and nights)

Accommodations: Camp provided

Transportation: Flights are provided to and from Edmonton or Calgary. All individuals utilizing provided flights must be fully vaccinated as per federal transportation regulations. Bussing provided from Fort McMurray to site (before and after shifts)

Overtime: Provided after 8 hours a day or 44 hours a week

 

The successful candidate will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955. 

 

Qualifications

  • Successful applicants must to be willing to help out in all tasks for general labourer duties.
  • Must be physically fit and be able to lift 50 pounds
  • Must have a valid driver's license.
  • High school diploma, GED, and/or post-secondary education is considered an asset.

Summary

All successful candidates must:

  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  • Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  • Disclose COVID-19 vaccination status:
    • Fully immunized individuals must provide government issued proof of vaccination to be exempt from site testing requirements
    • Individuals not fully immunized may be subject to site COVID-19 testing requirements and associated costs
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

    Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

    All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  • CSO or BSO Certification
  • Copy of Valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Copy of recent Driver’s Abstract
  • VOID cheque/direct deposit form
  • Silica Awareness
  • Hydrogen Sulphide Awareness

  • Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  • Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  • An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  • After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

  • Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

     

    NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

    Overview

    North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.  In that time, we’ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. We’ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers. 

    In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

    • Significant Growth – As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
    • Long Term Contracts – With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
    • Commitment To Safety – With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
    • Competitive Compensation – NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

    North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

     

    Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Landscape Construction Labourer
description:
The Yard Barber is seeking to hire a Landscape Construction Labourer.

Job Details:
  • Full time.
  • Permanent.
  • 40 hrs/week.
  • As soon as possible.
  • Various locations in Calgary, AB.
  • Wages based on experience.
  • This position is for year-round employment for the right person.

Responsibilities:
  • Sod install.
  • Retaining walls.
  • Flagstone.
  • Construct walkways and driveways.
  • Cart and spread topsoil and other materials.
  • Must be able to work under pressure.
  • Repetitive task.
  • Handling heavy loads.

Must have:
  • Minimum of 2 years experience.
  • Valid drivers’ license.
  • Various landscaping knowledge.
  • Fence and deck experience.
  • Physically demanding.
  • Attention to detail.
  • General knowledge of landscaping grading.




    About The Yard Barber:

    The Yard Barber is a family owned and operated company that has been servicing Calgary and area as a fully licensed and insured contractor and has more than 15 years of experience.

title: General Labourer (Contract)
description:
Who We’re Looking for:
IMI is looking for someone who’s self-motivated and result-oriented for upcoming contracts as a General Laborer.

We’re hoping you are someone who has a willingness to accept instruction and a variety of new tasks with a positive attitude. With that being said, we hope that most importantly, you have a high degree of safety awareness.

Experience/Education:
  • The right candidate for this position must have verification of their high school diploma or GED, as well as six months of experience in construction or in a warehouse.

If you suit the above, you could be responsible for:
  • Cleanup of debris.
  • Sweeping/ lifting/ loading and unloading materials.
  • Required lifting boxes up to 100 lbs.
Worksites can be dangerous, so in order to ensure your safety at all times, we require you always possess a hard hat, steel-toe boots, work gloves, safety vests, and work goggles.

Due to the many responsibilities we are tasking our employees with, we ask they have some or all of the following:
  • Hardhat.
  • Safety Vest.
  • Steel-toed work boots.
  • Work gloves.
  • Safety glasses.
  • Mask.

Additional Job Details: 
  • Work Location: Vaughan, ON.
  • Contract Length: TBD *end dates are subject to change.
  • Benefits Offered: Health insurance, Dental insurance, other types of insurance.
  • Temporary Full-time/ Overtime Opportunity: Yes.
  • Pay Frequency: Weekly.

Who We Are:
Founded in 1998, IMI is the largest installation resource company in North America, delivering technical resources and solutions to the supply chain industry. Offering turnkey installation talent and OEM product deployment in fields such as manufacturing, supply chain, automation, and robotics.

IMI has qualified, trained, and deployed thousands of technicians throughout North America and has worked with some of the world’s most progressive Fortune 500 companies for over 20 years. For more information, visit imipeople.com.


About IMI – A Global People Company:

Providing Technical Resources & Solutions to the Supply Chain Industry.For over 20 years, IMI has provided people with amazing careers with the world's best companies. As an IMI technician you will be an integral part of building North America's constantly evolving supply chain network. From conveyor systems, to automation technology to robotics systems. IMI is hiring at all times, at all levels:General LaborersMillwrightsMechanical Conveyor InstallersSite SupervisorsElectriciansAutomation Field TechnciansAnd many others!

title: General Laborer
description:
Mirage Renovations Inc. is a company that specializes in the renovation and maintenance of high-rise rental apartment buildings.

We are a rapidly growing company looking for a reliable, hard-working, and dedicated General Laborer to join our team.

You will be responsible for duties such as:
  • Jobsite cleanup.
  • Moving various materials (tiles, kitchen cabinets, drywall, etc.).
  • Assisting skilled contractors with their work.
  • Demolitions.

A Successful Candidate Requires:
  • 2-3 years of experience.
  • Must have reliable transportation to commute between multiple sites in a workday.
  • An ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
  • Must be currently located in or willing to relocate to Toronto.

Why You Should Join Our Team:
  • Travel during work hours paid.
  • No weekends!
  • Room for growth!
  • Paid as a sub-contractor for maximum earning potential.

Other Information:
  • This is a full-time position (not for general contractors). Serious applicants only.
  • Salary based on experience and will be fair and negotiable.
  • $20 - $22/hr.
  • Mon - Friday.
  • 8-10 hour shifts.

Our service area encompasses the whole GTA.




    About Mirage Renovations:

    Mirage renovations Inc. is an interior renovations company that specializes in residential apartment building rental units. We pride ourselves on a quick job, done well and at a reasonable price. Years of experience in the rental apartment sector has allowed us to build a highly dedicated and efficient team that is able to tackle jobs of any size. Capital Projects: - Drop Ceiling installation - Corridor painting - Metal door and frame replacements - Finish work after large scale building updates - Garage Painting - Balcony Repairs - Fences Suite turnovers: We can handle all the components of a complete turnover: - Demolition - Plaster & paint - Electrical - Plumbing - Cabinetry - Tub Surrounds - Flooring - Baseboards - Tiles - Tub surrounds - Doors & Frames - Cleaning In-suite/ Odd jobs: We are well- equipped to provide solutions to all your maintenance needs. - Repairing flood damage - Plaster repairs - Door replacement - Painting - Finish work after plumbing repairs - Leaky faucets - Hardware replacement - Boiler room repairs - Fire- rating updates

title: Labourer
description:
We are hiring immediately for professional general labourers, pressure washers, softwash labourers, exterior cleaning staff to help us continue to grow.  Wake up each morning and actually want to come to this general labour job. No pressure washing or softwash experience necessary!.  Our general labour pros are trained and provide outstanding residential and small commercial pressure cleaning and softwashing service. Our softwashing teams clean exterior of houses, roofs, gutters, windows and more. We hire from the construction, roofing, contractor, concrete, softwashing, pressure washing, lawn care, lawn maintenance world and more!

If you are looking for a career and not just another job we may be a good fit for YOU!  The owners and managers support and appreciate our employees.  We provide an amazing company culture!  We work hard, but we have fun at the same time.
Compensation:
  • Vacation pay
  • Promotions are available
  • Bonus available for each job completed with no callbacks, production-based pay. So the more efficient you work the money you make
  • Weekly pay-  between $1,000-$1,5000 weekly.  We provide performance pay so the more efficient you clean the more you earn!
  • Tell us your goals and we’ll help you achieve them! 
Some Qualifications: 

  • Not afraid of heights and able to work alone at times moving and climbing ladders
  • Valid driver's license with a clean driving record

Please apply today so we can meet you.

title: General Labourer - Summer Student (Acheson)
description:
Position Scope:

This position is located at our Acheson shop.

 

This is a SUMMER position only.

Responsibilities:
  • Help with disposal of surplus material in Acheson
  • Help clean up outside yard and sea-cans
Qualifications:

 

  • Must have valid class 5 driver's license
  • Demonstrate safety at all times
  • Standard first aid course

title: Labourer
description:
Looking to Start Your Driving Career? Looking to Learn New Skills? Austin Powder is seeking to add a career-minded entry-level team member! This is a full-time opportunity to handle site maintenance, manage inventory, be responsible for customer deliveries, as well as, customer support and assist the at job sites.

This position offers a competitive wage and generous benefits. Our benefits include extended health, dental, voluntary RPP, AD&D, weekly income (STD), long term disability, group life and dependent life. If this sounds like the opportunity that you've been searching for, apply for this blasting worker position today!

ABOUT AUSTIN POWDER

Austin Powder manufactures a full line of industrial explosives and provides blasting services to customers in the quarrying, mining, construction, and oil and gas industries -- all for the purpose of providing aggregate, energy, and mineral products to consumers.

Our values of commitment to safety, attention to detail, and the power of family are the very bedrock upon which our company's culture is built. We truly value our team which is why we offer competitive opportunities for career growth and advancement.

A DAY IN THE LIFE

As a Labourer, you will handle packaged explosive products, operate manufacturing vehicles on the job site (if licensed), and load and drive box trucks (if licensed). All activity is done in strict compliance with safety and company procedures. You will assist blasters load and stem blast holes prior to initiating the blast. This position involves being outside in all weather conditions, lifting and carrying 50+ pounds of product and other materials, and frequently squatting and bending as you prepare for the shot.

Safety is always a priority whether you are driving or assisting the Blaster in charge with site preparation and equipment setup. Under the direction of the Blaster in charge or Location Manager, you will inspect product bins, inventory of product, and complete required paperwork. To keep your truck and equipment running properly, you will perform both general and preventative maintenance. You will enjoy keeping busy and being on the move throughout the day.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must submit drivers abstract with resume
  • Valid Class 5 - no restrictions and desire to obtain Class 3
  • Preferred Class 3 license
  • Ability to work outside in all weather conditions
  • Physical ability to lift 23 kg.
  • Must meet requirements of all Provincial and Federal explosive laws and qualify as an ERD explosive possessor

Are you a self-starter that is hardworking and passionate? Do you enjoy being outdoors? Are you a dependable team player? Are you willing to learn and expand your skills? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this Labourer position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, and for inquiring about, discussing or disclosing compensation. Moreover, these regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Carpenter – Residential / Light Commercial
description:
Carpenter – Residential / Light Commercial

We have year-round work with over 50% repeat/referral customer base and are seeking experienced Craftsmen and Technicians with a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company serving (INSERT City/Metro Area/County/Local geographic reference) with excellent customer service and quality work

What You Will Receive

  • Earn $40-45/hour or up to $1,200/week, depending on your skills and availability
  • Work as an Independent Contractor or an Employee - part-time or full-time - on your own schedule
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking, billing
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers
  • Branded apparel and signage

Responsibilities

The Carpenter performs and coordinates the cutting, shaping and installation of building materials during the construction, remodeling or repair in a residential and light commercial setting. You must have experience as a residential carpenter, and you must have a positive attitude.

  • Constructing, installing, and repairing structures and fixtures of wood, plywood and wallboard.
  • Ability to determine and clearly identify proper materials and material quantities for new and existing projects.
  • Evaluate customer requests, price projects, troubleshoot customer issues, and present a description of a work order to a customer.

Requirements

  • Must have current Driver's License and submit to a background check
  • Must have tools, vehicle and good references
  • Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades
  • Must pass screening process
  • Must have a smart phone and access to the internet

We are always looking to speak with an experienced handyman or craftsman who has experience as a Remodeler, Carpenter, Electrician, Plumber, Painter, Mason, or Installer or any skilled tradesman (apprentice, journeyman or master level) from the residential or commercial construction industry. Please, no Project Managers or primarily New Construction.

Ready to Learn More?

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.

What our customers say:

Watch More

Why Handyman Connection?

title: Carpenter
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The carpenter is responsible for constructing and maintaining buildings.

Required knowledge includes: construction and remodeling trades, practices, procedures, techniques, tools and equipment, materials, specifications, quality control, cost control and safety.

The carpenter must be proficient at the following tasks: hanging doors, drilling and setting door hardware, setting windows, layout for stairs and common rafters, formwork, and reading blueprints. The carpenter must also possess the mathematical and analytical skills necessary to do materials estimates.

Qualifications

  • Ticketed Journeyperson Carpenter
  • Experienced with a large general contractor
  • Valid drivers license and clean drivers abstract preferred
  • Must be able to successfully pass criminal record check


Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

title: Tunneling Labourer AB
description:
We are a growing tunneling contractor based in Calgary, AB that offers its employees exciting opportunities for career growth, a great working environment, and competitive compensation.

The Company: Bothar Inc. specializes in trenchless tunneling technologies, balancing cost-effective drilling solutions with environmental protection. Our trenchless tunneling technology, Direct Pipe, presents unique cost saving and scheduling opportunities for challenging pipeline and municipal projects.

Bothar is respected in the trenchless contracting industry by clients and employees alike, for our integrity, commitment to excellence, and customer orientated service.

Our great team of staff are the best in their field. They are committed to collaboration, quality, and safety. We invest in our people, and they deliver excellence! We believe in leading through innovation and providing superior value and service to our clients and partners by with safe, high quality, and environmentally conscious trenchless solutions.

The Position: As we are expanding our field of operations, we are in need of more motivated and hardworking crew members to join our team. The Labourer position is responsible for assisting in the timely and technical execution of installations, as a part of the operations team on project sites. 

Labourers will have the opportunity to work with equipment used in Micro Tunneling, Horizontal Direction Drilling (HDD), Auger Boring, and Direct Pipe trenchless installations. 

Opportunities are currently available at various project locations across BC and Alberta. 

Compensation includes:

  •    Equitable pay based on experience
  •    Applicable overtime
  •    Living out allowance or paid accommodations
  •    Travel expense coverage

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  •  Maintain cleanliness / organization / stock of parts container and tool container
  •  Remove/Install cables on spools during de mob / mob.
  •  Efficiently pull and install tunneling utility lines (electrical cables, slurry lines, hydraulics)
  •  Effectively connect / install victaulic clamps and hydraulic connections
  •  Rig, hoist, and direct lifting equipment
  •  Load and unload trucks
  •  Maintain, clean, and refurbish equipment
  •  Effectively pack and secure pallets / boxes / cages
  •  Connect internal and external brackets for utility lines
  •  Inspect, connect, and install airlines
  •  Apply condat grease on machine connections
  •  Fill out required paperwork, such as Field Level Hazard Assessments, HID cards.
  •  Knowledge & ability to operate air compressor, pumps, arial lift, generators etc.

Technical Skills and Knowledge

  •  Basic mechanical/electrical skills
  •  Operate power / hand tools safely and with skill
  •  The ability to determine the necessary tools for assigned tasks
  •  The ability to troubleshoot a problem based on experience and applicable trade knowledge
  •  Good work ethic, ability to work long hours (12-hour shift work)
  •  Able to work in confined spaces
  •  Clearly spot vehicles and equipment, and communicate using basic hand signals
  •  Understand use of and clearly communicate on two-way radios.
  •  Identify lifting points on equipment, able to safely rig equipment / pipe for lifting
  •  Previous experience in tunneling, general construction, or oil field work
  •  Contribute to a safe working environment
  • Travel may be required subject to project locations

Successful candidates will be required to have the following safety tickets ( training is available);

  • WHIMIS, First Aid, CSTS or PCST, Confined Space Entry and Rescue, Fall Arrest / Fall Protection
  • Drug and Alcohol clearance

Other Relevant Information        

    • Travel is required in this position. 
    • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and walk; use hands and fingers to handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk, and hear.
    • Frequently required to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
    • Distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus
    • Employee will be required to work in outdoor weather conditions, including extreme cold and heat
    • Required to work in confined spaces (42-inch or 46-inch pipe)
    • Covid 19 Vaccination Required


    Bothar is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to providing an equitable, diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees, whatever their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation or identity, education, and/or disability, feel valued and respected. 

    While we appreciate all applications, only those who are selected will be contacted.

title: Journeyman Ironworkers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!
description:
Currently we are looking for Journeyman Ironworkers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Employee Benefit Program
  • Employee Assistance Program

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Alberta Ironworker Journeyman or Red Seal Certification
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015
  • Valid Fall Protection Certificate

  • Physically capable of performing all tasks required of field Ironworkers

At Phoenix Industrial, we believe we are stronger together. That’s why we believe that investing in our people and the communities in which we work and live returns to us ten-fold. We invest in your growth because we believe it is essential for our continued success. 
We are proud of our company, our projects, our sustainable growth and most importantly our people. And we’d be proud to welcome you to the Phoenix family.
Come Grow With Us!

title: Labourer
description:
Primoris Canada is an infrastructure contractor serving major firms in the oil, gas, power, petrochemical, and heavy oil industries and include services covering tailings and hydro-transport pipeline construction and maintenance, storage tank construction and maintenance, industrial facilities multi-discipline construction and maintenance, piping fabrication, and pipeline integrity services.

 

Summary: 

A Labourer is involved in a variety of job scopes assisting ticketed tradesmen. This work may exist indoors or outdoors and may be physically demanding.

 

Shift: Day/Night

Location: CNRL Horizon

Accomodation: Camp available


  • Comply with PSC and Client Safety rules, as well as OH&S standards
  • Assisting tradesmen in completing daily duties
  • Sorting and selecting tools, as requested by journeymen
  • Acting as fire/spark watch for welders
  • General Clean-Up
  • Load and unload materials as required
  • Attend required safety and tailgate/toolbox meetings

  • Previous experience working on an industrial site is considered an asset, but not required
  • CSTS-09 (or CSO if not already in possession of CSTS-09)
  • OSSA Fire Watch is considered an asset
  • Valid Class 5 Drivers License
  • Must be physically able to lift 50lbs
  • Able to work well in a team environment

Pre-employment alcohol and drug testing is a condition of employment.

title: Labourers - Northwest Territories
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for Labourers with large earthworks construction or mining projects experience.
 
 
Nuna is the largest Inuit-owned heavy civil construction, earthworks, and mine construction contractor in Canada.
 
Nuna Logistics is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective, and innovative operator in the north.
 
 
We offer: 
  • 3 week on / 3 week off rotations; 12-hour days
  • Competitive hourly rate with Overtime pay (1.5x),
  • Extensive benefits including company matching RRSP plan;
  • Employee recognition program,
  • Rotation allowances,
  • Commercial flights and accommodations are covered,
  • Long-term employment opportunities
This position is located on our project site located in the Northwest Territories.
 
PLEASE NOTE: Only candidates from NWT will be considered for this role.
 
Pre-access requirements include:
  • Drug Test
  • Medical 
  • Criminal Record Check
  • Covid screening 
 
 
Locations available:  
  • Snap Lake
 
RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Load and unload construction materials
  • Working around heavy equipment
  • Assist heavy equipment operators; spotting of trucks and other heavy equipment
  • Manual labor including shoveling, sweeping, raking
  • Working in remote locations in a camp setting
  • Experience with radio communications and protocols
  • Capable of working independently in a fast-paced environment with good safety awareness


QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Ability to lift to 50 lbs. on a regular basis
  • Must be 18+ years old
  • Must be willing to work outdoors and in various weather conditions
  • Willing and capable of committing to a 3x3 rotation

How to Apply:
Interested applicants are asked to apply online at http://nunalogistics.com/jobs.html  
Or by email:hr@nunalogistics.com
 
Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.   
We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Handyman / Carpenter
description:
Being a handyman takes a lot of skill, and yet so often customers appreciate the small things: being on time, meeting deadlines, listening to needs and honesty. If you can do those and more, you might make a great fit for Handyman Connection of Victoria.

We’re on the lookout for a qualified Handyman/Carpenter who can surprise customers with a can-do, above-and-beyond attitude that puts their desires first. Anyone can be a handyman – our “connection” is filled with go-getters aren’t afraid of an honest day’s work.

Benefits:
  • Average $30-$40 per hour with regular appointments every month of the year
  • Work as an independent contractor – on your own schedule
  • Enjoy backing from an office staff that is here to assist you
  • Benefit from a company mobile app that helps you stay organized
  • Marketing to draw customers, which includes branded signage and merchandise

Want to improve others’ lives using your gifts and talents? Apply to become a Handyman/Carpenter

Job Summary:
  • Share your expertise of home repair, maintenance and remodeling on job sites.
  • Bid work on a regular basis and produce it effortlessly.
  • Finalize appropriate job materials and quantities for all projects.
  • Evaluate requests, price out all jobs, troubleshoot and effectively communicate with clients.

Job Requirements
  • Basic handiwork in at least three (3) of these capacities:
    • Home remodels, including bathroom and kitchen
    • Painting, both inside and out
    • General carpentry
    • Drywall work
    • Basic plumbing and electrical
    • Floor installations and repairs
    • Residential maintenance
    • Understand building codes and materials management
    • Driver's license & insurance
    • Tools, vehicle & references
    • Pass personal screening & background check
    • Smart phone and Internet access

Please, no project managers or primarily new construction. Handyman Connection is strongly considering candidates with experience as a Handyman/Carpenter or similar positions.

Handyman Connection of Victoria would love to talk with you. Apply today and start the process!

he Byng Group is a leading interior renovation general contractor with more than 50 years' experience and a team of over 500, specializing in high-rise rental properties.

title: Skilled labourer
description:
Our client is growing and looking for a fourth member of full-time crew. Company philosophy is to train workers to ensure our timelines, quality of work and customer satisfaction is met.

The right candidate must be able to lead tasks with minimal supervision and must have a minimum of five years of renovation experience with relevant construction education. One of the key requirements of this role is leadership ability. The candidate must be able build and maintain strong site team morale.

The position is for a small-sized General Contracting company in the residential and commercial market that focuses on interior renovations for clients of various sizes across Toronto and the GTA. This is a strategic hire for the company as we are looking for an individual who is passionate about the industry and enjoys learning about construction techniques/methods, and who will be a future candidate for a foreman or site manager.

Requirements:
  • Must have a valid Ontario Driver's License, and your own vehicle; a truck is preferable.
  • Must have, at minimum, cordless drill, tool belt and hand tools.
  • Must be clean cut and presentable to clients – public perception is very important.
  • Must be hard working, flexible, reliable and take pride in your work.
  • Must have the ability to work within a team as well as alone.
  • Must provide a criminal record check.
  • Must provide a resume and professional references upon request.
  • Post-secondary education is preferred in a construction-related field of study.
Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Assist the Supervisor or General Contractor with basic work site project management.
  • Read and interpret plans, instructions, and specifications to determine daily work activities.
  • Provide assistance to sub trades, skilled trades, Supervisor and General Contractor on the job-site when required.
  • Build, install, and repair structural woodwork, flooring, ceilings and cabinetry.
  • Operate, maintain, and calibrate hand and power tools.
  • Read and comprehend plans and blueprints.
  • Clean and make minor repairs to equipment and tools when required.
  • Follow proper safety rules to maintain a safe working environment.
  • Operate all equipment in a safe and efficient way according to all relevant legislation,
  • policies and procedures.
  • Set up the accompanying tools, equipment, materials and supplies for trades, such as carpenters, drywallers, plumbers, electricians, etc., who are completing work on-site, when needed.
  • Load, unload and organize tools, equipment, materials and supplies to and from the work truck, work site, and designated tool boxes and bins.
  • Maintain a clean and organized work site to eliminate possible hazards.
  • Ensure daily time sheets and any other forms requested by Supervisor are consistently completed by team.
  • Maintain daily communication with General Contractor and record daily construction activity.
  • Assist with communication between sub trades, skilled trades, labourers and GC.
Knowledge - The employee must have proficient knowledge in the following areas:
  • Comprehensive knowledge of general construction and repair methods, and the proper utilization and care of tools, materials, and equipment used in building construction.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of traditional building materials, practices, and techniques
  • Strong knowledge of electrical, plumbing, tiling, drywalling, framing, flooring, painting and carpentry.
  • Minimum technical college education but college- or university-level education is preferred (post-secondary education such as George Brown College, Ryerson University, or equivalent is ideal).
Skills/Experience - The employee must demonstrate the following skills/experience:
  • Five (5) years or more of renovation experience.
  • Strong carpentry skills, and general trade and interior finishing experience.
  • Plumbing, electrical and HVAC experience is preferred.
  • Excellent project management, organizational and time management skills.
  • Strong verbal and listening communications skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to work as a team or unaccompanied on various tasks.
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English.
Personal Attributes:
  • The employee must demonstrate the following personal attributes:
  • Fast-thinking and good judgement (common sense).
  • Hardworking, detail-oriented and thorough.
  • Honest, trustworthy and flexible.
  • Respectful and conscientious of the people and environment around them.
  • Demonstrates sound work ethics and self-motivation to work with minimal supervision.
  • Interacts with supervisors, coworkers and clients in a positive, courteous and respectful manner.

title: General Laborer (Construction)
description:
Job Description: All-purpose Renovation Contractor
Go Industries is looking for an ambitiousAll-purpose Renovation Contractor. You will be responsible for all renovation work including layout, installation, and repairs for our client’s commercial, industrial, and residential customers. 

The Opportunity:
We are looking for an experienced full-time All-purpose Renovation Contractor to join our prestigious heating and cooling client’s team. This is a full-time opportunity with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow. 
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Must have expertise in multiple types of repairs, maintenance, and remodeling.
  • Must possess basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate.
  • General Carpentry - Rough and Finish.
  • Ability to Upgrades / Remodel / Refresh / Remodel all types of commercial, residential, and industrial spaces. 
  • Painting Interior and Exterior.
  • Drywall Repair/Patching / Caulking.
  • Electrical knowledge.
  • Minor Plumbing and Minor Electrical Knowledge.
  • Flooring Repair and Installation.
  • Ceramic Tile Installation.
  • Handyman, General Home Repairs and Maintenance Work.

Qualifications:
  • 2-5 years of renovation experience. 
  • Valid Driver’s license with clean abstract.
  • Able to work at multiple sites in Ontario Primarily in the Hamilton area.
  • Experience working in other trades is a bonus. (HVAC/Plumbing/Electrical)
  • Ceramic tile installation is a bonus.

Pay rate: 
  • Up to $40.00 per hour for the right candidate. 
 




    About Go Heating/Natural Direct Canada:

    GO Heating & Cooling has been proudly serving the communities Simcoe County, Bruce, Grey, Kawartha Lakes, Muskoka, Dufferin, Peel, York, Durham Region and surrounding areas since 1977. Our reputation has been built on Quality Service, Honesty and Integrity and this has made us the service provider of choice. Over the years, the GO company has grown but our commitment to our core values and to our community remains the same today as it did when we first opened our doors. Today we’re more than just furnaces and air conditioners – we’re home comfort experts. We know what it takes to keep your home healthy and comfortable, each and every day.

title: Nutrien Redwater: Scaffolder Journeyman and Apprentice (Redwater, AB)
description:
SCAFFOLDER - APPRENTICES AND JOURNEYPERSON: Local Drive-in position

SUMMARY:
A Scaffolders’ duties may vary from site to site, however the main responsibilities of a Scaffolder are to erect temporary work platforms using steel pipes, support braces and clamps with a high standard of workmanship using a variety of tools. Scaffolders work both indoors and outdoors, year-round in commercial and industrial settings.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • Must have a previous Scaffolding experience.
  • Valid certification from an accredited apprenticeship board.
  • Must be able to work for 8 hours at a time in an environment where temperatures may reach from 0 to 60° C, both indoors and outdoors in the sun.
  • Work in an environment in which vibrations and noise are moderate to severe and noise level may require the wearing of hearing protection devices.
  • Must be able to work in confined spaces for 4-7 hours per day; stand or walk for long periods.
  • Able to wear a full-face respirator for extended periods.
  • Climb and maintain balance on ladders and scaffolding at extreme heights.
  • Stoop, kneel, crouch and crawl.
  • Lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 pounds often and occasionally up to 100 pounds.
  • Maintain footing on surfaces which are sometimes slippery.
  • See well (naturally or with correction) and distinguish colors.
  • Hear well (naturally or with hearing aid).
  • Must be able to effectively communicate with other employees and supervision.
  • Use arms and hands to reach for, handle, and feel objects; and coordinate well the use of hands or fingers and eyes.
  • Must have reliable transportation to and from the work location.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
  • Must comply with all safety regulations of Brock Canada.
  • Ensures that work is performed in accordance with Contractor Specifications and/or as directed by the Contractor’s Representative.
  • Ensures they are following the applicable Contractor’s Safety Procedures, OH&S, Provincial and/or Contractor’s safety requirements.
  • Assures that the proper materials, tools and equipment is being used for the specified tasks.
  • Reads specifications, such as blueprints and data, to determine requirements.
  • Able to install steel pipes, support braces and clamps to form bases for scaffolds.
  • Able to dismantle scaffold upon job completion.
  • Can identify the type of scaffolding material to be used for the job (frame, tube & clamp, system).
  • Able to thoroughly describe scaffolding materials.
  • Sort and organize material
  • Able to count and place orders for material
  • Required to complete safety paperwork such as FLRA’s, Start Cards, etc.
  • Other duties as assigned

Department: Operations
This is a non-management position
This is a contract position

title: Skilled Ground Worker in Fort McMurray, Alberta | Careers at North American Construction Group
description:
Position Scope

NACG is looking for a labourer to work on a remote mining site in the Fort McMurray area. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Site: Fort Hills

Schedule: 14x7- 12 hours (paid for 11.5 hours) (Days and nights)

Accommodations: Camp provided

Transportation: Flights are provided to and from Edmonton or Calgary. All individuals utilizing provided flights must be fully vaccinated as per federal transportation regulations. Bussing provided from Fort McMurray to site (before and after shifts)

Overtime: Provided after 8 hours a day or 44 hours a week

 

The successful candidate will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955. 

 

Responsibilities

  • Successful applicants must to be willing to help out in all tasks for general labourer duties.
  • Familar with pumps/hoses & dewatering activities
  • Must have a valid driver's license.

**Must be physically fit and be able to lift 50 pounds** 

Summary

All successful candidates must:

  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  • Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  • Disclose COVID-19 vaccination status:
    • Fully immunized individuals must provide government issued proof of vaccination to be exempt from site testing requirements
    • Individuals not fully immunized may be subject to site COVID-19 testing requirements and associated costs
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

    Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

    All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  • CSO or BSO Certification
  • Copy of Valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Copy of recent Driver’s Abstract
  • VOID cheque/direct deposit form
  • Silica Awareness
  • Hydrogen Sulphide Awareness

  • Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  • Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  • An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  • After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

  • Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

     

    NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

    Overview

    North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.  In that time, we’ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. We’ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers. 

    In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

    • Significant Growth – As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
    • Long Term Contracts – With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
    • Commitment To Safety – With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
    • Competitive Compensation – NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

    North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

     

    Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Labourer
description:
Looking to Start Your Driving Career? Looking to Learn New Skills? Austin Powder is seeking to add a career-minded entry-level team member! This is a full-time opportunity to handle site maintenance, manage inventory, be responsible for customer deliveries, as well as, customer support and assist the at job sites.

This position offers a competitive wage and generous benefits. Our benefits include extended health, dental, voluntary RPP, AD&D, weekly income (STD), long term disability, group life and dependent life. If this sounds like the opportunity that you've been searching for, apply for this blasting worker position today!

ABOUT AUSTIN POWDER

Austin Powder manufactures a full line of industrial explosives and provides blasting services to customers in the quarrying, mining, construction, and oil and gas industries -- all for the purpose of providing aggregate, energy, and mineral products to consumers.

Our values of commitment to safety, attention to detail, and the power of family are the very bedrock upon which our company's culture is built. We truly value our team which is why we offer competitive opportunities for career growth and advancement.

A DAY IN THE LIFE

As a Labourer, you will handle packaged explosive products, operate manufacturing vehicles on the job site (if licensed), and load and drive box trucks (if licensed). All activity is done in strict compliance with safety and company procedures. You will assist blasters load and stem blast holes prior to initiating the blast. This position involves being outside in all weather conditions, lifting and carrying 50+ pounds of product and other materials, and frequently squatting and bending as you prepare for the shot.

Safety is always a priority whether you are driving or assisting the Blaster in charge with site preparation and equipment setup. Under the direction of the Blaster in charge or Location Manager, you will inspect product bins, inventory of product, and complete required paperwork. To keep your truck and equipment running properly, you will perform both general and preventative maintenance. You will enjoy keeping busy and being on the move throughout the day.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must submit drivers abstract with resume
  • Valid Class 5 - no restrictions and desire to obtain Class 3
  • Preferred Class 3 license
  • Ability to work outside in all weather conditions
  • Physical ability to lift 23 kg.
  • Must meet requirements of all Provincial and Federal explosive laws and qualify as an ERD explosive possessor

Are you a self-starter that is hardworking and passionate? Do you enjoy being outdoors? Are you a dependable team player? Are you willing to learn and expand your skills? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this Labourer position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, and for inquiring about, discussing or disclosing compensation. Moreover, these regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Carpenter
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The carpenter is responsible for constructing and maintaining buildings.

Required knowledge includes: construction and remodeling trades, practices, procedures, techniques, tools and equipment, materials, specifications, quality control, cost control and safety.

The carpenter must be proficient at the following tasks: hanging doors, drilling and setting door hardware, setting windows, layout for stairs and common rafters, formwork, and reading blueprints. The carpenter must also possess the mathematical and analytical skills necessary to do materials estimates.

Qualifications

  • Ticketed Journeyperson Carpenter
  • Experienced with a large general contractor
  • Valid drivers license and clean drivers abstract preferred


Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

title: Tunneling Labourer BC
description:
We are a growing tunneling contractor based in Calgary, AB that offers its employees exciting opportunities for career growth, a great working environment, and competitive compensation.

The Company: Bothar Inc. specializes in trenchless tunneling technologies, balancing cost-effective drilling solutions with environmental protection. Our trenchless tunneling technology, Direct Pipe, presents unique cost saving and scheduling opportunities for challenging pipeline and municipal projects.

Bothar is respected in the trenchless contracting industry by clients and employees alike, for our integrity, commitment to excellence, and customer orientated service.

Our great team of staff are the best in their field. They are committed to collaboration, quality, and safety. We invest in our people, and they deliver excellence! We believe in leading through innovation and providing superior value and service to our clients and partners by with safe, high quality, and environmentally conscious trenchless solutions.

The Position: As we are expanding our field of operations, we are in need of more motivated and hardworking crew members to join our team. The Labourer position is responsible for assisting in the timely and technical execution of installations, as a part of the operations team on project sites. 

Labourers will have the opportunity to work with equipment used in Micro Tunneling, Horizontal Direction Drilling (HDD), Auger Boring, and Direct Pipe trenchless installations. 

Opportunities are currently available at various project locations across BC and Alberta. 

Compensation includes:

  •    Equitable pay based on experience
  •    Applicable overtime
  •    Living out allowance or paid accommodations
  •    Travel expense coverage

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  •  Maintain cleanliness / organization / stock of parts container and tool container
  •  Remove/Install cables on spools during de mob / mob.
  •  Efficiently pull and install tunneling utility lines (electrical cables, slurry lines, hydraulics)
  •  Effectively connect / install victaulic clamps and hydraulic connections
  •  Rig, hoist, and direct lifting equipment
  •  Load and unload trucks
  •  Maintain, clean, and refurbish equipment
  •  Effectively pack and secure pallets / boxes / cages
  •  Connect internal and external brackets for utility lines
  •  Inspect, connect, and install airlines
  •  Apply condat grease on machine connections
  •  Fill out required paperwork, such as Field Level Hazard Assessments, HID cards.
  •  Knowledge & ability to operate air compressor, pumps, arial lift, generators etc.

Technical Skills and Knowledge

  •  Basic mechanical/electrical skills
  •  Operate power / hand tools safely and with skill
  •  The ability to determine the necessary tools for assigned tasks
  •  The ability to troubleshoot a problem based on experience and applicable trade knowledge
  •  Good work ethic, ability to work long hours (12-hour shift work)
  •  Able to work in confined spaces
  •  Clearly spot vehicles and equipment, and communicate using basic hand signals
  •  Understand use of and clearly communicate on two-way radios.
  •  Identify lifting points on equipment, able to safely rig equipment / pipe for lifting
  •  Previous experience in tunneling, general construction, or oil field work
  •  Contribute to a safe working environment
  • Travel may be required subject to project locations

Successful candidates will be required to have the following safety tickets ( training is available);

  • WHIMIS, First Aid, CSTS or PCST, Confined Space Entry and Rescue, Fall Arrest / Fall Protection
  • Drug and Alcohol clearance

Other Relevant Information        

    • Travel is required in this position. 
    • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and walk; use hands and fingers to handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk, and hear.
    • Frequently required to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
    • Distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus
    • Employee will be required to work in outdoor weather conditions, including extreme cold and heat
    • Required to work in confined spaces (42-inch or 46-inch pipe)
    • Covid 19 Vaccination Required


    Bothar is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to providing an equitable, diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees, whatever their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation or identity, education, and/or disability, feel valued and respected. 

    While we appreciate all applications, only those who are selected will be contacted.

title: Journeyman Ironworkers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!
description:
Currently we are looking for Journeyman Ironworkers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Employee Benefit Program
  • Employee Assistance Program

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Alberta Ironworker Journeyman or Red Seal Certification
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015
  • Valid Fall Protection Certificate
  • Valid Aerial Work Platform
  • Physically capable of performing all tasks required of field Ironworkers
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment

**At this time, our client’s may request contractors, vendors and suppliers to be fully vaccinated while providing service to their sites and therefore may require candidates to attest their vaccination disclosure status**
At Phoenix Industrial, we believe we are stronger together. That’s why we believe that investing in our people and the communities in which we work and live returns to us ten-fold. We invest in your growth because we believe it is essential for our continued success. 
We are proud of our company, our projects, our sustainable growth and most importantly our people. And we’d be proud to welcome you to the Phoenix family.
Come Grow With Us!
 

See Job Description

title: Labourers - Ontario
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for Labourers with large earthworks and construction projects experience.
 
Nuna is the largest Inuit-owned heavy civil construction, earthworks and mine construction contractor in Canada.  
 
We offer: 
  • 2 week on / 2 week off rotations; 12 hour days
  • Competitive hourly rate with Overtime pay (1.5x),
  • Employee recognition/ rewards program,
  • Commercial flights and accommodations are covered,
  • Long-term employment opportunities
This position is located on our project site located in the Northern Ontario, Timmins / Gogama

PLEASE NOTE: Only candidates from Ontario will be considered for this role.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Load and unload construction materials
  • Working around heavy equipment
  • Assist heavy equipment operators; spotting of trucks and other heavy equipment
  • Manual labor including shoveling, sweeping, raking
  • Working in remote locations in a camp setting
  • Previous Dewatering experience


QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs on a regular basis
  • Must hold a valid Driver's License
  • Must be 18+ years old
  • Must be willing to work outdoors and in various weather conditions
  • Willing and capable of committing to a 2x2 rotation,
  • Surface Miner CORE an asset. (Please submit copy with your resume).

Candidates will have to be Covid Vaccinated to gain site access and to fly. Covid-19 testing will be conducted on site.
 
How to Apply:
Applicants are asked to apply online at http://nunalogistics.com/jobs.html or by email: hr@nunalogistics.com
 
Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.   
We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
 
Nuna is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective and innovative operator in the north.

title: Painter/Drywall Installer
description:
The Byng Group is a leading interior renovation general contractor with more than 50 years' experience and a team of over 500, specializing in high-rise rental properties.


We are currently hiring Painter/drywaller installers throughout the Belleville, Kingston and Peterborough area to join our growing team!

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Paint walls, ceilings, doors, hallways, shelving in Apartment Units
  • Prepares surfaces to be plastered
  • Fills in nicks and cuts in ceilings, walls, and partitions using plaster
  • Repair walls with drywall
  • Sand areas after each coat making drywall paint-ready
  • Drywall Repairs, Taping and Plastering
  • Drywall Installation is considered an asset
  • Framing with Metal Studs considered an asset

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • Valid Ontario Driver's License with a clean Driverâ€™s Abstract
  • Able to problem solve on-site and off-site
  • Ability to follow and complete a daily, weekly & monthly task schedule
  • Own Tools Required. They are not supplied.

WHY CHOOSE US!

  • Annual Bonus
  • Company Events
  • Supportive Team Atmosphere

SALARY

  • Earn up to $30.00 - $40.00 per hour, rate is based on skillset and performance

title: General Laborer (Construction)
description:
Job Description: All-purpose Renovation Contractor
Go Industries is looking for an ambitiousAll-purpose Renovation Contractor. You will be responsible for all renovation work including layout, installation, and repairs for our client’s commercial, industrial, and residential customers.

The Opportunity:
We are looking for an experienced full-time All-purpose Renovation Contractor to join our prestigious heating and cooling client’s team. This is a full-time opportunity with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Must have expertise in multiple types of repairs, maintenance, and remodeling.
  • Must possess basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate.
  • General Carpentry - Rough and Finish.
  • Ability to Upgrades / Remodel / Refresh / Remodel all types of commercial, residential, and industrial spaces.
  • Painting Interior and Exterior.
  • Drywall Repair/Patching / Caulking.
  • Electrical knowledge.
  • Minor Plumbing and Minor Electrical Knowledge.
  • Flooring Repair and Installation.
  • Ceramic Tile Installation.
  • Handyman, General Home Repairs and Maintenance Work.

Qualifications:
  • 2-5 years of renovation experience.
  • Valid Driver’s license with clean abstract.
  • Able to work at multiple sites in Ontario Primarily in the Hamilton area.
  • Experience working in other trades is a bonus. (HVAC/Plumbing/Electrical)
  • Ceramic tile installation is a bonus.

Pay rate:
  • Up to $40.00 per hour for the right candidate.

title: Skilled Ground Worker in Fort McMurray, Alberta | Careers at North American Construction Group
description:
Position Scope

NACG is looking for Skilled Ground Workers to work on a remote mining site in the Fort McMurray area. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Site: Syncrude-Aurora

Schedule: 14x7 Days/Nights -11.5 hours/day

Accommodations: Not provided

Transportation: Bussing provided from Fort McMurray to site (before and after shifts)

Overtime: Provided after 8 hours a day or 44 hours a week

The successful candidate will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955. 

 

Qualifications

- Minimum of 1 years experience working as a Labourer and driving in the mine.

- Able to do heavy manuel labour and shoveling

- Able to run hand packers

- Able to communicate fluently via radio and understand direction

- High school diploma, GED, and/or post-secondary education cosidered an asset

Summary

All successful candidates must:

  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  • Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

    Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

     

    All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  • CSO or BSO Certification
  • Copy of Valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Copy of recent Driver’s Abstract
  • VOID cheque/direct deposit form

  • Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  • Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  • An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  • After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

  • Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

     

    NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

     

    Overview

    North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.  In that time, we’ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. We’ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers. 

    In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

    • Significant Growth – As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
    • Long Term Contracts – With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
    • Commitment To Safety – With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
    • Competitive Compensation – NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.
    • Attractive Benefits Package – With a substantial benefits package provided to all employees, NACG ensures that you are covered for life’s many surprises.
    • GRRSP Matching – As you begin your new career, you can also start planning for the future thanks to NACG’s GRRSP matching.

    North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

     

    Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Carpenter
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The carpenter is responsible for constructing and maintaining buildings.

Required knowledge includes: construction and remodeling trades, practices, procedures, techniques, tools and equipment, materials, specifications, quality control, cost control and safety.

The carpenter must be proficient at the following tasks: hanging doors, drilling and setting door hardware, setting windows, layout for stairs and common rafters, formwork, and reading blueprints. The carpenter must also possess the mathematical and analytical skills necessary to do materials estimates.

Qualifications

  • Ticketed Journeyperson Carpenter
  • Experienced with a large general contractor
  • Valid drivers license and clean drivers abstract preferred
  • Must be able to successfully pass criminal record check


Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

title: Painter/Drywall Installer
description:
The Byng Group is a leading interior renovation general contractor with more than 50 years' experience and a team of over 500, specializing in high-rise rental properties.


We are currently hiring Painter/drywaller installers throughout the Belleville, Kingston and Peterborough area to join our growing team!

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Paint walls, ceilings, doors, hallways, shelving in Apartment Units
  • Prepares surfaces to be plastered
  • Fills in nicks and cuts in ceilings, walls, and partitions using plaster
  • Repair walls with drywall
  • Sand areas after each coat making drywall paint-ready
  • Drywall Repairs, Taping and Plastering
  • Drywall Installation is considered an asset
  • Framing with Metal Studs considered an asset

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • At least 3 yearsâ€™ experience as a painter and drywaller
  • Valid Ontario Driver's License with a clean Driverâ€™s Abstract
  • Able to problem solve on-site and off-site
  • Ability to follow and complete a daily, weekly & monthly task schedule
  • Own Tools Required. They are not supplied.

WHY CHOOSE US!

  • Annual Bonus
  • Company Events
  • Supportive Team Atmosphere

SALARY

  • Earn up to $30.00 - $40.00 per hour, rate is based on skillset and performance 

#B

title: Carpenter
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The carpenter is responsible for constructing and maintaining buildings.

Required knowledge includes: construction and remodeling trades, practices, procedures, techniques, tools and equipment, materials, specifications, quality control, cost control and safety.

The carpenter must be proficient at the following tasks: hanging doors, drilling and setting door hardware, setting windows, layout for stairs and common rafters, formwork, and reading blueprints. The carpenter must also possess the mathematical and analytical skills necessary to do materials estimates.

Qualifications

  • Ticketed Journeyperson Carpenter
  • Experienced with a large general contractor
  • Valid drivers license and clean drivers abstract preferred


Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!

  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program

title: title
description: description

title: Drywaller
description:
Established commercial restoration/renovation company now hiring qualified: DRYWALLERS / DRYWALL CUTTER

  • 55+ year established and reputable company.
  • Start immediately.
  • Full time work in the Lower Mainland (Vancouver / Burnaby / Langley) area.
  • Competitive wage dependent on experience.
  • Extended medical/benefits plan available.

Work Description:

  • Cut open section of walls and ceilings to allow for access to services in the wall cavity.
  • Re-board wall and ceiling openings.
  • Use company supplied equipment to minimize dust and damage to surrounding finished surfaces.
  • Back-framing of wood/metal wall and ceiling assemblies.
  • Maintain a clean work area.
  • Wear Hepa respirator when needed.
  • Possibility to learn new skills.

Ideal Candidate Description:

  • Friendly with a positive attitude.
  • Take pride in your work.
  • Dependable with a good work ethic.
  • Works productively with minimal supervision.
  • Works well with others.
  • Pass a criminal background check.

This is a full time hourly position. NO PIECE WORK contractors.

Applicants, please send your resume and wages expectations to this job posting (in PDF format ONLY). Include your telephone number with your submission. Thank you.

( drywaller installer - drywaller - drywalling - taper )

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
We are following all Government Covid-19 protocols.

Experience:

  • Drywalling: 2 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Drywall Journeyman Certificate (preferred)
Show more
