title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Who We Are:

Like our country, ATCO Frontec is built on a Frontier Spirit of being agile, robust, ready to go to the most challenging places and push the boundaries. Do YOU have the Frontier Spirit? If the answer is yes, you should probably work with us.

COVID-19 Information

ATCO is committed to providing and maintaining a safe environment for our employees, contractors, partners, and customers. As part of this unwavering commitment to safety, all ATCO employees and contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 or provide proof of exemption.

Description:

ATCO Frontec is seeking a Maintenance Technician to join our RP North department in Whitehorse, YT. The Maintenance Technician is responsible for performing various skilled and semi-skilled tasks to maintain a 24/7 facilities operation. Responsibilities include maintaining the mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems.

Responsibilities

· Troubleshoot and perform minor repairs on plumbing systems (leaking faucet, plodded toilets, etc.)

· Performs building repairs including drywall, paint, flooring, carpentry, ceiling tile and grid

· Responsible for the completion of all maintenance services requests as assigned

· Performs daily site inspections of the facilities and mechanical equipment to ensure proper operations.

· Provide a report to the Maintenance Coordinator noting any problems found

· Performs other manual duties to clean and maintain landscaped environments

· Respond quickly and thoroughly to changes in client requirements and amendments in scope

· Ensure all operations meet and comply Customer regulations, federal and provincial health and safety legislations, regulations and corporate policies

· Completion of work orders in the CMMS system

· Perform routine maintenance jobs and repairs

· Follow Health and Safety Policies and Safe Work practices

· Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

· The successful candidate should have 4 or more years of experience in a facility maintenance position

· Strong knowledge of safe work practices and procedure typical form maintenance operations

· Highly experienced with vendor management in a 24/7 operation with a strong customer focus

· Abilities to work safely with a wide variety of hand and power tools and materials

· Ability to obtain Government Security Clearance – Reliability level

· Basic PC skills including working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel) and Outlook.

· Valid Driver’s License

· Professional communication skills, oral, and written

· Ability to prioritize and multitask

· Work well under pressure

· Effectively solve problems

We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

Final candidates will be required to undergo a Security Clearance Check.

This position has been identified as safety sensitive and will require completion of a pre-employment alcohol & drug test, fit to work medical test, criminal record check, and provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination.

Collection, use and retention of personal information will be in accordance with ATCO Group privacy policies and practices.

By submitting your resume and personal information to the ATCO Group of Companies, and/or participating in a personal interview, you acknowledge and consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the ATCO Group of Companies to determine your suitability for employment opportunities within the ATCO Group of Companies.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you located in Whitehorse, YT?

Experience:

  • Maintenance: 3 years (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-14

title: Camp Attendant
description:
COVID-19 Information

ATCO is committed to providing and maintaining a safe environment for our employees, contractors, partners, and customers. As part of this unwavering commitment to safety, all ATCO employees and contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 or provide proof of exemption.

ATCO Frontec is looking for someone who takes pride in their work, always does what needs to be done, and loves the thrill and sense of accomplishment that comes with taking on new and meaningful work. Safety is paramount to us and we’ve always got your back; even in the most challenging environments you know you’re going to be okay when you’re on our team. If you are someone who loves doing important work with great, dedicated people around you, then this role is for you.

Who You Are: You are a team player who likes to put their best foot forward have an eye for attention to detail.

Responsibilities:

  • Maintain the highest sanitary standards are maintained in all areas of responsibility in accordance with company, client, and governmental requirements.
  • Ability to clean rooms to company standard and adhere to room inspection requirements
  • Wash, sorts, counts, folds and distributes linens and towels, makes beds to company standard.
  • Cleans lobbies, lounges, rest rooms, corridors, elevators, and stairways.
  • Sweeps, scrubs, mop, and polishes floor.
  • Vacuum/cleans rugs, carpets, upholstered furniture, and draperies.
  • Dusts furniture.
  • Washes walls, ceiling, and woodwork.
  • Washes windows, door panels, and sills.
  • Empties wastebaskets and pick up debris and empties trash containers
  • Assists in laundry as needed
  • Actively involved in ensuring they are following safe and sound procedures and are adhering to government regulations as well as ATCO Frontec Health and Safety, policies and procedures.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Other duties as assigned.

SKILLS:

  • The successful candidate will have 1 or more years of housekeeping experience in large hotel/resort style.
  • Strong organization skills
  • Ability to work in a fast pace environment
  • Complete allocated workload during designated shift
  • Excellent people skills
  • Ability to work effectively and efficiently supervised or unsupervised
  • Team Player

We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

We are a diversified global corporation with investments in the essential services of Structures & Logistics, Utilities, Energy Infrastructure, Retail Energy, Transportation and Commercial Real Estate. ATCO is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Visit our website for more information.

title: Painter/Drywall Installer
description:
The Byng Group is a leading interior renovation general contractor with more than 50 years' experience and a team of over 500, specializing in high-rise rental properties.


We are currently hiring Painter/drywaller installers throughout the Belleville, Kingston and Peterborough area to join our growing team!

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Paint walls, ceilings, doors, hallways, shelving in Apartment Units
  • Prepares surfaces to be plastered
  • Fills in nicks and cuts in ceilings, walls, and partitions using plaster
  • Repair walls with drywall
  • Sand areas after each coat making drywall paint-ready
  • Drywall Repairs, Taping and Plastering
  • Drywall Installation is considered an asset
  • Framing with Metal Studs considered an asset

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • At least 3 years’ experience as a painter and drywaller
  • Valid Ontario Driver's License with a clean Driver’s Abstract
  • Able to problem solve on-site and off-site
  • Ability to follow and complete a daily, weekly & monthly task schedule
  • Own Tools Required. They are not supplied.

WHY CHOOSE US!

  • Annual Bonus
  • Company Events
  • Supportive Team Atmosphere
  • #B

SALARY

  • Earn up to $30.00 - $40.00 per hour, rate is based on skillset and performance

title: Housekeeper
description:
Benefits

  • Performance Based Bonus Eligibility Employee Discount Program – 10% off Southwest
  • Comprehensive Extended, Health & Dental Benefits Properties Lease
  • RRSP Plan Resident Referral Program – Cash Incentives
  • Monthly Transit Pass - 100% Reimbursement Service Awards
  • Employee Health & Wellness Incentive Program - Social Staff Events
  • $300.00 Annual Reimbursement Home Computer Antivirus Incentive Program
  • Education Reimbursement Program $50.00 Annual Reimbursement
  • Flexible Work Schedules Charitable Donation Matching Program - $1000.00Annually + 1 Day off to Volunteer

Working at Southwest

Named as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies and Most Admired Corporate Cultures in Canada, Southwest has developed, constructed, owned, and operated world-class properties for over 50 years. A leading developer of residential and commercial property and one of the largest privately held owner of multi-family residential buildings in the Halifax region, Southwest’s brand of quality and community involvement has made a major impact on the Atlantic Canadian real estate market. Southwest believes in going beyond the necessary to create inspiring environments by providing the best places to live, shop, work, and play, creating lasting relationships with employees, customers, and partners. At Southwest, we are always seeking the best and brightest stars in their field. From front line staff to senior management, we choose to employ the best in the industry!

We are currently seeking an outstanding individual to fill the position of Housekeeper.

The Housekeeper is responsible for performing a combination of specialized cleaning duties to maintain high standards of presentation and cleanliness for the property – including all common areas. This position reports directly to the

Property Manager, who assigns and approves duties and provides guidance.

Duties and Responsibilities

The Housekeeper is responsible for the interior cleaning of vacant suites and the internal and external property.

  • Clean suites, hallways, lobbies, restrooms, corridors, elevators and stairways; remove all stains and debris as soon as possible
  • Clean rugs, carpets, upholstered furniture, and/or draperies, using vacuum cleaners and/or shampooers
  • Empty wastebaskets and transport other trash and waste to disposal areas
  • Sweep, scrub, using brooms, mops, and/or powdered scrubbing and waxing machines
  • Dust and polish furniture and equipment
  • Polish silver accessories and metalwork such as fixtures and fittings
  • Replace light bulbs
  • Sort clothing and other articles, load washing machines and iron and fold dried items
  • Wash windows, wills, ceilings, and woodwork, waxing and polishing as necessary
  • Remove debris from parking lots
  • Clean carpeted grates
  • Ensure fitness and entertainment areas are cleaned on a regular basis; wipe down equipment
  • Ensure all pool and hot tub areas are cleaned
  • Ensure vacant suites are ready for showings and lease ready
  • Perform rounds of complex on a regular basis to ensure cleanliness of entire complex; escalate issues where appropriate o Seasonally provide light landscaping i.e., raking, garbage removal, and water plant boxes o Ensure barbeque and terrace area (including furniture) is cleaned on a regular basis

Administration and Health and Safety

  • Observe precautions required to protect residents, and report damage, theft and found articles to the Operations Manager
  • Request repair services as needed
  • Ensure the highest level of safety standards are adhered to while performing all duties
  • Keep cleaning supply cart well stocked and tidy
  • Professionally liaise with all residents and employees
  • Escort contractors around building when Concierge is not available
  • Execute all reasonable additional assignments as determined by the Leadership Team
  • Maintain all housekeeping equipment and ensure all required tools and equipment are in good working order

Position Details

Hours of Work: Full-time day hours Monday to Friday. Schedule is subject to change. $15.55/hr.

Work Location: Any of our locations – in units, concierge desk around complex

Position Requirements: Valid Proof of COVID-19 Double Vaccination

Knowledge and Skills Required:

  • Ability to perform with tact and professionalism in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
  • High level of integrity and dependability
  • Exceptional customer service and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to interact effectively with all employees and the public
  • Proven ability to plan, organize, and prioritize work
  • Strong attention to detail with a high level of quality
  • Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Excel)

Commitment to DE&I

Southwest Properties is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse team, who values your experiences, perspectives, and unique identity. We are committed to creating and maintaining an environment that is inclusive, equitable, and welcoming.

How to Apply

If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please forward your resume and cover letter to our Human Resources

Team: Southwest Properties Limited, 1475 Lower Water Street, Suite 100 Halifax NS, B3J 3Z2.

Thank you for your interest in Southwest Properties. Only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.

We are a team of individuals who get joy from bringing joy to others.

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 25 per week

Salary: From $15.55 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Commuter benefits
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Halifax, NS B3J 3Z2: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • Cleaning: 1 year (preferred)

description:
Responsibilities:

  • Ensure the health, comfort and safety of our Customers
  • Ensure daily communication with the Leader and team members
  • Suite maintenance and touch ups as per established quality standards
  • Ensure proper cleaning and maintenance of equipment
  • Drywall removal, repair and replacement

Experience and Educational Requirements:

  • Minimum 2 years painting experience required
  • Sprayer application experience required
  • Experience with cabinet installation, water restoration, mould remediation, pest control, confined space work, etc. would be an asset

Technical Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of English language both verbal and written

Non-Technical Requirements:

  • Strong commitment to providing excellent customer service
  • Dedicated to building better communities for all our Customers and surrounding communities
  • Ability to take responsibility for all actions and decisions and to follow through until a resolution is obtained
  • Exceptional problem-solving and decision-making capabilities
  • Strong planning and organizational skills coupled with ability to multi-task and prioritize (excellent time-management skills)

  • Ensure all tools on the tool list are acquired prior to end of probationary period

  • Vehicle required
  • Valid driver license

About the Company - https://www.bwalk.com/en-ca

Ready to shape the future of our communities? Come work with us and learn where doing what you love means never working a day in your life!

Deeply rooted in family spirit and humility, Boardwalk’s five core values of integrity, associates, teamwork, customer service and social responsibility are more than just words - they are a way of life. Coupled with our Golden Foundation of ‘treat others as you would like to be treated,’ ‘be good,’ ‘love community’ and ‘have fun,’ we believe in happiness and creating the most memorable experiences for both our Associates and Resident Members, continually looking for new and innovative ways to enhance and strengthen all our Boardwalk communities.

We hope these values speak to you as they speak so meaningfully to us!

As we continue to grow, we remain unwavering in our commitment to providing Resident Members with the best quality rental communities. This same commitment means Boardwalk is always seeking individuals who have a positive attitude, are energetic and passionate, self-driven, productive, have the capacity to deliver high-quality results and who believe in the power of teamwork.

Together, with you as part of our team, we will continue to create meaning every day for those who choose to call Boardwalk home.

_________________________________________________

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Commitment Statement

We are committed to attracting and retaining a diverse team that will honour and celebrate your experiences, perspectives and unique identity regardless of age, ethnicity, race, colour, abilities, religion, socio-economic status, culture, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression.

Together, our communities strive to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.

We believe every Associate in our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of values, customs and experience to better understand and engage with the world around us, identify challenges, so as to discover, design and deliver solutions together

title: Drywall Estimator
description:
B.J. Normand Ltd. is looking for an experienced Drywall Estimator to join our team. We are looking for someone who is eager to gain more experience in drywall, acoustic ceilings, office fit-ups and becoming a key member of our team.

Position Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Review project plans, requirements and specifications
  • Prepare take-off and cost estimates of materials, labour and equipment for the ICI sector.
  • Coordinate price packages with suppliers, sub-contractors, owners, designers and architects regarding tenders.
  • MUST be able to perform full estimating from take-off to closing tenders
  • Liaise, consult and communicate with engineers, architects, owners, contractors and sub-contractors.
  • Prepare and maintain a good relationship with suppliers, contractors and sub-contractors
  • Conduct material and equipment purchasing for secured jobs.
  • Participate in tender review
  • Negotiating terms of agreement/ contract / schedule with project manager
  • Complete submittals with project manager
  • Organize job start up meeting with site super/ G.C. to review scope of work
  • Assist project manager to order materials, equipment, engineering if required
  • Analyze the project and mitigate risk
  • Price change orders and understand the impact on the scope
  • Ensure accounting is in line with project

Requirements

  • Min 5 years experience on projects ranging up to $5 million.
  • Self-motivated individual able to work with deadlines.
  • College Diploma or University Degree (preferred)
  • Candidate must be proficient using MS applications.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Experience with Onscreen/Quick bid as an asset.
  • Bilingual is an asset
  • Must have a vehicle for use during the day.
  • Drywall Construction experience required.

Please forward your resume with salary expectation

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $78,000.00-$90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • construction estimating: 5 years (preferred)
  • Drywall: 3 years (preferred)

title: ​Skilled labourer
description:
DESCRIPTION

Our company is growing and we are looking for a fourth member of our full-time crew. Our philosophy is to train our workers to ensure our timelines, quality of work and customer satisfaction is met.

The right candidate must be able to lead tasks with minimal supervision and must have a minimum of five years of renovation experience with relevant construction education. One of the key requirements of this role is leadership ability. The candidate must be able build and maintain strong site team morale.

The position is for a small-sized General Contracting company in the residential and commercial market that focuses on interior renovations for clients of various sizes across Toronto and the GTA. This is a strategic hire for the company as we are looking for an individual who is passionate about the industry and enjoys learning about construction techniques/methods, and who will be a future candidate for a foreman or site manager.

BASIC REQUIREMENTS
  • Must have a valid Ontario Driver's License, and your own vehicle; a truck is preferable.
  • Must have, at minimum, cordless drill, tool belt and hand tools.
  • Must be clean cut and presentable to clients – public perception is very important.
  • Must be hard working, flexible, reliable and take pride in your work.
  • Must have the ability to work within a team as well as alone.
  • Must provide a criminal record check.
  • Must provide a resume and professional references upon request.
  • Post-secondary education is preferred in a construction-related field of study.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Assist the Supervisor or General Contractor with basic work site project management.
  • Read and interpret plans, instructions, and specifications to determine daily work activities.
  • Provide assistance to sub trades, skilled trades, Supervisor and General Contractor on the job-site when required.
  • Build, install, and repair structural woodwork, flooring, ceilings and cabinetry.
  • Operate, maintain, and calibrate hand and power tools.
  • Read and comprehend plans and blueprints.
  • Clean and make minor repairs to equipment and tools when required.
  • Follow proper safety rules to maintain a safe working environment.
  • Operate all equipment in a safe and efficient way according to all relevant legislation,
  • policies and procedures.
  • Set up the accompanying tools, equipment, materials and supplies for trades, such as carpenters, drywallers, plumbers, electricians, etc., who are completing work on-site, when needed.
  • Load, unload and organize tools, equipment, materials and supplies to and from the work truck, work site, and designated tool boxes and bins.
  • Maintain a clean and organized work site to eliminate possible hazards.
  • Ensure daily time sheets and any other forms requested by Supervisor are consistently completed by team.
  • Maintain daily communication with General Contractor and record daily construction activity.
  • Assist with communication between sub trades, skilled trades, labourers and GC.

KNOWLEDGE

The employee must have proficient knowledge in the following areas:
  • Comprehensive knowledge of general construction and repair methods, and the proper utilization and care of tools, materials, and equipment used in building construction.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of traditional building materials, practices, and techniques
  • Strong knowledge of electrical, plumbing, tiling, drywalling, framing, flooring, painting and carpentry.
  • Minimum technical college education but college- or university-level education is preferred (post-secondary education such as George Brown College, Ryerson University, or equivalent is ideal).

SKILLS/EXPERIENCE

The employee must demonstrate the following skills/experience:
  • Five (5) years or more of renovation experience.
  • Strong carpentry skills, and general trade and interior finishing experience.
  • Plumbing, electrical and HVAC experience is preferred.
  • Excellent project management, organizational and time management skills.
  • Strong verbal and listening communications skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to work as a team or unaccompanied on various tasks.
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English.

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

The employee must demonstrate the following personal attributes:
  • Fast-thinking and good judgement (common sense).
  • Hardworking, detail-oriented and thorough.
  • Honest, trustworthy and flexible.
  • Respectful and conscientious of the people and environment around them.
  • Demonstrates sound work ethics and self-motivation to work with minimal supervision.
  • Interacts with supervisors, coworkers and clients in a positive, courteous and respectful manner.
Note: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the incumbent(s) of this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and activities required of the position.

If you'd like to apply for this position then please send your resume and cover letter to jobs@dtcontracting.ca. Please include Applying for Skilled Labourer Position in the subject line of the email otherwise your application will not be viewed.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest; however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Show more

title: Renovator
description:
Job: Skilled Renovator

About Us
Mirage Renovations Inc. is a company that specializes in the renovation and maintenance of high-rise rental apartment buildings.

We are a rapidly growing company looking for a reliable, hard-working, and dedicated renovator to join our team.

The Role
You will be responsible for duties such as:
  • Drywall.
  • Plaster.
  • Paint.
  • Ceramic tiles.
  • Minor plumbing and electrical.
  • Kitchen and countertop installation.

Why You Should Join Our Team:
  • Travel during work hours paid.
  • No weekends!
  • Room for growth!
  • Paid as a sub-contractor for maximum earning potential.

About the job:
  • This is a full-time position (not for general contractors).
  • Salary based on experience and will be fair and negotiable.
  • $25-$30/hr
  • Mon- Friday
  • 8-10 hour shifts
A successful candidate requires:
  • A set of their own tools.
  • 2-3 years of experience.
  • Reliable transportation to travel between multiple work sites during the day.
  • An ability to work independently as well as part of a team.

Our service area encompasses the whole GTA.



About Mirage Renovations:

Mirage renovations Inc. is an interior renovations company that specializes in residential apartment building rental units. We pride ourselves on a quick job, done well and at a reasonable price. Years of experience in the rental apartment sector has allowed us to build a highly dedicated and efficient team that is able to tackle jobs of any size. Capital Projects: - Drop Ceiling installation - Corridor painting - Metal door and frame replacements - Finish work after large scale building updates - Garage Painting - Balcony Repairs - Fences Suite turnovers: We can handle all the components of a complete turnover: - Demolition - Plaster & paint - Electrical - Plumbing - Cabinetry - Tub Surrounds - Flooring - Baseboards - Tiles - Tub surrounds - Doors & Frames - Cleaning In-suite/ Odd jobs: We are well- equipped to provide solutions to all your maintenance needs. - Repairing flood damage - Plaster repairs - Door replacement - Painting - Finish work after plumbing repairs - Leaky faucets - Hardware replacement - Boiler room repairs - Fire- rating updates

Show more

title: BIM Technician
description:
The London office of Smith + Andersen is seeking a BIM Technician. The BIM Technician is discipline specific and has working knowledge of the Autodesk Revit building information modelling platform. The BIM Technician works under the direct supervision of a project engineer/designer. Using Revit, the BIM Technician prepares drawing packages including plans, layouts, schematics and detailed scale drawings.

Does this sound like you? Here are some of the more detailed responsibilities you can expect in this position:
  • Model and/or designs for a single discipline. Prepares drawing packages, including plans, layouts, schematics, and detailed scale drawings using drawings and files and the S+A Prototype standard drawing setup at the onset of a project.
  • Produce and/or modify a BIM (Building Information Model) from sketches, mark-ups and/or designs as required by the project team to suit design requirements, consultant changes, scope changes and/or general updates.
  • Review models against markups to ensure accuracy of work in the three dimensional model and resultant two-dimensional drawings.
  • Collaborate/communicate with other disciplines’ design changes and model challenges.
  • Populate and maintain the parametric database within a model as needed to meet design requirements.
  • Identify and discuss interferences or space issues with the project team for resolution and change implementation. This may include three dimensional analysis using Revit or other software such as Navisworks.
  • Prepare submissions for issuance, plotting and archives.
  • Control and maintain models in an organized manner in the appropriate project directory system, as per company standards.
  • Adhere to office BIM standards and prototype standards, including the project BIM Execution Plan, Level of Development matrix
  • Layout pipes, ductwork, cable tray, or conduits, and identify clashes. When required, produce schematic drawings and identify sizing requirements.
  • Working knowledge of structural, architectural, and electrical models to appreciate space limitations and interferences.
  • Review layouts of mechanical or electrical services for interferences with major building elements such as structure, ceilings, walls, etc.
  • Generate Navisworks models.
  • Any other BIM tasks required to assist in the completion of working drawings.
A few more qualifications which will help you with these responsibilities:
  • College diploma in Architecture, Mechanical or Electrical building service program; or a related field with relevant work experience.
  • Knowledge of the industry installation practices for mechanical and electrical systems so that what is created in BIM is a close representation to what a contractor can build on site.
  • Familiar with building sector services such as plumbing systems, heating, ventilation and air conditioning, lighting, power and systems and communications.
  • Good written and oral communication skills; able to communicate with the design team and external BIM teams or clients.
  • Ability to work in an environment driven by project deadlines.
  • Highly motivated with an attention to detail and an ability to accept direction.
  • Able to work independently as well as part of a team.
For more information about Smith + Andersen, please visit our website at www.smithandandersen.com.

Appropriate accommodations will be provided to candidates upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process. Successful applicants will be advised of Smith + Andersen’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended. Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Smith + Andersen is a trusted Canadian consulting engineering firm with offices in Vancouver, Kelowna, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, London, Toronto, Ottawa, and Halifax. Founded in 1965, Smith + Andersen has organically grown from an established reputation as trusted mechanical and electrical consultants, reaching new levels of engineering and design excellence in the communications, security and audiovisual fields, and providing enhanced services such as lighting, building automation systems, and intelligent integrated systems design. Thanks to their client-focused approach, Smith + Andersen is able to apply efficient, sustainable, and reliable design and engineering solutions on the most exciting projects across Canada. From fully integrated hospitals and welcoming schools, to healthy workplaces and secure transit stations, their team has established lasting relationships with public and private sector clients across the country.
Show more

title: Logistics & Maintenance Technician - Repost
description:
Requisition Details

    Job Title:
    Logistics & Maintenance Technician - Repost
    Requisition #:
    21-653
    Campus:
    Doon
    Department:
    Facilities & Maintenance
    Payband:
    E
    Payband Range:
    $26.21 - $30.39
    Hours/Week:
    40
    Starting Rate:
    $26.21
    Posting Date:
    Monday, April 18, 2022
    Closing Date:
    Posted until position is filled
    Vacancy Type:
    Support Staff - Full-time Temporary Appendix D Contract

Support Staff Temporary Full-time Appendix D Contract Replacement Position (approximately 8 month contract with the possibility of extension)

As the COVID-19 pandemic evolves around the world and in our local community, Conestoga College continues to adjust plans based on the guidance provided by our local Public Health authority. Considering these unprecedented circumstances, all final hiring decisions remain contingent upon confirmed enrolment numbers and the evolving work environment. Conestoga College will take appropriate measures to protect the safety and well-being of our College community and prospective candidates throughout the recruitment and selection process, including the scheduling of remote interviews.

Conestoga College’s Facilities & Maintenance department requires a qualified Logistics & Maintenance Technician. Following all Health & Safety Policies and Procedures, the incumbent performs semi-skilled work in the area of installations, maintenance, repair and general upkeep of buildings, equipment and facilities, including seasonal exterior work at the Guelph campus and supports the Logistics and Facilities support services functions at the Doon campus.

Hours of work for this position are at Doon campus, Wednesday – Friday, 8:30am – 4:30pm and Saturday – Sunday, 5:30 am – 2:00 pm.

Responsibilities:

  • Performs shipping, receiving, and courier functions including:
    • receiving incoming shipments
    • arranging cost effective shipping
    • preparing packages for shipping and completing documents
    • unloading and handling internal delivery of items; completing documents as required by standard College procedures
    • interacting with Purchasing, Accounts Payable, College staff, and vendors to solve discrepancies and maintain a high level of customer service and satisfaction
    • interacting with Customs to ensure international received shipments have required documents
    • interacting with Canada Post for regular incoming mail
    • collecting and distributing mail or shipments to other College buildings and campuses
  • Performs repairs to buildings and contents including:
    • maintaining work areas to ensure maximum use of resources available
    • assembling and/or building cupboards, bookcases, shelving and installation
    • installing and repairing locks on doors, cupboards, filing cabinets and desks
    • installing notice boards, whiteboards and signage as directed
    • performing minor painting, adjusting and maintaining door hardware
    • completing minor plumbing repairs as directed
    • responding to various maintenance call and work requests
    • completing repairs to drywall, masonry walls and ceilings
    • completing preventative maintenance tasks as directed
  • Maintains grounds & fleet by:
    • operating & maintaining grass cutting and snow removal equipment
    • clear snow and salt walkways in preparation for campus traffic
    • inspecting and documenting inspections and repairs to equipment including fire extinguishers as required
    • supporting weed control programs within guidelines; prunes trees and shrubs
    • litter pick up and outdoor cleaning
    • repairing minor asphalt and concrete cracks and holes
    • Cleaning interior and exterior of fleet vehicles, as well as ensuring vehicles are fuelled and ready to be used by team members
  • Moves furniture and event materials, up to and including complete assembly of modular furniture and event set ups
  • Moves equipment and supplies throughout the campus and preforms repairs to the same
    • completes required academic space set up to ensure delivery of programs in all common academic areas following appropriate codes and legislation
    • completes set up and tears down functions for special events
    • repairs various furniture equipment in common academic areas
    • completes repairs as per work request processes to program specific equipment as required
  • Provide temporary back-up or assistance and support to various Facilities functions including but not limited to;
    • convocation
    • shipping and receiving
    • snow removal
    • grounds maintenance
    • equipment repairs
    • exterior and interior signs
    • assist with emergencies (within Facility Management)
    • assist trades/contractors, etc


Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Two years of practical experience in the maintenance and repair of building contents and equipment
  • Proficient reading, writing and arithmetic
  • Specialized technical skills would be an asset in some areas. i.e. locksmithing
  • Good organizational skills
  • Good interpersonal skills and ability to deal effectively and respectfully with people especially clients
  • Overtime hours required, including before/after regular workday (including weekends), based on weather conditions and/or special events
  • Valid Ontario driver’s license and continuation of clean driving record to be eligible for Conestoga Insured Driver status

#LI-POST

title: Project Manager and Estimator
description:
B.J. Normand Ltd. is looking for a Project Manager / Estimator to join our team. We are looking for someone who is eager to gain more experience in drywall, acoustic ceilings, office fit-ups and becoming a key member of our team.

Position Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Liaise, consult and communicate with General Contractors, Suppliers, Architects, Engineers and Owners
  • Preparing complete on-screen take-offs and cost estimates of materials, labor and equipment
  • Co-coordinating price packages of specifications with suppliers, sub-contractors, and architects
  • Review project plans, requirements, specifications and costs
  • Coordinate price packages with suppliers, sub-contractors, owners, designers and architects regarding tenders.
  • Liaise, consult and communicate with engineers, architects, owners, contractors, suppliers and sub-contractors
  • Negotiating terms of agreement/ contract / schedule
  • Participate in tender review
  • Complete submittals and cost savings
  • Conduct material and equipment purchasing for secured jobs
  • Organize job start up meeting with site super/ G.C. to review scope of work
  • Organize man-power with site super, order materials, equipment, engineering if required
  • Attend job-site weekly meetings
  • Review the daily progress of the project and ensure it is financially on track and on schedule
  • Analyze the project and mitigate risk
  • Price change orders and understand the impact on the scope
  • Ensure accounting is in line with project
  • Support Foreman throughout the duration of the project and maintain quality control
  • Complete all job close out procedures

Requirements

  • Min 5 years of construction project management experience
  • Must have min 3 year experience in the drywall industry
  • Must understand construction costs to be able to price change orders
  • Ability to price own small projects
  • Self-motivated individual able to work with deadlines.
  • College Diploma or University Degree (preferred)
  • Bilingual is an asset (French)
  • Candidate must be proficient using MS applications.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Experience with Onscreen/Quick bid as an asset.
  • Must have a vehicle for use during the day.

Please forward your resume and salary expectation. We look forward to hearing from you.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $70,000.00-$90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • AEC / DEP or Skilled Trade Certificate (preferred)

Experience:

  • Project management: 5 years (preferred)
  • Drywall management: 3 years (preferred)
  • Estimating: 2 years (preferred)

title: TESTING, ADJUSTING AND BALANCING (TAB)TECHNICIAN
description:
Job Title: Testing, Adjusting and Balancing (TAB) Technician


Main Purpose of the Job: This position is open to someone with experience in Testing, Adjusting and Balancing or an entry level technician responsible for learning proficiency in this field.


Reports to: Management or Lead Technician (for trainee)


Benefits Offered:

  • Phone allowance starting at $60.00 per month
  • Car allowance starting at $150.00 per month and paid gas expenses
  • Training program and support towards obtaining certification as a NEBB TAB technician
  • Safety gear, hand tools and testing instruments to use on site
  • Safety training

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Take a proactive approach in participating in the company’s NEBB TAB Technician Training Program
  • Interpret mechanical drawings and specifications for ventilation systems requiring air and hydronic testing, adjusting and balancing
  • Test systems using specialized and calibrated instruments to measure system’s performance following NEBB Procedural Standards. Collect actual values for pressure, temperature, rotation speed, velocity, and flows for an air or hydronic audit and to improve the system’s performance.
  • Discuss system operations with end users to verify that malfunctions have been corrected.
  • Communicate with design engineers to clarify changes in design, and provide a technical explanation on the causes impeding a system to reach performance.
  • Make system adjustments using balancing dampers, circuit balancing valves, VFD’s (variable frequency drives), etc. to ensure performance.
  • Prepare the report which summarizes the testing and balancing notes, any deficiencies found during the TAB work.
  • Maintain proper documentation of daily activities using project specific reporting procedures
  • Coordinate site visits and work schedule with the mechanical firm installer, the General Contractor, the Building Operation firm or the owner.
  • The use of ladders is required to complete the task of Testing, Adjusting and Balancing of air and hydronic systems. All employees must possess the ability to safely exercise ladder usage.
  • The use of aerial platforms is required for some HVAC systems. All employees must possess the ability to safely exercise aerial platforms usage.
  • Perform work in a safely manner and in accordance with the company’s safety policy
  • Ability to travel regularly with the occasional overnight stays for some projects

Qualifications:

  • Post-secondary diploma in HVAC systems or equivalent work experience
  • Mathematical proficiency is a necessity for completing basic and advanced equations associated with Air and Hydronic balancing
  • Comfortable using Excel and cloud file sharing applications
  • Ability to review and understand mechanical drawings and specifications
  • Learn and understand the design intent of each system associated with a project
  • Very good mechanical aptitude in using hand tools
  • Ability to use specialize instruments such as Pitot Tube, Manometer, Anemometer, Velometer, Tachometer, Psychrometer, and Thermometer
  • Ability to understand and analyze mechanical HVAC systems for determining issues and determining basic recommendations for issue resolution(s)
  • NEBB certification is required to advance beyond Entry Level

Restrictive Access Requirements:

  • Clean background check as most facilities require a police clearance letter

Working Conditions:

  • Work environment: various commercial, industrial and residential buildings, new construction sites or retrofit buildings, mechanical rooms, confined spaces, hospitals, etc.
  • Working conditions may vary and based on the scope of each project, you may be required to work outside and be exposed to rain, snow, and extreme heat or cold.
  • Work hours may vary based on the scope of work for each project and at times you will be required to work weekends, overnight shift work or early morning shift work.
  • A variety of physical demands are required to completed the work on site: climbing ladders, climbing stairs, access building roofs, open ceiling tiles, use aerial platforms to access ventilation equipment, stand for long hours, work in confined spaces
  • Maintain a valid Driver’s Licence as project locations vary throughout the Greater Toronto Area or within the Province of Ontario.
  • Must be able to lift, move, and carry equipment (up to 50 pounds)

Details regarding wages, benefits and advancement opportunities will be discussed during the interview. Please email your resume to info@envirobalance.ca

Show more

title: Carpenter/Contractor
description:
We are looking for a safety-minded Carpenter. We have long-term work available for the right candidate . Applicants should have residential construction industry experience and access to reliable transportation. The ideal candidates will be capable of working with minimal oversight but willing to follow directions closely. Additionally, he or she should be familiar with construction industry safety standards and procedures to ensure project security.

Tasks of the job Include:

- Installs walls, floors, ceilings, and roofs using materials such as: wood, steel, metal, concrete, plastics, and composites of multiple materials.

- Fits and installs window frames, doors, door frames, door hardware, interior and exterior trim using a carpenter’s level, plumb bob, and laser levels.

-Erects scaffolding and ladders for assembling structures above ground levels.

- Studies specifications in blueprints, sketches, or building plans to prepare project layout and determine dimensions and materials required.

- Shapes or cuts materials to specified measurements, using hand tools, machines, or power saws.

-Follows established safety rules and regulations and maintaining a safe and clean environment.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $45,000.00-$60,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Kingston, ON K7K 2L9: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

  • Drivers License (required)

title: Drywaller
description:
Drywaller - WINMAR® Kingston is expanding and looking for an energetic and self-motivated drywaller to join our team. This position is full-time and offers a strong compensation package based on experience and expertise.

Responsibilities and Performance Expectations include:

Drywall Installer and Finisher Specific Skills

  • Measure, cut, fit and install drywall sheets
  • Cut and install metal corner beads to protect exterior corners
  • Fill joints, nail indentations, holes and cracks with joint compound using trowel and broad knife
  • Tape over joints and embed tape in compound
  • Fabricate and install suspended metal ceiling grids and place in panels to form acoustical and coffered ceilings
  • Must have own basic hand tools.
  • Must work well in team environment and be flexible to changing requirements.
  • Proficient in the use of electrical and manual tools as well as measurement devices
  • Must have a good work ethic
  • Manages time efficiently and work independently
  • Possesses a clean drivers’ license
  • Clean criminal records check

About Us

Established in 1977, WINMAR® is recognized as one of Canada’s largest restoration networks with over 100 locations across the country. We specialize in water damage, fire and smoke restoration services, mould inspection and removal as well as damage restoration and disaster recovery. As general contractors, we also specialize in construction, renovation, demolition and other services.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $22.00-$32.00 per hour based on experience

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $22.00-$32.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • On call

Experience:

  • Drywall: 3 years (preferred)

title: Carpenters and Interior Finish Installers
description:
Looking for: Carpenters and Interior Finish Installers
Job Type: Part of Full Time
Salary: $20-25/hr
Start Date: Immediately

About HF Interiors:

HF Interiors Inc. is a growing company who provide the supply and installation of commercial interior finishes. We specialize in high end, custom acoustic wall finishes and ceiling products for major projects in Toronto and the GTA

We are building a team of professionals who value work ethic, quality, and integrity. You will be working directly with the owners of the company. With their guidance and training there is room for advancement for those members of our team who are looking to expand their careers in commercial contracting.

Job Description:

We are looking for individuals who can join out team as commercial interior finish installers for major construction projects in GTA. Our clients are some of the biggest companies in the city and world.

We are hiring individuals by contract in the beginning to assess capabilities. Hours are invoiced as an independent contractor and are paid on a bi-weekly basis.

Full time salary positions are available for truly capable individuals.

Work is available immediately.

Who you are:

You are someone who has previous experience in commercial interior finish work, finish carpentry, fabric panels or upholstery work.

You are flexible with hours, have a strong ethic, can work as team, solve problems and work hard and be willing to learn.

We can offer full and part time hours.

Job sites are around the GTA and you must be able to get to the sites on your own.

Your responsibilities include:

· Installation of Wood, Felt, Fabric, and other interior acoustic wall finishes in commercial offices.

· Installation of Wood, Felt, Fabric, and other acoustic ceiling finishes in commercial offices.

· Assisting with or independently taking site/field measurements.

· Assisting with or independently completing ceiling or wall layouts for installations.

· Completing commercial construction projects in a timely and efficient manner.

· Cutting, measuring, and installing various types of custom interior finishes.

· Maintaining quality and workmanship standards required to pass all deficiency reviews.

· Working in a safe, professional manner always. Keep all safety certification up to date.

· Assist the site foremen and project manager in completing the projects in time.

Essential Qualifications:

· Ceiling Layout Experience / Layout/Measurement Experience

· Ability to read Architectural Drawings (Blueprints)

· Previous experience installing wall coverings

· Previous experience installing commercial finishes

· Experience on commercial construction sites (office towers, open concept offices, restaurants, banks)

· Skills from other detail oriented trades like finish carpentry and millwork are very transferable to our work. Materials are often custom products that get only one chance to be installed correctly.

Essential Certifications

· Current Working at Heights Certification - If you are experienced you should already have this. You can't work without this.

· Current Ministry of Labour - Worker's Health ad Safety Awareness Certification - (can be done online for free in minutes)

· Current WHMIS Certification - (can be done online in an hour)

If you have the experience we want, you should already have all three of these certifications. If not, we may be able to help with some requirements.

Essential Personal Protective Equipment:

Steel Toes, Hard Hat, Safety Glasses, Hi-Viz Vest or Clothing

Other Useful Qualifications:

  • Ability to perform site measurements and layouts

Benefits:

  • Room for growth
  • There is lots of work if you want the hours

Schedule:

  • Start times are typically around 7:00-8:00am and end times between 4:00-5:00pm depending on the job.
  • Weekend work or afternoons are required sometimes depending on the project or schedule.
  • It is imperative that you have a flexible schedule, in order to meet deadlines and to accommodate the schedules of different jobs.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Freelance

Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
All contractors are required to wear masks and appropriate PPE.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • GTA, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • carpentry: 1 year (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • WHMIS Certification (required)
  • Working at Heights Certificate (required)
  • Worker Health and Safety Awareness in 4 Steps (preferred)

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (preferred)
  • Night Shift (preferred)

title: Exterior Painting Subcontractor
description:
Mill Creek Painters is looking for painters for immediate work as independent contractors. We provide in-depth purchase orders so you can correctly and efficiently complete painting projects. We provide you with pre-sold jobs along with all the information up front on a daily basis. The best part is we provide weekly direct deposit and do not require you to ever complete any estimates or sales.

Working with Mill Creek Painters is more than just another contracting job - it's another opportunity to earn a great income, freedom to grow your business on your terms, and a chance to put down roots in your community! While you're helping homeowners by providing high-quality paint jobs, you'll be backed by our reputation and online presence. Are you looking for work with weekly pay and the ability to set your own schedule? Because we're looking to grow our team of painters TODAY!

What's In It For Me?

  • Pre-sold jobs - all you do is show up and paint with the ability to complete a job every two days on average
  • Flexible schedule - you set your own work schedule, work part-time, full-time, or as needed.
  • Weekly Pay - we pay per job and pay weekly through direct deposit, no more waiting weeks or months to be paid
  • Comprehensive purchase orders - get all the details up front and be prepared
  • Advancement - many painters move on to become employees as production supervisors or managers.

Responsibilities:

  • Painting: High-quality application of premium-grade paint on customer's home in areas not limited to walls, ceilings, baseboard, trim and doors
  • Post-project Review: Complete walk around of home post-installation and complete any outstanding work to exceed customer expectations

Requirements:

  • Reliable truck, van or SUV that can carry ladders and painting materials
  • Active and valid driver's license
  • Multi-height adjustable ladders
  • Functioning tools to include paint brushes, rollers, buckets, sprayers, tape, caulking, etc.
  • Valid general liability insurance $2M or ability to obtain
  • Valid WCB or the ability to obtain
  • GST number

Work remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: $10,000.00-$20,000.00 per month

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Application question(s):

  • Do you have your own painter's liability insurance?

Experience:

title: Boarder / Framer / Taper
description:
Robertson Walls & Ceilings is recognized as one of the leading contractors in Steel Stud, Drywall, Acoustic and Specialty Ceilings in British Columbia. Founded over 44 years ago on the principle of innovation and providing solutions to the clients in the residential sector, we have developed and partnered on some of the most iconic and prestigious developments in British Columbia.

Primary Responsibilities - Boarder/Framer:

  • Cut metal framing and trim to size, using cutting tools.
  • Install horizontal and vertical metal studs to frames so that wallboard can be attached to interior walls
  • Read blueprints or other specifications to determine methods of installation, work procedures, or material or tool requirements
  • Measure and cut openings in panels or tiles for electrical outlets, windows, vents, plumbing, or other fixtures, using keyhole saws or other cutting tools
  • Measure and mark surfaces to lay out work, according to blueprints or drawings, using tape measures, straightedges or squares, and marking devices
  • Remove existing plaster, drywall, or paneling, using crowbars and hammers
  • Trim rough edges from wallboard to maintain even joints, using knives;
  • Daily clean-up of jobsite;
  • Hang drywall panels on metal frameworks using lifts or hoists to adjust panel heights when necessary;
  • Cut and screw together metal channels to make floor or ceiling frames, according to plans

Primary Responsibilities - Drywall Taper:

  • Organizing and verifying materials; identify, establishing, and working from grid lines, using a transit, laser, tape, water level, dry line, ladder or scaffold.
  • Organizes with other trades a schedule by consulting with the supervisor.
  • Mixes compounds to apply and seal joints between boards using applicable tools to create a finished surface ready for painting.
  • Applies paper tape over joint to embed tape into compound and seal joint using appropriate tools.
  • Spreads and smooths compound material over tape using trowels to blend joint with wall surface.
  • Sands compound after drying.
  • Repairs cracks and holes due to workplace damage.
  • Installs metal molding to corners and curved openings and finishes to a smooth surface.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Requirements:

  • Minimum two (2) years of construction/carpentry/drywall experience;
  • Reliable transportation;
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills;
  • Ability to work with hand and power carpentry tools and other construction equipment;
  • Ability to do high standard finishing work;
  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings and specifications.
  • Think creatively.
  • Be able to kneel, bend, stand, stoop and stretch for long periods of time.
  • Lift and maneuver heavy, oversized wall board.
  • Work at heights
  • Team player

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $25.00-$35.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Skilled Tradesman/woman Become framing and drywalling apprentice! (ISM)
description:
BECOME A SKILLED TRADESPERSON! BECOME AN ISM!
(interior systems mechanic)

Sometimes people think we are part of the carpentry trade, but we are different!

We build with steel studs, and work with large contractors in the commercial sector.

THIS CAREER IS FOR YOU IF:

  • you like working with your hands and BUILDING
  • the thought of a slow paced job make you yawn
  • you like being challenged and always on the go
  • you are interested in steel stud framing and drywalling
  • you are interested in progressing through the apprenticeship training levels to get your ISM ticket
  • you are looking for a REAL career and not just a job
  • you strive to be the best at what you do - doing the bare minimum is not WHO YOU ARE

This is a SKILLED trade that requires PROFESSIONAL, SMART, HARDWORKING people who love to build things. Watch a building go up that you helped to create!

We provide the following:

  • starting rate is $18/hour
  • a life, dental, disability, benefit package
  • professional career training
  • a safe and respectful working environment

This position is a FULL TIME, ENTRY LEVEL APPRENTICESHIP.
We are a SAFE, EQUAL OPPORTUNITY employer!

You must demonstrate that you are HARD WORKING, RELIABLE, PUNCTUAL, and MOTIVATED to LEARN.
You must hold a valid driver’s license and you must have your own transportation, as jobsites are located throughout Winnipeg and surrounding areas. You will be responsible for travelling to and from jobsites. We DO NOT have a carpool policy.

You will be required to work Monday to Friday, shifts starting at 7am sharp. Weekend work is sometimes required. Working at heights, heavy lifting (AT LEAST 50 lbs) and working outside ALL YEAR ROUND are ROUTINE parts of the job. It's construction - so the jobsites can be dusty!

FYI - during COVID, we have been very busy - there has been no job loss. Construction is a safe and stable industry to get into. WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?

Previous framing or drywalling experience is not a prerequisite, but may be an asset.
Applicants who do not meet the above minimum requirements need not apply and replies without resumes will not be considered. Please include detailed a job history with dates of employment.
Check out our website and see what we're all about.

www.econowallandceilings.ca

MEMBERS OF WCA, MWCA
COR CERTIFIED
SERVING MANITOBA FOR 42 YEARS

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $18.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Expected start date: 2022-04-05

title: WALL & CEILING INSTALLERS (Interior Systems Mechanic / Lather) - ALL LEVELS
description:
JOIN THE TEAM

WALL & CEILING INSTALLER (Interior System Mechanic / Lather) - ALL LEVELS

About Us

Avid Contracting Ltd is a full-service demoBUILDpaint company. We regularly cover the construction scope of demolition, framing, drywall, glazing, wood and metal doors, ceilings, painting, wallpaper, and venetian plaster. Our primary focus is on commercial, institutional, industrial, and high-end residential projects. We perform the vast majority of our scopes of work with in-house expert tradespeople and we are proud of the team that we have built.

Our Mission

  • To deliver high quality construction services on schedule and at competitive prices
  • To meet or exceed our client’s expectations during the entire lifecycle of the project while maintaining a service-minded approach that will foster long-term business relationships
  • To maintain the highest level of professionalism, integrity, and fairness in our dealings with clients, suppliers, subcontractors, and employees
  • To create a work environment where employees are paid fairly, challenged, appreciated, and rewarded for exceptional performance and hard work

Due to our growth and continued success, we are seeking individuals to join our team who understand our mission and core values.

This is for you if:

  • You are passionate about your career
  • You are self-motivated and able to work with minimal direction
  • You care about producing quality work with excellent attention to detail
  • You work well in a fast-paced environment
  • You can communicate effectively

Job Description – WALL & CEILING INSTALLER – ALL LEVELS

Apprentice 1 - (Entry Level)

  • You will learn the basics of how to install, handle, build and apply materials that are used in the construction of walls and ceilings under the direct supervision of a qualified Journeyperson or Foreperson; you will learn best practices and industry standards to build commercial, industrial, institutional, and residential projects using materials such as steel stud, drywall, sound proofing, insulation and more.

Apprentice 2 - (1-2 years of experience)

  • You will assist a qualified Journeyperson or Foreperson with the installation, handling, building and application of materials that are used in the construction of walls and ceilings; you will continue to learn and use best practices and industry standards to build commercial, industrial, institutional, and residential projects.

Apprentice 3 - (2-3 years of experience)

  • You will install, handle, build and apply materials that are used in the construction of walls and ceilings under the indirect supervision of a qualified Journeyperson or Foreperson; you will continue to learn and use best practices and industry standards to build commercial, industrial, institutional, and residential projects.

Journeyperson 1 - (3-4 years of experience)

  • You will read and interpret drawings to determine specifications and requirements; prepare layouts in compliance to building codes using measuring tools; measure, cut, shape, assemble and join materials made of light weight steel studs, drywall, wood, wood substitutes and other materials; install ceiling grids and tiles; material take-offs, coordinate deliveries, and execute projects without immediate direction; help load, unload and move materials and tools onto site; clean work areas and equipment regularly; lead projects including small crews and mentor apprentices; solid understanding of the construction process.

Journeyperson 2 - (4-5 years of experience)

  • Perform all related duties of the Journeyperson 1; lead larger projects and crews, mentor apprentices.

Foreperson

  • The site Foreperson is accountable for following project plans and schedules and ensuring that crews under his/her direction perform daily and weekly activities to meet production goals. You will communicate directly with the Site Superintendents, General Manager, General Contractors, and Clients as necessary. You will also be involved and supportive in any day-to-day disciplinary decisions to ensure that all safety compliances and protocols are enforced and being adhered to.
  • This position also requires you to be able to prepare wall and ceiling layouts; install metal stud framing and furring for interior drywall and ceilings, using hand and power tools; attach gypsum board to studs or furring using screws; measure, cut and fit drywall sheets for installation on walls and ceilings; install T-bar ceiling of various sizes / drywall hard ceiling installation; problem solve discrepancies from blueprints to actual scope of work.

Qualifications

  • Entry level to 5+ years of experience including effective leadership qualities and supervisory experience
  • Able to perform physical work for an 8 hour shift, good dexterity and vision
  • Must be reliable and punctual
  • Able to meet deadlines and schedules
  • Knowledge of industry standards
  • Knowledge of safety rules and regulations
  • Positive attitude, strong work ethic and good interpersonal skills
  • Able to communicate effectively
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to learn quickly pertaining to scope of work
  • Good time management, decision making and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work independently
  • Able to recognize, enforce and adhere to safety protocols including PPE requirements
  • Ability to lift to 50 lbs., work at heights, various noise levels
  • Available to work Monday to Friday
  • Occasional weekends, nights, holidays, and out of town work
  • Willing to travel to different jobsites
  • Utilize company applications efficiently (cell phone required)
  • Must have your own hand tools
  • Must have your own transportation with valid license

Remuneration

  • Top wages and company benefits
  • iRecruit employee incentive program

If you are looking to join a dynamic, growing company as well as become part of a positive team environment, then we would love to hear from you!

Please submit your resume including references.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $20.00-$40.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
We are compliant with all Provincial and Worksafe BC protocols.

title: Carpenter/Drywaller
description:
Job Description

First General (Sault Ste. Marie) is a full-service restoration general contractor, specializing in the mitigation and repair of damaged residential and commercial buildings. We provide emergency response services, followed by total reconstruction of damage caused by water, fire, smoke and wind.

We are an independently owned and operated company, part of the First General international network, which is one of the largest full-service insurance restoration contractor banner group in Canada. Our policy is to provide straightforward honesty and impeccable integrity to our customers, insurers and contractors.

First General (Sault Ste. Marie) is seeking a self-motivated, personable, individual to fill the full-time position of Carpenter/Drywaller:

Requirements:

  • Inspect properties (residential and commercial) to determine structural and surface damages
  • Preform necessary tear out/demolition
  • Install drywall
  • Tape/finish drywall
  • Painting if required
  • Acoustic ceiling tile/grid installation
  • Rough carpentry (wood/steel stud framing, hanging drywall)
  • Finish carpentry (baseboard, casing, doors, cabinets, ceiling tiles)
  • Installation of doors, windows and siding
  • Install flooring (Laminate, vinyl, tile)
  • Manage a job from start date until completion
  • Manage a small crew

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in the restoration/renovation/carpentry
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Valid driver's license
  • General carpenter certification with the Ontario College of Trades an asset

Overview:

  • 40+ hours weekly
  • Available for overtime
  • Compensation package will include benefits

Job Title: Carpenter/Drywaller

Job Type: Full Time

http://www.firstgeneralssm.ca/

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $20.00-$28.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-05-11

Show more

title: Intermediate Interior Designer
description:
Role Description

We are seeking an Intermediate Interior Designer with a minimum of 3 – 5 years’ experience in applying their creative talents in an interior design studio, with a focus on custom private residences, large-scale condominium developments, boutique retail and hospitality.

Key Accountabilities

- Comprehensive knowledge in project delivery from programming & schematic design, conceptual developments & producing detailed working drawings

- Ability to manage & coordinate with clients and other professional consultants, but not limited to contractors, architects, engineers, suppliers & trades to ensure project success

- Solid understanding of the Ontario Building Code

- Able to interpret & prioritize project scheduling, deadlines & responsibilities

- Take responsibility for the development of the design & the project with input from the Principal Designer & Senior Designer

- Prepare & develop with the team, the required drawings, models, images, material & concept boards & other documents relating to the design

- Aptitude for anticipating, identifying & arriving at creative solutions

- Able to work well under pressure & meet deadlines efficiently

- Able to take initiative in response to direction or instruction

Candidate Requirements & Skills

- Must be located within the GTA, or be able to reliably commute to the studio.

- Advanced AutoCAD and SketchUp Skills

- Familiarity with Adobe Suites (InDesign, Illustrator & Photoshop)

- Advanced MS Office Application Skills

- Experience working with millwork / shop drawings, lighting & ceiling plans, electrical plans, product & material specifications

- Use of Harvest, an asset

- Analytical Skills

- Organizational Skills

- Capability to manage & meet deadlines

- Advanced written & verbal communication skills

- Motivated & self-directed

- Confident & comfortable working independently & with others

Experience Requirements

- 3 – 5 years in custom private residential design, condo development design, retail & hospitality design

Education & Training Requirements

- Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Interior Design

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $25.00-$45.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Toronto, ON M6B1W8: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • design: 3 years (required)

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Who We Are:

Like our country, ATCO Frontec is built on a Frontier Spirit of being agile, robust, ready to go to the most challenging places and push the boundaries. Do YOU have the Frontier Spirit? If the answer is yes, you should probably work with us.

COVID-19 Information

ATCO is committed to providing and maintaining a safe environment for our employees, contractors, partners, and customers. As part of this unwavering commitment to safety, all ATCO employees and contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 or provide proof of exemption.

Description:

ATCO Frontec is seeking a Maintenance Technician to join our RP North department in Whitehorse, YT. The Maintenance Technician is responsible for performing various skilled and semi-skilled tasks to maintain a 24/7 facilities operation. Responsibilities include maintaining the mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems.

Responsibilities

· Troubleshoot and perform minor repairs on plumbing systems (leaking faucet, plodded toilets, etc.)

· Performs building repairs including drywall, paint, flooring, carpentry, ceiling tile and grid

· Responsible for the completion of all maintenance services requests as assigned

· Performs daily site inspections of the facilities and mechanical equipment to ensure proper operations.

· Provide a report to the Maintenance Coordinator noting any problems found

· Performs other manual duties to clean and maintain landscaped environments

· Respond quickly and thoroughly to changes in client requirements and amendments in scope

· Ensure all operations meet and comply Customer regulations, federal and provincial health and safety legislations, regulations and corporate policies

· Completion of work orders in the CMMS system

· Perform routine maintenance jobs and repairs

· Follow Health and Safety Policies and Safe Work practices

· Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

· The successful candidate should have 4 or more years of experience in a facility maintenance position

· Strong knowledge of safe work practices and procedure typical form maintenance operations

· Highly experienced with vendor management in a 24/7 operation with a strong customer focus

· Abilities to work safely with a wide variety of hand and power tools and materials

· Ability to obtain Government Security Clearance – Reliability level

· Basic PC skills including working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel) and Outlook.

· Valid Driver’s License

· Professional communication skills, oral, and written

· Ability to prioritize and multitask

· Work well under pressure

· Effectively solve problems

We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

Final candidates will be required to undergo a Security Clearance Check.

This position has been identified as safety sensitive and will require completion of a pre-employment alcohol & drug test, fit to work medical test, criminal record check, and provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination.

Collection, use and retention of personal information will be in accordance with ATCO Group privacy policies and practices.

By submitting your resume and personal information to the ATCO Group of Companies, and/or participating in a personal interview, you acknowledge and consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the ATCO Group of Companies to determine your suitability for employment opportunities within the ATCO Group of Companies.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you located in Whitehorse, YT?

Experience:

  • Maintenance: 3 years (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-14

Show more

title: Camp Attendant
description:
COVID-19 Information

ATCO is committed to providing and maintaining a safe environment for our employees, contractors, partners, and customers. As part of this unwavering commitment to safety, all ATCO employees and contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 or provide proof of exemption.

ATCO Frontec is looking for someone who takes pride in their work, always does what needs to be done, and loves the thrill and sense of accomplishment that comes with taking on new and meaningful work. Safety is paramount to us and we’ve always got your back; even in the most challenging environments you know you’re going to be okay when you’re on our team. If you are someone who loves doing important work with great, dedicated people around you, then this role is for you.

Who You Are: You are a team player who likes to put their best foot forward have an eye for attention to detail.

Responsibilities:

  • Maintain the highest sanitary standards are maintained in all areas of responsibility in accordance with company, client, and governmental requirements.
  • Ability to clean rooms to company standard and adhere to room inspection requirements
  • Wash, sorts, counts, folds and distributes linens and towels, makes beds to company standard.
  • Cleans lobbies, lounges, rest rooms, corridors, elevators, and stairways.
  • Sweeps, scrubs, mop, and polishes floor.
  • Vacuum/cleans rugs, carpets, upholstered furniture, and draperies.
  • Dusts furniture.
  • Washes walls, ceiling, and woodwork.
  • Washes windows, door panels, and sills.
  • Empties wastebaskets and pick up debris and empties trash containers
  • Assists in laundry as needed
  • Actively involved in ensuring they are following safe and sound procedures and are adhering to government regulations as well as ATCO Frontec Health and Safety, policies and procedures.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Other duties as assigned.

SKILLS:

  • The successful candidate will have 1 or more years of housekeeping experience in large hotel/resort style.
  • Strong organization skills
  • Ability to work in a fast pace environment
  • Complete allocated workload during designated shift
  • Excellent people skills
  • Ability to work effectively and efficiently supervised or unsupervised
  • Team Player

We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

ATCO Frontec is part of ATCO Ltd. ATCO delivers inspired solutions for a better world. We are a diversified global corporation with investments in the essential services of Structures & Logistics, Utilities, Energy Infrastructure, Retail Energy, Transportation and Commercial Real Estate. Learn more about how we build communities, energize industries and deliver customer-focused solutions like no other company in the world at www.atco.com. ATCO is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Visit our website for more information.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Experience:

  • housekeeping: 1 year (preferred)
